column2: Maddox Pain Management: Gil Maddox, MD
column3:
Maddox Pain Management, led by Gil Maddox, MD, offers comprehensive pain treatment solutions in Anniston, Alabama. Our clinic specializes in interventional pain procedures and personalized care plans for chronic pain conditions. Located at 1309 Quintard Ave, we serve patients throughout Calhoun County with evidence-based pain management approaches.

Dr. Gil Maddox brings extensive medical training and specialized expertise in pain medicine. His practice focuses on minimally invasive techniques for back pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. The clinic provides spinal injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management tailored to each patient's needs.

Our team addresses both acute and chronic pain conditions. We treat herniated discs, sciatica, arthritis pain, and post-surgical discomfort. Patients receive thorough evaluations before customized treatment plans are developed. The clinic emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction.

Maddox Pain Management accepts most major insurance plans and offers convenient scheduling options. New patients can expect comprehensive initial consultations lasting approximately one hour. Our office is wheelchair accessible with ample parking available.

Contact us at (256) 237-7002 to schedule your appointment. Visit www.maddoxpainmanagement.com for more information about our services and treatment approaches.

column3:
Tuscaloosa Spine & Pain Management Center, led by Wesley L. Spruill, MD, offers specialized care for chronic pain conditions. Dr. Spruill is a board-certified pain management specialist with extensive experience treating spine-related pain and injuries. The clinic provides same-day evaluations for patients seeking immediate relief from acute pain symptoms.

Our modern facility in Tuscaloosa features comprehensive on-site diagnostics including the region's most advanced MRI and CT scanning technology. Patients benefit from our integrated approach combining medical treatment with physical therapy. Our facility includes a therapeutic pool and fully-equipped gym for rehabilitation exercises.

Treatment options at Tuscaloosa Spine & Pain Management Center include non-surgical disc decompression, targeted injection therapy, and medication management. Each treatment plan is individually tailored to address specific pain conditions. Dr. Spruill specializes in interventional procedures for herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and sciatica.

The clinic's signature Spine Wellness Exercise Program helps patients build strength and flexibility. This program focuses on core stabilization and proper body mechanics. Many patients experience significant pain reduction through this specialized approach.

Located at 1050 Ruby Tyler Parkway in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, the center welcomes new patients seeking effective pain management solutions. Contact our office at (205) 759-7246 to schedule your consultation or same-day evaluation.
column11: Board-certified pain management specialists. Comprehensive, individualized approach to spine-related pain and injury. Same day evaluation. Modern, comprehensive facility offering on-site diagnostics, therapy, pool and gym. The regions most advanced MRI/CT scans. An array of treatments including disc decompression and injection therapy. Our unique spine wellness exercise program.

column40:
I have had two procedures here and have had a very positive experience both times. Very caring Dr and staff|I love coming here to Tuscaloosa Spine Care. The welcoming check-in staff are really nice and the nurses are just the absolute sweetest and Dr Spruill is so great! He really listened to me and my concerns. He explained everything to me that I needed to know about a possible upcoming procedure in a way that I could understand, not "Dr talk".
I truly recommend him to anyone!!!!|I had to use 3 other pain Drs because of my bone Dr. Finally just told them I am not using any other Drs for my pain other than Dr Spruill. He is the best. Always has listened and talks to you like you are somebody. The staff in the recovery area are the best also. I highly recommend them.|Our issue was NOT addressed and we did not feel that Dr. Spruill was the least bit compassionate towards the chronic pain my husband is experiencing.  We left with a medication that had contraindications for his other current health issues (discovered after reading the patient literature that came with it) -- and that was AFTER haggling with two separate nurses when they returned to check us out with NOTHING to provide any relief for my husband. The doctor said he WOULD prescribe something for pain while we waited for the tests.  However, the medication he intended cannot be taken with another medication my husband  is currently on.  If the doctor had stayed in the room long enough to actually discuss my husband's medical history or sufficiently review his current medications, that may have been avoided.  The fact is, as I was asking questions, he stood with most of his body outside the door and spoke to us with his head leaning past the door into the room.  He ordered some additional tests and when the results came in they called and told us basically what we had told THEM in-office on that visit.  And they wanted to refer him to a surgeon. We also told them at that visit that he had ALREADY seen a surgeon and we had been referred to have pain management UNTIL the surgery could be performed (there are some complications that must be dealt with prior). I told them that I wanted to be referred to another doctor because I didn't feel like Dr. Spruill paid any attention to my husband's concerns or history. I felt like we were just put into their "test-running" conveyor belt and I'll be happy if I never have to cross the threshold of that place again!   Meanwhile, after two days of me missing work, we are STILL dealing with debilitating chronic pain with NO end in sight for months!|They were not able to do the procedure I was scheduled to have. They truly are concerned for your well being.

West Alabama Spine and Pain Specialists offers comprehensive pain management services in Northport, Alabama. Located at 4280 Watermelon Rd, Suite 111, the clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and medication management.

The practice focuses on identifying the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients receive personalized treatment plans addressing back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Board-certified pain management physicians bring extensive training in anesthesiology and pain medicine. The clinic emphasizes minimally invasive procedures whenever possible. Patients appreciate the convenient Northport location serving West Alabama communities. The modern facility features state-of-the-art equipment for precise pain interventions.

column40: Dr. Graham and his staff are very friendly.  I don't have a long wait time that is a plus.  It would be great if they had a patient portal|The staff is so good and they are always there for you  Dr Graham and his team are best he had help me to function my job at work|My first doctor here was Mccormick, very disappointing. He didn't listen, he told me what was wrong with me, where and how I was hurting instead of listening. When he left, they asked if I wanted my records to be transferred with him.....NOPE. So I lost all hope in finding decent treatment for my Degenerative Disc Disease, with has caused Carpal Tunnel in both arms and hands. And the pain is so very awful at times. Some more than not. But then I ended up being place under Dr. Graham's care. I can TRULY say how wonderful of doctor he is, along with the Nurse Practitioner I've dealt with. He is SO VERY attentive and caring. My first time meeting him, he hugged my, and does it every single time I see him :) He LISTENS to me and take my words, feelings and pain into consideration. Me also being a Type 2 diabetic, my health is something I take VERY SERIOUS. I still aim to live my life, work, take care of my home and family, and DR. GRAHAM helps so much with contributing to that. He won't change my meds if I'm alright with them, nor has he pushed any kind of surgery/s on me. He brings pleasant, kind and Spiritual uplifting vibes every time he walks into the room. And I am SO VERY GRATEFUL and THANKFUL to him for that. I just wish the receptionist at the front window was at least a little nice. Sad to say, but her demeanor and attitude is so unpleasant. Her communication towards me, every time I come in, is something I would rather not have to deal with. I just don't know if it's my race or she has a pick and choose to be nice to, attitude. Either way, it's VERY unprofessional and sad. I understand that people have bad days, but I try not to let my bad days define how I treat others.|I had tried to go to a similar healthcare facility and was never comfortable.  Dr. Graham and his staff have been great and I always felt cared for and listened to.|The first thing Dr. Graham did when entering the room before even speaking to me was hugged my neck. Before knowing me or even speaking to me he showed me he already cared. He hugged me and told me "I'm so sorry you had to go through what you've been through." I was so nervous to go because in the 5 years of seeing so many doctors not a single one understood what I was going through. I was so scared he would immediately want to try Injections and medicines I've tried a million times. Being 21 years old, I've had 6 knee surgeries on one leg and I have tried everything in the book. Dr. Graham took the time to hear my story and listen. He deserves more praise for how he treats his patients than I can express on this review. I would recommend him to anyone on this planet. Thank god for doctors like him. He's a god sent. He's a blessing to the physician community and if you're experiencing chronic pain like me, please go see Dr. Graham. He truly cares and listens.|I'm Sure Doctor Graham is a fine doctor, but the staff had a severe lack of cordiality and communication that prevented me from even being willing to see him. Three missed calls and a late appointment later, I arrive to see four behind the desk, none on the phone, all capable of answering. Sheets of redundant paperwork and several miscommunications later, the visit ended before it began. Hopefully others have better experiences than me, as doing a nerve block treatment here could never have felt comfortable.|I've been a patient of Dr. McCormick's for awhile now.  It's very frustrating because you can never reach a human being, it's always phone tag.  I have other health problems besides my back and I can't always make my appointment; however, I try to definately give over 24 hours notice if possible.  I showed up from my June appt only to be told that there was a $300+ balance on my acct from the surgical procedure I had in May that had to be paid before I could see the doctor.  They didn't bother to mail out a statement or tell me over the phone when I made the appt.  I  didn't have the money so we had to leave.  I canceled my July 24th appt on July 2nd because we still didn't have money to pay in full.  I had to cancel my August 25th appt because I woke up sick.  The rude receptionist returned my husband's call and said we needed to look at our calendar and pick a day when I wouldn't be sick and come in then.  I mean, who says something this stupid.  I called later and left a message for the office manager or Dr. Graham's wife to call me back and needless to say that was a week ago and I haven't heard a word.  It's pathetic that a smart mouth receptionist is apparently allowed to speak to patients anyway she chooses and gets away with it.  I wasn't happy with the care I was receiving anyway (two weeks of faxes from the pharmacy and calls from me trying to get a prescription refilled) and three nerve blocks and an Eblation that didn't work, etc., but I most definately won't stay somewhere that has staff like the receptionist.  She needs to remember that without patients, she wouldn't get a paycheck!  I would not recommend their office to anyone.|Dr Graham is the most kind and gentle man! He has an incredible bedside manner! He helped keep me as comfortable as possible until I had back surgery to fix the severe pain in my leg. I couldn't have made it without his help. I would recommend him to anyone in need of pain management and if needed I would go back!!

Integrative Pain and Wellness (formerly Alabama Anesthesiology & Pain) offers comprehensive pain management services in Boaz, Alabama. This multidisciplinary clinic specializes in treating chronic painful conditions with the goal of improving pain levels, enhancing physical function, and elevating overall quality of life.

Located at 11744 US-431 in Boaz, the practice delivers personalized treatment plans for patients throughout Marshall County and surrounding areas. The clinic's integrated approach combines advanced interventional techniques with holistic pain management strategies.

Patients benefit from specialized care for conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain
  • Joint pain and arthritis
  • Neuropathic pain disorders
  • Post-surgical pain
  • Work-related injuries
  • Sports injuries

The medical team brings extensive experience in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and rehabilitation. Their physicians completed advanced fellowship training in pain management techniques. Each treatment plan is tailored to address individual patient needs.

The clinic offers both medication management and interventional procedures. Treatment options may include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and regenerative medicine approaches.

Integrative Pain and Wellness accepts most major insurance plans. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 256-803-8800. The practice maintains a patient-centered philosophy focused on long-term pain relief solutions.

And everyone here is always willing to listen & tries very hard to put me at ease going thru this process.

I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND them for any & all of your pain management (especially chronic pain) issues.|My experience with this Dr. was horrible. He literally said, "I will not prescribe this medication because of your mental health." He also then proceeded to tell me that he has more patients on less medication than me. I'm sorry but isn't it supposed to be a specialized treatment plan. Meaning one on one, not to put the patient in a group of totally different patients. I never had problems with the office just the doctor. I tried his way for 3months and still in pain because of my Cereal palsy and when I asked to try a different way this is how I was treated.|This Dr. Is awful he only cares about the money not the person. They will set your pill counts up as a appointment just so they can get more money from your insurance and charge you a co-pay. I have never seen anything like this. What a scam!
Don't waste your time. They got the one star review because there was no choice for zero stars. Also the redhead that works up front is a extremely unprofessional and rude! If you care about your health at all don't go to this Dr.|I'm not sure who the other patients who left reviews was seeing at this office, but my experience was far different. Dr. Guilliand seemed ok but the front office was a nightmare to deal with. Quite rude anytime I'd call, even though the doctor told me I could call if I had any issues. Apparently not a good fit, so I finally got into UAB; which this AAA office attempted to throw me under the bus. Professionalism is vacant at this office. I hope others don't experience what I did. So sad.

column3:
Premier Pain & Spine is an independent pain management clinic located in the heart of Rainbow City, Alabama. Our specialized medical facility focuses on comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients throughout Etowah County and surrounding areas.

At our 3015 Steele Station Rd location, our team of board-certified pain specialists provides personalized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. We combine advanced diagnostic techniques with evidence-based interventions to help patients regain mobility and improve quality of life.

Our clinic specializes in treating:

  • Back and neck pain management
  • Joint pain relief
  • Neuropathic pain conditions
  • Sports injury rehabilitation
  • Post-surgical pain management
  • Arthritis and inflammatory disorders

Our physicians bring extensive training from prestigious medical institutions, with decades of combined clinical experience in interventional pain procedures. Each doctor maintains current certification in pain management techniques and regularly participates in continuing education.

We offer minimally invasive procedures including epidural injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Our comprehensive approach may also incorporate physical therapy, medication management, and lifestyle modifications tailored to each patient's needs.

The clinic features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and treatment rooms designed for patient comfort. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options.

For appointments or consultations, contact Premier Pain & Spine at +1 256-203-4844 or visit our website at https://premierpainandspine.org/ to learn more about our services.
column11: We're an independent pain management clinic, located in the heart of Rainbow City.

column40:
Dr Jones was Very Unprofessional And he was Forcing me to stop using Anti Anxiety medicine which I Need. It's not my fault I have depression and anxiety problems Just like it's Not my fault I was in a wreck Years ago that Fused my spine together in Two places and that I am in Constant Pain. I wasn't driving. He doesn't want to give me Anything but one of the lowest pain medicine and he Wants me to take No anxiety depression medicine. He is The Worst! I have been to several pain Drs and All of them were better than him  I would Never refer Anyone to him. SPOS|**Horrible Experience at Premier Pain & Spine**

I was a patient at Premier Pain & Spine for over two years and initially had a positive experience. However, things drastically changed.

Dr. Stephen Jones, who was once attentive, became difficult to communicate with, especially when I encountered issues with billing and insurance. The staff, particularly at the front desk, displayed a shocking lack of knowledge about insurance processes, which resulted in significant confusion and an outstanding balance I was never informed about.

During a recent visit, I was told I couldn't be seen without my insurance cards, despite having two insurances on file. This miscommunication turned my appointment into a frustrating ordeal, and I felt treated poorly by staff who were unhelpful and dismissive. The situation escalated to the point where Dr. Jones discharged me without a valid reason, despite my compliance as a patient.

I also witnessed disturbing practices regarding patient management and records, including incorrect billing statements and unprofessional conduct by the staff. I felt discriminated against and treated with a lack of respect.

This experience has left me feeling drained and in search of new medical care. I urge anyone considering this practice to be cautious and look elsewhere if they don't want to be treated horribly. I was threatened by the Doctor & staff for no reasons. I've never been treated so badly in my entire life by medical "unprofessionals" at Premier Pain & Spine. I was also denied of my medical records but the office sent records with my social security number on them via email. So unacceptable! The doctor left me without medicine for days & days. This place gets no stars from me.|If I could give this Dr a negative review, I would. This couldn't be a more unprofessional Dr, his staff is the worst. He actually needs to have his medical license reviewed. He has already been reported for negligence to the board. Literally go anywhere else. He is awful.|Would like to know if it is possible to have refills on pain medication to extend past exact 28 day supply due to obvious lifestyle differences. There have been times when my medicine was not refilled until the day after I run out making it so my wife has to drive to Cherokee Co. to pick up the medicine on the exact day it was allowed to be refilled, then turn right around and drive to Fort Payne where I work so there is not a break in my medications. For those of us on pain management, but still trying live and provide for our family, this can be quite inconvenient. The two hour round trip every month is also a concern, seeing that this time eats into my personal off time with my employer. Surely regulations exist that would not be violated to accommodate for these varying lifestyles?

UPDATE: Was dismissed by Premier Pain and Spine after a telephone complaint regarding them completly changing my standard regimen of pain medication for over 20 years with my Neurologist, PC and since they took me on as a patient. They changed my medicines without consultation and without discussion and attempt to taper and simply called in the medication they "wanted", and not what I had been taking since choosing them as my Pain Management doctors. When I called to see what was going on, they returned my call  and said that Dr. Jones had made the choice to do (without consultation, approval, or tappering attempts) and that is how it would be. Naturally, I did not agree with this and knew that I was in for some terrible withdrawals. Within a couple of days I received a letter of dismissal in the mail. Dr. Jone's bedside manner and lack of communication with his patients, as well as his similar dealings as my own with other patients, will surely contribute to his business failing. If not, I will be greatly surprised!!!|I have been a patient of Dr.Jones for about 3 years and I truly love him as a doctor. He is very caring and listens to what you have to say. We always have a good laugh when I'm there no matter how bad I'm feeling. His staff is also very caring and enjoyable to be around. I would just like to say "Thank You to each and everyone of them." God Bless You All !|Finding Dr.Jones and his staff has been a God send. They take the time and listen to you so you can receive the best care possible. Dr. Jones also has conversations outside of why you are there. He has taken the time to check on my son and family's well-being. I highly recommend this office if you want people who care and empathize with you and your situation and that also understands nobody hurts the same and every treatment plan will be different.|Dr. Jones is an outstanding, compassionate, understanding physician.  His staff are all very understanding and work well with the public.  This office operates like a well oiled machine,  so you have to do your part keep your appoints , and be respectful.  You will get what you give with front-end staff.  Overall, I give this office a 5 star rating  they are outstanding in every aspect.|Super awesome group of people! I love Premier Pain and Spine! They all are so caring, compassionate, and respectful from the front desk to the nurses to Dr. Jones. You are not just a number. Dr. Jones will listen to you and he takes time to hear your complaints and works through every solution to make you feel better!
Thank you, Dr. Jones and staff! I love ya'll ! Yall are amazing  


I have to do an update. At the time I made this post everything above was true. Then I had to start seeing some nurse practitioner.  She was very rude every time I saw her. They always asked " how is the medication working for you"? You could tell them til you're blue in the face and they still send in the same exact medication and dose. I have untraceable hemiplegia migraines along with other health issues.  The last appointment I had with this nurse practitioner was the final straw, I was finding another establishment when I left. But I had been up over 48 hours with my migraines and I was still in pain and I was exhausted. I had my head down in my hands while she was talking then she stopped and said " Are you having an issue with staying awake"? I explained to her what was going on and she said "Give me just a minute" then left the room. She came back and said "Here's your discharge papers, we will no longer see you"! I mean WTF!!??
And just FYI I had been with Dr. Jones for a couple of years.

Southside Pain Specialists delivers comprehensive pain management solutions in Cullman, Alabama. Our clinic specializes in evidence-based treatment options that are both effective and cost-conscious. Every treatment plan begins with establishing a clear diagnosis, ensuring targeted care for each patient's unique condition.

Our pain management physicians follow rigorous standards established by the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians, The American Board of Pain Medicine, and the International Spinal Injection Society. This commitment to professional excellence ensures patients receive the highest quality interventional pain treatments available.

We focus on three key outcomes for every patient: improved pain perception, enhanced quality of life, and restored physical functioning. Our specialists offer advanced interventional procedures alongside conservative management approaches, creating personalized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions.

Located at 1300 Bridge Creek Dr NE in Cullman, our facility provides a comfortable environment for consultations and treatments. Patients throughout northern Alabama seek our expertise for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, and neuropathic pain syndromes.

Contact Southside Pain Specialists at (256) 841-0800 to schedule a consultation with our experienced pain management team. Additional information about our services and approach to pain management is available on our website: https://www.southsidepainspecialists.com/

column40:
I have been seeing Dr Kendrick for seventeen years. Him and his staff have been great. When I went through brutal rounds of chemo, Dr K and his Nurse Practitioner, Stephanie, were most helpful. They recognized I was dehydrated and gave me fluids which helped tremendously. I rarely wait very long. There has been very very few times I had to wait for a while. As far as them getting back to me on the same day, if it involves medication or emergency, they do respond on their patient portal the same day. Non-emergency, it may take a couple of days. I have learned that as his office has grown, and much like most physician offices, it may take a couple of days. However, if I needed him the same day for an emergency, I have all the confidence in him that he would see me. I highly recommend Dr Kendrick and his nurse practitioners. He has kept me off the operating table for my back for seventeen years.|I heard bad stories, but I trusted my doctor. Now I'm looking at him sideways for referring me to such a terrible clinic. I was supposed to be scheduled for a block but no one called to schedule it. A month after I was supposed to have had it, still in pretty bad pain, I have left multiple messages and called multiple times. No one has answered a phone call or responded to any of my messages for 3 weeks. I left messages on every extension. I'm now looking to get a different referral and maybe even a new doctor who wouldn't put me through this when this place is known for these stories. Stay away.|-hipaa violation. when confronted, they avoided me for days and then lied
-first appt waited hour and half before rescheduling (and they acted like I was being unreasonable when I requested to do so)
-no risks or side effects were ever discussed with me
-they treated me like a drug addict liar when I told them I didn't take medications
-bad reaction to shot, no response for days. When they did respond,  they said I must have a latex allergy lol
-my last call to them (to schedule 1 of the 4 shots my ortho begged of me), I could hardly breathe my thoracic was so bad. I must've sounded close to death & in a lot of pain- & still no call back|Make sure if you have a procedure done here that they give you (or call in) your pain prescription. They don't return phone calls.
Thank you to Boston Scientific for taking care of me.
Southside Pain, I wish I could publish my true thoughts about you.
Ok amendment time, after Boston Scientific took care of contacting someone ( thank you from my heart) the idiots prescribed me Opiates after I specifically told them I cannot take opiates.
Looking forward to my Wednesday appointment now, so I can be there in person, since they obviously don't use the phone or answering service. Instead it will be ME ... THERE.|They refuse to answer the phone. Took us 2 months to schedule a appointment and we had to drive from Selma Alabama to their office to make a appointment in person because nobody will answer the phone. Now we've been waiting for almost a month for them to call in meds and had drug store call them to request meds. And have called 10 times  left messages with nurse and no response. The patient name is Shannon Sides|I saw Dr. McKnight & he was awesome! He listened and understood all my back pain from multiple surgeries & worked out a plan and medication to help ease my pain, he was wonderful! I also see Dr. Berke and he was super nice and discussed my pain and if my medication was helping me, super nice man as well! Front desk people are always nice when I come in And check out! Super great people here!|I was previously a patient at another Pain management facility. I never once saw a doctor except when I was having a procedure. At Southside Pain Specialists I see my doctor on every appointment. Imagine that,  getting to see your doctor on every visit??? Unheard of elsewhere. I couldn't be happier with the decision I made to switch to Southside Pain Specialists.|If I could leave less than one review for this pain specialist clinic, I would unfortunately, they don't seem to care about their patients. You have to go in regularly and you have to do what they want to make sure you get the pain medicine that you need for chronic diseases.But yet they can't seem to call in the pain prescriptions for you, and you end up for weeks without the pain medication that's needed. You call them and leave a message and they ignore you. Then when they do send it in, they send it into the wrong pharmacies.Then you have to wait longer, you can go.Weeks without having your pain medicine. If I could find a pain clinic near me that I could go to, that wouldn't treat their patients like this.I would go in a hot second. Do not go to this pain clinic. Whatever you do, do not go to them. You may need pain medication for chronic and terminal diseases, but I guess it doesn't matter to them that you're in pain. Twenty four hours a day, seven days a week that you lose sleep night upon night upon night.Because they can't do their job.

Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants offers comprehensive pain management services in Huntsville, Alabama. The clinic specializes in nonsurgical interventional treatments for chronic pain conditions. Patients seeking relief from persistent discomfort find personalized care plans tailored to their specific needs.

Ronald L. Collins, MD, DAAPM leads our pain management team with extensive medical expertise. Dr. Collins holds board certifications in both anesthesiology and pain management. His specialized training focuses on interventional spine procedures for effective pain relief.

Dr. Collins completed his Medical Degree and Residency at the University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. His educational foundation includes an undergraduate degree in Biology from the same institution. This comprehensive medical background ensures patients receive knowledgeable care.

Specialized Pain Management Services

The clinic addresses numerous chronic pain conditions through advanced treatment approaches:

  • Persistent low back and neck pain relief
  • Pre and post-surgical pain management
  • Shingles-related pain treatment
  • Peripheral neuropathy care
  • Discogenic and radicular pain solutions
  • Cancer-associated pain management

Commitment to Medical Advancement

Dr. Collins actively contributes to pain management advancements as a Lead Investigator in multiple research protocols. His dedication to nonsurgical spine procedures benefits patients seeking alternatives to invasive surgeries. Professional affiliations with the American Academy of Pain Medicine and American Society of Anesthesiologists demonstrate his commitment to industry standards.

Location and Contact Information

Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants is conveniently located at 201 Governor's Drive, Governor's Medical Tower Suite 400, Huntsville, AL 35801. Schedule a consultation by calling +1 256-265-7246 or visit https://tnvalleypain.com/our-physicians/ronald-collins-md/ for more information.

Dr. Collins received his Medical Degree & Residency at the University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham where he also received an Undergrad Degree in Biology. He is dedicated to the advancement of pain management & nonsurgical spine procedures & a Lead Investigator in several research protocols. column3:
Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants provides comprehensive pain management services in Huntsville, Alabama. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through interventional techniques and personalized treatment plans.

Dr. Gantt is board-certified in both anesthesiology and pain management with extensive experience in interventional spine procedures. He expertly treats patients suffering from persistent low back and neck pain, offering relief through targeted therapies. His practice encompasses pre and post-surgical pain management, peripheral neuropathy treatment, and specialized care for discogenic and radicular pain conditions. Dr. Gantt also provides compassionate pain management for patients with cancer-related pain.

Education and Military Service

Dr. Gantt's medical journey began at Birmingham Southern University where he completed his undergraduate studies. He earned his Medical Degree from the University of Alabama School of Medicine, followed by a residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Kentucky. His distinguished career includes service in the United States Navy, where he provided and coordinated anesthesia care aboard the hospital ship Comfort. Dr. Gantt further contributed his expertise as an assistant professor at the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants, we focus on identifying the root causes of pain. Our treatments aim to reduce dependency on medication when possible. We develop individualized care plans based on each patient's specific condition and medical history. Our clinic utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to ensure accurate treatment approaches.

Location and Contact Information

Visit us at 201 Governors Dr SW, suite 400 & suite 300, Huntsville, AL 35801. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Gantt, call +1 256-265-7246. Additional information about our services and physicians is available at https://tnvalleypain.com/our-physicians/roddie-gantt-md/

Dr. Gantt received his undergraduate degree from Birmingham Southern University & received his Medical Degree from the University of Alabama School of Medicine. He completed his residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Kentucky.

Dr. Gantt served in the United States Navy providing and coordinating anesthesia care on the hospital ship Comfort. He also served as an assistant professor at the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, MD.

column2: Thomas J. Kraus, DO, MBA, DAAPM
column3:
Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants offers comprehensive pain management services in Huntsville, Alabama. Led by Thomas J. Kraus, DO, MBA, DAAPM, the clinic specializes in diagnosing and treating spinal, nerve, and musculoskeletal disorders. Dr. Kraus is board-certified in both Anesthesiology and Pain Management with over 20 years of clinical experience.

The clinic provides effective solutions for various pain conditions including pre and post-surgical pain, discogenic pain, radicular pain, and shingles. Patients benefit from the latest interventional spine procedures performed by experienced specialists. These procedures include epidural steroid injections for cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine, caudal epidural injections, facet and sacroiliac joint injections, medical branch blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulator implantation.

Dr. Kraus brings extensive leadership experience to the practice, having previously served as Medical Director and Vice Chairman of the Department of Anesthesia at Huntsville Hospital Center for Pain Management from 1994-2001. His return to the practice ensures patients receive expert care from a physician with deep roots in the local medical community.

The clinic's approach focuses on personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific pain management needs. Located at 201 Governors Drive SW, Suite 400 in Huntsville, Alabama, Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants is conveniently accessible to residents throughout the region.

For appointments or consultations, patients can call 256-265-7246 or visit the clinic's website at https://tnvalleypain.com/our-physicians/thomas-j-kraus-d-o/ for more information about services and treatment options.
column11:
Dr. Kraus is board-certified in both Anesthesiology & Pain Management specializing in the diagnosis & treatment of common spinal, nerve & musculoskeletal disorders including pre & post-surgical pain, discogenic, radicular pain & shingles.

With over 20 years experience, Dr. Kraus provides the latest in interventional spine procedures: epidural steroid injections for the cervical, thoracic & lumbar spine, caudal epidural injections, facet & sacroiliac joint injections, medical branch blocks, radiofrequency ablation & spinal cord stimulator implantation.

Dr. Kraus rejoins our practice where he previously served as Medical Director & Vice Chairman of the Department of Anesthesia at Huntsville Hospital Center for Pain Management from 94-01.

The Center for Pain in Dothan specializes in comprehensive chronic pain management through multidisciplinary treatment approaches. Located at 104 Medical Dr, Dothan, AL 36303, this specialized clinic understands that chronic pain creates both physical and emotional challenges requiring more than medication alone. Their board-certified pain specialists develop personalized treatment plans addressing various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain.

The clinic's philosophy centers on four key goals: reducing pain levels, restoring participation in daily activities, decreasing medication dependence, and delivering cost-effective treatment options. Their integrated approach may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, medication management, and behavioral health strategies tailored to each patient's needs.

Patients at The Center for Pain benefit from advanced diagnostic capabilities and evidence-based treatments designed to identify and address pain's root causes. The medical team brings extensive experience in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and rehabilitation, offering treatments ranging from epidural steroid injections to spinal cord stimulation.

The clinic emphasizes functional restoration, helping patients return to work, family responsibilities, and recreational activities. Their patient-centered approach focuses on improving quality of life while providing education about pain management techniques for long-term success.

For appointments or more information about pain management services in Dothan, contact The Center for Pain at +1 334-288-7808 or visit their website at https://center4pain.com/.
column11:
Chronic pain creates a unique combination of physical and emotional hardships. Sometimes it takes more than just a medicine to alleviate suffering. The Center for Pain offers a controlled, multidisciplinary approach to treating pain that results from injury or disease. Our focus is on restoring function and improving quality of life.

Our goals for patient care: Reduce pain levels and encourage healthy self-care. Restore participation in usual life activities, and Reduce reliance on medications. Provide the best, most cost effective treatment.

I typically see Dr. Sovic but he had an injury the last time I needed a low back epidural. Dr. Landsen did my procedure at this time. All I can say is both of these men are very professional and awesome at what they do. I have to go to them around every three months and I have never had a problem. I would just like to say thank you to the entire team here. Y'all are all awesome!!!!|Dr Sovic & staff were AWESOME!  It was my first time having a block and I definitely will use him in the future again when I need to.  Highly recommend to anyone having back problems and need relief!|Dr Sovic has been my Pain Management Physician for years. He is top notch in his field. His staff is friendly and always on their game. I would recommend Dr Sovic and his staff to anyone with chronic pain.|I would not recommend Dr. Landsen or his nurse to anyone.  They waited until after my 3rd block to tell me that I needed another referral for pain management other than blocks when I had been discussing pain management issues with them since my first block.  I got the 2nd referral and then they closed for a week for spring break, knowing the severe pain I was in.

I was told if the first block on my L-spine did not work, I would need an MRI.  The physical therapist that has been doing needling on me said I would need to try physical therapy if the needling did not last at least a week.  I left several messages asking for the MRI and PT orders as well as requested pain med to get me through but never received a call back.  I ended up having to get a referral to a different clinic and now have to wait for an opening while having to deal with this pain.

Dr. Landsen was also trying to diagnose me with something I do not even have during my last block.

When I first asked for something for pain until the blocks worked, Allison, Dr. Landsen 's nurse, told me they like to try alternative methods but not once did they offer any suggestions.

Allison also breached HIPPA that is a major violation.

All these circumstances are very concerning.  The patient advocacy is severely lacking here as well as professionalism.|They don't deserve 1 star.  Dr Kraus just about killed me with a patch that interacted with my blood pressure medicine. After he took me off of my normal pain medicine. Auburn Pain Specialists is a comprehensive pain management clinic located at 890 N Dean Rd, Suite 100 in Auburn, Alabama. Led by Dr. Eric Robinson, MD, the practice delivers specialized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions throughout the Auburn-Opelika area.

Dr. Robinson combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. With extensive training in interventional pain techniques, he offers solutions beyond medication management. The clinic specializes in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Patients benefit from a range of advanced treatment options including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain relief
  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation
  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain management
  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions
  • Physical therapy coordination and rehabilitation planning

Dr. Robinson completed his medical education and specialized pain management fellowship at respected institutions, bringing years of clinical expertise to the Auburn community. The clinic emphasizes comprehensive assessment, accurate diagnosis, and multimodal treatment approaches.

Auburn Pain Specialists accepts most major insurance plans and welcomes new patients. The office features modern facilities with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment.

For appointments or consultations, patients can contact the clinic directly at +1 334-501-2005. The practice is conveniently located with accessible parking for patients with mobility challenges.

Alabama Pain Clinic is a specialized medical facility located at 101 Sivley Rd SW, Huntsville, AL 35801. Our dedicated team provides comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Northern Alabama. Established to address chronic and acute pain conditions, our clinic combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans.

We focus on identifying the root causes of pain rather than simply treating symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates medication management, interventional procedures, and rehabilitative therapies. Patients receive individualized treatment plans designed for their specific pain conditions and medical history.

Specialized Services

  • Chronic pain evaluation and management
  • Interventional pain procedures
  • Spinal cord stimulation
  • Nerve blocks and injections
  • Radiofrequency ablation
  • Joint injections
  • Medication management
  • Non-opioid pain relief strategies

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists address a wide range of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. We also treat fibromyalgia, headaches, and post-surgical pain with targeted interventions.

Our Medical Team

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology. With backgrounds from prestigious medical institutions, our doctors stay current with the latest pain management techniques. Each physician completes ongoing education in advanced pain therapies and minimally invasive procedures.

Patient-Centered Care

We prioritize patient education and active participation in treatment decisions. Our staff takes time to explain conditions and treatment options thoroughly. New patients receive comprehensive evaluations during their first visit.

Contact Alabama Pain Clinic today at +1 256-265-6532 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

Chronic pain creates a unique combination of physical and emotional hardships. Sometimes it takes more than just a medicine to alleviate suffering. The Center for Pain offers a controlled, multidisciplinary approach to treating pain that results from injury or disease. Our focus is on restoring function and improving quality of life.

Our goals for patient care: Reduce pain levels and encourage healthy self-care. Restore participation in usual life activities, and Reduce reliance on medications. Provide the best, most cost effective treatment.

column38: Karen|Natalie Collar|Britni Posey|Aletha Morgan Mclean|Charles Farish|Stephanie Gadison|Petrina|Scott Carmichael
column40:
This was my first experience with a pain doctor or pain clinic. My orthopedic and cardiologist physicians recommended that I try a pain center because my pain was greatly impacting my ability to function in daily life and physically improve my health.

The Center for Pain in Montgomery turned out to be life changing for me and enabled me to function like a regular human being again. The front office staff, nurses, and Dr. Ware were all very professional, kind, and showed empathy when dealing with my pain.
I had reached a point to where I literally felt like I was going to die. I have multiple chronic autoimmune illnesses including MS, severe Arthritis of the spine, and Conn's Syndrome. I was in a wheelchair full time until after my hip surgery four months ago. My pain was so excruciating that I could not put even the slightest pressure on my leg. I had to wait for a hip replacement for almost two years due to having had a serious heart attack.
I finally was able to have the replacement this past July as I was able to get my pain and also my blood pressure under control with the help of Dr. Ware.
Although that replacement was very successful, I am now waiting for a replacement of the other hip and again am in chronic pain.
Thank God for Dr. Ware and the Pain Clinic!
Because of their careful and professional management of my pain, I am able to hold on as I wait for the second surgery.|The Center for Pain and Dr. Ware have been wonderful in helping me manage severe back pain and explaining what course of action we should take. The entire staff has been professional and kind from the front desk, to the medical assistants, Nurse Practitioners, and treatment rooms. I appreciate all they have done to help get me back to normal activity.|Dr.Ware was absolutely great! This was my 1st visit to a pain center ever! I was referred to them by my orthopedic surgeon! It was my 1st visit and he Treated my pain on day 1!|I have been using center for pain at this location for about 1 -1 1/2 years . The new office stuff is very pleasant, they work with you on appointment times and dates. The only complaint I have is having everyone come in at around the same time|As usual, I'm very grateful for everyone that works there.
Everyone is very professional and courteous at all times.
I believe you have the finest staff an office one could wish for.
Thank you for everything you do...
May the good Lord bless you and yours always...
God bless you all...

Sincerely ;
Charles H. Farish|First time here but the friendliness of the staff was awesome. I didn't wait long to be called back and Dr. Ware was amazing. There was a bit of confusion as to what services I was there for but it was rectified immediately and services were rendered. Thank you all.|Dr Ware was great, he is a great listener. The only thing I dislike is the wait time is too long. They take new patients before the established patients. If I have an appointment at 8 and a new patient have an appointment at 9 the new patient is taken first. Never experienced this at any other doctor office.|These guys are a blessing, I have two bulging discs in my lower back and they gave me two epidurals and I feel so much better! Thanks so much for your help "The Center for Pain "!

Dr. Victor Chin leads a specialized Pain Management practice at Sports Medicine Alabama in Huntsville. Board-certified in both Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine, Dr. Chin provides comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The clinic offers advanced interventional procedures and personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs.

Located at 4715 Whitesburg Dr, Huntsville, AL 35802, the practice serves patients throughout Northern Alabama. Dr. Chin completed his medical education at the University of Alabama School of Medicine, followed by residency training in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He further specialized through a Pain Medicine fellowship at the University of Alabama at Birmingham.

The clinic specializes in treating spine-related pain, joint pain, nerve pain, and sports injuries. Services include epidural steroid injections, joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and regenerative medicine options. Dr. Chin emphasizes minimally invasive techniques to reduce pain and improve function.

Patients appreciate Dr. Chin's comprehensive approach that combines interventional procedures with physical therapy and medication management when appropriate. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and offers convenient scheduling options.

For appointments or consultations, contact the office directly at +1 256-787-1516 or visit the website at https://sportsmedalabama.com/team/victor-chin-md/ to learn more about available services.

Our services include:

We treat conditions such as back pain, neck pain, sciatica, fibromyalgia, migraines, and post-surgical pain. Most major insurance plans accepted. New patients typically receive appointments within one week.

Complete Pain Care in Moody, Alabama provides comprehensive pain management services and specialized addiction treatment. Our clinic offers evidence-based Suboxone treatment for patients struggling with opioid dependency and substance abuse disorders. Located at 2345 Moody Pkwy, we serve patients throughout the Moody area with personalized care plans.

Our pain management specialists address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We utilize a multidisciplinary approach combining medication management, interventional procedures, and rehabilitation techniques. Each treatment plan is tailored to the patient's specific needs and medical history.

The clinic's substance abuse program focuses on medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction. Our Suboxone treatment helps patients manage withdrawal symptoms while reducing cravings. We combine medication with counseling support for comprehensive recovery care.

Our physicians bring extensive experience in pain medicine and addiction treatment. They hold board certifications and stay current with advanced treatment protocols. The medical team works closely with each patient to develop effective pain management strategies.

Complete Pain Care accepts most major insurance plans and offers flexible scheduling options. New patients can expect thorough evaluations to determine appropriate treatment paths. We prioritize patient education and involvement in the treatment process.

column2: Aaron Shinkle, M.D. - The Center for Pain
column3:
The Center for Pain in Montgomery, Alabama provides comprehensive pain management services under the direction of Dr. Aaron Shinkle. Specializing in interventional pain management techniques, the clinic offers personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

Dr. Shinkle's approach combines advanced medical interventions with compassionate care. The clinic addresses various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Patients receive thorough evaluations before customized treatment recommendations.

Dr. Aaron Shinkle brings exceptional credentials to his practice. After growing up in Springville, Utah and serving on an elite wildland fire crew, he graduated summa cum laude from Utah Valley University in 2004. His medical education was completed at the prestigious Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, where he attended on a full academic scholarship. His specialized training includes an anesthesiology residency and interventional pain management fellowship at the University of Alabama at Birmingham.

The Center for Pain offers various treatment modalities including medication management, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Dr. Shinkle understands how pain affects daily functioning and relationships. His dedicated approach helps patients regain quality of life through effective pain control strategies.

Located at 488 St Lukes Dr in Montgomery, AL 36117, the clinic serves patients throughout central Alabama. For appointments or consultations, call +1 334-288-7808 or visit their website at www.center4pain.com for more information about services and treatment options.
column11:
Aaron Shinkle, M.D. grew up in the small town of Springville, Utah. After high school, he spent two years working on an elite wildland fire crew. In 2004, he graduated summa cum laude from Utah Valley University. Before attending medical school, he was an accomplished researcher. He attended medical school at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN, with a full academic scholarship. Following medical school graduation, he completed a residency in anesthesiology and a fellowship in interventional pain management at the University of Alabama at Birmingham.
Dr. Shinkle has made it his life's work managing states of pain. He understands how debilitating painful conditions can be and how they can negatively impact a person and their loved ones.

OrthoAlabama Spine & Sports offers comprehensive pain management services in Birmingham and Hoover, Alabama. The clinic specializes in nonsurgical treatments and minimally invasive spine procedures for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Srinivas Mallempati, a board-certified, fellowship-trained orthopedic specialist, leads the pain management team. Since joining OrthoAlabama in 2007, Dr. Mallempati has provided expert care using advanced interventional techniques. His extensive training in interventional spine and pain medicine enables him to offer personalized treatment plans for each patient.

The clinic offers multiple treatment options for pain relief:

  • Trigger point injections for muscle pain
  • Epidural steroid injections for nerve inflammation
  • Ultrasound-guided peripheral joint injections for precision
  • Kyphoplasty for vertebral compression fractures
  • Orthobiologics for natural healing enhancement

Dr. Mallempati's approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients receive comprehensive evaluations before any treatment recommendations.

Patient Convenience

Appointments are available at two convenient locations:

  • Birmingham office: 1801 Gadsden Hwy, Birmingham, AL 35235
  • Hoover office: Easily accessible for residents in surrounding areas

For consultations or questions about pain management options, patients can call +1 205-228-7600 to schedule an appointment.

column2: The Center For Pain - East Montgomery
column3:
The Center For Pain in East Montgomery specializes in comprehensive chronic pain management through a multidisciplinary approach. Located at 488 St Lukes Dr in Montgomery, Alabama, this specialized clinic addresses pain resulting from injuries and diseases with personalized treatment plans. The medical team understands that chronic pain creates both physical and emotional challenges requiring more than medication alone.

The clinic's pain specialists focus on three primary goals: reducing pain levels, restoring normal daily activities, and decreasing medication dependence. Their treatment philosophy centers on functional restoration and quality of life improvement rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients receive individualized care plans that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, and behavioral strategies.

The Center For Pain offers cost-effective treatment options for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Their Montgomery facility provides a controlled environment where patients learn healthy self-care techniques alongside medical interventions. The clinic's approach acknowledges the complex nature of chronic pain management.

Patients seeking pain relief can contact the clinic directly at (334) 288-7808 or visit their website at www.center4pain.com for more information about services and appointment scheduling. The Center For Pain serves the Montgomery community with evidence-based pain management solutions focused on long-term wellness and functional improvement.
column11:
Chronic pain creates a unique combination of physical and emotional hardships. Sometimes it takes more than just a medicine to alleviate suffering. The Center for Pain offers a controlled, multidisciplinary approach to treating pain that results from injury or disease. Our focus is on restoring function and improving quality of life.

Our goals for patient care: Reduce pain levels and encourage healthy self-care. Restore participation in usual life activities, and Reduce reliance on medications. Provide the best, most cost effective treatment.

Dr Katz is the ultimate professional, giving you what you need; he can hold your hand kindly one day but on another day kick you in the ass when you need it.  I would not go anywhere else. Highly recommend DR Katz and his staff.|I've been a patient of Dr Herrick & The Center For Pain since 2004, at least four visits each year. Today was only a follow up but I was in & out in less than half an hour. All of the staff from the front to the back was friendly, polite, professional, & personable. Great job guys & gals & THANK YOU!!|My experience was great. No long waiting. Easy scheduling. All my needs were met. I been using this clinic about 5 yrs. They are very organized.|Everyone is very kind. Dr. Herrick, Ann and the entire staff. I love the environment and it's comfortable. They are very prompt, efficient and swift with calling patients from the lobby to their room for Dr. Herrick. It makes it worth my drive. Can't ask for a better environment.|I enjoy the friendly  kind staff that greet me during my appointment. The  visit is never prolonged, they call you to the  back shortly  after  sign in. I am very blessed to be a patient here.|The Nurse Practitioner was super nice and helpful. He was honest and professional. I appreciate his help.  Since my earliest trips to Dr. Katz, I have always been treated with compassion and respect. Thank you!|Dr Shinkle does great with the spinal injections and rarely doesn't hit the exact spot needed.
However, you will never meet with Dr Shinkle to access your pain or treatments. You will meet with different nurse practitioners, never the same from month to month, who will take your medical information and results and return with a medication plan based purely on a step by step from the minimum dosage and medication no matter your condition or pain levels.
Center for Pain does not diagnose any conditions, suggest any other treatments or access any causes other than what you were referred by your physician. They treat only chronic pain conditions and any other pain should be treated by your physician or an ER.
A nurse practitioner at Center for Pain told me that doctors "dump" their patients on Center for Pain to avoid dealing with the DEA/Medical Boards since the opioid crisis became political.
See your personal physician, orthopedic doctor, etc. and have them refer you to Center for Pain with EXACT details on what prescriptions or pain treatments they recommend and Center for Pain will execute those recommended treatments very well . Otherwise you will spend months and months and tons of money before you ever receive adequate relief.
The shortcomings aren't Center for Pains fault, and not Dr. Shinkle's either; it's the result of the regulations placed on them by federal and state agencies due to the Opioid Crisis.

column3:
Huntsville Pain Management Specialists offers comprehensive pain treatment solutions in Huntsville, Alabama. Our clinic specializes in interventional pain procedures, medication management, and personalized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently at 185 Chateau Dr SW, Unit 302, Huntsville, AL 35801, we serve patients throughout Madison County and surrounding areas.

Dr. James Thacker leads our experienced medical team with over 15 years of specialized training in pain medicine. Dr. Thacker completed his fellowship at the prestigious Mayo Clinic and holds board certification in both Anesthesiology and Pain Management. His expertise includes treating complex regional pain syndrome, spinal disorders, and neuropathic pain conditions.

Our clinic provides advanced treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for back and neck pain
  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammatory conditions
  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain management
  • Radiofrequency ablation for nerve-related pain
  • Trigger point injections for muscle pain relief
  • Medication management with focus on minimizing opioid use

We accept most major insurance plans and offer same-week appointments for new patients. Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and comfortable treatment rooms. Patients appreciate our thorough consultations that typically last 30-45 minutes.

For appointment scheduling or questions about pain management options, contact our office at +1 256-885-1605. Office hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

Marshall Pain Clinic delivers comprehensive chronic pain management through medical interventions and multidisciplinary approaches. Located in Guntersville, Alabama, our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced treatment options with personalized care for patients suffering from persistent pain conditions.

Our clinic specializes in a wide range of pain management procedures including Cervical, Thoracic, and Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injections, Caudal Steroid Injections, and Intra-articular Facet Blocks. We also provide Transforaminal Epidural treatments, Occipital Nerve Blocks, Stellate Ganglion Nerve Blocks, and Sacroiliac Joint Injections. These interventions effectively address various pain sources throughout the body.

Conditions We Treat

The Marshall Pain Clinic team treats numerous chronic pain conditions. Patients with arthritis, joint pain, shingles, cancer-related pain, and other persistent discomfort find relief through our targeted medical procedures. Our comprehensive approach addresses both symptoms and underlying causes.

Expert Medical Team

Our facility is staffed with experienced registered nurses and radiology specialists who work together to provide exceptional care. Each team member brings specialized training in pain management techniques to ensure safe, effective treatment delivery.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. Our treatment plans are individually tailored to each patient's specific needs. We combine medical interventions with complementary approaches for optimal pain relief and improved quality of life.

Thanks to her again.|Since I started going back to The Center for Pain, things have been better.  They really listen to me this time around.The ablation I had done has been a god send.  It doesn't take all the pain away, but I no longer have pain that is a 9/10, but is now a 4/5 and sometimes a 6.|I truly thank God 4 the Dr's and Staff at The Center 4 Pain. They're Considerate, Genuinely Concerned, Caring, Efficient and Always Professional. They take great care of each patient and do their best 2 share knowledge about the treatments b4 they send U home feeling some level of pain relief. I Highly Recommend this Facility bcuz of their Attention 2 Details with Everyone, their Ethics, Cleanliness, Timeliness &  shown 2 each patient. They're  during every appointment.|(The post has been updated as of 12/13/2924)

I am pleased with the medical care I'm receiving at this facility. I also feel comfortable, welcomed, and treated as an individual by the practitioners, all of the techs, and both the front-end and back-end staff. It can be a busy practice at times, but if there is something you need to discuss with your practitioner all you have to do is explain the issue or tell them what it is you need. We have to remember that this is a pain center. Pain is not seen it is measured and it can only be measured based on diagnostic tests and the information we provide to the physician. A little bit of patience can go a long way to having a great understanding between you and the pain management practitioners. I've had great success with this group and I recommend them highly. I say give them a try if you need pain control but only if you are willing to invest in wanting to get better and be truly honest about your pain levels. The therapy is only as good as the information provided. Great group of people, friendly, but professional at the same time.  They take to get to know the patients and try greeting them when they arrive at the facility if they aren't busy. Friendly atmosphere and the facility is an open area with with very few doors until you reach the exam or procedure rooms. This makes the atmosphere feel inviting and relaxing.

Updated: 12/13/2024
The Centers for Pain located at the Chestnut Street office has a totally different atmosphere than the one on St. Luke Drive. The main difference between the two offices is the speed at which you are seen and your wait time to be seen. Both facilities are great but I just prefer the Chestnut Street office since I started going there. I love the staff at the Centers for Pain. Dr. Almeida and his Nurse Practitioners have improved my quality of life over the two years I have been seeing them. They helped to control my pain by managing my medicine and ensuring I wasn't feeling, too, much pain while trying to reach my management goal. They even found and repaired a fracture in my lower back and sacrum area which was able to be done as an outpatient procedure in the office. I WAS ECSTATIC and overjoyed by this fact. They took such good care of me. I felt well cared for and safe throughout the entire procedure and after it was completed. I am doing well    now and so happy they found this problem because it has decreased a great deal of my pain nowadays and made it somewhat easier for me to sleep. I'm grateful for this. I could sing their praises all day, but to wrap it up in a nutshell, they're a wonderful group, I wholeheartedly recommend trying them if you have a chronic pain problem that affects your daily life, if you are looking for a pain doctor who's willing to listen to you, explain to you what's has gone wrong with your body, and why it's gotten to this point now. Basically, listen to the hard truth and then choose to seek the proper treatment program to improve your pain levels, then I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE CENTERS FOR PAIN. I hope my post has been inspiring to someone who has been seeking a good Dr and a great staff that works with him. Thanks to The Centers for Pain for making my life manageable.|I've had great experiences while coming from the staff members of the  Center for Pain. Staff members are very professional and courteous.They very knowledgeable and explains the treatments in a a way that the patients can understand.I'll highly recommend Center for Pain  to anyone who needs treatment for pain. Thanks to Center for Pain,for their great service and support!!

The Center For Pain in Prattville offers comprehensive pain management services for Alabama residents struggling with chronic pain conditions. Located at 660 McQueen Smith Rd N, this specialized clinic takes a multidisciplinary approach to treating pain resulting from injuries and diseases. Their medical team understands that chronic pain creates both physical and emotional challenges, requiring more than medication alone for effective treatment.

The clinic's philosophy centers on functional restoration and improving quality of life through personalized treatment plans. Patients benefit from targeted interventions designed to reduce pain levels while encouraging healthy self-care practices. The Center For Pain focuses on helping patients resume normal daily activities and reduce medication dependence whenever possible.

Their pain management specialists provide treatments for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. The clinic emphasizes cost-effective treatment options that address the root causes of pain rather than just symptoms. Their integrated approach may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral strategies.

Additional information about services and treatment approaches is available on their website: http://www.center4pain.com/

Patients seeking long-term pain relief in central Alabama will find The Center For Pain offers evidence-based treatments in a supportive environment focused on improving function and overall wellbeing.
column11:
Chronic pain creates a unique combination of physical and emotional hardships. Sometimes it takes more than just a medicine to alleviate suffering. The Center for Pain offers a controlled, multidisciplinary approach to treating pain that results from injury or disease. Our focus is on restoring function and improving quality of life.

Our goals for patient care: Reduce pain levels and encourage healthy self-care. Restore participation in usual life activities, and Reduce reliance on medications. Provide the best, most cost effective treatment.

His and and himself are just great very nice people . Zero stars I do not & I never will recommend him as a Dr. It cost $0 to be polite. What an ugly spirit!|I have been a patient here for me to years. Thank you Dr. Meyer and I'll see you next month!|I would be very hesitant before going to this clinic. I last saw the doctor on 12/8/22 and Maranda, at the front desk, scheduled me for 1/6/23, and this was a day they were not even open. I came to the clinic, and they were closed. I get to the office and no one was there. I'm not sure how this happened, but from the phone call on the following Monday I could tell this was a mistake. I don't believe I ever heard an apology at all. I work a full time job, and I must schedule appointments well in advance. I can't just take off when I like, and I don't have a lot of sick or vacation time. I come 1/10/23 and was told to sit in the lobby to be seen. This was not the conversation we had on Monday. I told you I had to be at work by 8:00 am and told you why I couldn't take off any longer. This is your fault and not mine. This is your error and not mine. At this point, I will have to go without medicine. I have every right to be angry! This is now two wasted trips and gas! I'm being punished for something I didn't do wrong, and this was not my fault. I'm now being told to find another doctor. They really show care for their patients. Maranda has shown incompetence. If this had been me, I wouldn't have a job. If I had not called, I would still be waiting for a return phone call. I've never had this experience with any doctor or his office. Once I stop taking the medicine and start to take it again, it will make me extremely sick, but I have no choice at the moment.

Curis Pain and Wellness offers comprehensive Primary Care and Pain Management services in Owens Cross Roads, Alabama. The clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and medication management. Patients receive personalized treatment plans addressing both immediate pain relief and long-term wellness goals.

Led by Daniel Burnes, MD, the medical team includes experienced nurse practitioners Heather Porch, CRNP and Keeshia Cloud, CRNP. Dr. Burnes brings extensive training in pain management techniques and innovative treatment approaches. The practitioners work collaboratively to provide holistic care addressing the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

The clinic offers treatments for back pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, and minimally invasive procedures. Patients appreciate the clinic's focus on improving functional capacity and quality of life.

Conveniently located at 6727 US-431 Suite L in Owens Cross Roads, AL 35763, the facility features modern equipment in a comfortable setting. New patients can schedule appointments by calling 256-489-2870 or sending documents to fax number 256-489-2878.

Visit www.curispainandwellness.com for more information about services and treatment options.

Mobile Physical Medicine & Wellness, PC is a specialized pain management clinic located in Mobile, Alabama, offering comprehensive non-surgical treatments for various musculoskeletal and neuromuscular conditions. Founded in 2011 by Dr. Schnitzer, the practice delivers personalized care for patients suffering from chronic pain and mobility issues.

Dr. Schnitzer is a Board Certified Physiatrist with extensive training in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation. His expertise encompasses treating neck pain, back pain, spine disorders, and neuromuscular conditions through non-invasive approaches. The clinic specializes in managing migraine headaches, performing electrodiagnostic testing, and treating workers' compensation injuries.

Patients seeking alternatives to surgery can access comprehensive treatment plans tailored to their specific needs. The clinic's holistic approach focuses on improving function and reducing pain without surgical intervention. Dr. Schnitzer's methods emphasize long-term pain relief and enhanced quality of life.

Located at 3929 Airport Blvd, Building 2, Suite 100 in Mobile, AL 36609, the clinic is conveniently accessible to residents throughout the Mobile area. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 251-450-8044 or visiting their website at www.mobilephysicalmedicine.com for more information about services and treatment options.
column11: Dr. Schnitzer specializes in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and is a Board Certified Physiatrist. He established his own practice, Mobile Physical Medicine and Wellness, in 2011. His practice focuses on non-surgical treatment of neck, back and other spine and neuromuscular disorders, migraine headaches, electrodiagnosis, workers' compensation injuries and non-invasive pain management.

column2: Dr. Berryman Phenix City Pain Management
column3:
Dr. Berryman Phenix City Pain Management offers comprehensive pain treatment solutions for residents throughout Phenix City and surrounding Alabama communities. Located at 1810 Stadium Dr Suite 140, Phenix City, AL 36867, our clinic specializes in interventional pain procedures and personalized care plans.

Dr. Berryman brings extensive medical experience to pain management treatment. His approach combines evidence-based techniques with compassionate patient care. The clinic addresses various chronic pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain.

Our treatment options include:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain relief
  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation
  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain management
  • Medication management for ongoing pain control
  • Physical therapy recommendations and coordination
  • Minimally invasive procedures for long-term solutions

Patients appreciate our efficient scheduling process and minimal wait times. New patients can typically secure appointments within one week. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients on payment options.

Contact us at +1 334-214-4616 to schedule your consultation. Our office hours accommodate working professionals with some evening availability. Visit https://www.phenixcitypain.com/ for detailed service information and patient resources.

Serving Phenix City with dedication to improving quality of life through effective pain management solutions.
