column2: Center For Physical Medicine and Pain Management - Dr. Rachelle B Janush
column3:
Center For Physical Medicine and Pain Management, led by Dr. Rachelle B. Janush, offers comprehensive pain management solutions in Montgomery, Alabama. The clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and personalized treatment plans.

Located at 2227 Taylor Road, this Montgomery pain clinic provides relief for patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and neuropathic conditions. Dr. Janush combines advanced diagnostic techniques with targeted therapies to address the root causes of pain.

The practice offers several specialized treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain
  • Joint injections for arthritis relief
  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain management
  • Physical therapy integration for functional improvement
  • Medication management when appropriate

Dr. Rachelle B. Janush brings extensive experience in physical medicine and rehabilitation. Her approach focuses on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence. The clinic emphasizes functional restoration alongside pain reduction strategies.

Patients throughout Montgomery County benefit from individualized care plans. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and offers appointment scheduling through their website or by phone.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.cpmpm.net or call +1 334-260-8988.

column40:
I had gone to Dr. J for over 12 years. She  gave me care even when I didn't have insurance.

She is a  "Pain Management" doctor. She doesn't just dish out pain meds so if that's what you are looking for them you better keep looking.

She did help me, I was totally happy with her. She diagnosed me with chronic pain syndrome, degenerative disc disease, migraines and several other conditions. However after 13 years,  January 2020.she divorced me as a patient. She did not give me an explanation as a matter of fact, I was basically kicked out of her office by her staff and was later sent a letter in the mail.

Not only was that very disappointing. Not to mention being unprovoked and unprofessional. I followed her directions very carefully. I never failed a drug test. I Have no idea why after 13 years she  could do that as a doctor. Fortunately, in March 2020 I found an amazing new Pain Specialist. He has alternative therapy and treatments including Radio frequency injections. I am now not just existing, I am thriving. So I suppose I should thank her. For almost 5 years I am being treated by
Dr Brian Thoma at Cahaba Pain and Spine Care
2010 Patton Chapel Rd # 200, Hoover, AL 35216|Dr. Janush has treated me for an extremely painful chronic injury for more than 14 years. In all probability, she saved my life. Her efforts to find relief for me were never exhausted.  While I have at times had to wait an hour or more to see her that is an exception, and is explained by the length of time she takes with her patients. My first visit with her was two hours long. She has been very thorough and compassionate, she listens to my questions and offers understandable responses. She suggested a neurostimulator for me which helped tremendously. She is, in my long experience with her and in my opinion, an excellent doctor. However, I have found her office staff unreliable. I have frequently left messages and questions which never received a response. Dr. J is sometimes slow to complete needed reports or documents for my disability ins carrier, but I suspect her staff may be responsible. She has also charged an exorbitant fee to draft a letter for me, and it was explained to me that it was because she expedited the letter, though she had the request for the letter for a month. I have never had a negative experience with DrJ herself but have many times been very frustrated with her staff. I think she's an excellent doctor and an outstanding lady. She's very personable, approachable, understanding and compassionate, with an exuberant, vivacious personality. I rate four stars only because of the admin frustrations.|Dr. Janush is amazing and her staff is just as wonderful! I've been battling constant muscle contractions in my neck and shoulder for years. Oral medications only provide a few hours of relief, but Dr. Janush was able to provide a longer lasting relief to my condition with injections. She's not just a great doctor though, she is a beautiful person that truly loves her patients. She doesn't just breeze in and out of the room. She takes time to listen, answer any questions, and she provides a whole concept approach to advising patients of at home care.|Dr. Janush has been a great doctor for me since 1997. She is very professional, knowledgeable, stays up-to-date on all forms of medical treatment, medications and forms of rehabilitation.
I would not be in physical condition which keeps me functioning for a soon to be 68 yr old female.

I have referred her to family members & friends.
All she asks is that you listen to her advice and follow her instructions.
She is the best in her field. She has gotten my family members and myself back to physical abilities we lost due to injuries.
Thank you Dr.Rochell Janush, You have a heart of gold and love for your patients.
Thank you and God bless you and your family|Dr. Janush is a very caring, compassionate and incredibly intelligent doctor. Being a combat veteran and former MMA fighter that suffers from various physical ailments she is the only one who has taken a serious interest in helping treat my pain over the years. She goes above and beyond what most other doctors do. She takes the time to listen, test and diagnose. She lets you know from the initial contact that it could be an ongoing progress to get the combination of treatments perfect and for me she has. I have been a patient of hers for 5 years and I don't find the wait longer than any other doctor. If anything it is a shorter wait. Her staff is courteous and most of them have been there many years. They get to know each patient individually and go out of their way to help whether it be the receptionist at the front desk or the office manager. Personally, I find the accusations in the negative reviews to be untrue in my 5 year experience. Dr. Janush always comes in with a smile, even when it's obvious, after getting to know her, that she hasn't had the best of days. It never stops her from giving her patients ONE HUNDRED PERCENT of her time and attention. For the accusation that she gives blocks with no anesthetic is an outright fabrication. In 5 years that has never once happened to me. For anyone that might think that this is an inside review my name is James Carswell. If you are in pain and want a doctor that actually cares about her patients then she is the one to see.|There should be a Zero star rating for this vile whack job. Anyone who is happy with this Doctor just hasn't been there long enough. She refuses to go one inch out of her way to deal with insurance companies- even when there is an issue that results in great harm to the patient. She said she wasn't paid to do that, but charges exorbitant fees. I had a change in insurance that required her to change my medication. She botched the conversion chart (which a 2nd grader could figure) and then refused to correct it. I immediately got sick. She refused assistance in any way- even though I was a long time patient, and had paid many thousands of dollars. To run the bill up, you must take excruciating injections that do absolutely nothing. She botched many of these, once sending my husband to the hospital in an ambulance when she punctured his lung. This woman cares about nothing but money- is rude , vulgar, profane and has a God complex. She enjoys bullying patients who are at her mercy because they need medicine. You'd be better off going to a pusher--and a pusher would care more about what happens to you than this quack. Save yourself an ordeal and find a decent doctor-- which excludes this one.|Wow! She really takes the time to make sure you understand what she is going to do or what she wants to do before anything is done.  Dr. Janush made me feel that I was ok for hurting and was able to pinpoint some root causes whereas other doctors would just put a "band-aid" with medication or physical therapy. She brings a fresher perspective as to my ailments and what can be done for it. Very nice and understanding-worth the wait!|Over the past seven years I have been dealing with a chronic pain and fatigue disorder called fibromyalgia.  When I first started going to see her I felt like she was an answer to my prayers, because no other doctors had any idea was going on with my body.

I have now been a patient of Dr. Janush for the past five years. During most of this time she has been very helpful to me, and I have felt like my health was getting better.

However, during the past month, she had to switch one of medications as the company no longer made the one that had been working great for me for the past five years. I have broken out in hives all over my body unlike anything that I have ever experienced. I have even had to take a leave of absence from work in order to deal with my illness.

I have also been to my primary care physician sick times in the last six weeks, and I have had to take three rounds of predinosone without much results. My primary doctor sent me to a wonderful allergist, Dr. Lee. Come to find out I am allergic to the new medicine. However due to the nature of the medication, I can't just stop taking it without getting very sick. I have literally pleaded  in tears for her to see me or to write a prescription for a medicine to which I am not allergic. To my dismay, all she has told me to do is quit the medication and deal with the withdrawal or go to the emergency room. During this most difficult time, I have felt completely alone to find a solution that doesn't require going through withdrawal or sitting in the emergency room for hours. I have been to the emergency room twice before and all they gave me was vicadin or Ativan to knock me out, charge me $100.00, and send me home. Unless one is literally dying, the emergency room isn't very helpful.

During the past month, I have felt like Dr.Janush does not care about me at all. The medication she prescribed is causing me to break out in hives, and she refused to take time to see me or to write me a different prescription.  No other doctor has ever treated me this way, especially when I am having problems with the new medicine she prescribed.

For this reason I have decided that I need to take my business elsewhere.

column3:
UAB Pain Management Center offers comprehensive pain treatment services in Birmingham, Alabama. Located at 1201 11th Ave S, this specialized clinic provides evidence-based approaches for both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's multidisciplinary team develops personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs.

The clinic specializes in interventional pain procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation therapies. Patients benefit from advanced diagnostic techniques to identify pain sources accurately. Treatment options include nerve blocks, spinal injections, radiofrequency ablation, and implantable pain management devices.

UAB's board-certified pain specialists have extensive training in anesthesiology and pain medicine. Many physicians completed fellowships at prestigious institutions and regularly contribute to pain management research. The center maintains strong connections with UAB's academic medical community, ensuring treatments reflect the latest medical advances.

The facility offers specialized programs for back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic conditions. Additional services include cancer pain management, headache treatment, and complex regional pain syndrome care. The center emphasizes minimally invasive techniques whenever possible.

Patients appreciate the clinic's coordinated care approach with physical therapy, psychology, and rehabilitation services. The center accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients on treatment authorization.

For appointments or questions, contact UAB Pain Management Center at +1 205-801-8250. The clinic is conveniently located in Birmingham's medical district with accessible parking options.

You know I wait for whole year to get in this program. I need to put on a medication that I did not like then. I had an accident and fell. They gave me strips. So one strip was 4 a day. So I took a extra little piece of that strip. Because I failed and was hurting and told them the truth that I took it before the time. I was supposed to take it. They took me off the program 1 week later after I started.
Now how is that. Changing over a new leaf trying to be honest, I get penalize. They boot me off the program and tell That I have an addiction problem. Because I took a extra little piece of that strip that was 1/4 Milligram a few hours early. I understand they're programming but I don't condone it. Everyone is not That's not having addiction to this medication that you prescribe.
So now it makes a Harder for me define pain management. Because this is what they put in your chart that you have an addiction problem to pain meds. In the best part of this is I have surgery in 3 weeks. I have no pain doctor. I'm glad I have jesus.....|Pain clinic's are a waste of time and money was able to take care of my pain through my regular doctor who new my condition. Government steps in and makes me spend more money for another doctor that wants to give you the weakest pain medicine or some new stuff that your insurance doesn't cover|This place is a complete waste of time. Neurology sent me here. The staff is courteous, but they just pass you off to someone else. If you are allergic to anabolic steroids and they don't work for you, there is nothing else they will do because they only perform steroid injection 'nerve blocks' there. I got referred to do biofeedback, and was told to go see my gynecologist. (Which I've already been and they told me to see neurology lol) They're playing hot potato with me. : / No one wants to actually put the work into figuring out the underlying cause, or investigate a solution. Way to go UAB.|So I have been in severe pain for several months waiting on Financial approval. I had to pay to see another doctor just to get a referral to here. I spent more time in the waiting room than I spent with a doctor. I saw I guess a nurse or resident where the most physical thing they did to determine my pain was to run their fingertip down my spine barely touching me and asked did that hurt....well no? Then when the actual doctor comes in no kidding he was there less than 20 seconds. I was a new patient and I left with nothing to help with my pain. I even asked if they could do an injection and his response was no u need an MRI before we can do anything for you. Ok well if you knew this why wouldn't you have had me do this before hand while I was waiting the last two weeks for this appointment? I don't understand where doctors caring bedside manner have gone but you definitely won't find it here!|WHY IS TURNLEY WORKING IN PAIN MEDICINE? When I filled out my 15 page medical history and finally got an appt. I overheard a nurse say this right before my appt. with Dr. Turnley, "Dr. Turnley says she is NOT starting even one more patient on opioids!" I should have walked out then but -- like lots of people -- I was desperate for pain relief. Turnley's comment indicates 2 things: (1.) a complete lack of empathy and (2.) self-serving priorities, IOW she's more concerned with her own personal comfort than with the health of her patients. I've tried at least 15 types of pain treatment, including all 3 approved "fibromyalgia medications," which did not work, possibly because I also have spinal stenosis and disc disease. When Turnley found out I had tried those meds SHE LITERALLY HAD NO IDEA WHAT TO DO WITH ME! So, after filling out page after page of documentation and waiting for weeks TWICE, I left demoralized and still in pain. Why? Because Dr. Turnley didn't want patients who needed pain medication because they might require extra time, thus interfering more in her life than patients who aren't suffering from chronic pain. Why didn't she choose pediatric medicine? Or mortuary science?|I've seen all the negative reviews. I myself have had nothing but good experiences. I've always been taken to the back in a timely manner. The doctors listened to me and we together came up with a plan that gave me my life back I'm so grateful and thankful for the staff and doctors. I highly recommend!!!|Have been going here for 2 years...even had the nerve stimulator implanted ,only helps just a little, not like I hoped for...they sent me to a different doctor after 2 years with the same one..he was great.now I have some lady ,who is a straight up hateful and doesn't care...she wanted to ween me off some of my meds...told her I have no problem with that ,as long as my pain is manageable....been out of meds 4 days...have been calling and leaving messages, and talked to a nurse ...she looked and told me that the doctor nor her nurse have looked at my question or problem...4 back surgeries and a failed fusion ,2 cages a rod and screws in my lower back ,along with degenerative disc disease and degenerative joint disease, and now they do not want to help ,or return my calls ,..or even look on the computer for messages......very disappointed...and hurting like hell.....|

Yet, still there are good doctors. Very caring personal.|I wanted to leave zero star but it would not let me leave a review without 1. If you have a loved one I would not recommend you going to this place. My 92 yr old Mother had two fractures of her vertebras and was in so much pain. It was going to be two weeks before they could schedule her Kyphoplasty after being diagnosed. On the day of her procedure she was very sick and it had to be rescheduled but they said it wouldn't be the next week but probably toward the end of Nov. I'm sorry but if you have a broke arm or leg you get it set because it is considered an emergency. When I called and spoke to a nurse she was rude and said everybody was in the same boat there. Whatever that means. As luck would have it I got in touch with her Orthopedic Dr and he got someone that could do it in three days. It was done today. I can tell you that after hearing from several Drs that she should not have had to wait to get this procedure done. If I had of seen all of the one star reviews, Mother would not have EVER entered there doors. They don't have to worry because she will not be going back to them.  We would rather have someone that really cares for there patience and show compassion. Sometimes we learn from our mistakes.|I had to have a procedure on my lumbar spine done. I was nervous because I have Trypanophobia (Fear of Needles), so IVs and things like that are terrible or me.

The entire staff involved set me at ease and did a great job start to finish. I was in and out in about an hour. The front office staff was friendly and helped me get checked in.

Kudos to all the staff that were involved in treating me.

Dr. Kasper came and talked me through the procedure and ensured all my questions were answered. He was very friendly and professional.

I believe it was Jolie that put in the IV. She did a fantastic job! I barely felt it and she got it on the first try (I have some IV horror stories, so this was a very pleasant change!)

The rest of the staff, Robin, Jordan and Chris did everything they could to make me comfortable and they were all very friendly and professional.

If I need any future procedures I will be asking for this crew by name. Well done, one and all!!|Each and every member of AAPC staff  excel in a friendly and helpful manner. Their professionalism is prevalent in each and every aspect of care and concerns shown toward patients|One star isn't low enough for this terrible company. Nurse jolee or however you spell it got called out by another nurse for improperly putting in an IV and then proceeded to verbally attack the patient ( nurse who called her out) in front of a 4 year old child. Very unprofessional and a terrible place to seek treatment. I highly recommend you find another office for your needs. Very Very Very rude employees. Don't waste your time.|I have always had great visits to AAPC.  The staff is courteous and helpful during the visit or procedure.

column40:
Place is super dated needs a face lift but I guess when there is that much traffic everyday it's gonna be worn out. Long wait time for appointment. Dr. Hundley was alright seemed to care about his reputation.|The physician was superb but the nurse Benita was rushing and only worried about getting off on Friday as it apparently was a short day. Had to do urinalysis to get pain prescription and felt rushed. With kidney disease I do not go often. I relayed this to the nurse as I did not know going in that I had to do a urine test and was not able to give one within her needed time frame she said their lab person was off. She called someone and I could hear her complaining about not being able to get off in time. She then came back and gave me a transport swab from LabCorp which was not the correct one. Complained I did not do it right and it was a waste of a swab. I then tried drinking 4 cups of water to urinate and was still being rushed. I finally got tired of being pushed to go that I just left. I was not able to get my prescription and I hope she is happy. She called shortly after I left to make sure I was aware I would not get my prescription but I was not going back to be subjected to more unkindness. The physician was awesome but I just want to make sure he is aware why I did not get my pain medication.|A very positive experience. Dr. Hundley was patient, listened to my concerns, & addressed all of them for me. He went above & beyond. He reviewed all of my medical records & made some recommendations. Thanks to his thoroughness we caught a potential heart problem.
The staff is top notch as well.

Thank you all!|Per usual from the time I walked in until the time I left, everything was very professional and on point. The receptionist was kind and helpful, then Benita the nurse, ask me specific questions and was truly interested in my responses. She rolled me to my room as I was in a wheelchair, made sure that I was comfortable and assured me the Dr.Hundley would be in very shortly. True to her words, he was there in about 5 minutes. He was concerned to see me in a wheelchair and on oxygen. I explained my recent experience in the hospital and what was going on with my health. He wanted to know the reason why I was admitted my diagnosis and my prognosis. I assured him I would keep him updated with my labs my other physicians visits and send him copies as best I could. He is not only concerned about my pain but about my health holistically. For that I am grateful. Thank you Dr Hundley and entire team and staff for always caring and concern about my whole person. I am very blessed and fortunate. Thank you so much!|Very prompt,  didn't wait long to see the doctor,  very knowledgeable,  had great solutions for a path to recovery.  Highly recommend doctor Hundley, staff was very friendly.|My experience with Dr Hundley was clearly disappointing.  I  did everything I could do to get the help I needed.  He did nothing but make me wait another month suffering.  Disabling.   getting worse by the day.  I honestly respect his position as a dr. But as a patient and actually gnd care I feel he could have done a lot more.  I had all my hospital records a disc and notes from the dr.s I had seen to finally get to see Dr. Hundley. I was upset disappointed and confused as to what I could have done different.  I did everything and more I was told to do. So I could get see. My meds and begin our relationship between Dr. Hundley and I.  At this point I am not sure I'll be going back to his office|I've always had good visits with Dr. Hundley, he listens to what I have say. He's more down to earth than most doctors I've been to over the years, yeah I'd recommend the good doctor to my friend & anyone who asks about him.|Dr. Hundley is a fantastic doctor who cares about his patients and understands their needs.
I recommend him to anyone that's needing pain management.

Lighthouse Pain Clinic provides personalized treatment plans for various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. The medical team specializes in interventional pain procedures, medication management, and innovative therapies for chronic pain relief. Patients experiencing back pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, or post-surgical pain receive evidence-based treatments in a compassionate environment.

Unlike typical pain clinics, DYNAMIC Pain & Wellness creates a welcoming atmosphere free from stigma. The staff prioritizes customer service and emotional support throughout the treatment process. They understand pain affects both physical and emotional wellbeing.

The clinic utilizes cutting-edge technologies and modern treatment approaches. Their interventional procedures target pain at its source rather than masking symptoms. The "Wellness" component reflects their commitment to improving overall quality of life.

Located at 2826 Ross Clark Circle, Suite 103 in Dothan, the facility offers convenient access for Southeast Alabama patients. Their highly skilled clinical team provides comprehensive pain assessments during initial consultations.

Patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 251-308-9800 or visiting their website at dynamicpainandwellness.com. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients on treatment options.

All patients and their families will know that each member of our staff cares. We understand that pain is not only physical, but it an emotional experience. Our highly skilled clinical staff will utilize cutting-edge technologies to ensure optimum physical well-being.

column38: anissa mathis|Tamara Rodgers|Faith Hope|Heather C|Jacqueline O|Edward McCormick|Chuck barthlemess|Chastity Smith
column40:
I initially sought treatment from Dynamic Pain and Wellness over a year ago, hoping to alleviate my chronic back pain. Given my history of multiple back surgeries, permanent nerve damage, and severe arthritis throughout my spine and joints, I was eager to find a solution.
Unfortunately, I am not a suitable candidate for epidural procedures due to a severe allergic reaction to steroid injections, which was documented by an allergist in Dothan over 15 years ago. This reaction was so severe that it took me over six months to recover, and I was advised to avoid and never take steroids again with the first injection being so severe another could kill me. .
Regrettably, my experience with this clinic has been disappointing, as they seem to prioritize profit over patient well-being. I was required to purchase a back brace and underwent two nerve ablation procedures, as well as drug testing n every visit. The first ablation provided some relief, but the second procedure was unsuccessful, and I was left in more pain. Despite my repeated assertions that I could not undergo epidural injections due to my allergy, the staff, particularly Regis, continued to push for these procedures & Regis was down right ugly to me on multiple visits. My primary care physician even provided documentation of my allergy, but this was not sufficient to deter Regis from insisting epidural injections.
Furthermore, the clinic's practice of drug testing on every visit (every 3 weeks)  resulted in additional expenses, as my insurance did not cover these tests. In light of my experience, I would strongly advise current and prospective patients to exercise caution when considering treatment from Dynamic Pain and Wellness. I wld advise you to RUN NOT WALK ....RUN FROM THIS PLACE! They treat you like a number; bottom line you are a dollar $$ sign to them.|Only the patient is allowed to go back. It doesn't matter if they are hard or hearing or have memory problems. They most of the time don't return phone calls. If you decide you don't want a procedure the suggest you should have they may tell you they can't do anything else for you. They were really good at first but the longer my boyfriend went to see them the worse they got...well when they got the new doctor that you only see during procedures. Don't recommend thet at all now.|See below recommendation for btr practice in adjacent bldg 2nd floor. Went to this office about a year ago and was going to get some injections done. I put a review up here back then about how it was tho do no c it. It was quite an unpleasant visit.  The doctor was nice enough, but the staff is quite lacking. As life happens. I actually had forgotten this experience. So when my pain worsened, I contacted them again and set an appointment and went to see them.  it was only after this visit that I was reminded of my feelings for this practice. For the most part, the staff make you feel unwelcome, rushed and are quite insolent in their demeanor. towards u, Like the patient is burdening them. I did not see the doctor this time, so this is no reflection on him, unless he's okay with the way his staff is.  sorry to have to write such a review, but truth is truth. my recommendations is to see Dr.  in the adjacent building 2nd floor. Perhaps doctor jerkin and this dr can team up, but leave this  staff behind. The staff at 2nd floor dr office is what 1 would expect from a doctor visit, which is filled with pleasantness and respect and an obvious willingness and desire to help you or be of assistance.|I am very happy with this clinic. I get my injections and medication. I wish I got to take to Dr. Sam more. Other than that they take good care of you.|Everyone who works here is absolutely wonderful except for NP Regis Johnson who brings the entire place down.
I've been living with chronic pain and illness for 25 years and I have NEVER had issues with a provider. The first time I saw Regis she tried to sell me on a spinal cord stimulator. If she had gone over my history, she would know that it wouldn't work for me. The second time she misdiagnosed me with an SI joint injury and scheduled a procedure. The MRI came back that my SI joint was fine so I had an unnecessary procedure.
At my appointment on 10/9, I specifically asked NOT to see her but was told there was nothing they could do.
My appointment with her was the epitome of medical gaslighting. I have never witnessed a NP with such a God complex! She will argue with you and cut you off when you ask questions. I told her twice that we weren't communicating effectively and asked to see the Doctor or a different NP. This infuriated her and I was told no the first time. The second time she said she would talk to him, left the room and came back to say the doctor said the same thing.
The appointment ended in an argument with her threatening me in the hallway that "I didn't want to see her raise her voice and that I didn't want to go there." She then said "Your not getting ANY meds" (3 non-opioids) until I come back in 2 weeks for ANOTHER procedure and the 2 weeks after that at a follow up appointment..
The clinical director Jessica admitted to me on the phone yesterday that she witnessed how angry Regis was and how upset I was but could really care less about the situation.
Great way to treat a patient! She has NO business working in the medical field and treating patients with multiple chronic pain and illness conditions. All she wants to do is sign you up for a procedure like a sleazy salesperson.
A detailed three page letter has been sent to Dynamic Pain and Wellness as well as the Alabama Nursing Board. I don't expect a response as they could care less if they lose a patient even the one who was Dr. Searcy's very first patient.
Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.|Have had nothing but good treatment.  Doctor is quick, no messing about and boom done.  Has saved me from major surgery.  Taking very good care of knee pain and backpain.  If you don't want surgery come talk to them.  They will work on your pain.  Also, i do not take pain meds, I have not needed to.  I'm 54 years old and so far happy that I came here.  Doesnt hurt to come talk to them.|Everything has gone well since I started going to Dynamic Pain & Wellness.  The only thing I would like to see is Dr Searcy coming in to meet his patients instead of coming in, doing the procedure and leaving.  We need to know the doctor who's working on our bodies!  Everytime I went there for a procedure, his team got me ready with my face down on the table, Dr Searcy came in to do the procedure and left right out before I even got off the table.   He's just not very personable!|Don't waste your time with this place.  They want to inject you under the guise of being "interventional" but they don't listen to where your actual pain is.  Regis is the WORST medical "professional " I have ever had the misfortune to run across. Don't dare ask her a question and don't dare ask to see a doctor because it won't happen. In this rat race for 2 years and endured painful injections and was looked at like I was crazy because they didn't work. Went to a new doc and the very first injection worked like a charm. I feel 100% better.  The new doctor actually listened to me not like these money hungry circus acts. Buyers beware!!

column2: Jacob Vella, M.D. - The Center for Pain
column3:
Jacob Vella, M.D. - The Center for Pain offers comprehensive pain management services in Montgomery, Alabama. Dr. Vella is uniquely double board certified in pain management by both the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine, demonstrating exceptional expertise in treating chronic pain conditions.

Originally from California, Dr. Vella brings extensive experience as the former managing partner of New York State's largest pain practice before establishing his clinic in Auburn. His practice specializes in minimally invasive, non-surgical treatments for complex spinal disorders, providing patients with effective alternatives to traditional surgery.

The Center for Pain focuses on interventional pain management techniques that target the source of pain directly. Patients suffering from chronic back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic conditions can find specialized care tailored to their specific needs. Dr. Vella's approach emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction.

Early in his career, Dr. Vella was recognized as one of 20 emerging physician leaders in pain medicine. His contributions to medical research have been published in peer-reviewed journals, particularly advancing the field of neuromodulation. This commitment to innovation ensures patients receive the most current, evidence-based treatments available.

Located at 488 St Lukes Dr, Montgomery, AL 36117, The Center for Pain welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. The clinic offers comprehensive evaluations and individualized treatment plans in a compassionate environment. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 334-288-7808 or visit www.center4pain.com for more information about services and treatment options.
column11: Originally from California, Dr. Jacob Vella is an interventional pain management physician who is uniquely double board certified in pain management by both the American Board of Anesthesiology and of Pain Medicine. Before moving to Auburn, he was the managing partner of the largest pain practice in New York State. He specializes in minimally invasive non-surgical options for painful and complex disorders of the spine. He was chosen early in his career as one of 20 emerging physician leaders in pain medicine. His active engagement in medical research and development has been published in peer related journals and his contributions have worked to advance the specialty of pain medicine. Most specifically in the division of neuromodulation.

Southside Pain Specialists delivers comprehensive pain management solutions in Cullman, Alabama. Our clinic specializes in evidence-based treatment options that are both effective and cost-conscious. Every treatment plan begins with establishing a clear diagnosis, ensuring targeted care for each patient's unique condition.

Our pain management physicians follow rigorous standards established by the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians, The American Board of Pain Medicine, and the International Spinal Injection Society. This commitment to professional excellence ensures patients receive the highest quality interventional pain treatments available.

We focus on three key outcomes for every patient: improved pain perception, enhanced quality of life, and restored physical functioning. Our specialists offer advanced interventional procedures alongside conservative management approaches, creating personalized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions.

column40: So I broke my left shoulder blade on February 1st of 2024! My orthopedic referred me to this pain clinic in March, I have been calling and leaving a message once a week since the middle of March! I do not drive so I've been calling to schedule a bus for my appointment! They DON'T ever pick up the phone or return messages! So I finally got a ride to see them! Receptionist says they're understaffed and gives me a business card! I call the number on the card it's for the Birmingham location  and they don't do appointments for Cullman There's only 2 pain clinics in Cullman and the other one won't accept car accident victims! I hope anyone in pain finds some relief, because you won't find it here! Absolute joke|While Andy at the Cullman office has always been very polite and helpful. Getting Doctor Gillespie to actually follow through with anything is almost impossible. I've been out of my pain medication for weeks at a time. Because they can't get it together and get it to the correct pharmacy. I have left numerous messages, With no response from them. When I tell them the problem they act like it's my fault. I've given them the correct information. Many times and I have had it confirmed, That they have the correct information. But yet they still can't get it together, No return calls, Even with something as simple as getting a prescription for a tens unit. They can't get it into my insurance company. The receptionist and the medical staff at the birmingham office are rude. I have waited up to 3 hours in their office for an appointment. Find another pain clinic. Any other pain clinic. It's a shame that a few people abuse the system and now all of us that have Chronic pain conditions, that will never go away have to suffer needlessly because we cannot get a pain clinic that will help us.|Had appt. Set up for 3 months . When for appt they  were closed. Never received  a call to let us know or reschedule.  Took off work. Not sure we will stay with  them or go back to  Bham clinic|I went to them for help with my Hips. My medical had been giving me pain meds. I was not looking for more are different pain meds. But Dr. mcKnight told my medical Family Doctors that I did not need them. So they took me off.  I'm on chemo and a lot of other meds and have an auto immune disease. That caused me to stop work but Dr. McKnight did not help me he made matters worse. Also this is the same clinic in Birmingham.  If I could give -1 I would. Don't make a mistake and see them it's not about helping people!|These people never call you back when you leave a message|

column40:
Always professional and friendly. Always try to make everyone feel that they value them no matter how busy they are  ( I have never felt less important than any other person )! The staff is truly great, not only do they take the time to discuss your concerns, but they also listen to your feedback ( I have seen many different doctors, and they have always treated me with the utmost respect)! My life would be horrible if I didn't have this program to look after me,( being a retired teacher who needs to have some quality of life and remain active ) they have given me back the opportunity to still feel useful!!|Everyone is wonderful! They are all so nice, professional and knowledgeable and treat me with dignity that has become uncommon. Dr. Leslie takes time to listen to me, ask questions and shows true empathy for my situation! She understands that at this point, I'm more concerned with quality than quantity of life as there's no cure for Sarcoidosis and you guys are helping me to stay active as long as possible!
Also, EVER office should have as good of a person as your angel out front! EVERYONE is of the highest quality!
When looking at all these reviews, please remember that 91% of people that will take the time to leave a review are for negative reasons. I know these stats from running 2 restaurants before. Just give them a try. Don't take honesty as rudeness. For everyone of us with legitimate pain issues that need these specialist, there's one or more trying to use their services dishonestly and that makes it harder for those of us that truly need it. I'm blessed to have found these guys after battling a chronic disease, that many doctors don't understand, for almost 30 years. I attend the Anniston office.|Nurse Practitioner (NP) Mary, from the Rainbow City Clinic, was fantastic on my most resent visit along with the Alabama Anesthesiology administrative staff (especially Andrew) who always provides great support.

NP Jennifer Y. & Dr. Casper, have provided outstanding care to me for several years now.  They're competent at what they do, very caring, and they're much appreciated by me.

Alabama Anesthesiology and Pain Consultants is an excellent clinic to address chronic pain issues.|They used to be okay, but lately it's a struggle to even get through by phone; they can't keep a doctor to save their life and the last person we saw didn't seem very focused on us. Told them my parent was struggling with the medication and they just increased it. They were sick for 6 months, several ER visits - only for a doctor to point out the meds. It was like night and day. Proceed with caution, it's a very disorganized and impersonal place now.|The visit is so easy and so kind. They are the friendliest Dr's office ever! I wish they could also be a family practice! Kayla is The best, when getting people signed in and checking insurance , to making you feel at home! Aubrey is alao a huge perk for the practice as well! She is sooo sweet! Dr Casper and Jennifer Yates are the best working together! And I hate that they will not be working together as much anymore! If I had a down side to the practice, that would be it! You just dont get any better or smiling faces as as this group! But over all..If I must see a dr, IT will always be at the oxford location!!!|Just moved here, was on 6 pills a day. I fell from 30 feet onto a concrete Crete slab. I have bolts in my ankle, knee surgery twice, I rod snd flap in my bone to wrist. They cut me to 4, had me do x-rays, still wanted to cut me to 3 as that's what this other doctors said they only give out. They don't intend,  the just hurdle you through like numbers not people. I hope when I get to see my new regular doctor he can guide me to someone who listens to their patients. I still have surgeries to go.|I have been with AAPC for two years as of next month (Nov 2024) with pain from a broken back and neck suffered in an accident in 2016. We haven't always agreed on everything, but pain management must be the hardest ailment to treat. As far as I'm concerned they are Heaven sent. I feel that most disagreements that I've read in these reviews comes about because pain management has very strict rules and regulations by DEA that they and the pharmacist have to follow. When it comes to narcotics the DEA rules supreme and yet the Pain Consultants do all they can to help and assistance. In the two years I've gone through three minor procedures and two major spine operations. I have virtually every vertebrae between LL5 and Thoracic 9 connected with straps, rods, bridges and screws. The major surgeries were caused by my walker with wheels that flip out from under me and I landed on the tip of my tailbone back in March 2024 on the concrete driveway which basically wrecked my lower lumbar causing the two major surgeries that I've undergone recently. Yet, I now feel that I am really on my way to some major relief from all the pain. For that I have nothing but appreciation for my neurosurgeon and the AA&PC doctors and practitioners. I know that they really care and do all they can to help me relieve the pain.|Check in was pleasant and easy. They got me right in and I was finished within 30 minutes. Dr was so nice!  Would highly recommend!

column40:
I highly recommend Pain Rehabilitation Center. Dr McCoomer is very knowledgeable on patients needs and he cares for the patient. He has helped me with pain from back surgery and Polio. The staff is very friendly and helpful about your needs.|Best pain consultant doctor in the area along with a great group of nurse practitioners. There entire staff makes sure all patients are treated equally as well. Definitely a wonderful experience|The lack of professionalism of this office is simply shocking.
I received treatment with Pain and Rehabilitation for several months, ending in September of 2022. Flash forward to August 2023, where I receive notification that Pain and Rehabilitation has turned over my account to a collections agency. This is despite the following:
- As active duty military, my visits are 100% covered by Tricare insurance.
- The only charge I ever incurred out of pocket was a fee for a missed appointment that I paid and have the charge statement to prove
- At no point in time from September 2022 to August 2023 did Pain and Rehabilitation attempt to contact be by phone or mail. Not a single time.
While this may seem to be a simply mistake, an inability to maintain proper accounting or turning over an account for collection in error is, at best negligent, and at worst criminal. Such poor record keeping can inflict damage on an unsuspecting person's credit and cause completely unneeded stress.
Be very aware of seeking treatment with Pain and Rehabilitation and I highly encourage you to maintain excellent financial records.|Fantastic experience!  My pain is gone and the customer service is outstanding!  I highly recommend this office!|He's a good doctor he keeps my pain in good levels im able to do more...

column40:
Great Dr. Kind and understanding. Knew exactly where my pain was by touching area's where except my pain was located. Very educational. Professional. Everyone is super understanding. Would never want to see another Dr. For my pain. I've been to alot who were hateful,hurt me made my pain worse. It's bad enough living in constant pain and having to take meds which I hate but worse to have a Dr who thinks they owe you something and doesn't understand how bad it is to have to live in a body in constant pain where you can't sleep,walk or have a life due to so much pain. Thanks so much Dr Connor and staff for being a lifesaver|Dr. Connor is an excellent doctor.  As Pain Management Specialist go, she is one in a million.  She truly listens to her patients and responds to their individual needs.  She takes care to follow State and Federal guidelines by performing regular drug screens and blood and nerve tests.  She has helped me to live with my pain, gain better concentration in college and at work.  She takes the time to discuss the different options available for people living with my spinal conditions, and her personal experience with surgery and injections.  I have been seeing her for around 3 years, and have always been treated with kindness and dignity.  I have never been treated like someone who is simply seeking medication, as some doctors treat patients.  I have been diagnosed and evaluated for my particular condition, and treated appropriately. The only negative thing I have to say about seeing Dr. Connor is the wait time.  I have never been to an appointment that didn't last at least 2.5 - 3 hours.  She is an excellent doctor with a lot of patients, so the office visits take a while.|Today was my first appointment and they follow social distancing and everyone had face masks. So i felt comfortable being there, and the staff was so kind. Dr Connor was just a gem, what an absolutely sweet lady. You can tell she really cares about her patients. I give them a 5 star rating, and would refer them to anyone!|I have only had 2 visits with Dr Conner, my first impressions of her are great!
I love my primary care physician but have such a limited time with him, it is like you only can tell them so much in the appointment allotted time. Walk ins get even less, I might be having multiple symptoms but can't tell them about all, just pick the one that they can treat now.
I went to see Dr Conner on a scheduled visit, but she noticed somethings unrelated to my visit. It was enough that she had me in the ER for testing within a hour.
She cares about her patients, and in her position, some people would take advantage.
I would find it hard not to be critical. She trust her patients and I feel they trust her, I do.
Everyone knows that feeling when you go to ER or a Dr with a unseen injury or with pain, you feel like a drug seeker until you can prove that you are not. She shows empathy, concern, Knowledge, and common sense.
If there is a down side of her practice, I have yet to see it. I really hope now, that someone listens and believes me, that they may find out what is wrong. Tired of trying so hard to live and suffering they whole time. I want to be me again.|I have been going to Dr. Connor for 10 years. She's been there as a physician and friend. She always there when you need her to be. Angela and all of the staff are precious people. If your not happy there then you need to evaluate the real reason your there asking for medication. I trust her to also care for my mother and other family members. You want the best doctor in Alabama for your pain care then go see Dr. Conner.|I have been going to Dr. Conner for 9 or 10 years and have been very involved in the decisions  regarding my care and the medication I take!  I am fearful of some pain meds. And she has always listened to me and discussed my concerns!
I feel she always has my best interest at heart and works to help me get to a therapeutic level so I can function to take care of myself and be the most productive person I can be!
I will always want her for my doctor and I trust her with my life.|Dr Connor is one of the FEW, one of the GREAT,  ONE IN A MILLION.  Before i met Dr Conner,  I felt hopeless,  believing the best portion of my life was over.  The pain had crippled me,  and taken me from the day to day lives of my children.
Since beginning treatment with Dr Connor,  almost a year ago now, I feel ALIVE again!  My children have their father back,  and i have hope!  I have my life back.  Words truly cannot express my gratitude to Dr Connor. She is the best doctor i have EVER been associated with!! She is an angel from heaven here to help those in need!|ABSOLUTELY EXCELLENT! Dr. Connor and her staff are the best! They treat you like family! No other Dr cares more for her patients than her! I wish she was still in business. I miss her. I can't find another Dr.

Only had experience with one other pain clinic and Dr Ballard's office is like the light at the end of the tunnel. She was very attentive and appropriately concerned and offered me options I was never given at previous clinic. I'm a 35+ years experienced RN who had my career ended suddenly after 2 back surgeries. My second visit is tomorrow and I feel confident about the direction our Healthcare journey is going and am thankful to be treated like a human and not a drug addict. Thanks to Dr. Ballard and her team!|I cannot tell you enough good things about this wonderful lady, Dr. Horne. I've never had a doctor actually sit down with me and have such a caring attitude towards how we were going to tackle my specific pain management, how I would like to go about easing my pain for long periods of time without making me where I cannot function or drive and didn't just throw medication at me and tell me she'd see me a month. She actually cares about her patients, even if it is not pain related!  She takes her precious very planned out time to give you names of great physicians for other medical problems that have better reputations than other offices that I've seen in the past. What a sweet lady she is!|Dr. Horne and her staff are absolutely amazing.  Dr. Horne has gone an extra mile trying to help relieve my ungodly back pain. I'm praying these blocks work. Dr. Horne if you read this thank you from the bottom of my heart.|My daughter and I use to go to Dr Ballard and we didn't have any problems. Everyone was always nice to us. We changed because of the distance now I wish we had stayed.|Have called 5 times to try to talk to staff about possible starting a treatment for my back. They never return your calls. Told them it was getting worse. I have never had to deal with pain before and don't know what is needed for this.
I have yet to receive a call back. This has been over about 2 months. The staff never returns your calls so obviously they don't care.|Dr. HORN, is honest, authentic and kind at the same time. 2nd visit- she gave me her opinion for surgery which i did on an out patient basis. I spent years suffering, afraid of what the surgery would intell. It was completed and I'm on my way to recovery. She knew!!!|This female doctor saved me. I had been prescribed medication for pain for a bulging disc. This has been a few years back, but she was absolutely amazing. Total transparency, I had never needed pain medication before I had problems with my back. I was in my mid forties. I was running a business at the time, and had no time to take off for surgery. Until I had to!

The Doctor, she told me, " one day you're going to be down at the beach or out in the yard and that disc is going to rupture!"  And she wasn't wrong. I was on a boat over in Atlanta on Lake Lanier. We hit wake and I went up and bounced down.

On the way home from my legs went numb and were aching all the way to my feet. I had surgery the following Friday spinal fusion.

These people were amazing. They took care of me made sure I had medication for maintenance and breakthrough pain for three months. That is the amount of time it took to re-habilitate after having an XLIF procedure.

My surgeon was in touch with them and they adjusted my medication as needed.

I just wanted to take a moment to say in all fairness, you do your part, and they do theirs. You have to be honest and you have to take your medication as prescribed. I will say this, when I was in more pain than I realized, they adjusted, as I stated above. And when I got better, I came off that medicine.

But while I was there, they treated me with respect and dignity, and I never had one problem with anyone working there. This doctor and her staff helped me an and did an amazing job.

That was in 2018. I'm not sure how things work now since the law has changed so much. But having not taken a pain pill since 2018, I can say while I was there, they made my life so much better. People and chronic pain deserve their pain medication when they are hurting.

Not everyone is looking for a daily high. But sadly, I hear these days US-wide, the good must suffer with the bad. And that the DEA have changed the laws and not in favor of chronic pain patients.

Despite it all, These people were an absolute saving grace for me. Thank you.|Bad experience today with a Rude Nurse. I had to withdraw myself as a patient. You can't miss her, I guest she thinks she's MTG. Totally uncalled for. Your money will spend at other Pain Clinics.

Center for Pain in Mobile specializes in comprehensive chronic pain management through multidisciplinary treatment approaches. Located at 855 Downtowner Blvd in Mobile, Alabama, the clinic addresses pain resulting from injuries and diseases. Their medical team focuses on more than just medication management, recognizing that chronic pain creates unique physical and emotional challenges for patients.

The clinic's treatment philosophy centers on functional restoration and quality of life improvement. Patients receive individualized care plans designed to reduce pain levels while encouraging healthy self-care practices. The medical specialists work to help patients resume normal daily activities and reduce medication dependence when appropriate.

Center for Pain offers controlled, evidence-based interventions tailored to each patient's specific condition. Their pain management protocols incorporate multiple therapeutic modalities to address complex pain syndromes. The clinic emphasizes cost-effective treatment options while maintaining high standards of care.

Services include interventional pain procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative approaches. The clinic treats conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Their medical team has extensive experience in diagnosing and treating challenging pain conditions.

Patients seeking pain relief in Mobile and surrounding areas can contact Center for Pain at (334) 288-7808. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on their website: https://www.center4pain.com/
column11:
Chronic pain creates a unique combination of physical and emotional hardships. Sometimes it takes more than just a medicine to alleviate suffering. The Center for Pain offers a controlled, multidisciplinary approach to treating pain that results from injury or disease. Our focus is on restoring function and improving quality of life.

Our goals for patient care: Reduce pain levels and encourage healthy self-care. Restore participation in usual life activities, and Reduce reliance on medications. Provide the best, most cost effective treatment.

United Spine & Pain PLLC is a premier pain management clinic located in Foley, Alabama. Specializing in comprehensive spine and pain treatments, the clinic offers cutting-edge interventional procedures and personalized care plans for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions.

The medical team at United Spine & Pain focuses on diagnosing and treating various pain disorders including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Their approach combines advanced diagnostic techniques with evidence-based treatment protocols to address the root cause of pain rather than just managing symptoms.

The clinic's state-of-the-art facility at 222 S Alston St in Foley features modern medical equipment for precise diagnosis and effective treatment delivery. Patients benefit from a range of services including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management.

The physicians at United Spine & Pain bring extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology, with specialized fellowship experience in interventional pain management techniques. Their expertise covers both common and complex pain conditions, offering hope to patients who have not found relief through conventional treatments.

What sets United Spine & Pain apart is their commitment to compassionate care in a welcoming atmosphere. The clinical team takes time to understand each patient's unique pain experience, developing customized treatment plans that address individual needs and goals. New patients receive thorough evaluations to ensure accurate diagnosis before treatment begins.

The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to navigate coverage options. Their dedicated staff handles insurance verification and authorization processes to minimize patient stress.

For those seeking relief from chronic pain, United Spine & Pain PLLC offers same-week appointments. Contact their office at +1 850-633-4877 or visit www.unitedspinepain.com to schedule a consultation and experience the difference that specialized pain management can make in restoring quality of life.

Eastern Interventional Pain is a specialized pain management clinic located at 4735 Norrell Dr Suite 105, Trussville, AL 35173. Serving the greater Birmingham area, this comprehensive pain center offers advanced interventional treatments for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

The clinic provides targeted therapies for back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and neuropathic conditions. Patients receive personalized treatment plans combining minimally invasive procedures with comprehensive pain management strategies. Eastern Interventional Pain specializes in epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation.

Expert Medical Team

The medical staff includes board-certified pain specialists with extensive training in interventional techniques. Physicians at Eastern Interventional Pain completed fellowships at prestigious medical institutions and maintain active memberships in pain management associations. The clinical team stays current with the latest evidence-based approaches to pain relief.

Patient-Centered Approach

New patients receive thorough evaluations to identify pain sources accurately. The clinic emphasizes conservative treatments before considering more invasive options. Eastern Interventional Pain coordinates care with primary physicians and specialists for comprehensive management of complex conditions.

Convenient Access

Located in Trussville, the clinic serves patients throughout Jefferson County and surrounding areas. The facility features modern equipment in a comfortable setting. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 205-661-3627 during regular business hours.

David P. Herrick, M.D. is a premier pain management clinic in Montgomery, Alabama, dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in the Parker Pavillion Building at 2105 E South Blvd #401, the practice offers specialized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Herrick brings extensive medical training and years of clinical experience to his pain management practice. Board-certified in pain medicine, he utilizes evidence-based approaches to address various pain disorders. The clinic specializes in treating conditions including lower back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Patients benefit from a range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options. These include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. The clinic emphasizes minimally invasive techniques whenever possible.

Dr. Herrick's approach focuses on improving quality of life and functionality. Treatment plans often combine medical interventions with physical therapy recommendations. The clinic staff prioritizes patient education about pain mechanisms and self-management strategies.

The practice serves patients throughout Montgomery and surrounding communities. New patients can expect thorough evaluations and detailed discussions about treatment options. Most major insurance plans are accepted at the clinic.

column49: Advanced Medical Clinics is a medical clinic in South Huntsville. We have a non-surgical orthopedics trained medical doctor as a pain management physician. We have two chiropractors, an Exercise Physiologist - Kinesiologist and a Counselor for those that need counseling. We practice in an integrated collaborative manner. We are the Anti Pain Clinic as we use no steroids and no pain meds. We do use non-surgical regenerative therapy along with nutraceuticals and homeopathic remedies.  Our success rate is through the roof because we get to the root cause of your pain or problem and treat that cause instead of just your symptoms. Results do vary patient to patient.

column3:
Alabama Neurology, located at 1022 1st St N #305, Alabaster, AL 35007, is a premier pain management clinic serving patients throughout central Alabama. The practice specializes in comprehensive neurological care with a focus on treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches.

The clinic offers advanced diagnostic testing and personalized treatment plans for various pain conditions. Patients receive care for migraines, neuropathic pain, back pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Alabama Neurology physicians utilize both medication management and interventional procedures when appropriate. The team emphasizes minimally invasive techniques to reduce recovery time.

Expert Medical Team

The medical staff includes board-certified neurologists with specialized training in pain management. Physicians have completed rigorous fellowship programs at leading medical institutions. The clinical team stays current with the latest pain management research and techniques. Each doctor brings years of experience treating complex neurological pain disorders.

Comprehensive Patient Care

Alabama Neurology provides same-week appointments for acute pain concerns. The clinic coordinates care with primary physicians and other specialists. Patients receive thorough education about their specific condition and treatment options. The practice offers ongoing pain management support through regular follow-up visits.

Location and Contact Information

The Alabaster office is conveniently located near major highways. Patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 205-621-4799. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and Medicare. The facility features modern equipment for accurate neurological assessments.

Treatment Approach

Alabama Neurology takes a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Treatment plans may include medication, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications. The practice focuses on improving quality of life and functional ability. Physicians work closely with patients to establish realistic pain management goals.

Hannahan Comprehensive Pain Care provides specialized interventional pain management services in Enterprise and Dothan, Alabama. Dr. Hannahan focuses on evidence-based treatments for chronic pain conditions. The clinic offers comprehensive solutions for patients seeking relief from persistent pain issues.

Dr. Hannahan is a board-certified interventional pain physician with extensive training in pain management techniques. His approach centers on minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source. Patients benefit from his expertise in diagnosing complex pain conditions and developing personalized treatment plans.

The clinic specializes in various interventional procedures including epidural injections, nerve blocks, and radiofrequency ablation. These treatments help patients with back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic conditions. Dr. Hannahan emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction for better quality of life.

Patients at Hannahan Comprehensive Pain Care receive individualized attention with thorough evaluations. The clinic's goal is helping patients return to active lifestyles through effective pain management. Treatment plans often combine interventional procedures with complementary approaches for optimal results.

Alabama Pain Physicians offers comprehensive pain management services in Prattville, Alabama. Led by Dr. Aaron Shinkle, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and medication management. We provide individualized treatment plans for patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Dr. Shinkle completed his medical training at the University of Alabama School of Medicine, followed by residency in anesthesiology and fellowship training in interventional pain management. With over 15 years of clinical experience, he brings specialized expertise in spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and regenerative medicine techniques.

Our clinic offers same-week appointments for new patients experiencing acute pain conditions. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to maximize coverage benefits.

Services include:

  • Joint injections
  • Nerve blocks
  • Spinal cord stimulation
  • Radiofrequency ablation
  • Medication management
  • Physical therapy coordination

Located at 660 McQueen Smith Rd N, Suite E, Prattville, AL 36066, our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. Contact us at (334) 288-2808 to schedule a consultation or discuss treatment options.

The rest of the visit was excellent as well,and I have an epidural scheduled shortly.|Very professional, friendly and really not much wait time. I wish I had known about them instead of going to the surgi-centers. More cost effective also. I would like to discuss that fifth star with a member of your staff as not to take away from the four stars given because you ALL deserved them!!! Please contact me regarding my one only issue for improvement to get that fifth star. Thanks to all for a great experience.|95% satisfaction with the visit; however, there is always room for improvement! Strongly suggest that you make an exception to your rule of "Only patient allowed in room" to allow spouses to enter with the patient! Some patients are reluctant to share openly with the doctor or the PA about important information dealing with their health. Their spouse could help in this regard and possibly make a difference in the doctor's and/or PA's evaluation or corrective actions! Just a strong recommendation.|Been seeing this group since 2020. Love going here! Nice doctors and the nurses are awesome also! Don't ever want to go anywhere else!!!|The front staff are friendly and helpful. Dr. Kevin Hites is knowledgeable and answered all my questions. I have been going to this group for almost 3 years and I highly recommend them for their professionalism and helping me deal with my pain with different methods.|Dr Rachael is always a help to me. I go in feel low and so how she makes me have some kind of understanding. We had a new break through that I would have never imagined. column40:
I have been a patient for over a year and been very happy with the treatments from Dr. Olamikan & Ivy. After my injections I have relief for months and can actually be active again. Advanced Pain Center is the dream team for pain management. Came back to add also, Ivy is a great PA. He also has an amazing team. P A Ivy is Fabulous, beautiful and just like Dr. O, she is really good at what she does.
Ms. Vicky is the mother of the crew that runs the office. Renk leads a specialized team dedicated to comprehensive pain relief solutions. column38: O'Connor|travis Williams|Crystal Korevec|Meghan Germain|Collin Astor|Hannah D.|akpolarbeardad BOB Hickey|Ciana Fegler
column40:
I've been going to Alpenglow for over a year for migraines. I recently saw Dr. Renk and honestly you really could not tell you were getting poked with a needle. So light handed. Extremely thankful for Dr Renk and all the staff at Alpenglow. Everyone's friendly and very helpful.|Excellent staff. Doctor and nurse were SUPER organized. Dr. Renk was extremely knowledgeable and had many options for me. I really appreciate the summary of our visit afterward. I've never received that from a doctor's office before. I also really appreciate the office going out of their way to get me an initial appointment last minutes since I just moved from Fairbanks and am overdue for Botox for migraines. I'm very grateful I found this clinic and look forward to continuing my care there.|After suffering from chronic pain and illness for over 10 years, I had almost given up hope of finding answers or relief. I spent thousands of dollars on various specialists, often waiting up to a year for appointments, only to be turned away without a clear diagnosis or helpful solutions. That all changed when I was referred to Alpenglow Pain and Wellness.

From my very first visit, I felt a sense of relief. The team at Alpenglow was compassionate, understanding, and truly dedicated to helping me find answers. Dr. Calor took the time to listen to my history and concerns, which made a world of difference. They conducted a thorough evaluation and were able to provide a clear diagnosis and a tailored treatment plan that finally addressed my pain.

The support I received was remarkable, and I felt like I was truly being cared for as a whole person, not just a set of symptoms. Thanks to their expertise and personalized approach, I am beginning to see improvements in my condition and reclaim my life.

I wholeheartedly recommend Alpenglow Pain and Wellness to anyone who has struggled with chronic pain and is looking for compassionate, effective care. Thank you for giving me hope and a path to healing!|Absolutely worst experience I have ever had in my life in a medical setting. I came in with excruciating pains after driving three hours just to make it to my appointment. Dr. Mary Beth saw me for maybe 10 minutes. Came in with a diagnosis packet already in hand and filled out her assessment sheet without even watching as she told me to show her different poses. When preforming "assessments" she half assed and even skipped actually doing what she said she was assessing. Then proceeded for the remainder of her time with me, to try to sell me a huge packet of a bunch of different prescriptions I should buy from them. Without once stopping to ask if I was okay (as I am shooting with pain and visibly crying and uncomfortable) or how bad my chronic pain is and is effecting my day to day life. When I asked about immediate pain management for day to day life, she said there was nothing she could do for me except prescribe a medication that would take months to build up before alleviating any pains. How can you call yourself a pain and wellness clinic?? This is honestly disgusting to have to put up with simply to get the resources necessary so I can go to someone more capable and compassionate to the patients lives and well-being they are caring for. I HIGHLY recommend NOT going to this clinic. It is very unfortunate that there are very few resources available for chronic pain and the ones we do have are money hungry businesses that don't give a crap about people's actual lives.|The first thing I want to address is their punctuality which Priscilla and the wonderful lady to her left helped me (apologies I was rude and didn't ask your name). My appointment was set for 12:15 and they saw me at 12:25  and in medical terms 10 minutes is nothing. Cynthia Dunleavy and Dua made my appointment feel very indivualized. I'm not a cog in a wheel. They listened, explained and were honest. They didn't catastrophize. Plus their office is clean and tidy and the music in the front office was great! Thank you alpenglow. I'll leave another review after my treatment|The office is super clean and the front desk workers were professional and very nice! I had Dr.Renk and she was super thorough with her evaluation/examination. Afterwords she was super informative and provided me with a good amount of written information to take home.  I appreciated all the effort the staff and clinicians put into my case!|I had been going to Alaska Pain and Wellness for years and never had any issues, They recently closed their doors for retirement.  I just stared a new Journey with Alpenglow Pain to Wellness.. I'm so impressed by the verity of modalities offered for treatments and their in the know about VA protocols...
Alpenglow is very professional from the Receptionist, Nurses and Dr. Calor...
Thank You ! Time to Heal ...
I'm going to miss Dr. Calor .. have a safe journey and enjoy your retirement.
<<PolarBearHugs>>|I'm so thankful to Dr. Calor! She was able to diagnosis me the same day instead of waiting weeks to hear back. I'm so appreciative of the non nonsense of getting straight to the point and not wasting time. I'm so thankful to Dr. Calor for confirming my suspicions and connecting so many dots! Being able to have referrals go out the same day and not having saying any time was so refreshing!

column2: Algone Premier Pain Specialists of Alaska - Wasilla

Algone Premier Pain Specialists is Wasilla's comprehensive interventional chronic pain clinic specializing in customized treatment plans for patients seeking lasting relief. Located at 3190 E Meridian Park Loop #207, the clinic focuses on diagnosing and treating various chronic pain conditions through cutting-edge therapies and minimally invasive procedures.

The clinic's experienced pain management physicians conduct thorough evaluations to identify suitable candidates for interventional treatments. These may include minimally invasive spinal surgeries, targeted joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and other advanced pain management techniques. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs of individual patients.

Algone Premier embraces a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining medical interventions with complementary therapies. The team creates an honest, safe, and respectful environment where patients feel supported throughout their pain management journey. This comprehensive strategy helps patients reduce reliance on pain medications while improving overall function and quality of life.

The clinic specializes in treating conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Patients benefit from the clinic's focus on both immediate pain relief and long-term pain management strategies.

Algone Premier is committed to teaching patients the power of change through their innovative treatment approaches. The clinic serves the Wasilla community and surrounding Alaska regions with a dedication to promoting health and wellness.

For consultations or appointments, contact Algone Premier Pain Specialists at +1 907-373-9460 or visit their website at https://algonepremier.com/ to learn more about their services and treatment options.
