column40:
They used to care about you, but now they have stopped caring about treating your pain to setting limits on your medications. They are decreasing the amount of pain medication they allow patients. So on medication dose treats all! Whether your pain increases as they cut back on your medication THEY DON'T CARE!!
So if you have minor pain go to them, but if you have major chronic pain go somewhere else!!!! If you could rate them in negative numbers I'd give them a minus 5.|Drove all the way from Anchorage to be seen only to be refused because I did not show 30 minutes before my appointment. I think it's just asinine to make an appointment at a certain time but reality you need to be there 30 minutes sooner too much room for confusion. And then to be turned away after an hour drive is infuriating will not be going back. Will be finding a new Dr, somebody that is a little more realistic and understands our time is just as important as theirs.|Vince Perino at Algone has changed my life over the past year. He listened and continues to listen to my concerns. He monitors my medication to make sure dependency doesn't become an issue. Having some pain relief has allowed me to lose 100 pounds, start my 2nd career and play outside with my 7 y/o daughter. I would highly recommend Algone(especially Vince) if your in pain and need assistance getting back to the point where you can live life again!|Algone used to be an amazing practice, however, since Drs. Grissom & Peterson left the practice, Algone has gone downhill!!! I wouldn't recommend Algone to anyone!!!|Dr. Grissom was the best! Had been with him for almost 20 years. Then comes the new owners. They are paranoid about pain med abuse, in which I don't deny happens. However, for people like me that need pain management without abusing this is not the place to go. I had a wrong pain med count and had to sign papers on it, which flagged me. The situation was resolved in my favor. However, I was put on a patch that is for abusers. Which did not even help with the pain. I loved and miss Luda. With the owners being MD's they  are over her decisions. So she could not help me with the situation that I had been put in.|I have never experienced the extremely inflated level of customer service & patient care in my life like I have from this office. Talk about way above and far beyond any reasonable expectations! Tammy went way beyond any thing I could reasonably expect someone to do to get me the answers that I needed. Nicole worked double time to move mountains & took action to solve my issue. I can definitely say without a doubt that if you have the unfortunate need for a pain management team you will be very fortunate if you are a patient here!|I have been going to Algone for several years now and my experience with everyone in the office and my doctor has always been great. It's probably the first doctors office that I've never felt judged in or been treated like a number. At Algone they treat me like a human and the only time I'm not referred to by name is when there is new staff.
I truly couldn't be happier.|I appreciated the opportunity to have assistance from algone. The Dr assigned to me was incredibly knowledgeable about my condition and my journey. The medical assistant that roomed me was simply rude. The Dr gets a 5 star for attention to detail and unfortunately the support staff appear to have little patience and/or ability to deal with those with complex medical conditions. They get a negative rating. When I called to decline further assistance the gentleman continued the lack of care. He simply asked if I was breaking contact!? I told him that I had one visit and a failed med trial. My only option left is an implanted nerve stimulator and that I was not ready to go that route. He simply stopped talking and hung up. Rude and disrespectful at best. I simply ended the dr patient relationship and never breached my contract. Absolutely disgusting.
I've worked in healthcare 25 plus years full time and would never show such disrespectful attitude to patients. I would not recommend using this facility. Unless you want to be treated poorly.

 I want  Dr.colar to know that what she is doing/did for me Is going to save my life and mental health beyond words!  #NOTALLANGELSHAVEWINGS 

THANK YOU TEAM APENGLOW! Y'all do BEAUTIFUL THINGS for the people! You are loved and appreciated for it.|I am absolutely shocked!!!!!
Best doctors appointment of my life !!!!!!! I walked in nervously with my diagnosis and a bunch of scans &  I left with  referrals to specialists that specialize in treating Ehlers  Danlose  patients, Cutting edge new medication prescription & a band I could wear to help my hips, special Vitamins for better absorption, and overall health & the confidence that All of my health struggles would be cared for in the best way.

I moved here from upstate New York.
Who would ever have thought the best care I could ever find  would be in Alaska!
I highly highly highly highly highly recommend Dr. Calor|I am incredibly grateful for the kindness,  compassion,  and support given me by the Alpenglow staff. column40:
Amazing, the front desk staff were kind and pleasant. The nurse was funny and really listened to make sure he understood how I was feeling and what I needed help with. Dr.Gay was professional but explained everything in simple plain terms so I didn't feel overwhelmed or confused. I was able to get treatment on my first visit and my pain went away and stayed gone almost immediately. If you want someone who will listen to you and give you the best treatment possible you couldn't find a better place.|Dr Gay is awesome!!  He has helped me with my back and nerve pain for the past couple years.  He is easy to talk to, he explains options, making sure I understand, and he cares about relieving my pain.  His staff is very friendly and helpful.  I would recommend Dr Gay to anyone experiencing back and nerve pain.|DR treated My husband like he just wanted drugs.  HE implied that we were selling the tramadol. We have been gone from them for almost two years now we get a bill for over 100 dollars. The Doctor has so many patience's that he really don't have quality time since he's lining his pockets with different t services he can have you purchase. Not a good fit for us.|Dr. Gay and his staff are the utmost professionals in all they do.  Dr. Gay isn't the kind of doctor that will just willy-nilly  "give you a shot" and send you on your way--or settle on a series of shots.  Dr. Gay assesses your entire situation and determines, together with you, the patient, the best course of action--each time you visit--to augment your primary care provider/surgeon's treatment plan.  Professional, down-to-Earth, friendly, accommodating environment providing you with top-quality care--can't ask for more than that.|I live in Fairbanks and was not a current patient of Dr. Gay's when he agreed to see me this past January. I have a herniated disk at the L5/S1 region that elevated into severe sciatica. After seeing various pain, neurological, and orthopedic doctors in Fairbanks, and all agreeing I needed an epidural steroid injection (ESI), not one would flex their schedule or work me in for the procedure for 1 to 3 weeks later.
After being in the worst pain of my life for 3 weeks straight already, I knew I could not wait this long. I ended up in the ER when someone my husband knew recommended calling Dr.Gay's office as they had recently seen him for a similar issue. He agreed to see me the next day (which was his day off) to do the ESI procedure. He took the time to explain everything to me and never once did I feel rushed. After the procedure was complete I immediately felt relief, which continued to improve over the subsequent week.
I wish more doctors shared his compassion and humble nature.  Dr. Gay's staff went over and above to accommodate my emergent need, and I cannot thank the whole team enough.|I contacted Dr. Gay's office because I was in a great deal of discomfort. Abigail was so accommodating and was able work work me into their Wasilla office in a couple of days. When I met with Dr. Gay and he did the examination he was able to determine what the issue was and we decided to go with a cortisone injection. He actually follows up with you and when he did, I explained about 60% improvement. He then said we could follow up with a second injection. Because I was leaving for the winter they made sure to fit me in before I left. Again, he followed up and I was pleased to tell him the 2nd injection did the trick!
His entire staff is beyond amazing and caring! Thank you Dr.Gay, Abigail, Latasha and Eli!|Dr. Gay is kind and compassionate and he listens. I am on my 4th apt with him and have always been impressed with his bedside nature and his plans for action. Thank you for trying to help me be pain free, it means the world to my poor back!|1/10/2018   Just want to say Thank you to Dr. Gay and his assistant
for making me feel so comfortable during my procedure yesterday.  Dr.Gay answers all my questions as does his awesome assistant.  I have been receiving treatment from Dr. Gay for well over a year and the services provided have always been excellent. Again Thank you

Of note, I have phenomenal mental health coverage and I have not found another provider in the state who does not take my insurance for counseling. Also, refused to admit any error on their part.|Unprofessional, heartless - was messaged regarding pain management by my doctor. I had previously indicated that this could be an issue since I worked with them previously - I made mention of this on the phone call where they were able to get me on the schedule - I get into the office and fill out their paperwork after a month and a half dealing with pain at this level only to be told that I'm not going to be seen today due to said previous relationship.

This could have been addressed before I made it into the office - this could have been addressed before I had weeks of pain. This could have been addressed so that I could get to an office that will actually do their job. Instead they have wasted my time, wasted my energy, and being told that I will not be seen even though I've been on their books was a low blow.

As a chiropractor who would refer to clinics for patients in need - should I ever get to a point where I'm able to practice again without being in such pain that it impacts my work, I will never refer or recommend anyone to AA Spine and Pain clinic.|I am a previous patient who has returned to AA Pain and Wellness after my original provider retired. Despite initial concerns, I have found a new medical home with Dr. Lonsor. He is thorough and transparent in his care approach, always ensuring the best treatment within established guidelines. His team also exemplifies his commitment, even during busy periods.
My most recent procedure was highly successful, allowing me to engage in moderate activities without experiencing pain.|I recently had an outstanding experience at AA Spine and Pain Clinic, and I want to share my positive feedback. When I made my appointment over the phone with Alysa, I was impressed by her dedication. She went above and beyond, searching for cancellations and promptly calling me back the same afternoon with an earlier slot. While I understand that not everyone may be able to get scheduled as quickly, I'm immensely grateful for her exceptional efforts to accommodate my needs.  I was seen much sooner than the initially scheduled two-week wait.

Candace was efficient in gathering all the necessary details, ensuring a smooth transfer of knowledge when the doctor arrived. Katie, the practice manager, deserves recognition. Katie's kind bedside manner instilled confidence they could alleviate my pain.  Her proactive approach was evident when she worked directly with the VA to expedite my procedure.

Overall, I am stunned Anchorage has this level of service, and seamless coordination among the staff. Thank you to specifically these three for making my experience so positive. Highly recommended!|The experience with the service provided was less than satisfactory. Despite encountering numerous challenges during the process of scheduling an appointment, including a lack of communication regarding the enrollment link for the patient portal, I took the initiative to independently seek out the necessary information online. The subsequent visit for the appointment was further marred by a sense of frustration displayed by the front desk clerk, which left me feeling disappointed in the level of patient service and guidance that was extended. A gentlemen (patient) also was there after he saw what I was saying also expressed to me that he was also having issues.|Scheduling my surgeries with Michelle was a breeze. She always makes me feel so comfortable, she called me two days before my surgery to let me know my post op prescription was ready and to let me know I am in good hands with the doctors. She made the entire process so easy. I think the staff at AA Spine Clinic is great but Michelle and Dr. Gama are a dynamic duo!! Keep up the amazing service that you provide to your patients each and everyday!!|AA Spine & Pain Clinic is the best place to go if you have pain issues. Dr. Johnston is amazing! The team always provides the best care and makes sure I am heard. Dr. Lonser is also great, and today the medical tech, Candace was THE BEST! She was so kind and listened and made the experience less stressful for me (back injection). Also, I didn't catch her name - maybe Alyssa? - whoever was at the front desk today is the sunniest person ever. When I called back later with a question, she was so pleasant and helpful. What great employees you have with these two support ladies! TOP NOTCH!|The staff here is the BEST I've EVER had the pleasure of being a patient with.  Dr. Lonzer is super great! My whole care team is fantastic. This is especially true of Alyise , Miracle and Candice.  They are so compassionate and helpful in answering any questions I have. I just can't say enough good about them all!!! The front desk ladies are so friendly and welcoming every time I walk in the door. I highly recommend AA Spine & Pain Clinic for any one with physical  or mental illness  conditions.

column3:
Urban Pain Institute

Urban Pain Institute is Wasilla, Alaska's premier Interventional Pain Management clinic specializing in comprehensive chronic pain treatment. Located at 2490 S Woodworth Loop, Suite 100 in Palmer, our dedicated team focuses on diagnosing and treating various pain conditions without surgical intervention.

Our pain specialists employ minimally invasive procedures and modern techniques to address chronic pain at its source. The clinic's approach combines advanced diagnostic methods with targeted interventional treatments for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and pain resulting from injuries or illnesses.

At Urban Pain Institute, patients receive personalized care plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function. Our providers bring extensive experience in pain medicine, utilizing evidence-based treatments such as nerve blocks, spinal injections, radiofrequency ablation, and other cutting-edge interventional techniques.

The clinic's philosophy centers on finding effective alternatives to surgery and reducing reliance on pain medications. Each treatment plan addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies for sustainable results.

New patients can expect thorough evaluations to identify pain sources before developing customized treatment approaches. The clinic serves residents throughout the Matanuska-Susitna Valley region with compassionate, patient-centered care.

For consultations or appointments, contact Urban Pain Institute at (907) 277-7247 or visit urbanpain.org to learn more about available services and treatment options.
column11:
We are an Interventional Pain Management clinic located in Anchorage, AK specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of chronic pain conditions. Our providers are passionate about helping those who suffer from debilitating pain.

Using a comprehensive, modern approach to pain management, providers in our clinic use non-surgical techniques and perform cutting-edge, minimally invasive procedures to provide pain relief without surgery. If you experience back or neck pain, or have pain from illness or injury, call the Urban Pain Institute for a consultation. We will work together to help you find relief from your pain.
column38: Bea|Joseph Brush|Dave and Evalyn Salzer|Shannon C. Watson|j s|Katie Crouse|Kendra L|Herb Everett
column40:
Horrifically bad. Every ortho/neuro evaluation by the doctor was rushed and not completed correctly, and the injection was the WORST pain I have ever experienced in my life, and did absolutely nothing to help my chronic pain. I was offered zero sedation for the procedure-- it was only once they'd already done it that they asked why I didn't opt for sedation. Because you didn't offer it!!!

Once I got to my car, they called and were scolding me for "walking out," even though the tech had said I was good to go. I was treated like a non-compliant patient the rest of the time I waited. My appointment was also at noon, and they didn't pull me back to start the injection until 1:30. Every experience I have had here was terrible and I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. I have ZERO idea how they have good reviews.  This doctor does not care one bit about his patients and treats everyone like an inconvenience.|I have been suffering with back pain for over 25 years. I've been here and there and everywhere with no help Dr. urban is the first one that alleviated my pain without a major operation. I highly highly recommend him. He also gave me several options for in the future For any reoccurrence. I can't endorse him enough.|My back pain is gone Thank you Dr Urban and team. My pain went from breath taking, I couldn't cough, laugh or sneeze without severe pain. I could barely walk when it was at its worse. Thank you, thank you, thank you
Dave Salzer|Rating:  (5/5)
I recently had the privilege of receiving treatment from Dr. Urban at Urban Pain Institute, and I am compelled to share my remarkable experience. From the moment I walked through the door, I knew I was in the right hands.
The customer service at Urban Pain Institute is unparalleled. The staff were not only professional and courteous but also incredibly accommodating. They went above and beyond to ensure that I felt comfortable and well-informed throughout my entire journey. One thing that truly stood out was the promptness of their responses. In today's fast-paced world, it's refreshing to find a medical team that values your time. Every question I had was answered promptly, either in person or via phone and text, which made me feel like a valued patient. Dr. Urban demonstrated a level of compassion that I very much appreciate. His empathy and understanding of my concerns made a world of difference. He took the time to thoroughly explain my condition, the recommended procedure, and all available treatment options. This compassionate approach eased my anxieties and built trust from the start. The medical procedure itself was nothing short of remarkable. Dr. Urban and his team were not only highly skilled but also exceptionally attentive. They made sure I was comfortable every step of the way, which was incredibly reassuring. I felt like my well-being was their top priority. Now, the results have exceeded my wildest expectations. I honestly didn't think it was possible to feel this good again. Dr. Urban's expertise and precision in his work are truly admirable. My quality of life has improved significantly, and I am grateful beyond words. In conclusion, I cannot recommend Dr. Urban, Adam and Tiffany along with the entire team at Urban Pain Institute enough. Their outstanding customer service, prompt responses, compassionate care, and remarkable results make them the top choice for anyone seeking spine treatment. If you're looking for a spine specialist, your search ends here. Thank you.|I've had 5 back surgeries throughout the years due to work injury. I've been to a few different pain doctors throughout the years that in my opinion tended to settle with the fact that there's not much more that can be done but use pain pills to deal with my pain.

I've been seeing Dr. Urban and his staff for several years now and actually have found relief from the pain because of what Dr. Urban has been able to do for me and continues to do.

I've always felt comfortable with seeing Dr. Urban, not only because i think he does great work but also because of the professional staff he has on hand. They've always been respectful and helpful.

You won't be sorry unless you don't go see Dr. Urban.|My chronic pain was taken seriously. I was heard by Doctor Urban. The nursing staff is incredibly kind and checked in on me the day after both procedures. I had an initial appointment followed by two procedures all within 8 days. I am beyond ecstatic and truly shocked at how quickly they got me in and treated my pain. I have never been treated so quickly or so kindly.  Doctor Urban also had phenomenal bedside manner. He made me laugh many times but also repeatedly made sure I was ok during the procedures. I think that he truly is an exceptional doctor. After years of pain I have hope of being able to live a pain free life. I couldn't be happier with every part of their services and how exceptionally kind they are. I am so grateful for this experience.|Highly recommended Urban Pain Institute. Dr. Urban, Adam, and the entire staff at Urban Pain Institute go above and beyond to assist the patient. Dr. Urban listens to patient concerns and addresses them. Adam exceeds expectations regarding customer assistance. Demonstrating the upmost professionalism, he guides patients through the absolutely confusing insurance company guidelines addressing patient concerns along the way. The young lady that works the front desk is always a pleasure. The young lady that preps patients for surgery is kind. She demonstrates concern regarding the patients comfortability and after procedure care. As stated above, the entire staff are excellent. Thank you!|Been seen by Dr Urban and team for years. Highly recommended. Ask for a referral from your physician.

column3:
Neuroversion is Anchorage's premier pain management clinic specializing in comprehensive treatment solutions for chronic pain conditions. Located at 2925 DeBarr Rd STE 240 in Anchorage, Alaska, our facility combines advanced interventional procedures with personalized care plans.

Our team of board-certified pain specialists brings decades of clinical experience to each patient consultation. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify pain sources accurately. Treatment options include minimally invasive spine procedures, nerve blocks, and regenerative medicine techniques.

Neuroversion physicians complete extensive fellowship training in pain management interventions. Our integrated approach addresses both symptoms and underlying causes. Many patients experience significant relief after their first treatment session.

We specialize in treating complex conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain
  • Failed back surgery syndrome
  • Neuropathic pain disorders
  • Joint and musculoskeletal conditions
  • Cancer-related pain management
  • Headache and facial pain syndromes

Our commitment centers on providing compassionate, logical care with dignity. Every treatment plan reflects our patient-centric philosophy and innovative approach. We coordinate with primary care providers to ensure continuity of care.

Most insurance plans accepted, including Medicare and Medicaid options. New patients typically receive appointments within two weeks. Our facility offers accessible parking and comfortable treatment rooms.

Contact Neuroversion at (907) 339-4650 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about our services is available at www.neuroversion.com.
column11: At Neuroversion, we are committed to providing compassionate, logical, and high quality care in a patient-centric, innovative and socially responsible way with dignity and integrity. We strive to bring relief and hope to every patient, every time, through an integrated team practice.
column36: Closed|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|Closed
column38: Krystina Witaschek|Jabbles Owen|Debi Erickson|Robbin Bolding|Hannah Connaker|Gail Evans|Barbie Williams|Mary Johnson
column40:
I cannot say enough great things about Dr. Liu and his whole team! They have helped me twice now with nerve pain (after two different surgeries) and I really appreciate that Dr. Liu and his team care about each of the patients that come through his office. Thank you Neuroversion team!|Dr. Liu is ahead ah mazing. He checked on my Mom every evening during her hospital! Again, a great surgeon and caring doctor!|My first visit started at the front desk & they welcomed me with open arms & made it much easier to open up to my new Doctor.|I see this review process only as a way for whomever is responding to get the last word and besmirch any naysayers. The fact of the matter is, if you don't fit the mold they're looking for it's not going to work. I have each visit I've been to recorded, this particular Dr absolutely looked me straight in the face and lied. The two visits were so desperately different I thought I'd lost my mind. I, family (mom's a doc), and other medical providers have listened to the recordings, all assured me I was professionally gaslighted. If it was a movie he would get 100% rotten tomatoes, sadly it's my life. I was criticized for crying, obviously I was confused and had been sitting in a wooden chair for 2 hrs in severe pain waiting for all this fun to start. The nurse took me to the room explaining she'd get my urine as I was leaving. We had passed the bathroom
and she was kind enough to notice the intense pain I was in so "we'll just do it on your way out". The first thing he asks when he walks in "why did you refuse to UA"?  I immediately became defensive, how rude. This is when the visit just turned into absolute "story time" claiming what he was saying was all in my chart. Well bravo!!!  I can put anything I want into a chart too. The odd thing it just doesn't match the recording. I have a very serious, extremely painful condition that can be somewhat controlled with a regimen of meds, only one a narcotic. The funniest part of all, I was asking for a pain pump which often removes the need for any other narcotic. So if I'm drug seeking yet begging for a pain pump....makes no sense. He stated I was unreliable, irresponsible and that he only does pain pumps for those he will go above and beyond for and I'm not one of the chosen. I have drug use in my past, no problem admitting this. He told me a few years ago to get clean and we could talk. I did as he asked but was told my clean time wasn't impressive, just a snap's worth of time. Any recovering addicts out there know 24 hrs is humongous but I was headed toward 3 yrs. Can't do any better than that. The answers to the bad reviews flip the story back onto the patient, psychosocial bull, socioeconomics causing our "outbursts". We need therapy or to find something better to do with our time. Well I'm doing exactly what my therapist told me to do. I have a life, limited as it is, you do not occupy anymore of my time than it took to write this. You let a person barely able to stand, crying, visibly shaken to the point driving should have been discouraged walk right out your door with no more compassion you'd give a mosquito. Some of us have had every injection known to mankind, every procedure you can name yet our conditions persist well beyond tolerable for any human. This man even told me I have one of the most painful conditions a human can have. In the literature it is compared to stage 4 metastatic cancer. At first I thought you were just an odd duck, but you are truly cruel, judgemental, dishonest and thoroughly cold hearted.....unless you feel like going "above and beyond". There is truly something wrong with you. Respond if you just can't stand not to but it's not worth it. Every last word spoken at each visit was legally recorded and put out for people to hear. Shame on you.|I've been a patient of Dr. Ekstrom and Medical Assistant Isaac for almost a year now, and they have always been so compassionate and so positive every single interaction even not at my best.

We've had a great treatment plans and things intact to help my day to day be as good as they can be with the unfortunate genetics i have haha!

I can't thank them enough, his MA Isaac is always on it, always communicative and super effective at his job.
They're definitely a power duo
and my interactions with everyone else as well at Neuroversion after my injection and every visit has been nothing short than fantastic!!

Thank you all for all that you do and everything that you have to deal with.
:) Hannah|My husband and I love the provider's at Neuroversion!  They cared for my husband based on his individual health and pain needs!
They genuinely care about their patient's, and take their oath as a Physician to heart!
The only problem with being as good as they are! When you're in real bad pain and lack of sleep, you have to wait to get help!
I still wouldn't go anywhere else!|Everything about this office is wonderful. I don't have to wait very long for my appointment. And the staff is really sweet and very caring. Dr. Lui is the best. I went to 3 other Doctors before him and none of them were as good him. I'm so happy I was referred to him. I always see his P.A. and that would be Jamie Lytton. What can I say....the girl ROCKS!!!|DON'T EXPECT ANY PEOPLE PERSONS AT THE FRONT DESK.  You will not be greeted with a smile.  Excellent doctor'!!!!  Ms. Mitchell rocks.  Great medical staff.

column2: Interventional Pain Consultants: Lawrence A Kropp MD
column3:
Interventional Pain Consultants: Lawrence A. Kropp MD

Interventional Pain Consultants is an Anchorage-based specialty clinic providing targeted pain management solutions for Alaska residents. Dr. Lawrence A. Kropp leads the practice with extensive experience in interventional pain procedures for spinal conditions, cancer-related discomfort, and chronic pain syndromes. The clinic specializes in minimally invasive techniques that address pain at its source rather than masking symptoms.

Located at 2751 DeBarr Road, Suite 380 in Anchorage, the practice offers comprehensive pain evaluations and customized treatment plans. Dr. Kropp utilizes advanced interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Patients seeking alternatives to medication management will find evidence-based options for long-term pain relief.

The clinic explicitly does not maintain a chronic opiates program, instead focusing on interventional approaches that target pain pathways directly. This philosophy emphasizes functional improvement and quality of life enhancement through precise diagnostic and therapeutic techniques.

Common conditions treated include herniated discs, spinal stenosis, facet joint pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and cancer-related pain. The practice serves patients throughout Anchorage and surrounding Alaska communities with appointment scheduling available at (907) 258-5009.

For more information about services and treatment options, patients can visit the clinic website at http://larrykroppmd.com/ or contact the office directly.
column11: Our practice focuses on Interventional Pain procedures for Spinal, Cancer and chronic pain. We do not have a chronic opiates program.
column38: Jen Chacon|Jill Rubin|Esther Frantz|Brandon Phillips|Marcelle Riddle|Maria Dinkerbell|Levi Cross|Charlie Howard
column40: Dr.Kropp helped our son after a surgery. His staff was efficient and quick to get us in. Dr.Kropp was very personable with our youngest and professional. Acknowledged and walked us through what our son was experiencing. Highly recommend and very appreciative of his care. We value his expertise in this specialty.|Dr. Kropp and his entire office are absolutely top notch--I cannot recommend them enough! I absolutely love the personality of everyone who works there, and Dr. Kropp is so warm and welcoming! Quick backstory, I'm only 35 but was diagnosed in my mid-20s with mild scoliosis and early degenerative disc disease, so ive had quite a few back related issues over the last 10-15 years. I've seen Dr. Kropp three times: the first time, we discovered I had a ruptured disc and he was honest with me, explaining why injection likely wouldn't be useful for me at that point and referred me to my wonderful neurosurgeon; the second time, I needed injections into my neck because I'd been carrying tension for over a year due to overcompensating from my back surgery; and the most recent time, today, was due to a 1.5-year-long muscle knot that was also causing a bulging disc/narrowing nerve canal, so I was injected into both the disc and the muscle knot with the goal of fixing the issue at its source. All three times, Dr. Kropp has given me and my husband very thorough explanations of why he does what he does, what he thinks will work best, yet always ultimately leaves the decision up to me (no surprise, I always take his suggestions because they make complete sense after he explains them). I also really enjoy hearing Dr. Kropp's personal anecdotes with back pain/surgeries; he's very down-to-earth and easy to talk to, and knowing that he has personally experienced the pains I'm having makes me feel very heard and understood. The injection process is very thorough, clean, and as comfortable as it can possibly be--getting a needle stuck into your back isn't exactly a "fun" experience in the moment, but the process is so short and Dr. Kropp and his assistant are so kind and encouraging that it's absolutely worth the couple minutes of mild discomfort for the lasting relief it provides. My husband and I always leave the office talking about how wonderful everyone was. Like I told the doctor today, I don't see Dr. Kropp often, but man am I beyond grateful he's here when I do need him! Truly cannot recommend him enough!|Dr. Kropp is a UNICORN! Groundbreakingly good at his job AND legitimately filled with compassion for his patients. He has been treating my severe chronic pain successfully for 7 years. Without his help I would not have been able to keep working all these years. He treats me without risking addiction. Without causing lots of damage or scaring. And always without stressing me out. If you want a strong team member in your fight to STAY healthy and functional, you'll never find a better partner than Dr. Kropp. He really gets it!|I had neck surgery in March. C 5/6 fusion. I felt way better after the surgery, but had lingering pain in my neck. Dr. Kropp and his staff made sure that they listened to me and carefully explained the procedure. I walked into a clean and modern office, and was handed a tabled for the initial paperwork. It was super easy to use and took less than five minutes to complete. I was immediately taken back to the prep room and within minutes after that, I was on the procedure table. Dr. Kropp administered the sedation, and I barely felt a thing. They gave me a soda to help wake me up and I was out of the office about fifteen minutes later. Overall, in and out in about a half hour. My discharge instructions with my follow up appointment was already in my email with a quick and easy link to talk to Dr. Kropp again. The procedure was such a success, that we decided to do it on the other side of my neck. It can be a fluke for something to go so right, but the next time I went back, it was just as easy. If you are having pain that Dr. Kropp thinks he can treat, you owe it to yourself to try this.|I have been a patient of Dr. Kropp's for over 10 years and there isn't any doctor I trust more to treat my back pain.  He is extremely knowledgeable, compassionate, kind, and positive.  I've seen a lot of doctors and he has, by far, the best bedside manner of any specialist I've ever been to.  It is evident that he really cares and he won't recommend treatments unless he fully believes they will be beneficial.  His office is run efficiently and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  It is a very calming atmosphere.  I sing his praises to anyone I meet who is suffering from back or neck pain.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!|Amazing experience. Great staff. No one likes to be told they need a lumbar procedure but if you do he's the guy to see. The in-office procedure was quick, painless, easy and even pleasant. I almost wish it had taken longer just because Dr. Kropp and his staff were so personable. I was put at ease straightaway. He was very thorough in his assessment and answered all of my questions with patience and care. He walked me thru my imaging, the procedure, after-care and long-term goals/outlook beforehand. If I have to do it again I'll definitely go thru Dr. Kropp but he was so efficient and professional one visit has probably done the trick!|I don't recommend this practice and I will not returning in the future. The office is clean and the staff is nice but I have had a horrible experience. I was supposed to be sedated (as was previously discussed, agreed upon, and documented) for the procedure but had the needle in my back without being sedated and with no warning. I was courteous about it and didn't complain. During the follow up to the procedure Dr. Kropp called me a liar when I was trying to describe the state of my back the day after the procedure. I feel completely disrespected and cannot put any faith into Dr. Kropp moving forward.|I can't say enough about these guys! Very efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. Their office staff are the most friendly and on it that I have encountered in Anchorage. The entire staff went above and beyond to accommodate my situation.  Dr Kropp himself is easy to like and made me feel comfortable right from our first conversation. He explained my procedure and answered all my questions with patience. I would recommend this office to anyone looking for answers to their pain.

column3:
Algone Anchorage Interventional Pain Clinic

Algone Anchorage Interventional Pain Clinic provides comprehensive pain management services for Anchorage residents struggling with chronic pain conditions. Located at 4001 Dale St #105, Anchorage, AK 99508, this state-of-the-art facility offers evidence-based interventional treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

The clinic is led by Dr. Shamsideen Musa, a board-certified anesthesiologist with specialized fellowship training in pain medicine. Dr. Musa's extensive medical background ensures patients receive expert care using the latest pain management techniques. His dual qualifications in anesthesiology and interventional pain medicine allow for a comprehensive approach to treating complex pain conditions.

Patients seeking relief from chronic back pain, joint discomfort, neuropathic pain, or post-surgical pain can access specialized treatments at Algone. The clinic offers various interventional procedures including epidural injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Non-surgical approaches focus on improving function and quality of life.

The Algone team creates individualized treatment plans addressing both symptoms and underlying causes. Their multidisciplinary approach may incorporate physical therapy, medication management, and minimally invasive procedures. Treatment goals emphasize pain reduction while improving daily functioning.

For Anchorage residents seeking pain relief solutions, Algone provides convenient scheduling options. New patients can call +1 907-770-1152 to arrange consultations. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on their website: https://www.algoneanchorage.com/

Serving the Anchorage community with compassionate care, Algone Anchorage Interventional Pain Clinic remains committed to helping patients regain control over their lives through effective pain management.
column11: Algone Anchorage Interventional Pain Clinic is a state-of-the-art facility offering hope to men and women in Anchorage, Alaska, who struggle with chronic pain. Owner Shamsideen Musa, MD, is a board-certified anesthesiologist and interventional pain specialist who is fellowship trained in pain medicine and a highly qualified anesthesiologist.
column36: Closed|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-12 p.m.|Closed
column38: Tiffany Hoffman|Travis Ririe|Susie Ast|Shawn Doyle|natasha latta|MissJoe O|Jeffrey Thomas Lee|Tyson Thompson
column40:
I had an awful experience with Algone and Dr.Musa. During our consultation he seemed to understand I was in a lot of pain and saw the MRIs which indicate a surgical intervention by an orthopedic surgeon. After talking about what I've tried and what has worked and not worked in the past we agreed on a medication so I could function  until surgery.   To my surprise when I filled my medication it wasn't at all what we talked about.  One of the medications I was allergic to, one was the wrong form so I couldn't take it and one was a psych med. Dr. Musa isn't a psychiatrist and it felt like he was saying that I'm crazy and the pain is in your head.  There was no discussion about mental health during the consultation.   None of these medications were discussed and they knew my allergies.  I called multiple times to try and find out what I could do since these weren't the medications we talked about and then I got an email telling me that he could no longer treat me. I have never been treated so poorly by a doctor before.  A warning to those who might seek his help; he'll lie to your face, gaslight you and fire you as a patient if you persist.|Was referred by my doctor to these people, from the beginning it was a disaster with them. Most unorganized dysfunctional pain clinic I've ever dealt with. Wound up going to Algone in Wasilla because after they had seen me twice after they just wouldn't answer the phone and I had to just go down there. Walked in and they wanted to collecta urinalysis sample... all good and fine I guess. And then, nothing for weeks. I call and call and no answer. Friday came around and I was fed up and went down there. 3:00pm in the after as I'm waking up to the door, gal comes out saying that they are closing early. Got a call back on Monday first thing nig the morning. They told me that my insurance was taking too long for authorization. I have Medicare and Medicaid, I've never had an issue before. Don't have an issue now with them now that I go out to the valley because it's not the same company. Spoke with Algone in Wasilla and they said that they had never heard of a clinic doing that; that they only share the name and are not actually part of the Anchorage practice at all. Avoid the headache if possible...|Don't waste your time. The staff is incompetent and the Dr treats you like a drug seeker. He knocked my pain medicine in half the first day I met him after being on it for 7 years and refused to put it back. Started using kratom to substitute the loss and was penalized and then taken off all my meds. I have never in my life struggled with the terrible Healthcare that I have received since being in alaska. If this office has given you grief as well, please report them or these Drs will continue to give substandard care. It is unacceptable medical behavior.|I am so blessed to have found Algone and especially Doctor Musa. My visits have been great, very thorough which I like and understand. Since I found Doctor Musa and Algone, I can finally say how much better I finally feel. The injuries were rough, but the care I've received from Algone has been amazing and professional. I highly recommend them, and Doctor Musa. Thank you Algone!|The physician is absolutely fantastic, the office staff appear unable to complete their jobs either based on knowledge or understaffing and thus have cost us a tremendous amount of money, time and stress. We are now having to start over with a new physician exclusively based on the office staff deficiency.|Algone is to pushy with sending patients Emails & phone calls about filling out questions before appointments.  This was too much for me they keep calling L/M. Or sent
me texts over  & over again. I called Algone about this repeatedly problem. They just never listened to the issue or cared. Staff unprofessional.
I was very disappointed with their office procedures and how they treated me. I had one appointment and it was a nightmare.  Never again|I had a positive experience at Algone Pain Management. This was my first appointment and it was calming and very nice to have a friendly staff to receive my wife and I. Dr. Musa was prepared for me and asked the questions that got to heart of my pain. Dr. Musa's knowledge of my spinal issues showed to me that he is very experienced. I trust the plan for medication and a spinal nerve block. My Dr. never spoke down to me and if there was something I didn't understand he was patient  and repeated a sentence. Dr. Musa covered a lot of ground and I was able to understand and remember most of everything. The nurse was very patient of me and my concerns. I struggle with chronic pain and sleep is an issue  so my comprehension and my mood is murky most days, the staff looked past this and treated me with respect.|I am a current patient here and I have to express how happy I am to have found Dr. Musa and the rest at Algon. They have the expertise and all the options for pain management and have improved my quality of life.

Northern Lights Interventional Pain Management is Fairbanks' comprehensive pain treatment center specializing in interventional procedures and personalized care plans. Pain Management at Orthopedic Physicians Alaska offers comprehensive pain treatment services in Eagle River, Alaska. The clinic specializes in interventional pain management techniques, chronic pain conditions, and personalized treatment plans for patients throughout the Anchorage area.

Located at 10928 Eagle River Rd, Eagle River, AK 99577, the practice provides advanced solutions for back pain, joint pain, nerve pain, and sports injuries. Their multidisciplinary approach combines medication management, physical therapy, and minimally invasive procedures.

Dr. Heath McAnally leads the pain management team with extensive experience in anesthesiology and pain medicine. Board-certified in his specialty, Dr. McAnally completed his medical education and advanced fellowship training in pain management techniques. column38: Deni McCloud|Helen Hoover
column40: I have had several back surgeries over the years due to just plain old poor genetics. I was at my wits end seeing pain management docs, changing medication or insisting on alternative treatments that I had already tried. I tried anything and everything just so that I could get through the working day. Dr. McAnally was the first pain doc that sat down and listened and more importantly, believed and trusted me. The world of pain management is full of distrust for many good reasons. Dr. McAnally saw "me", and got to know me. He took that precious time for me. That kind of care can be a rare thing for doctors that deal with pain. They have to be wary of drug seeking patients. There are feeling of shame when you have chronic pain and need medication to help live your life, get your joy and happiness back instead of being stuck in bed holding your breath through pain. This is the norm for Dr. McAnally. He is an amazing doctor and human being who truly cares for his patients. I cannot say enough good things about him as well as his nurses, nurse practitioners, and med students and office staff. I thank them all from the bottom of my heart and spine.|When we moved to Alaska in 2012 I was on a lot of pain meds for a serious neck injury. Several surgeries and numerous procedures barely touched my pain. A year in Alaska brought more meds. I became a zombie. I could not function. Could not drive. I saw Dr Jones who asked if I would see Dr. McAnally for pain management. With a copy of all the meds that were prescribed for me, Dr. McAnally took one look and said that if I stayed with him he would knock holes in my meds. I thought he would reduce my dependency on some of the items. Months later with only one of my meds still in use he said that I didn't need it and explained how drugs become responsible for causing dependency.I really believed that I needed that pill but I also knew that every medication that he had eliminated from my list was good . I was feeling like myself again so I said "ok, you've been right about everything so far, so I'll trust you to quit it". 10 years later I have that bottle with all the pills still in it. It reminds me what I once lived through and what I never want to experience again. Thank you Dr.McAnally.The photo that is with this entry is me a few weeks shy of my 83rd birthday. My life is full of adventure, fun with family, husband, sons, daughters in law and grandkids. I take the snow off the roof, drive my snow machine or four wheeler, car, truck, and ice skated with my grandkids not long ago.

Northern Anesthesia & Pain Medicine LLC

Northern Anesthesia & Pain Medicine LLC is Eagle River's comprehensive pain management clinic serving Alaska residents with specialized care for chronic and acute pain conditions. Located at 10928 Eagle River Rd #240, Eagle River, AK 99577, our practice combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans.

Our board-certified pain specialists focus on identifying the root causes of pain rather than merely treating symptoms. We offer evidence-based treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Patients appreciate our modern facility equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. We accept most major insurance plans and work with workers' compensation cases. New patients can typically schedule appointments within two weeks.

column38: Chuck Dunnagan|Paul Franke|Julie Blair|Katy Coski|Trinity Wasankari|Christine Burton|Sean Cavanaugh|Hucky 007
column40:
This is actually Laurie Dunnagan posting and not my husband (don't know how that happened, but...) and I can only say good things about Dr. Mac and his staff. I had the best experience and then the best outcome one could hope for. I had RFA done in my lumbar area, without sedation, but with nice conversation, good music, great care, and for the first time in a very long time I am pain free. I feel unburdened. So to Dr. McAnnally, Jeannie, Breanna, Sam, and all the others who were so very nice, thank you for this wonderful gift. (I'll miss seeing you all, though.)|As a physician I have a liability being a patient; knowing all of the complications of procedures and the risks involved.  As a long time Chief Medical Officer, I been responsible for patient safety and maintaining standards of care.   Receiving care from Dr. McAnally and his staff was a fantastic experience.  I received a comprehensive anatomy and physiology lesson which was very helpful, and was well cared for.
Very very bright and compassionate physician, to say the least.  I was so impressed with the staff that I will have trouble resisting attempting to recruit a few away.
You really cannot go wrong being Dr. McAnally's patient.  I recommend him highly.  He really saved me from a miserable situation.|When I started at Napm seven years ago I was very sick (physically) , I met Dr Macanally he spent two hours with me my first appointment trying to help me figure out what was wrong and how best to fix it . After several referrals and many after hours calls I was finally on my way to starting to feel better. Dr Macanally always made me feel like he really was concerned about my well being , but also the well being of our communities. I never wanted to be on Pain management in the first place but seven spine surgeries-- you are definitely on pain meds .  He managed my pain never over medicated which I have always valued . He was always so conservative with dosing . I didn't want to be a statistic while trying to recover from my terrible situation. I didn't want to have to take pain meds for the rest of my life either . With the assistance of the classes offered at Napm by Donna I learned about pain and how my body and brain don't always work together, that my brain can trick my body and sometimes pain medicine can make it worse not better . I successfully was able to have my final
7th surgery a lumbar fusion and after a slow wean I was able to get off pain medicine, it's been over a year an half and I haven't wanted pain medicine once . I have my life back and I am 100% positive I wouldn't be where I am today without Dr Macanally! THANK YOU HEATH!!|I highly recommend Dr. McAnally. He is kind, his knowledge is extensive and he is very helpful. He was well prepared before my visit. The MRI and my medical history had already been reviewed in detail. Dr. McAnally spent quality time with my physical exam, listening to my medical history and then was able to give his professional advice. He gave me options and advice on medications, specific books regarding health/exercises, natural methods for my health and explained medical procedures that may help in the future. I have a complicated medical condition so I was grateful for the variety of options and they were gently introduced to me. He continues to respond promptly to my medical needs. My experience has been nothing but positive!|I had the best experience I could have in a Doctor's office. Not only was the entire staff kind, MD Mcanally provided utmost comfort, support and advice. Although my issue isn't yet fixed I am hopeful and it's nice being seen and heard.|I had the fortune of discovering Northern Anesthesia and Pain Medicine back in 2013 after having gone to another pain management facility in the Valley for back pain. I was not happy with the other facility as the billing was completely upside down and I was getting a bill (this happened for several months) despite having insurance and no one at this other place seemed able to do anything. I finally I decided I had had enough, talk about a real pain in the bottom!
The treatment I received from Dr. McAnally (Dr. Mac) and his staff was so much different compared to what I was used to getting, I felt like they saw me vs just a chart; they listened to what I wanted. I always have too much to do so I've always opted to have the "nerves burnt in my back" and the first time I had this done it was not like the other facility, it was much more in depth and I do not need to go back as frequently.
However, that does not mean the staff does not remember me or my children because they do and it's a great feeling when you walk into a place (regardless of how long it's been) and they remember you and ask about you and your family. If you ever find yourself in need of pain management, hands down, Northern Anesthesia and Pain Medicine is probably the most caring, compassionate, and professional pain management place out there! Not enough can be said about Dr. Mac and his staff, love, love, love them!|Doctor McAnally has been a life saver for me.  I first started seeing him for lower back pain due to a fractured sacrum a few years ago. Doctor McAnally strives to find what is best for any patient.  He honestly finds the cause of the pain then treat the pain the best way possible.  I can not express enough how great of an experience it has been, being one of his many patients.  I trust his medical opinion above any other Doctor I have ever seen.  Everyone at NAPM is awesome, thank you all so much!|I've had three epidural lumbar spinal steroid shots at Northern Anesthesia for a pinched nerve in my back causing radiating nerve pain down my leg.  The procedure is a bit uncomfortable considering you are getting a shot in your back but overall, it was relatively painless even without sedation.  You just need to relax and breathe during it.   Dr. McAnally is excellent and really knows what he's doing.  His staff is very organized and friendly.  They always follow through by calling to check up on you.  I highly recommend Northern Anesthesia, Dr. McAnally is a very knowledgeable doctor and I felt safe under his care.

column40:
I have been with AA pain and spine clinic for many years.. I have seen three Doctors and two PAs since 2012 and traveled back and forth to Anchorage every month and it was good at times because I was able to go to Costco etc... But finally they opened a clinic in Wasilla and I was excited because I new there was a chance I wouldn't have to make that drive every month. And my first visit was nice just meeting the staff and Greg my new PA, and honestly I was so taken back with the knowledge that he was speaking to me about my physical problems that were going on in my body, and the cause of why I'm hurting in so many different parts of my body, that were related to my injuries it really blew my mind.  Of all the years I have been going to AA spine clinic God has sent a Man of faith that cares so much about me to describe everything I felt was happening to my body!!!! In all my many years I'm so thankful and blessed that God has finally put someone in front of me that actually cares about my wellbeing and I'm not just a number.. I just read up on Greg to find out a bit more about who he is and his medical background like I do with every DR or PA I have ever gone to. And to learn that he is a God loving person was so refreshing. my heavenly father is my creator, and his Son Jesus is my savior and I take it very seriously when I have to put my life into someone else's hands .. Jesus is my guide to everything and my roadmap and I'm so happy and blessed that he has finally put my wellbeing in a Man of faith with the staff at AA spine clinic|I am actually shared patient with both doctors in the office. I have enjoyed talking to both. I went into surgery for a long time and came out of the hospital overwhelmed and extremely concerned about my opoid intake. I was sat down and reassured they listened to what I was worried about and let me know they were going to help me and my mental health team. It was mostly just paranoia on my part but I felt comfortable sharing what to me felt like crazy thoughts from my hospital stay not my clinic visits. I walked out of there feeling assured. I was extremely blunt and honest about withdrawals and using anxiety meds and I was not made to be ashamed of it.
I would even recommend ladies who were addicted against thier will to go there. I truly believe they would help you and make you not feel toxic. Which during my time in shelters ladies who were abused or not able to make good choices told me they assume about themselves. Please try them.|Greg Wilkinson is a perfect addition to the awesome team at Alaska Pain To Wellness. He is smart, well trained, compassionate, and competent. He is truly committed to the wellbeing of his patients. I wholeheartedly give him 5 stars along with Dr Johnson and the entire staff.|I appreciate Gregg and the nursing staff because they help give me confidence and help to keep me from working myself up into a frenzie when I'm in immense pain. They are kind, professional and always listen to what I have to share. They make my life liveable.|I have known Dr. Johnson for many years and he has always treated me with respect and dignity, unlike so many pain doctors.  He is always willing to listen, explain new medications, adjust doses: whatever it might take to bring me the most pain relief.  And he is honest with me when he discusses what level of pain relief I can expect, and works with me to get the best individualized plan that works for ME.  I was worried when Dr. Johnson began to turn some of my visits to Greg Wilkinson, a Physician Assistant.  But Mr. Wilkinson has come to know about my particular situation and has offered me wonderful care and spends time with me discussing various alternatives. Mr. Wilkinson, like Dr. Johnson, is always more concerned with my medical needs and comfort than he is with following some cookie-cutter protocol.  Mr. Wilkinson and Dr. Johnson allow me to continue to live life, work, visit family, all the things that my untreated pain had prevented - and I am eternally grateful to them both.  And they have done it with respect for me.|Comfortable, that's what I feel when it's time for my appointment. Both Dr. Johnson and Wilkinson have helped me to be able to hold down a job and provide for my family with treatment. They're so easy to talk to about my pain issues without feeling judged. Without AK Pain to wellness I couldn't imagine where my life would be.|Excellent care and a very friendly staff. I feel like a human here vs feeling like a number at most other medical practices I have been to. Greg actually wants to find the cause of the issue and how to resolve it. Every other place I have been to just throw medicine at the problem and they don't care if you get better. Greg is amazing!|Steven Johnson & Greg Wilkinson are great people! The staff is very friendly & outgoing. This was a referral from a friend and I'm happy with the care they give. Thanks everyone at Alaska Pain to Wellness!

column40:
First off AA Spine and Pain is located in a building with the name Valley Spine on the door!
When I googled AA Spine and Pain Wasilla the map sent me to Anchorage! I finally found a way to take out that stop.
Then tried the proper address-267 E Park avenue.... It routed me to Park Avenue- no that's not it.....
Then it got all confused with Parks Highway and sent me back to Anchorage.
I finally called.... The Anchorage number.... Got sent to Wasilla- I finally called. After a while she finally picked up and said quickly "Hold"- didn't ask if I could hold- just "Hold" click!
I held for 10 minutes, still holding I stopped the car and re entered the address- same problem  sent me to Anchorage, couldn't find E Park Avenue, sent me to Park then Parks Highway.  I turned around and looked at labels for key area buildings....
10 minutes on hold- She finally picked up the phone- I told her Google had me all over the place. Still looking. I'm going to be late.
I finally found the place... But it's labeled Valley Spine. I guess I'm here.... She said you're late and need to reschedule.... The phone rang in the middle of our discussion "please hold ....Click " then she rescheduled me for another date.

1.) They need more help there. 2. ) Fix the sign to read the proper Name  3.) Clarify E Park, Park, and Parks Highway in Google and the map for AA Spine and Pain 4.) teach the clerks proper phone edicate.|

Integrative Pain Center of Alaska provides comprehensive pain management services in Fairbanks, Alaska. Led by Dr. Nancy Cross, MD, the clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using advanced medical approaches. Dr. Cross is board certified in both anesthesiology and pain medicine, bringing specialized expertise to patients suffering from pelvic pain, spinal disorders, cancer pain, and women's health issues.

The center's philosophy centers on helping patients return to functional living through supportive care, patient education, and innovative therapies. Treatment plans utilize the most advanced, economical, and safe techniques available in medical, pharmaceutical, and technological fields. The clinical team stays current with the latest pain management research and regularly undergoes advanced training to deliver optimal patient outcomes.

Located at 1275 Sadler Way #200 in Fairbanks, the facility offers state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment options for Alaskan residents seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. The clinic's multidisciplinary approach addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of pain management.

Patients can expect personalized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary approaches based on individual needs. The center emphasizes long-term pain solutions rather than temporary fixes.

column40:
I simply cannot say enough about Dr. Cross and her amazing clinic here. Dr. Cross is the ultimate and classy profession who sincerely takes her time with every patient and includes the patient on every step of the way. She is a supreme patient educator and patient advocate. Her team was so welcoming and they went above and beyond to reschedule after Alaska decided to throw a snow storm into the mix. To every member of the team, I give you my most heartfelt thank you!!!|The staff should have better bedside manner, family members go with their loved one to help and be with them, however twice now I feel talked down to and and treated like a random person when in fact I was there for my husband. I dread taking my husband to his appointments here. Have respect and do better with all people!|I went to Integrative Pain Center today for and intake/assessment, as my PCP issued a referral to them in November 2023. However, my initial appointment was scheduled for May 2024, but I cancelled due to recovering from a surgery and they quickly rescheduled it for August 29, 2024. My appointment lasted all of 10 minutes total. I found the lady working the front desk to be kind, but overly busy. I waited for almost 15 minutes or longer after my appointment ended for a medical release form but no one provided me with the form, so I left. Btw, the doctor claimed to need this form before she would treat me....a long with other background info which they had over nine months to request of me. A medical release document is something that should've been standard at my check-in or even given to me with their thick pre-intake package they emailed and needed returned before they would schedule. Instead this place would rather charge my insurance for unrendered services by having me arrive for an appointment that they wasn't prepared for. I plan to dispute the charges as beside going over my medications and looking at a CT scan from FMH they did not do anything. They must have some contact with FMH since apparently I didn't sign a release for them to see those records.

Also, it should be noted that I found the provider and the attending nurse to be prejudiced and lacking cultural sensitivity. Most importantly, they both of them lacked empathy and compassion, for many reasons that I'll gladly list out if asked. But I'll stress that I do not recommend this company or provider, Dr. Cross. I would've rated a zero or given it one star had it not been for the kind, but preoccupied, front desk clerk or office manager (I really don't know what her official title is). However, if you're of the BIPOC community, I highly suggest you seek out another provider even if you have to go to Anchorage or Seattle.|Dr. Cross is awesome. After getting the run around by many physicians over the years concerning my back pain, she was able to dial in and work out a pain management plan that has really improved my quality of life. Her entire team is super polite. Highly recommend!|Everytime I come back to Integrative Pain Centers to see Dr. Cross, I have a wonderful experience. The staff is very friendly and supporting and takes their time. I never feel rushed or as "just an other patient" - everybody makes me feel welcome and makes me feel like their priority for now. The Front Office stuff is friendly and professional and the MA's are helpful and understanding for my constant pain. Dr. Cross is always makes an effort to manage my pain in new ways and she listens and takes her time and she is very good in explaining everything that is going on. I never feel like I go into a procedure without knowing what is going to happen. She always makes an effort to educate her patients and to explain and answer every question. I finally found a doctor who can help me and make my pain tolerable.|Dr Cross is amazing.  This is the first time I have been pain free in over twenty years!|Dr ,  Cross should have her license removed!  I went to see her with my pain issues and I didn't know what was wrong so she looked at my mri and she said I was faking it then she sent my company a letter saying that I neededto return to work full duty and that there was nothing wrong with me. I had a real problem then so I went to a different Dr and it turned out my neck was completely crushed and broken in 4 places. She is the worst Dr I've ever met  definitely not recommended. She is crazy the way she flipped out on me in the Dr office. I was totally shocked.
Do not trust her
Steve|Always great work,  friendly staff

column2: Fireweed Health Care - Opioid Addiction & Pain Management Clinic in Anchorage
column3:
Fireweed Health Care

Fireweed Health Care is a specialized 3-in-1 clinic in Anchorage offering comprehensive addiction and pain management services. Located at 3500 Latouche St, this integrated healthcare facility provides evidence-based treatments for opioid addiction, chronic pain conditions, and mental health support. As one of Anchorage's leading opioid treatment centers, Fireweed combines medical intervention with therapeutic approaches.

The clinic specializes in medication-assisted treatment using Suboxone and Vivitrol for opioid dependency, administered under the supervision of experienced psychiatric nurse practitioners. Patients seeking pain management in Anchorage benefit from individualized treatment plans addressing both physical symptoms and underlying conditions. The clinical team offers comprehensive assessments to determine the most effective pain relief strategies.

Beyond opioid addiction recovery, Fireweed Health Care provides specialized treatment for tobacco and alcohol dependency. Their holistic approach includes psychotherapy services to address co-occurring mental health concerns during the recovery process. The clinic's practitioners have extensive experience in addiction medicine and behavioral health interventions.

Fireweed Health Care accepts most insurance plans and offers flexible scheduling for both new and returning patients. The facility maintains strict confidentiality protocols while creating a supportive environment for healing. For appointments or information about their comprehensive services, contact them at (907) 276-4611 or visit fireweedhealthcare.com.

They never notified me and I found in out about the new doctor through a radio ad. Additionally they never answered my phone calls and because they would be closed before I end work I didn't have a chance to visit them. I finally got a chance to visit one day and they told me they threw away all my medical records including my MRI which I needed as I'm moving soon and the doctors at my next location are requesting it. Furthermore they never notified me that they were getting rid of my medical records and the receptionist doesn't even know how they get rid of it meaning it could have been "disposed" unsecured with potential of exposing my information. column38: Iron Dogger|Jeanne Yoder|Christopher "CHG" Gately|Sandy Goliver|mark sparrow|Tyler Bell
column40:
Dr. Grissom and his team are in the field to actually help people and it shows by the attentive care they provide.
They listen carefully and provide educated advice you can trust.  That has become lost in the medical money grab, but you do not get that absurd treatment from this office.
My primary pain doctor of over a decade retired and I was absolutely terrified trying to find another doctor who actually listened and was willing to try alternative methods, whatever it takes to get relief, without being medicated numb and regain some kind of semblance of a life.
My first appointment was outstanding!  The scheduling was quick and quite accommodating.  There was minimal wait time and this is not an exaggeration whatsoever!  They are thorough and professional yet provide a comfortable atmosphere where you feel confident in being able to share the intricacies of your unique situation.  They listen.  They are able to establish a plan with plenty of options to tailor to your needs and expectations.
I HIGHLY recommend Dr. Grissom and his team.
I feel confident instead of terrified now going forward.  I have two forms of Leukemia, Idiopathic Chronic Pancreatitis, and a destroyed lower lumbar, which all require intricate methods for healing and just to keep me comfortable when and if  possible.  I know I'm in great hands and look forward to the potential.|Dr. Grissom took a great deal of time with me to figure out why I had such pain in my back, hip and leg.  He relieved that pain many times with infusions that made life and normal movement bearable. After encouraging me to have an MRI, he discovered that I would need rather extensive surgery to permanently fix my pain problem. He continued with the infusions until I was able to schedule the surgery with an excellent neurosurgeon he suggested.  I have nothing but respect for Dr. Grissom's professionalism and medical expertise.  His office workers and assistants were consistently upbeat, welcoming, and of the highest caliber.  I would recommend Algone Clinic in general and Dr. Grissom in particular to any person with a pain issue.|After being with this clinic for over 4 years I have seen five different doctors. Eventually dr. Grissom decided to put a pain pump in me. After many trials we scheduled a surgical date at which time they put me under and brought me back two Consciousness telling me that their representative for the pain pump had not shown up. I asked them if they had known this before putting me under and they had told me yes but they thought that she would show up in the next 15 minutes. I asked them how late she was and she was supposed to be in at 8 in the morning and my appointment was at 1 p.m. . They decided to hold off the surgery due to me having a 10 x 7 inch hernia repaired that would have some recovery time. Directly after which doctor Grissom sent me three different letters terminating my contract with their pain management company. One said that I called too often which was impossible because I was still not able to use the phone at the hospital due to sedation. One letter was sent saying that I talked rudely to his team on a recording. I asked him if he could could hear that recording because I had known that I did not make any call like that and he hung up on me. The third letter stated that I had additional drugs in my system. At which point I asked him to see my clinical report and it clearly stated that the morphine in my system was from my hernia surgery. This doctor is self-involved and only worried about the promotion of his popularity through the medical field. He will step on any patient he can possibly gain influence from. I would not trust this doctor with my life or any of my children's lives. After talking to him one time you can realize he actually thinks he's in a TV medical show|||
