column40:
"I want to express my gratitude to the entire staff at AZ Clinic. Everyone was so kind and helpful, making my experience truly positive. I'm so happy to be a patient here. The team is caring and takes the time to explain every step of the process. Thank you for your exceptional care!"|First visit, consultation, was excellent. Catherine Lambert is very easy to talk to, inquisitive, caring and helpful. Among the best medical experiences I've had. Huge improvement from my previous pain management clinic. Recommended without reservation.|They asked for 5 star reviews that's the 1st red flag. They don't bill insurance and have you seek reimbursement after paying cash for your visits. I have not received one reimbursement. Finally and most notably they are judgmental and question you on your medication usage ( I've never failed one urine test and been taking pain meds for 13 years). They don't know how to take clinical notes and when you get frustrated with the whole process they discharge you from their clinic and state that YOU are the problem. The worst experience in all the years of going to different clinics to manage my pain. Deborah ( operations manager)  & Dr. Tamara McDonald are the absolute worst in the whole Valley!! Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. Don't believe any response they try and post in response to this review cause I'm sure their egos will get hurt by this review!|This office is absolutely amazing. The front desk staff are so sweet and delightful. The nurses are so kind and my NP Tammy McDonald is great! She takes her time with you and is so sweet. I couldn't recommend this office more!|I recently had my consultation with NP Tammy McDonald after moving from the east coast out here to Yuma, AZ.  I had difficulty finding a new pain doctor because there is only one clinic in Yuma and that provider has a 4 month wait list.  So on a whim I called AZ Pain Medicine and the receptionist, Deborah, was so nice and helpful and told me she could get me in the next week.  I took the appointment and I'm so happy that I did!

The drive was 3 hours to Phoenix but I think it was totally worth it, because there is nothing that compares to peace of mind when you're a chronic pain patient.  It's scary to have to find a new provider, especially after the stress of moving across the country.   Everyone was very friendly and efficient at the clinic and I could tell right away that it would be a good experience.  Deborah sent me the patient paperwork prior to my appointment so I came with all of it filled out. My wait time wasn't very long at all.

NP Tammy McDonald was my provider and she was so kind and really took a lot of time inquiring about my  history with my pain condition.  I appreciate when a provider takes the time to get to know you and really listen to how pain has affected your life. And the best part is that she was understanding and listened to me! I have had a couple of experiences years ago when I was seen by providers who literally spent less than 5 minutes with me and didn't seem to care at all or take my pain seriously.  That was not the case this time! And I'm so grateful for that! It's so difficult as a pain patient when providers don't listen and want to come in and immediately start making changes before even asking how you feel!!! But this was not the case this time.  I felt so relieved to see that I had found a provider who I knew genuinely cared and wanted to help me.  She even suggested another medication that might help me if I wanted to try it in the future.  So I could see that she genuinely cared about my quality of life and pain level.

Peace of mind and having an empathetic provider is what I look for in a pain clinic and I believe I have found that with AZ Pain Medicine.  I don't mind the drive nor do I mind paying out of pocket because I feel it's worth it when it comes to having a top notch provider.  Chronic pain is exhausting sometimes and it makes it even worse when you feel like you aren't believed or taken seriously by providers.... I've been a pain patient for 7 years so I've seen some great providers and a couple of less empathetic ones. Well,  NP Tammy McDonald is one of the best and I highly  recommend AZ Pain Medicine to anyone who is trying to find a provider!|Today my RX was delayed at 4pm by Walgreens needing a pre authorization from my new insurance. Knowing az pain med closes at 4 they still answered and had it all taken care of within 30 minutes. The level of care a patient receives in this office is 10star. They really care and understand what can happen with a delayed prescription. They were fast, kind and followed up at the end to let me know what was happening. I appreciate being treated like I mattered. Thank you|AZ Pain Medicine Clinic lied TWICE so far.  I am supposed to have my ablation done tomorrow, and they call me 24 hours before the procedure to tell me the insurance denied it saying that it is experimental. So they need to change it to an epidural steroid injection into my lower back. I asked why I'm finding out 24 hours before my procedure instead of weeks ago when it was ordered. I called my insurance. They denied it because they did not send over any physicians notes with the request so that is why insurance denied it. The first lie came with scheduling the procedure that my insurance would only cover the procedure on Tuesdays, Thursdays or Fridays, as I wanted sedation for this and would need a driver but they are only available on Mondays. Again called insurance and they have no stipulation on coverage days, it's the office that codes different days a different way.  They lie, they don't help. I will be researching new pain management. Don't trust what they say and always ask questions, confirm with your insurance.|Great practice for those with pain.  I've been a patient for many years!!! Tammy, Kate, Susie and Deb are extremely professional yet compassionate. They take the time to listen and genuinely care about my wellbeing and quality of life.

column38: Mike "Siegel"|Maureen Porter|Brian Wiggen|Pat Inserra|Cary Dortch|A Larsen|Wind Woman|Cassandra Molina
column40:
If you need to see a pain specialist, this is the place to go. The doctor and staff are not only compassionate but also highly effective in their care. They truly listen, which is reflected in the dedication of the team, many of whom have been there for as long as I can remember. Given the typically high turnover in front desk and medical assistant roles, it is remarkable to see a team that remains consistent, always welcoming, and genuinely happy to help.

From check in to my consultation with the medical assistant, my visit with the nurse practitioner, and ultimately my procedure with the doctor, every step of the experience is exceptional. The staff is attentive, detail oriented, professional, and inviting. Their commitment to superior patient care is evident in every interaction.

I wholeheartedly recommend this practice to anyone in need of pain management. They truly make a difference.

Sincerely,
Michael|My husband is seeing Dr Or
mond for neck pain and I have to say everyone and I mean everyone in his office is Top Drawer amazing. The care we have received the time spent listening to our concerns about treatment have been better than we could ask for. Dr Ormond is knowledgeable compitant and compassionate. I highly recommend him to address your pain and health needs. And again. His staff All of them are wonderful|Yesterday I was treated at Atlas Pain Specialists for my extreme sciatic pain. Transportation to Atlas required transport via gurney arranged with Royal Express (Eric). With his professional service, I arrived comfortably with no problems.
When I arrived on the gurney I was immediately met with the ladies at the front desk and those involved in my treatment process.  They showed so much care and compassion to make this process as seamless and positive as possible.  I experienced smiles, positivity and compassion and genuine care from all of the employees.  Dr. Ormand was great and the treatment was quick, professional and my special needs were a top priority.
Those at Atlas Pain and Royal Express truly care about their clients and take extra care and compassion in dealing with your specific needs. That is a rare experience in the medical service these days. I absolutely highly recommend entrusting your medical care with the staff at Atlas Pain Specialists. They truly care about their patients!|A routine appointment today. The clinical staff of Dr. Ormmond anre  always pleasant and interested in your health problem resolution. They  do not rush you and take their time in answering all your. Questions. I highly compliment  his staff for their professionalism. If you need a pain management group this is the place to go!|Easy recommendation for a very difficult practice area. Dr. Ormond is kind, intelligent, and great doctor. Happy to have his assistance. Staff is also wonderful. Five stars|The best pain management facility I have ever been to. I work in healthcare and I'm a cancer survivor that ended up with some issues after my cancer treatments. I was in so much pain and didn't have a lot of hope for anything better. Many pain management clinics didn't even treat me like a human - and didn't offer many alternatives to alleviate the pain from the arthritis and autoimmune disease that came about after breast Cancer. I can honestly say Dr. Ormond gave me my life back. We are still working through things but man I feel a marked improvement with his treatment plans. They are on the forefront of many pain methodologies that have greatly improved my quality of life. If you just want meds thrown at you, this isn't the place for you. What Dr. Ormond does is treat your pain with proper methods with the goal to taper off or significantly lower your medication usage. This was super important to me.

Thank you Atlas Pain. Thank you for treating me so respectfully and being attentive at all my appointments. Thank you for putting me at ease during procedures, and thank you for treating me like a person. This place quite literally saved my life. I was in so much pain prior to seeing Dr. Ormond and in just 4 months I already feel like a totally different person.  I highly recommend you give Atlas Pain and a try.|Love the front desk people. They are business oriented, but still have their humanity intact. I prefer seeing Dr Ormand, as I have had back pain for 20yrs. Highly recommend.|Super offended with the PA. I've been made out to be some druggy or pill popping individual. However the PA has the audacity to chart * PT seems jittery and inability to concentrate " hmm where are the exploratory questions? Had you done so you would of found out that I have been living on caffeine all day due to lack of sleep and I also brought up the fact that the medication used on Tuesday to put me under for a procedure didn't agree with me. No bed side manner now just trying to find an excuse for my discharge for a previous error on my behalf even though all my urinalysis came back clean. Not interested in a practice like this. I won't even complete my remaining procedures with them.

**UPDATED
Received my "updated medical records"they truly are trying to male me be the problem here. Apparently my "behavior  was noted before at other visits" however they never charted said behavior. I guess being bubbly or scattered brain for X Y Z reasons oh and apparently being 10 minutes late was super important that they needed to chart it. I mean how petty is the PA. The courteous thing to do would be to get on the phone with me and speak to me and stop making me to be something I am not.  My Uranlysis all have been negative for any illegal substances.

column3:
PaloVerde Pain Specialists

PaloVerde Pain Specialists is a premier pain management clinic located in Peoria, Arizona. Led by Dr. Adam Kramer, MD, MSPT, our practice delivers comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients throughout the Phoenix Metro area.

Dr. Kramer combines his medical doctorate with a Master's in Physical Therapy, offering a unique integrated approach to pain management. This dual expertise allows him to understand both the medical and physical rehabilitation aspects of chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our clinic specializes in both surgical and non-surgical pain treatments tailored to each patient's specific needs. We offer advanced interventional procedures including:

- Intracept Procedure for chronic lower back pain

- Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD) for spinal stenosis

- Spinal Cord Stimulation for neuropathic pain conditions

- Specialized pain management for cancer patients

- Targeted treatments for diabetic neuropathy

- Customized pain relief for post-surgical recovery

Patient-Centered Approach

At PaloVerde Pain Specialists, we believe effective pain management begins with listening. Our doctors take time to understand each patient's complete story. We treat the whole person, not just symptoms on a chart. This compassionate approach helps us develop more effective treatment plans.

Serving the Phoenix Metro Area

Conveniently located in Peoria, our clinic serves patients from throughout the greater Phoenix region seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information

Ready to take control of your pain? Schedule your consultation today.

- Phone: +1 833-578-7246

- Address: 13090 N 94th Dr #212, Peoria, AZ 85381

- Website: https://paloverdepain.com/

Take the first step toward a pain-free lifestyle by contacting our office or scheduling your appointment online.

Dr. Adam Kramer, MD, MSPT - The pain specialist based in Peoria. We are one of the top rated pain clinics in Phoenix Metro.

column3:
Saguaro Pain Clinic

Saguaro Pain Clinic provides specialized interventional pain management services in Tempe, Arizona. Our medical team focuses on treating spine and joint pain through non-invasive procedures. Patients experiencing chronic pain conditions find comprehensive care at our modern facility.

We offer targeted treatments for back pain, neck pain, and joint discomfort. Our interventional approach means we address pain at its source. Treatment plans are customized for each patient's specific needs.

Our physicians combine extensive training with years of clinical experience. The clinic's specialists hold board certifications in pain management and anesthesiology. Our doctors regularly participate in continuing education to stay current with advanced pain relief techniques.

Services include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, and radiofrequency ablation. We also provide spinal cord stimulation and peripheral nerve blocks. Many patients experience significant pain reduction after appropriate interventional treatments.

The clinic's comfortable environment was designed with patient comfort in mind. Our Tempe location offers convenient access for East Valley residents. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment.

Visit us at 1001 E Warner Rd #103, Tempe, AZ 85284. Contact our office at +1 480-597-4321 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services at www.saguaropainclinic.com.
column11:
Saguaro Pain Clinic uses minimally invasive interventional pain management techniques working in conjunction with therapy to help you get back to your normal life quickly and safely.

Saguaro Pain Clinic provides the following interventional pain management techniques:
Nerve blocks
Joint Injections
Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)
Trigger Point Injections
IV Therapy and vitamin injections
Semaglutide Weight Loss Injections
Epidural Steroid Injections
Regenerative therapy injections, like PRP and prolotherapy

column3:
Pain Institute of Southern Arizona

Pain Institute of Southern Arizona offers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Tucson. Our specialized medical team treats chronic pain conditions resulting from illness, injury, or aging. Patients throughout Southern Arizona receive personalized care plans designed to restore quality of life and daily functioning.

Our distinguished pain specialists completed advanced training at prestigious institutions including Mayo Clinic, Stanford, and Harvard. This exceptional medical background ensures patients receive cutting-edge treatments using the latest evidence-based approaches. The clinic specializes in minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and innovative pain relief techniques.

The Pain Institute treats various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Treatment options range from epidural steroid injections to radiofrequency ablation and spinal cord stimulation. Each treatment plan addresses the underlying cause of pain rather than just symptoms.

Located at 7140 E Rosewood St in Tucson, our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. New patients can schedule consultations by calling (520) 999-9000. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to maximize coverage benefits.

Visit https://pisapain.com for more information about our services, providers, and treatment approaches. The Pain Institute of Southern Arizona remains committed to helping patients return to pain-free, active lifestyles.
column11: Our providers understand that pain from an illness, injury or aging can disrupt a person's activities and day-to-day routines. The team of renowned Interventional Pain Management Specialists, with training from world-class institutions such as the Mayo Clinic, Stanford and Harvard, deliver state-of-the-art treatments and procedures. Our goal is to help patients find relief from pain--helping them return to an enjoyable quality of life.

column3:
Advanced Pain Management

Advanced Pain Management stands as a premier pain management clinic serving the Phoenix metropolitan area and Tucson, Arizona for over two decades. With ten conveniently located offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson, the clinic provides comprehensive interventional pain management services for adults suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Led by distinguished specialists Dr. Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini and Dr. David Delatte, the clinic focuses on delivering long-term pain relief solutions through personalized treatment plans. Their patient-centered approach addresses various pain conditions with evidence-based interventional techniques. The medical team combines extensive clinical experience with advanced diagnostic capabilities to identify pain sources accurately.

The clinic prioritizes accessibility with next-day appointments, ensuring patients receive prompt diagnosis and treatment initiation. This commitment to timely care helps patients begin their pain management journey without unnecessary delays. Advanced Pain Management maintains a balance of high-quality care that remains both convenient and affordable for patients throughout Arizona.

Services include comprehensive pain evaluations, minimally invasive procedures, and ongoing pain management strategies. The clinic specializes in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary approach may incorporate interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative techniques.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can visit www.advancedpainmanagement.com or call +1 602-353-7624. The main Phoenix location is situated at 4140 N 108th Ave #134, Phoenix, AZ 85037.
column11: Welcome To Advanced Pain ManagementAdvanced Pain Management has been providing high-quality, convenient, and affordable pain management services for adults throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area and in Tucson, Arizona, for over 20 years. At their 10 offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson AZ, interventional pain management specialists Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini, MD, and David Delatte, MD, focus on providing patients with long-term pain relief from a variety of acute and chronic conditions.The practice offers next-day appointments, so patients can get an accurate diagnosis and begin treatment as soon as possible.

column3:
Integrity Pain & Wellness provides advanced treatment for spine, joint, and neurologic pain across Arizona. With locations in Scottsdale, Mesa, Glendale, and Prescott, our pain management specialists deliver targeted interventional treatments using fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance. Patients throughout the Valley benefit from our minimally invasive and non-invasive solutions that address pain directly at its source.

At Integrity Pain, we focus on reducing reliance on oral medications, particularly addictive opioids. Our interventional pain techniques target the precise pain location rather than masking symptoms with medication. Each treatment plan is individually tailored based on comprehensive diagnostic studies and patient symptoms, ensuring effective pain relief with minimal side effects.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating various painful conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

Compassionate Care Throughout Arizona

Patients seeking pain relief can visit our Glendale location at 6677 W Thunderbird Rd g101, Glendale, AZ 85306. Our commitment to compassionate care extends to all patients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area and beyond. Contact us at (480) 325-9600 to schedule a consultation and begin your journey toward effective pain management.

Learn more about our comprehensive pain management services by visiting our website at www.integritypainaz.com.
column11:
Integrity Pain provides the most advanced and effective treatment for spine, joint, and neurologic pain. Our practice specializes in minimally invasive and non-invasive solutions for spine, joint, and nerve pain, with locations in Scottsdale, Mesa, Glendale, and Prescott, AZ.
Our team focuses on interventional treatments, which minimize reliance on oral medications. The goal is to treat pain directly at the source, utilizing fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance. We aim to reduce or avoid the use of addictive opioid medications.
Committed to providing compassionate pain relief to patients throughout the entire Valley, we always provide an individualized approach to care, based on diagnostic studies and symptoms.

column3:
Premier Pain & Wellness

Premier Pain & Wellness is an advanced interventional pain management clinic located in Peoria, Arizona. Our practice specializes in comprehensive pain solutions using cutting-edge surgical techniques and technological advancements in pain medicine. We provide personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from a wide spectrum of conditions, from simple arthritis to complex degenerative spinal disorders.

Our team of pain specialists offers expert care for chronic pain conditions, focusing on minimally invasive procedures and innovative therapies. The clinic's approach combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address the root causes of pain. Patients receive individualized attention for back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and neuropathic conditions.

At Premier Pain & Wellness, we have particular expertise in cancer pain management, offering specialized protocols to improve quality of life for oncology patients. Our physicians bring extensive training in pain medicine and interventional techniques to every case. The practice utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify pain sources before treatment begins.

Treatment options include advanced spinal interventions, joint injections, nerve blocks, and regenerative medicine approaches. Our facility is equipped with modern technology for precise pain procedures in a comfortable setting. We emphasize functional improvement alongside pain reduction for comprehensive patient outcomes.

Visit our clinic at 9242 W Union Hills Dr, Building D, Suite 100, Peoria, AZ 85382. Contact us at (602) 644-7004 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services at www.premierpainandwellness.org.

Thank you for considering Premier Pain & Wellness in your treatment journey. We look forward to serving you.
column11: We are an advanced interventional pain management practice offering the latest surgical and technologic advancements in pain medicine. Thank you for considering Premier Pain & Wellness in your treatment journey. We look forward to serving you.

column3:
Integrated Pain Consultants

Integrated Pain Consultants provides comprehensive pain management services at their Scottsdale, Mesa, and Phoenix, Arizona locations. The clinic specializes in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized interventional approaches.

Led by Dr. Nikesh Seth, a double board-certified anesthesiologist and interventional pain management expert, the practice brings decades of specialized education and clinical experience to Arizona patients. Dr. Seth works alongside skilled colleagues including Dr. Shawnjeet Saini, Dr. Jose Chavez, and a team of experienced nurse practitioners.

The clinic offers targeted treatments for various spinal conditions including sciatica, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, scoliosis, and failed back surgery syndrome. Their comprehensive approach addresses neck pain, back pain, and other chronic pain conditions that impact daily functioning.

Patients seeking non-surgical pain relief options can access innovative interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. The practice focuses on improving mobility and quality of life through minimally invasive techniques.

Their Mesa office is conveniently located at 4824 E Baseline Rd, Suite 140. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 480-626-2552 or visiting their website at https://www.azipc.com/ for more information about available treatments and locations.
column11:
Integrated Pain Consultants in Scottsdale, Mesa, and Phoenix, Arizona, is a leading pain management practice thanks to decades of education, hard work, and experience. Double board-certified anesthesiologist and interventional pain management expert Nikesh Seth, MD, his colleagues Shawnjeet Saini, MD, Jose Chavez, DO, and the team's highly skilled nurse practitioners, offer comprehensive relief from all types of acute and chronic pain.
The Integrated Pain Consultants team diagnoses and treats numerous causes of neck and back pain. These include sciatica, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, scoliosis, and failed back surgery syndrome.

Excellent Doc. Really understands the process of treatment and always makes me feel heard. Explains things in a way that feels like my successful treatment is his goal. Would definitely recommend.

Also, the access they provide  to procedures is top notch. Very smooth, which is not an easy thing to do with multiple locations across the valley. Honestly, I always feel like I'm in good hands, even when there's a large needle going into my back. Again, I would highly recommend Integrated Pain Consultants and Dr. Siani.|Dr. Saini is an amazing doctor. He is very knowledgeable and hears what you are saying. He listens to the patient since they know their body best.  He has a great bedside manner and is looking to help you find a plan for pain relief/management and a positive outcome.|I'm posting 2 reviews today. The first was negative because of a bizarre interaction with Gianni. But, overall, this office is terrific. Dr Seth has helped me thru a difficult time with kindness and support. He is an excellent MD. I trust him and know he will always help me find the best way to manage my situation. The staff are great, too. Friendly and professional, but not uptight. Lately, seeing a NP/PA has been a bit of a challenge. There has been a lot of turnover so it's difficult to build rapport. I think that caused my issue with Gianni today. We don't know each other, I saw a different provider last month, a third provider 2 months ago and a 4th earlier in the year. I think consistency in pain management is critical. There seem to be many changes since a big company bought out the practice. When there have been issues or concerns, I've been told that they can't do anything about it, the company that owns the practice has dictated the way things are being done. I still give the practice 5 stars because of Dr Seth and his long time staff. They are outstanding.   And Dr Seth is definitely the only doctor I trust to be sticking needles in my back.|I came on Friday and my prior ath still isn't done when I've called 3xs today. I'm an amputee w lupus and this is highly unacceptable.  Quick to get my in but sure takes there time w makong one quick phone call to insurance so make or right pls. I've been patient and been understanding. I have a zero quality of life. Hanging patiently per usual other wise no complaints but I've been trying for 2 days now|Great first appointment! I just moved from NY and was struggling to find a good Dr. until I found Integrated Pain Consultants in Scottsdale. Pain Institute of Southern Arizona

Pain Institute of Southern Arizona offers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Tucson, Arizona. The clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions resulting from illness, injury, or aging that disrupt daily activities. Their team of renowned specialists brings expertise from prestigious medical institutions including Mayo Clinic, Stanford, and Harvard University.

The Pain Institute provides state-of-the-art treatments and minimally invasive procedures designed to address various pain conditions. Patients receive personalized care plans focused on reducing pain intensity and improving functional capacity. The clinic's approach emphasizes both immediate pain relief and long-term pain management strategies.

Located at 4741 E Camp Lowell Dr in Tucson, the facility offers advanced diagnostic and therapeutic interventions. Their specialists are trained in the latest pain management techniques and evidence-based protocols. The clinic's mission centers on helping patients return to an enjoyable quality of life through effective pain control.

Patients seeking treatment can expect comprehensive evaluations and tailored treatment plans. The Pain Institute's medical team works collaboratively to address complex pain conditions with multidisciplinary approaches. Their interventional techniques target pain at its source rather than merely masking symptoms.

column3:
Integrated Medical Services - Pain Management

Integrated Medical Services - Pain Management offers comprehensive pain relief solutions in Goodyear, Arizona. Our specialized team addresses the complexity of chronic pain through personalized treatment plans. Located at 14415 W McDowell Rd in Goodyear, our clinic provides advanced interventional techniques for patients seeking non-surgical options.

Our pain specialists excel in treating back pain and spinal conditions with minimally invasive procedures. The clinic offers extensive spinal injection therapies including lumbar, thoracic, and cervical epidural injections. Patients benefit from our expertise in facet joint injections and radiofrequency neurotomy across all spinal regions.

For those suffering from persistent pain, we provide advanced treatments like spinal cord stimulators and sympathetic blocks. Our comprehensive approach includes diagnostic procedures such as discograms alongside therapeutic interventions like vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty. The clinic specializes in Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD), offering relief without major surgery.

Our pain management physicians combine years of clinical experience with cutting-edge techniques. The team focuses on improving quality of life through targeted peripheral nerve blocks and percutaneous disc nucleoplasty. Patients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area choose our Goodyear location for effective pain management solutions.

Contact our office at (623) 512-4190 to schedule a consultation and discover how our interventional pain management services can help restore your comfort and mobility.
column11: Our Pain Management Department understands the complexity of pain offers a variety of treatment options for easing suffering and improving the quality of life for those living with pain. Our department specializes in back pain and interventional pain management. We specialize in nonsurgical spine intervention and spinal injection techniques including lumbar, thoracic, and cervical epidural injections; lumbar, thoracic, and cervical facet joint injections; lumbar, thoracic, and cervical facet radiofrequency neurotomy; sympathetic blocks; spinal cord stimulators; discograms; vertebroplasty/kyphoplasty; percutaneous disc neucleoplasty; peripheral nerve blocks; and Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD).

column3:
The Regional Pain Institute

The Regional Pain Institute in San Tan Valley offers comprehensive pain management solutions for Arizona residents. Our specialized clinic provides personalized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. Located at 36453 N Gantzel Rd STE 101, our facility serves patients throughout San Tan Valley and surrounding communities.

We focus on identifying the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced interventional procedures with medication management when appropriate. Patients receive individualized care plans tailored to their specific needs and medical history.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Our clinic specializes in treating:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Sports injuries

- Post-surgical pain

- Work-related injuries

- Headaches and migraines

Advanced Procedures

The Regional Pain Institute offers state-of-the-art interventional procedures including:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Nerve blocks

- Regenerative medicine options

Experienced Medical Team

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive training in pain management techniques. Each doctor has completed specialized fellowship training beyond standard medical education. Our team stays current with the latest evidence-based approaches to pain treatment.

Contact us at +1 480-636-1225 to schedule a consultation or visit https://regionalpain.com/san-tan-valley-az/ for more information about our services.

column2: Desert Sky Spine and Pain East Tucson Clinic
column3:
Desert Sky Spine and Pain East Tucson Clinic

Desert Sky Spine and Pain East Tucson Clinic specializes in comprehensive pain management solutions for Tucson residents. Located at 1241 N Wilmot Rd, this established practice focuses on identifying and treating the root causes of chronic pain conditions.

The clinic's philosophy centers on helping patients reclaim their lives from debilitating pain. Rather than merely masking symptoms with medication, the medical team develops personalized treatment plans addressing underlying issues. This approach prevents recurring pain cycles and reduces dependency on strong pain medications.

The board-certified physicians at Desert Sky bring extensive experience in interventional pain management techniques. Their expertise covers various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the patient's specific needs and medical history.

Patients benefit from the clinic's multidisciplinary approach combining advanced diagnostic tools with innovative therapies. Treatment options may include minimally invasive procedures, targeted injections, physical therapy recommendations, and medication management when appropriate.

The East Tucson location provides convenient access for residents seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 520-229-2080 or visiting their website at desertskymedicine.com.

Desert Sky Spine and Pain helps patients avoid the cycle where pain disrupts sleep, work, and daily activities. Their goal is enabling patients to enjoy active, fulfilling lives without constant worry about pain flare-ups.
column11:
Reclaim your life with Desert Sky Spine & Pain.
We know what it feels like to be restricted by pain - to lose sleep, take time off work, to have to skip fun adventures or to constantly worry about disruptions in your life because of the next flare up. We want our patients to live life on their terms, enjoying active and fulfilling lives.

Most people wait until they are desperate to address their pain and at that point, they need strong medication to get their pain under control just to be able to sleep or make it through the day. This doesn't address the root of the pain and can become a vicious cycle.

At Desert Sky Spine & Pain, we believe in addressing the root issue behind your pain, so you don't have to worry about the next flare-up.

column3:
Apex Pain Specialists

Apex Pain Specialists provides comprehensive pain management services tailored to each patient's unique needs in Chandler, Arizona. Located at Dobson Town Place, 2705 S Alma School Rd, this premier clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions through personalized care plans.

Led by board-certified interventional pain experts Dr. Naveen Reddy and Dr. Maziar Massrour, the clinic offers specialized treatment for auto accident injuries, arthritis, spinal stenosis, herniated discs, back pain, and sciatica. Their multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures, physical therapy, medication management, and alternative medicine techniques.

Patients throughout Arizona seek treatment at Apex Pain Specialists for chronic and acute pain conditions. The clinic's physicians evaluate each case individually, developing targeted treatment plans that address the underlying causes of pain rather than just symptoms.

Dr. Reddy and Dr. Massrour bring extensive training and experience to their practice. Their interventional techniques include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. These minimally invasive procedures often provide relief when conservative treatments have failed.

The clinic emphasizes patient education and active participation in the healing process. Treatment plans may incorporate physical rehabilitation, medication optimization, and lifestyle modifications to maximize long-term pain relief.

Apex Pain Specialists accepts most insurance plans and offers convenient scheduling options. Their office features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable setting.

For pain management services in the Chandler area, contact Apex Pain Specialists at (480) 820-7246 or visit their website at www.apexpainspecialists.com.

column40: I love this place. They truly take constructive criticism and make necessary changes in the office to make the clients/patients more comfortable. Thank you for this- to the office staff & to the office manager who has personally set aside time to speak with me and hear me out.HUGE shout out to Kindra. She's as patient as her must patient patient even though she does her job of listening to our needs very seriously. Nothing gets by her. She determines what we feel is best for us and weighs that with her own vast expertise. In this- I can promise you- I've gotten some of the most effective treatment here ever in Tucson. Thank you, advanced pain management.|Kendra is always thorough.  I've seen some of the front office staff being short with some folks, but a lot of the negative reviews don't give the whole story.  First thing, the clinic doesn't drop patients for one failed screening. Yes, the clinic does have to be cautious because let's face it, a lot of the patients are seekers.  They're cautious because the state can shut them down, and then legit patients would be without care at all.  If you're failing screenings, you should really ask yourself what's important to you.  Pee don't lie.|Mohammed was courteous and helpful. Treatments  are not feasible because of my age (94] and just coming from rehab and hospitalization for almost 3 1/2 months because of Sepsis Shock Severe. ( A miracle to have survived.) However, we discussed options. Mohammed is a very pleasant person with a good attitude. I would recommend him dealing with others, the public. Thank you Mohammed.Sorry my post got all mixed up. There was more on the pleasant and positive  for  Mohammed.|Felt like I was cared about this being my second appointment and after MRIs were completed. Staff is wonderful. Very busy place, takes time to get scheduled for injection. Just moved here from Illinois, and trying to find new providers is frustrating, especially in todays world for those of us who truly are needing care for pain. First visit was not so great.|Today was my first time here. The front staff were so sweet. Cheerful and made it more comfortable for me, being a new client. Mickayla saw me first. Very personable and great at her job.  Angela ,(doc) I saw next ..great communication , knew exactly what I was saying. And is going to help treat my bad knee. .I look forward to my next appointment.i trust advanced pain management with my back and knee pain. Thanks to the wonderful treatment I received from the second I walked through the door!|They didn't tell me to bring my separation letter from my pain management from over a year ago, and nothing could be prescribed until they got it. Didn't matter anyway because they can't even prescribe the mg medication I need to just function. So I got a referral sent to a neurosurgeon and a wave out the door. And the doctor I saw had the bedside manner of a coffee table. This place might help people with a sprained ankle, but if you've got serious issues..run the other way.|Despite completing an enormous stack of new patient paperwork and bringing in a detailed meds list and medical history to my initial appt., I was told that I would need a release of my "contract" with the pain management clinic I went to prior to my recent major illness and ongoing pain from lumbar osteomyelitis. I was unaware that  I had a "contract" with the previous clinic, and they had no idea what I was talking about when I called them. Nevertheless, I was informed that the new clinic would not send my prescription to the pharmacy until they received a release, thus delaying the start of my pain medication.These clinics are now more concerned with what their lawyers say then what their patients legitimately need for treatment. I was also told that I could not have a drop of alcohol while in their care, something which completely ignored my case history and the requirements of the previous pain clinics I have been treated by. Had this been made clear to me in advance, I would have thought twice before coming here.The nurse practitioner I saw was totally humorless, and seemed more interested in completing her paperwork than listening to me describe my needs. In the 24 years since I visited my first pain Dr for treatment of sciatica, these practices have all become obsessed with control due to the opioid abuse epidemic, and they automatically assume their patients are addicts or potential addicts. I have been prescribed opiods dozens of times since I first experienced severe back pain in my teens, and I have never abused them in over 40 years. After my recent hospitalization, I reduced my meds consumption to 25% of what it had been with no assistance from any pain clinic. How dare they ignore my efforts to become opiod free and presume that I am just another junkie! I am not at all happy about the way I was treated here!|Exceptional care. She is a jewel in this practice that I look forward to working with in the future. She's professional, yet courteous and listens well to her patients. I highly recommend her and Advanced Pain Management to all levels of patients experiencing pain. Together, they will work to get at the root causes of your pain and develop solutions tailored to improve the quality of life we are all seeking. Kindra always goes beyond to ensure we understand all options available. Very glad we found her.  Best you've got in this practice.

He educated me and I felt confident in choosing him for the epidermal into my spine for my nerve pain. This is why the second star. Every visit with this Gilbert location and they request your insurance card, credit card and all the same intake questions for every single visit by email and when u arrive onsite.  (Super broken and annoying process). Post procedure and the pain level increased 5 times.  Afterwards I felt like something was trying to explode off my neck and upper back. I scheduled an appointment to see the doctor and was told that he doesn't do follow ups.  I have to see the PA and she will communicate with the doctor.  About 1.5 years ago I had this same procedure at a location in scottsdale and it was nothing like this.  I had relief and the doctor saw me post procedure.  I should have driven the extra 30 minutes to go back there instead of trying out The pain Experts and having a very poor experience.  I will update my review based on the appointment w the PA. column3:
AZ Pain Doctors provides comprehensive pain management services in Phoenix, Arizona. Our specialized team takes a complete approach to managing chronic and acute pain through advanced diagnostic techniques, innovative treatment methods, and personalized care plans. Located at Highland Avenue, our clinic combines medical expertise with compassionate patient care to help residents throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area find relief from debilitating pain conditions.

At AZ Pain Doctors, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our services include interventional pain procedures, medication management, chiropractic care, and advanced diagnostic assessments. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs of individual patients, targeting the root cause of pain rather than just symptoms. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and post-surgical pain.

Our Clinical Approach

Our physicians employ evidence-based practices to develop effective pain management strategies. The clinic utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment to accurately identify pain sources. Treatment options range from minimally invasive procedures to comprehensive rehabilitation programs. We emphasize patient education, ensuring you understand your condition and treatment options fully. Our goal is providing long-term pain relief while improving overall quality of life.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in building strong doctor-patient relationships based on trust and communication. Each patient receives personalized attention during their visits, with ample time to discuss concerns. Our staff coordinates care with other healthcare providers when necessary. We accommodate urgent pain issues with flexible scheduling options. The clinic environment is designed for comfort and accessibility.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with AZ Pain Doctors, call us at +1 602-795-8700. Our clinic is conveniently located at 2222 E Highland Ave, UNIT 220, Phoenix, AZ 85016. For more information about our services and treatment options, visit our website at https://azpaindoctors.com/. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to address financial concerns.

The wait times are always very minimal once your are checked in for your appointment.   The providers are very attentive and you are not rushed during your appointment time. They are worth all 5 stars and more.|I'm very grateful, that I am being cared for and that my needs are met!  Dr. Saran & Yvette Decker have always treated me well with dignity & respect!  I appreciate their knowledge & excellent bed side manner!|Doctor Saran cares listens and explains what to expect with any procedure. He is also friendly, kind does not rush, it is refreshing to have such a great doctor .Thank you Dr. Saran. The staff are very friendly and always will to go above and beyond. Thank you.|After reading some past reviews I was very skeptical About transferring over to this pain doctor. However, I am so glad I went ahead and went because Dr. Saran was one of the best pain doctors I have seen, He was very patient And professional took his time to listen to me. We went through a lot of my past history and my concerns from the last pain clinic I went to and he validated all those concerns I had.|Went for a appointment on 12/26/24 at 8am at the 72nd and bell location because my 80 year old grandmas right shoulder has been in pain. We went for the injection, waited an hour for them to come into the exam room that "unfortunately we needed to reschedule" because they didn't have the injection on site, we waited 1 week for this appointment and now they say we need to wait another week, all while my grandma is still in pain, horrible service, they were not prepared, and they were not even apologetic about the situation and every time I call Tracy the office manager at the Glendale location she never answers her phone and it's always going to voicemail.|Dr. Saran was friendly, professional and explained everything thoroughly. However, the office needs to improve communication between the front and back office staff and pay more attention to the doctor's orders. I was supposed to be fitted for a brace but the MA walked me to the desk to be checked out and disappeared. Dr. Saran told me to make an appointment for injections for the following Tuesday and I did not need pre authorization from Medicare then the receptionist told me I did need pre authorization and that it would take two weeks. Very confusing. Also, please update your system for collecting patient information. I had to fill out a ridiculous amount of paperwork (much of it was repetitious) even though I filled it out online. Though I really liked the doctor, the office staff leaves much to be desired.|I had a great experience for my first time.  They have a lot of knowledge and empathy towards their patients.  They made sure I understood everything and was happy with my visit.  Plus is they have a very nice looking Chiropractor with a great bedside manner!!!|Dear Az Pain Doctors ,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to formally express my dissatisfaction with the care I received during my recent visit on 12-05 -2024 and today 12-10 -2024 by Dr Daniel Baum.

During my appointments, I felt that the level of professionalism displayed was lacking. Specifically, I found the communication to be dismissive and lacking in empathy. I was referred to your clinic by my primary doctor for issues related to my neck and the left side of my body, including my left arm and shoulder, which are directly associated with a recent car accident car (my vehicle was on shop for 4 weeks ). However, during our consultation, I was surprised and disappointed to receive a diagnosis of arthritis, with the explanation that my age (nearly 40) is the likely cause.

I believe that attributing my symptoms solely to age, without considering the context of my recent accident, was both unprofessional and inappropriate. It felt as though my concerns and the specifics of my situation were not adequately acknowledged. This left me feeling frustrated and confused, as I expected a more nuanced understanding of my condition, especially given the circumstances.

I am reaching out to you because I believe it is crucial for your clinic to be aware of this experience. I hope that you can address this matter to improve the level of care and communication provided to your patients.

Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your prompt response regarding how you intend to address my concerns.

Sincerely,

Hilse Vera

Hope Clinic Non Invasive Pain Management is a specialized medical facility in Scottsdale, Arizona dedicated to providing comprehensive pain relief solutions without surgical intervention. Located at 15030 Hayden Rd #120, Scottsdale, AZ 85260, the clinic serves patients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area with evidence-based pain management techniques.

The clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through non-invasive approaches. Patients benefit from innovative therapies including therapeutic injections, physical rehabilitation, and integrative medicine approaches.

Hope Clinic's board-certified physicians bring extensive experience in pain management, neurology, and physical medicine. Their practitioners stay current with the latest advancements in non-surgical pain relief techniques.

The facility offers treatment for various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and sports injuries. column3:
Saguaro Pain Clinic

Saguaro Pain Clinic provides specialized interventional pain management services in Tempe, Arizona. Our medical team focuses on treating spine and joint pain through non-invasive procedures. Patients experiencing chronic pain conditions find comprehensive care at our modern facility.

We offer targeted treatments for back pain, neck pain, and joint discomfort. Our interventional approach means we address pain at its source. Treatment plans are customized for each patient's specific needs.

Our physicians combine extensive training with years of clinical experience. The clinic's specialists hold board certifications in pain management and anesthesiology. Our doctors regularly participate in continuing education to stay current with advanced pain relief techniques.

Services include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, and radiofrequency ablation. We also provide spinal cord stimulation and peripheral nerve blocks. Many patients experience significant pain reduction after appropriate interventional treatments.

The clinic's comfortable environment was designed with patient comfort in mind. Our Tempe location offers convenient access for East Valley residents. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment.

Visit us at 1001 E Warner Rd #103, Tempe, AZ 85284. Contact our office at +1 480-597-4321 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services at www.saguaropainclinic.com.
column11: Interventional pain management for patients seeking spine and joint pain relief through non-invasive procedures.

Advanced pain management does what the name says they manage my pain.  And they ALL treat people with the upmost respect.  From the Receptionist at the door to the doctors.  Doctor Johnson is very respectful too.  He is always polite and listens to me never rushing me or acting like I am lying.
I appreciate him and everyone who works there they are all very respectful e every time, it always gives me a good feeling.  It's because of them that I can get through my everyday chronic pain.
It's with all of heart that I thank all of you very very much.
God Bless.|I just met with Johnson Wong at APM and I had a great experience with becoming a new patient at this practice. Johnson took the time to talk with me about my history and really seemed to understand my specific pain issues and history of management. I'm really glad I found this practice, I feel like my medical history was taken seriously. The staff was really friendly and helpful too|Dr Johnson is very personal able. He takes his time explains things so the patient can understand it. It keeps the conversation real. He is a very nice person and a wonderful doctor. I would and have recommended him to my friends.|Johnson Wong has been incredibly helpful, consistently going above and beyond to assist me with whatever I need. What stands out even more is his genuine interest in my well-being. He always takes the time to ask how I'm doing and seems truly invested in making sure I'm comfortable and supported. It's rare to find someone who not only excels in their role but also brings such a personal touch to their interactions.|Dr. JOHNSON WONG is very attentive and listens. He is very patient and has done a great job taking care of my medical issues. He is best pain specialist I know and keeps it .|Review of Poor Patient Care Experience

I had an unfortunate experience with my ablation procedure on September 20, 2024, and I feel compelled to share my thoughts. While the staff was quick to attend to me, I felt the overall approach to patient care was severely lacking.

During my visit, I was brought back by a medical assistant who informed me of the procedure's name. After a brief discussion about my medical history with the anesthesiologist, I was put under anesthesia. When I woke up, I found myself sitting in a wheelchair in another room with very little monitoring. I was only observed for about 10 minutes before being sent out to my car while still feeling dazed and out of it.

What was particularly disheartening was that the doctor who performed my procedure never introduced themselves or discussed what I could expect during or after the procedure. I felt like just another name on a schedule, not a patient deserving of individualized attention. As someone who works in the medical field, I understand that these procedures are routine for medical professionals, but this was my first experience. I felt incredibly vulnerable when I woke up disoriented and without any information about what had transpired.

I am extremely disappointed in the patient care I received and am now apprehensive about future procedures. I hope that Advanced Pain Management can take this feedback seriously and work towards transforming their approach to offer more personalized care. Patients deserve to feel valued and cared for, not like they are just part of an assembly line.|Johnson Wong has consistently listened to my needs, curated a treatment plan, and been prompt in communications. Even with several SNAFUs with insurance and other doctors, he has provided the relief of my pain anxieties and my bizarre circumstances. I would say go to him, but i don't want him getting so crowded I can't be his patient.|Ever since I was a little kid, I was terrified of needles . I was the kid who would always say, "ok..wait wait wait ok I'm ready...no wait wait wait wait a minute." Now being an elderly adult you can best believe that now I'm going to be brave and say, wait wait wait wait wait a minute..some things just don't change, however, Dr Wong has the most amazing personality and patience for an elderly kid like me. I love coming to the Glendale clinic because the staff are phenomenal and Dr Wong is extremely supportive and knowledgeable about my various autoimmune diseases and he has the Midas touch when this scary elderly adult gets the trigger shots done. Dr Wong has a very strong understanding the unique needs of each of many pain scenarios that I live with. Some may wonder why I don't get a more aggressive treatment plan. Well unfortunately, I can't be sedated even lightly due to Hypoxia (COPD, and many other chronic conditions) so I depend on the extra calming attention. Thanks again for all your help. J. Smith

Pain Institute of Southern Arizona

Pain Institute of Southern Arizona offers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Tucson. Our specialized medical team treats chronic pain conditions resulting from illness, injury, or aging. Patients throughout Southern Arizona receive personalized care plans designed to restore quality of life and daily functioning.

Our distinguished pain specialists completed advanced training at prestigious institutions including Mayo Clinic, Stanford, and Harvard. This exceptional medical background ensures patients receive cutting-edge treatments using the latest evidence-based approaches. The clinic specializes in minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and innovative pain relief techniques.

The Pain Institute treats various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Treatment options range from epidural steroid injections to radiofrequency ablation and spinal cord stimulation. Each treatment plan addresses the underlying cause of pain rather than just symptoms.

Located at 7140 E Rosewood St in Tucson, our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. New patients can schedule consultations by calling (520) 999-9000. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to maximize coverage benefits.

Visit https://pisapain.com for more information about our services, providers, and treatment approaches. The Pain Institute of Southern Arizona remains committed to helping patients return to pain-free, active lifestyles.

Our goal is to help patients find relief from pain--helping them return to an enjoyable quality of life.

column3:
AZ Pain Doctors

AZ Pain Doctors is a specialized pain management clinic located in Goodyear, Arizona, dedicated to diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions. The practice focuses on identifying the root cause of pain before developing personalized treatment plans, moving beyond simply prescribing narcotic medications.

At our Goodyear clinic, we understand that chronic pain significantly impacts daily functioning and quality of life. Our approach begins with comprehensive diagnostic evaluations to determine the specific pain generator, as effective treatment requires accurate diagnosis. This evidence-based methodology ensures patients receive appropriate interventions rather than just symptom management.

The medical team at AZ Pain Doctors specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Our physicians combine extensive training in pain medicine with years of clinical experience to deliver advanced pain management solutions.

Our treatment options include minimally invasive procedures, targeted injections, physical therapy recommendations, and medication management when appropriate. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual patient needs and pain patterns.

The clinic's comfortable facility at 1325 N Litchfield Rd, Suite 120 in Goodyear serves patients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 602-795-8700.

For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at http://azpaindoctors.com/
column11: Chronic pain can be frustrating and debilitating. At AZ Pain Doctors, we understand the significant impact that pain can have on your quality of life. Oftentimes, patients are given powerful narcotic medications without a thorough diagnostic evaluation, or any other evidence-based treatments. Our practice philosophy is to first determine a diagnosis for your pain. It is very difficult to effectively treat pain without knowing the actual pain generator.

column3:
Advanced Pain Management

Advanced Pain Management stands as a premier pain management clinic serving the Phoenix metropolitan area and Tucson, Arizona for over two decades. With ten conveniently located offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson, the clinic provides comprehensive interventional pain management services for adults suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Led by distinguished specialists Dr. Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini and Dr. David Delatte, the clinic focuses on delivering long-term pain relief solutions through personalized treatment plans. Their interventional approach addresses the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. The medical team combines extensive clinical experience with advanced diagnostic techniques to accurately identify pain sources.

The clinic prioritizes patient accessibility by offering next-day appointments, ensuring prompt diagnosis and immediate treatment initiation. This commitment to timely care helps patients begin their recovery journey without unnecessary delays. Advanced Pain Management's philosophy centers on restoring quality of life through effective pain control strategies.

Services include comprehensive pain evaluations, minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and innovative therapies for conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. The clinic utilizes state-of-the-art technology for precise diagnosis and targeted treatments.

Patients appreciate the clinic's dedication to affordable care and convenient scheduling options. The welcoming environment and compassionate staff create a supportive atmosphere for those seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions.

Visit their main Phoenix location at 9620 N Metro Pkwy W, Suite 143, Phoenix, AZ 85051, or call +1 623-466-6350 to schedule an appointment. Additional information about services and locations is available at advancedpainmanagement.com.
column11: Welcome To Advanced Pain ManagementAdvanced Pain Management has been providing high-quality, convenient, and affordable pain management services for adults throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area and in Tucson, Arizona, for over 20 years. At their 10 offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson AZ, interventional pain management specialists Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini, MD, and David Delatte, MD, focus on providing patients with long-term pain relief from a variety of acute and chronic conditions.The practice offers next-day appointments, so patients can get an accurate diagnosis and begin treatment as soon as possible.
column38: Debbie Garrett|MzRena MzRena|tabby_chan|K|Wendi Farbstein|Tyrone Jones|Laura Delgado|Cindy Carrillo
column40:
I've been here at Advanced Pain Management - Metro for two months now and this is a good time to update my original review!
I knew it.... Alex is wonderful, she truly listens to me when I talk and she gives my experiences and my observations about myself, thoughtful consideration..
As I suspected after our first meeting, she's a gifted, outstanding provider.
I've never gotten the impression that she was running behind and had to rush through our appointment to get to her next patient.
I believe she's truly committed to my wellbeing and she's properly educated and determined enough to make it happen. I'm having frequent appointments while we're getting procedures, treatments, and medication straightened out.
I've made substantial improvements in my day to day abilities and the quality of my life.  I'm very hopeful that my progress will continue.
I haven't been this hopeful for so many years.
If you like numbers the way that I like numbers, I'll give you mine now. I'd say I'm at 30/30. Overall, my day-to-day abilities have increased by at least 30% and my pain has decreased at least 30%. If you have severe chronic pain like I do, you'll understand the significance of those numbers.
The office runs like a top, they are very efficient and they don't waste my time.
With that said, if you make an appointment... Don't be late, I've been told that they do not see patients who are late.
That's the only way to keep an office running like a top.

Original review:
Just finished my first appointment and so far so good.
I feel very hopeful with Alexandra as my provider. We've already scheduled a procedure and some different medications and am awaiting the scheduling of physical therapy. I'll be updating my review as my nightmarish pain is relieved  and I get a bit of my life  back. I'm looking forward to earning decent  money again!
The office seems to run like a top!
So be on time to any appointments you schedule!|Alex and staff are great, always professional and friendly.  The office space is always clean no matter how crowded it is. column3:
Arizona Pain | Glendale

Arizona Pain in Glendale was founded with a clear mission: to provide world-class pain management care equivalent to what we would want for our own family members. Our comprehensive pain management clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through innovative, multidisciplinary approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our team of board-certified pain specialists offers advanced interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies. We focus on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients benefit from our holistic treatment plans that may include nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and regenerative medicine options.

The Glendale clinic features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and treatment facilities. Our physicians have extensive training in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and physical rehabilitation. Many of our doctors completed fellowships at prestigious medical institutions and regularly contribute to pain management research and education.

Arizona Pain serves patients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area with convenient locations in Scottsdale, Glendale, Gilbert, and Chandler. We treat various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

New patients receive thorough evaluations to develop personalized treatment strategies. Our goal is helping patients return to daily activities with improved function and reduced pain levels. We accept most major insurance plans and work closely with referring physicians.

Visit our Glendale office at 18555 N 79th Ave d101, Glendale, AZ 85308, or call +1 480-525-6605 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about pain conditions and treatment options at https://arizonapainrelief.com/.

By visiting Arizona Pain, you can help find out what your pain issue may be, what the comprehensive options are for treatment, what tools are used when getting treatment and how to find a doctor in your area.
Come see us at one of our conveniently located Phoenix valley offices (Scottsdale, Glendale, Gilbert, and Chandler).

column3:
Arizona Pain Care Center is a specialized medical facility dedicated to diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions. Located in Glendale, Arizona, our center provides comprehensive pain management services to help patients regain control of their lives and improve their overall well-being.

At Arizona Pain Care Center, we focus on enhancing patients' quality of life through effective pain syndrome diagnosis and treatment. Our approach combines medical expertise with personalized care plans tailored to each individual's needs. We offer a wide range of services including:

- Interventional pain procedures

- Medication management

- Diagnostic evaluations

- Customized treatment plans

- Follow-up care

On-Site Fluoroscopy Suite

Our facility features a state-of-the-art fluoroscopy suite that allows us to perform many procedures in-house. This advanced imaging capability enables precise treatment delivery while saving patients from costly hospital fees. Procedures performed on-site include:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Nerve blocks

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation trials

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our team takes time to understand each patient's unique situation, developing individualized treatment strategies that address both symptoms and underlying causes. Our commitment to personalized care means we:

- Listen carefully to patient concerns

- Explain treatment options thoroughly

- Set realistic expectations

- Provide ongoing support

- Adjust treatments as needed

Contact Information

Arizona Pain Care Center is conveniently located at 17100 N 67th Ave, Suite 600, Glendale, AZ 85308. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at +1 623-263-6340 or visit our website at [www.azpaincarecenter.com](https://www.azpaincarecenter.com/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=gbp&utm_id=google).
column11:
The goal of the physicians and staff at Arizona Pain Care Center is to improve our patient's quality of life by restoring function and reducing chronic pain.

We diagnose pain syndromes and primarily treat these conditions using injective therapy. Our facility allows for us to perform many of the procedures in our fluoroscopy suite, saving our patients money that could be associated with hospital fees.

I have been a patient at AZ Pain Care Center for a few years. I've had a number of successful treatments at the pain center. It became time to move to palliative care, but the transition became unexpectedly complicated. Shannon Morgenstern went above and beyond to manage my case, and I cannot thank her enough. Scott W|I have been in pain for almost 1 month after a procedure that Dr Patel recommended. He claims he sent orders to the veterans for some pain relief for me. They never got any order.so tonight is Friday and Dr Patel is off tomorrow so I don't get to find out what is going on with my procedure till Monday. What would you do?You can't park anywhere because of all of the other business when it's busy. My pain is worse.|I would not recommend this clinic for numerous reasons. First, their office is open to the waiting room and you can hear everything that is being said on the phone because they use phones and not headsets. So anything you say on the phone is going to be heard by everyone in the waiting room. Second, the front desk clerk seems to have no idea about dealing with insurance companies in orders. Third, the nurse practitioner couldn't even take my blood pressure with a regular cough. She didn't know what she was doing. Plus, she took me off of a medication that my primary doc said was no problem to use as long as you didn't use too much at a time. That medicine was important to me. My overall experience is that I am not going back to this location again|I made an appointment with Dr. Patel through his staff and was given the first available time which was almost immediately.  My lower back was excruciatingly in pain.  I could not walk upright or sit without being in pain. From 1 to 10, my pain was 10!!  Dr. Patel was very compassionate and prescribed some pain medicine for me over the weekend and was lined up for a MRI the following week.  Dr. Patel mapped out a plan for getting me well after he could view the MRI results.  Over the weekend, the pain in my back dramatically decreased with the use of the pain medicine.  On Monday, I canceled my MRI and all of my future appointments because my pain had decreased so much that I knew that I could heal on my own.  I did have a follow up Face Time with one of the Nurses at the pain center because they are truly concerned with each. patient.  If I am ever in pain again, I will make another appointment and do recommend to anyone that who is having back pain to contact Arizona Pain Care Center.  They are there to help you and do understand your pain!

Jim Flemming|I do not recommend this clinic. After being put on oxycodone I was informed I could never have another drink again. I have had back pain for 15 to 20 years I used kratom and alcohol to stop the pain. I told them what I was doing day 1.
They put me on oxycodone. It helped 100 %. I was told I could never have another drink and never have take kratom. I tried to explain that getting off kratom might take awhile. They seemed to understand.
I never used alcohol very much. They told me taking kratom and alcohol could make me depressed. Instead of working with me they refused to renew my prescription they immediately took me off. I tried to explain it might take awhile to stop kratom and I thought stating a I could never have another drink seemed a little harsh. But there was no explaining anything to them.
There was no weening myself of the oxycodone, kratom or alcohol.
I do not recommend this clinic. Try another place that might listen to you.
Also if I smoked weed (which I do not) that would have been fine. I took no illegal drugs. They made a lot of money from the insurance company so I guess it worked out for them.|My experience with AZ pain care center has been better than other pain mgmt practices. My provider is Shannon. Every aspect of her care has been professional and friendly. All of the injections she has performed on me have been quite effective. Also the office staff is friendly and never drop the ball.|Shannon Morgenstern, NP-C went above and beyond helping me dealing with post operative suture pain, 6 days after, in  office. She took the necessary time, expertise and care!

column48: Am I a good candidate for PRP hair regrowth if my hair is thinning?

Pain Solutions Medical Group offers comprehensive pain management services throughout Arizona. With multiple locations in Chandler, Phoenix, Mesa, Tucson, Avondale, Tempe, Scottsdale, Goodyear, Litchfield Park, Tolleson and surrounding areas, our clinic specializes in treating personal injury patients with effective pain relief solutions.

The medical team utilizes evidence-based approaches for both acute and chronic pain conditions.

We treat various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, accident injuries, and work-related injuries. Our comprehensive treatment plans may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and rehabilitation services. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual patient needs.

As personal injury specialists, we work closely with insurance providers and legal representatives to document treatment progress. Our clinic provides detailed medical documentation for personal injury cases while focusing on patient recovery.

New patients can expect thorough evaluations during their first visit. Most insurance plans are accepted, and our staff assists with paperwork requirements. Same-week appointments are often available for urgent pain concerns.

Contact Pain Solutions Medical Group at (480) 855-0557 to schedule a consultation or visit http://painsolutionsaz.com/ for more information about our services and locations throughout Arizona.

Our clinic specializes in:
