column40:
Dr  Lakshman Gollapalli, MD is by far the most compassionate, caring, honest, genuine pain Management Dr. I have ever encountered .   He has amazing active listening skills and takes the time you need without feeling like you have to rush.    I have recommended family and friends to this amazing Dr. and they all love him too!
Thank you so much Dr. Gollapalli for  all you do!    Happy New Year!!!
B|I've been going to APM since before Dr. G came into play, but I will say this, he is a great Dr. he listens to his patients and he goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable with any treatments he gives. Dr. G is highly intelligent and the staff there are all Aces with Me and My Husband John P. Thank you APM for always listening to  me ranting and still being so kind!!!!!!|I got dc for asking a question to the person who answers the phone. 7 yrs I've known them. Epidurals are not FDA approved and what is going on. They kicked me out for asking a question. Difference between aggressive and assertive and being intelligent. I have lupus and I'm an amputee. Will be reporting for PT abuse immediately. U cannot show any emotion either states a contract. I asked a valid question. My pt rights were violated. Ty for nothing. Those epidurals Illegal in other countries. I didn't even know I was kicked out of the office until I called to ask about a nerve block. I guess I'm not allowed to be intelligent. Absolute patient abuse and never again is anybody going to abuse me medically. I know my rights. A little too well. I feel like the lower part of my back is fused that shouldn't be. And I can barely pick up the good leg that I do have left because I'm an amputee Jerry was always amazing with me and then Dr gee took over and he never listened to me he never wanted to. So now I'm looking into palliative care because it's so bad and I'm getting an advocate. I was left with one month of prescriptions and no referral for continuity of care. They said that I was going to the supreme Court and I don't know anybody at the supreme Court but a lady by the native of Claudia morandi she is an advocate for pain patients and she is the one who is advocating for us not me but now she she has certainly heard my story. I am very heartbroken because I was with Jerry for about 7 years after I became an amputee and he helped me immediately and once Dr g got his hands in the mix everything was messed up and now I have no quality of life and I'm going down fast. This will also go in my article for the American psychology association because once you are done with my spine you knew that you wouldn't be making any more money off me be informing my insurance company as well. Ask questions please. I will never be the same again.

And now I will be taking legal action|right off 101/ Ray rd. Dr g is one smart guy, attentive, and listens . he, his pa, np's truly want the best for us.
thanks to all ya for r tolerating me!|I had my first appointment at Advanced Pain Modalities last month and was extremely impressed with Dr. Gollapalli.
He put me at ease with his kind and personable demeanor as soon as I met him.
Dr. Gollapalli was kind, empathetic, intelligent, and highly knowledgeable.
He understood my autioimmune conditon well, which causes chronic pain as well as other symptoms.
I was also a former patient of Gerard Quigley at my previous pain specialist office. He is now a practitioner at APM.  He was always empathetic, intelligent, and highly knowledgeable as well.
Mirabelle is a very helpful, kind, and professional front office medical assistant.
I would highly recommend Advanced Pain Modalities to anyone looking for a pain specialist clinic.|Dr. G and Gerard are 2 of the most amazing health providers I have ever had.  I am always spoken to with dignity and respect.  They look for solutions to the pain not just a band aid!|Dr. Gallipoli is amazing. Listens to YOU and hears YOU!  Gerard also in his office is great. They work to HELP you not just give a band aid|I have been blessed to be a patient of Dr. G's for several years.  He is truly one of the most caring and compassionate doctors I have ever met.  He is extremely knowledgeable and takes excellent care of me.  I had a life changing traumatic accident in 2008 which has left me disabled and in chronic pain.  (I fell over 8 feet and broke my thoracic spine in 7 places, broke apart my tailbone, suffered other injuries and also battle with chronic neuropathic pain throughout my body).  Through Dr. G's expertise and phenomenal care, he has improved my quality of life.  I cannot thank him enough for ALL he has done for me and continues to do for me.  I highly recommend Dr. G to anyone who suffers with complex pain issues and disorders.  He is the best!

AZ Pain Doctors

AZ Pain Doctors offers comprehensive pain management services in Paradise Valley, Arizona. Our clinic specializes in treating both chronic and acute pain conditions using advanced diagnostic techniques and personalized treatment plans.

Our team takes a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, combining interventional procedures, medication management, and chiropractic care. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we develop individualized treatment strategies for optimal results.

The clinic's pain specialists are board-certified with extensive training in pain medicine. Our physicians stay current with the latest advancements in pain management to provide evidence-based treatments for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathy.

At our Paradise Valley location, patients benefit from comprehensive evaluations and targeted therapies. We offer minimally invasive procedures, spinal injections, nerve blocks, and regenerative medicine options when appropriate.

Our facility at 10565 N Tatum Blvd features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. New patients are welcome, and we work with most major insurance providers.

Contact AZ Pain Doctors today at (602) 795-8700 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at https://azpaindoctors.com/

Dr. Ray is an excellent physician and diagnostician who is concerned with his patients' well being.|Britney has stayed on top of my pain management needs, including doing nerve blocks. Her staff works really hard to handle my insurance company to get the treatment I need.|I've had an exceptional experience with Dr. Neil Thakker and Brittany Kalupski at AZ Pain Doctors, particularly at their Paradise Valley office. Their commitment to punctuality is impressive, with appointments starting on time 95% of the time. The office staff deserves a shoutout for their courteous, efficient, and accommodating nature.
Dr. Thakker has been phenomenal in conducting my outpatient procedures for lower back and SI joint pain, showing a high level of expertise and care. Brittany has been instrumental in my pain management journey, offering effective medication plans and physical therapy guidance.
For anyone struggling with similar issues, I highly recommend visiting their website to learn more about their services. It's also worth reading other reviews to get a broader perspective on their pain management expertise and outstanding care.|Dr. Sharma and his staff who treated me were wonderful!|I was feeling mixed feelings about coming to the pain center. I have stage 4 Cancer and I was worried they wouldn't understand the pain I was experiencing,  but I was wrong. The Doctor was kind and really understood and listened to me . Together we worked at a plan to control my pain and my quality of life, Thank you all.|Dr. Thakkar and his team, including the amazing front office staff are Phenomenal!  The entire staff from the front office to the MAs in back office are friendly, warm, and caring yet professional. Dr.Thakkar is a wonderful physician and has helped me manage very difficult pain control issues. His PA, Brittany is also a wonderful practitioner. She is compassionate and engaging as well as extremely knowledgeable. I won't go anywhere else!|Caring staff except poor on paperwork, charting correct side of body to be treated as well as forwarding said information to surgical clinic. Asked to speak to the practice manager as for the 3rd time the wrong procedure was scheduled and needed to express my sincere concerns, was placed on hold for over 5 minutes. So called back and was informed that the manager is not in the office until Wednesday of the following weeks, today is Friday, quite a long hold time!

Dr Thakkar is most excellent, fully explains procedure and any and all information asked, his staff's charting is sorely lacking. The patient is my mother who is disabled from a stroke. If I was not there to advocate for her I shutter to think of what medical outcome she would have had.

Anyone seeking the excellent care of Dr Thakkar, make sure that all information is correct, what is being treated, the side, the procedure notated by staff. As I am finishing this review, I received a call from the practice saying that the procedure (an ablation) originally schedule that was incorrectly scheduled as a nerve block on the opposite side of body has now been corrected. I cannot say if indeed we shall proceed with this appointment, as excellent as Dr Thakkar is. TBC

Refused to cooperate with my insurance to send additional chart notes so I could get a prescription for an OTC lidocaine patch. Literally any chart notes or MRI would have gotten it approved. I highly do not recommend honor health for any services at all from emergency dept to specialists.|Small parking lot, couldn't get a parking spot in their lot. Lady at the desk was quite unpleasant and cold. The music in the waiting room is loud.|Had my first Cervical ESI injection and was apprehensive and nervous, but the entire staff treats you with respect and so caring and nurturing they put me at ease. They told me it really wouldn't be that bad, and they were right! Highly recommend Dr. Kubitz and he communicated with me every step of the procedure. The only "pain" I felt was one little poke for the numbing, and then I didn't feel anything else. I had no sedation and I'm glad I chose that route as to me a IV is much more painful than that one little prick to numb, and probably would take longer than the entire procedure I had was as I am a "difficult poke". Great staff!|What a Great Staff you have! 5-Stars to the person answering the phone, the front desk staff, the pre and post procedure care teams and Dr. Grove. You were amazing! Thank you 'all' for the compassionate care!|I have been a patient here for almost a year and I must say this clinic is by far the best I have ever been to. Everyone is so caring & thorough. I have been to multiple surgery centers and because I've experienced such miss treatment, that when I had my first visit here it completely caught me off guard.
Even the front desk staff are wonderful & very respectful. The thing I admire the most is their ability to empathize with a patient in pain and go above and beyond to try to make you as comfortable as possible.|This was my first visit to the Honor Health Pain Management Center at East Union Hills Drive in Phoenix. I was not disappointed. The experience far surpassed my expectations. My procedure was for a lumbar epidural with Dr. Mosallaie. I arrived early, processed paperwork and waited a very short time. They actually got me in early to my surprise. The center is efficiently run, speedy, professional and the nursing staff is extremely courteous, caring and helpful. Things moved right along. The operating room when I entered was staffed my the doctor and five or six assistants busy at work. My X-rays were projected and I was immediately ready to go under twilight sedation. Next thing I knew, it was over. Now that I'm home, I'm eager to see in a few days how successful it was. The only DOWNSIDE to the visit was I was unable to speak with the doctor himself.|Best staff ANYWHERE! Dr. Grove is so compassionate and a real joy to work with! He's assembled a good staff around him! This place is wonderful for quick procedures. Thank you for taking such good care of me! :)|I came in for a medial branch block.
The entire staff was incredibly nice. The nurses even took time to play with my 2 year old to entertain him while i was in operation. All paperwork was confirmed 3 fold to ensure everything was right.
Very professional.

My overall experience was excellent. One incident stood out to me as incredible, and I wanted to share. Having dyslexia, makes completing paperwork, even on a computer, a truly tedious task. Your receptionist, Alicia, not only asked me how my work was coming along (I'm constantly asked that),  but she asked me if she could help me. Never having been helped, I wasn't sure. But she orally asked me the questions and we were done quietly and quickly. Alicia, thank you!!|Dr. Hadaad was so thorough, friendly, respectful and patient. She explained my upcoming procedure so well and was kind when I changed my mind on one of the procedure options.  The office staff were also super.   What a welcoming experience  to a new patient!|Dr. Paul Overdorf DO is an awesome Pain and Wellness Physician. He is kind, attentive and provides in depth details to each patient. For me, he explained my medical conditions to my understanding and next steps. Also, the staff was professional and kind during the my visit. I highly recommend Innovative Pain and Wellness as a go to for your pain related issues. I appreciate them all.|Dr. Overdorf has been wonderful throughout all of the times I have seen him. He has gone over my images with me and talked through my options for care moving forward. He takes the time to listen and seems like he truly cares about his patients. The office is very nice as well.|This location is clean, staff is very nice and welcoming! Came and did cryotherapy(1st time here), best experience so far! Any questions I had staff answered and I didn't feel pressure to buy anything. Staff was super helpful when booking appointments. The systems here are very modern and work great! I recommend checking if they have any packages on groupon (great savings). Other than that prices are fair for the experience you get here!

(If you found this helpful be sure to hit the thumbs up button.)

Update: I've been here 5 times now , and still love it here. Got a completely different staff and they still were so sweet and helpful.|Dr. Haddad & her staff deserve at least 5 stars.  Very caring office that is working hard to find ways to fix my pain.  She is leaving no stone unturned.  Never makes you feel rushed, takes the time to explain things which may require doing it more than once because sometimes it takes a while till I grasp things.
If you need pain management, she's a great find!|I would have given this medical group a 5-star.  The staff was great and the doctor visit was great.  He listened to my concerns, was knowledgeable, and explained the options depending on my MRI results.  Part of my decision to go to this practice instead of another was that it wouldn't take very long to get an appointment and others were booked way out.

So here is were the 1 Star comes in!  I was not told that the doctor I was seeing was only temporary.  Also, I expected a call from eSMIL to schedule my MRI within a day or two of my appointment, which has been typical of other doctors I go to.

I waited a week for the order to come through.  No call, so I called the office.  They simply said that he hadn't sent in the MRI order yet, and that he would.  I ended up calling back at least another couple of times...I think more.  I didn't keep track.  It is now a month and a half after my appointment, and still no MRI order which the doctor agreed was necessary.

I called today, and now they tell me that he is no longer practicing there.  This is when they told me he was only temporary.  I told them I had called several times.  If he was only temporary, why didn't they tell me that and set me up with another doctor?

She said that they had other transitions in staff...not just the doctor I was seeing.

So basically they likely didn't follow up with other patients as well as myself.  I'm sure they have many patients who have had similar experiences, though I can't be sure of course.

What it comes down to is...Someone should have been immediately assigned to me, and I should have been contacted about the change and not told each time that he just hadn't gotten to ordering the MRI yet.  Some other Dr. should have called in the order, and I should have been informed and asked if I wanted to accept an alternate doctor.|Dr. Overdorf performed the Intracept procedure on 3 vertebrae that have caused me pain for years. The relief I felt after six weeks was significant. I would recommend anyone suffering with back pain consider Intracept as a possible solution.

column3:
Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) delivers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Mesa, Arizona. Our practice focuses on creating individualized treatment programs for patients experiencing acute and chronic pain conditions. Each care plan is driven by our physician-developed outcomes program that tracks progress and ensures effective pain relief.

At ASAP, we welcome patients at any stage of their pain journey. Whether you're experiencing recent low back pain with no prior treatment or dealing with complex pain issues following multiple surgeries, our team provides thorough evaluations and personalized care plans. We offer:

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Advanced diagnostic imaging

  • Medication management

  • Interventional procedures and injections

  • Coordination with physical therapy

  • Chiropractic care referrals

Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by Board Certified pain specialists with extensive training in interventional techniques. Our non-physician providers typically bring years of specialized experience in pain management. This combination of expertise allows us to address complex pain conditions with the most current evidence-based approaches.

Stepwise Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in starting with conservative treatments when appropriate. Our physicians develop customized care plans that may include medication management, therapeutic exercises, and minimally invasive procedures. This measured approach helps patients find relief while minimizing risks.

Visit Our Mesa Location

Advanced Spine and Pain welcomes new patients at our convenient Mesa office. Contact us to schedule your consultation:

Address: 4566 E Inverness Ave STE 205, Mesa, AZ 85206

Phone: (480) 573-0130

Jenise was amazing and actually wanted me to understand my condition.|There is no better doctor that will care for you than Dr. Todd Turley. At most doctors offices you love the staff and the doctor isn't great, or the other way around. At ASAP the office is amazing and the doctors are absolutely amazing. If you have a bad experience with staff or doctors here I promise you it's not because of them!|I feel I need to share my horrible experience here. I have had to have lower lumbar epidurals a lot over the past 12 years. I have never had to be sedated and they have been painless procedures, that is,....... until I came here! Dr Turley did my procedure and I had a shock sensation during all 3 epidurals, the last being the worst. Shock from lower back all the way to my toes, front and back. I now have nerve damage and blown veins, swelling, in my legs and struggle, even more, with walking. I did give opportunity for correction and was told that if no other doctor did this to me, the other pain doctors did the procedure wrong. I don't even know what to say.

The practice delivers comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area. Their board-certified physicians combine evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

The clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Their multidisciplinary approach incorporates interventional procedures, medication management, and physical therapy recommendations to address pain at its source.

Dr. James Henderson, the clinic's medical director, brings over 15 years of experience in pain management. After completing his medical degree at Johns Hopkins University, he pursued specialized fellowship training in interventional pain techniques at Mayo Clinic. The clinical team includes pain specialists with backgrounds in anesthesiology, physical medicine, and rehabilitation.

West Valley Pain Solutions offers advanced diagnostic capabilities and minimally invasive treatments. Services include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication therapies. The clinic emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction.

New patients can expect thorough evaluations during their first visit. The team develops individualized treatment plans focusing on improving quality of life and daily functioning. Most insurance plans are accepted, including Medicare and Arizona Medicaid.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can visit https://westvalleypainsolutions.com/ or call their Phoenix office directly.

Led by specialists Dr. Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini and Dr. David Delatte, the practice emphasizes comprehensive care with convenient next-day appointments. With 10 conveniently located offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson, patients can access high-quality care close to home. The Surprise location at 14811 W Bell Rd serves patients with the same commitment to excellence found across all their facilities.

column40:
I've been with OnCall for several years. I love the fact that appointments are via video. Due to my disability, I have a lot of doctor appointments, and getting to do one I have scheduled regularly via video makes things so much easier for me! Also, OnCall knows what they are doing and they are great at it. If I run into problems at the pharmacy or insurance, OnCall is right on top of it and they get things straightened out so quickly. My provider, Leah, is AWESOME!! She is so nice and she cares about the fine details. Caring about the fine details now helps to prevent issues later (I often have issues with the pharmacy and her attention to detail has helped so much). I will be with OnCall for a very long time!!!|Extremely happy to have found this office. They listen, understand patients, and actually care about their patients health. My provider has been so helpful in getting me a regimen to control my chronic pain and all the medical assistance are responsive and attentive. Love On Call Pain clinic, can't go wrong with trusting them with your chronic pain.|I have been with OnCall Pain since they went virtual. They are very compassionate about you the patient. I was able to get a MRI, bone density test, nerve study, ortho brace, surgery consult so many different special referrals in the last 2 years the doctors really care about you and your pain. When I first started OnCall Pain I was on a walker and had very little activity.  Now I am active again because OnCall Pain helps me manage the pain. They taught me new ways to manage my pain, sometimes just tying new things each month.|I have been with OnCall Pain for two years now!  I have been able to return to a normal everyday productive life with all their help!  The best experience with Pain Management I've had since having to be in this type of care!  Five star experience with providers and staff! Thank you for all you do OnCall!!
Happy Holidays!!|So glad I found this clinic! Ashley took the time get to know me as a person and addressed all my issues in a very empathic and professional way. I've had two compression fractures in my spine, arthritis and bone spurs and a myriad of other things that cause chronic pain. I've been receiving interventional treatments from another pain management clinic such as nerve blocks and RFA treatments. They were still not able to control my pain although I highly recommend the ablation since it did provide some relief, but since I was honest about being a sober alcoholic for the last 2.5 years they dismissed any other valid pain medication options for me. I had tried multiple non narcotic medications, physical therapy and massage and chiropractic work with them but I was still at the end of my rope. On call pain is very serious about the management of opioid therapy therapeutically and I am so grateful to them for seeing me as a person and not a label like a lot of pain management doctors out there. I can actually do housework without having to be in bed flat on my back afterwards. I can't say enough good things about this clinic. Thank you again!|They are so good. They actually treat you as a human being, listen to your unique circumstances, diseases, etc.
Make a plan that is built for you and with you. There are no hidden agendas or medications that they are trying to have you take for their own reasons. I feel that they actually care about my quality of life and that I am not just a number.
I had a local person for over a year, and all she did was decide that every person really just had fibromyalgia and needed to take ever-increasing doses of Lyrica, which in my case caused a great deal of damage to my already damaged joints.
I have been with OnCall for over 4 years now. They were and are my miracle. I spend at least a thousand dollars a month on interventional pain procedures, not just medications. That's what so many pharmacists don't know or care about. They just think they are going to save the world and those of us who NEED help are the ones creating the problems, in their minds.

I understand for my circumstances that I will never be pain free and don't expect to be. But I think we all deserve to have some quality of life. And they have given me that!|I have been a CPP for 25 years and am so blessed to have found care at OnCall Pain. I am able to receive compassionate care from the comfort of my home without judgement. I have complex needs and appreciate that my provider treats me like a human being, always providing new ideas for things to try outside of just medications which I appreciate!|This is my In-Depth Review of OnCall Pain Management

I have had an exceptional experience with OnCall Pain Management's online service, and I feel compelled to share my positive experience.

Their Thoughtful and Responsible Approach
What truly sets OnCall Pain Management apart is their thoughtful and responsible approach to pain management. From the very first consultation, it was evident that their priority was not just to provide relief, but to genuinely understand the nature of my pain. Their team took the time to listen, ask pertinent questions, and create a tailored pain management plan that addressed my specific needs. This personalized care made me feel valued and heard, which is something I haven't always experienced with traditional medical services.

The Convenience of Online Consultations
The convenience of online consultations cannot be overstated. In today's fast-paced world, being able to access high-quality medical advice and pain management from the comfort of my home has been a game-changer. The process is seamless, from scheduling appointments to receiving prescriptions and follow-up care. The platform is user-friendly, ensuring that even those who are not tech-savvy can navigate it with ease. The flexibility of online consultations has eliminated the stress and inconvenience of traveling to appointments, especially during times when I'm in significant pain.

The Accessibility without Compromise
One of the standout features of OnCall Pain Management is their ability to maintain a high standard of care without compromising accessibility. The online nature of their service ensures that individuals from various locations can receive expert pain management advice and treatment. This is particularly beneficial for those who may not have easy access to specialized pain management clinics or who live in remote areas. Despite the virtual format, the quality of care is never compromised. In fact, the thoroughness and attention to detail provided by the OnCall team are on par with, if not superior to, in-person consultations I've had in the past.

Their Commitment to Patient Well-Being
I am deeply grateful for OnCall Pain Management's unwavering commitment to patient well-being. Their holistic approach considers not only the physical aspects of pain but also the emotional and psychological impact it can have. They offer comprehensive support that includes education about pain management techniques, lifestyle adjustments, and coping strategies. This holistic care approach has been instrumental in improving my overall quality of life, not just managing my pain.

Modern, User-Friendly Approach
Lastly, the modern and user-friendly approach of OnCall Pain Management deserves special mention. The platform is intuitive, the communication is prompt and clear, and the overall experience is designed with the patient in mind. Every interaction, from initial contact to follow-up, has been professional and compassionate. Their dedication to leveraging modern technology to improve patient outcomes is truly commendable.

My Personal Conclusion
My experience with OnCall Pain Management has been nothing short of exceptional. They have redefined pain management with their thoughtful, accessible, and patient-centric approach. I highly recommend their services to anyone seeking effective and empathetic pain management solutions. Grateful for their commitment to patient well-being and the modern, user-friendly approach to pain management, I can confidently say that OnCall has significantly improved my life.

Canyon Pain Center is a premier pain management and chiropractic clinic serving Phoenix residents with comprehensive care solutions. Premier Pain Management is a specialized pain treatment clinic located in Maryvale, Phoenix. Our facility at 7141 W Thomas Rd #101, Phoenix, AZ 85033 offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area.

We focus on personalized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our physicians combine interventional procedures with medication management when appropriate. Patients receive thorough evaluations before any treatment recommendations are made.

Specialized Services

  • Interventional pain procedures
  • Spinal cord stimulation
  • Joint injections and nerve blocks
  • Radiofrequency ablation

    • Conditions We Treat

    Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. We also address complex regional pain syndrome and fibromyalgia.

column3:
Integrated Pain Consultants

Integrated Pain Consultants provides comprehensive pain management services at their Scottsdale, Mesa, and Phoenix, Arizona locations. The clinic specializes in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized interventional approaches.

Led by Dr. Nikesh Seth, a double board-certified anesthesiologist and interventional pain management expert, the practice brings decades of specialized education and clinical experience to Arizona patients. Dr. Seth works alongside skilled colleagues including Dr. Shawnjeet Saini, Dr. Jose Chavez, and a team of experienced nurse practitioners.

The clinic offers targeted treatments for various spinal conditions including sciatica, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, scoliosis, and failed back surgery syndrome. Their comprehensive approach addresses neck pain, back pain, and other chronic pain conditions that impact daily functioning.

Patients seeking non-surgical pain relief options can access innovative interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. The practice focuses on improving mobility and quality of life through minimally invasive techniques.

Their Mesa office is conveniently located at 4824 E Baseline Rd, Suite 140. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 480-626-2552 or visiting their website at https://www.azipc.com/ for more information about available treatments and locations.
column11:

Double board-certified anesthesiologist and interventional pain management expert Nikesh Seth, MD, his colleagues Shawnjeet Saini, MD, Jose Chavez, DO, and the team's highly skilled nurse practitioners, offer comprehensive relief from all types of acute and chronic pain.
The Integrated Pain Consultants team diagnoses and treats numerous causes of neck and back pain. These include sciatica, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, scoliosis, and failed back surgery syndrome.

Phoenician Pain & Rehabilitation Center offers comprehensive pain management services in Chandler, Arizona. This physician-owned practice is led by Shimul Sahai, MD, who brings specialized expertise to treating both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center takes a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, focusing on personalized treatment plans for each patient.

Patients seeking relief from back pain, knee pain, hip discomfort, sciatica, and arthritis find specialized care at this Chandler clinic. The medical team conducts thorough assessments including focused joint examinations and functional evaluations. These assessments examine gait patterns, balance capabilities, and physical endurance levels to understand pain's impact on daily functioning.

Dr. Sahai and her dedicated staff prioritize compassionate care in a welcoming environment. The clinic's philosophy centers on attentive listening to develop customized treatment strategies. As a small practice, they provide individualized attention rarely found in larger medical facilities.

The center offers interventional pain management techniques alongside rehabilitation services. Their holistic approach addresses both pain symptoms and underlying causes. Treatment plans may incorporate various modalities based on each patient's specific needs and medical history.

Located at 963 N McQueen Rd in Chandler, Arizona 85225, the clinic serves patients throughout the East Valley area. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 480-398-1940 or visit their website at www.phoenicianpain.com for more information about services and treatment options.

column40:
My first experience with them was nothing short of a nightmare. I arrived 15 minutes late after mistakenly going to a pain location with a similar name on Bell Rd., only to discover their location was on 91st--quite a distance away. As a single mother juggling an infant and a busy schedule, I rushed to their current location, hoping they would understand the honest mistake and grant me some grace as a first-time patient.

Despite the effort I put into making it there, even sending an email explaining the mix-up since they don't have a functional contact phone number, I was coldly told I needed to reschedule. To make matters worse, the doctor was already running behind, so accommodating me wouldn't have disrupted their schedule.

The lack of empathy and compassion was shocking. Any decent medical office should show understanding for new patients, especially under such circumstances. Instead, they dismissed my situation, leaving me frustrated and scrambling to rearrange child care for another day. If you're looking for a practice that values its patients, this is not the place. Their rigid policies and poor communication make it clear that patient care is not their priority.|I've been coming to AZ Pain for over a decade now. They diagnosed a compressed spinal cord and helped me manage my pain while I waited for cervical spine surgery, helped diagnose my low back pain I've had for almost two decades, have done injections in my spine for pain control, I've done PT with them (Bri and Johnny are the best!)... they offer full service that is always the BEST. And their staff is amazing! Always friendly and helpful!|*claps hands* alright let's get this straight first off, I'm not a patient, I'm actually the boyfriend of one who's been coming here and it's been nothing but fantastic. I've watched my girl struggle with issues her whole life and learning she has scoliosis after YEARS of not knowing was a massive shock and after we've been treating it, it's shown TREMENDOUS results. Nothing but love and appreciation for these guys, completely changed our lives for the better and a especially big shout out to Bre and Jonny who absolutely make this Earth a much better place to be in. Shine on!|"In-house" defined as "done or existing within an organization" or "without assistance from an outside organization; internally".

I hurt my neck or shoulder from sport and exercise. I found this place through my united health care app. I called them around December 12th to schedule an appointment. I was getting ready to go out of town on the 20th.  The receptionist, or whoever I spoke to, had an appointment on the 21st or on January 2nd. I was assured they could do X-Rays and MRI/Imagine in house and not to worry they'd be able to take care of everything. Because of this I opted for the appointment on the 2nd.

I arrive to my appointment 30 minutes early. I'm called back and a nurse takes my blood pressure and gets my height/weight. Then a nurse practicioner comes in and asks me what happened. Then without doing a single diagnostic or ANY kind of triage or anything beyond listening to my story decides I need Pain injections and chiropractic visits multiple times a week. We spent less than 15 minutes together before she send me to someone else.

This person immediately tries schedule me for pain injections and multiple chiropractic visits a week BEFORE my imaging or anyone has done ANYTHING to triage my issue. When I tell her I don't want that treatment prior to finding out what is wrong she tells me then I need to go schedule an MRI and hands me a referral sheet!

At this point I'm very frustrated as I haven't even finished my paperwork AND I wouldn't have take the appointment on the 2nd if I knew I was going to be referred out. This person then begins to argue you with me about what "In-house" means.

So I included the definition of "in house" here. If they actually had "In-House" MRI I wouldn't have been given a referral sheet and told to schedule my own MRI. You will notice they have Chiropractic "In-house" because they didn't print me a referral.

To this person's credit they never stopped trying to get me to take the pain injections.

This place doesn't give a shit about actually helping you get better. They want your money and they want you on pain medication. I did not know that by "Pain Specalist" they meant Drug pushers. I was incredibly direct with both the Nurse Practitioner I didn't want pain medication for an injury she couldn't even name.

The best part is the imaging place they recommend isn't even in my network and I still had to go find my own place to get the MRI

OH and they did not recommend or do X-Rays which is typically what you would do prior to an MRI since you think you'd want to make sure my neck or shoulder didn't have any broken bones.

They must do this commonly because when I told the lady who scheduled my MRI she literally laughed and made a comment about me not being the only to say that.

TLDR;
Without triaging my injury in anyway, without doing any diagnostic, without even touching my neck or shoulder, without DOING ANYTHING this place tried to push pain medicine and treatment I might not need on my in less time than it took for me to fill out their new patient paperwork.

Disgusting. Find somewhere invested in your health and not your wallet.|I am so grateful for Dr Koc and Bre & Jonny's attention to my care. I am feeling better and sleeping better and more comfortably. They truly care and have shown a lot of compassion. I can highly recommend their office for both chiropractic adjustments and physical therapy!|One stop shopping. I go to scottsdale clinic for medical, chiropractor,  physical therapy, epidural, and traction. This place is awesome and so are the people. Staff really help each other out. Today, the buzzer beeped when my traction was over. The Dr and pt where busy. Instead of leaving me there till someone is free, another Dr. Who was walked out came to help me. And if one department is busy, they get you in to another department,  so you don't have to sit and wait. These things are unheard of.  The staff listen to you and your concerns and actually do something,  instead of I can't help you. Which I heard for over a year and half. I dont known why it has a 4.2 score, for my opinion it's all 5's. Top notch. Just a great great place to go to. I have spent 1.5 yes going to everyone from orthopedic,  pt, primary Dr, pain management clinics to no avail. Couldn't help me or just wasn't good at their job. Going to so many places for all the stuff I need while being in so much pain. Sooooo glad I found this place. And never a long wait 5 minutes tops.|Everyone is very friendly and helpful.  I always feel better after an adjustment from Dr Koc.  The front desk always greets me with a smile and a personal greeting|Dr. Koch is a miracle worker!
His magic table and gentle adjustments have been integral in handling my chronic neck and back pain.  THANK YOU Doctor Koch!

The office environment is clean, calming, and professional, contributing to a positive healing experience. I highly recommend Arizona Pain/ Phoenix to anyone seeking effective chiropractic care."|Have been coming to Dr. Mitch for a couple of months and have had a lot of great progress in my recovery. Was in a car accident early March of this year and shortly after had a lot of tension around my upper back/shoulder area. Difficulty turning my head to the right without having to turn my entire body in order to look including soreness in my lower back. Since starting my PT and adjustments I've regained a lot of motion back in my neck and have felt a lot less tension around my upper back. My lower back has also shown great signs of relief from soreness! I appreciate the folks here for helping regain my flexibility, mobility, and relief from the accident!|I love this place! Frank and Dr. Healey are hilarious, and more importantly they care about you as a person and a patient. I have felt better going here than any other chiropractic practice. The adjustments by Dr. Healey and PT with Frank have helped more than anything has before. Go here!|I have been in constant pain for 5 years. With a level 8. I've had my share of emergency rooms, pain management, epidural injections for 4yrs, Ablations where the Dr missed the target and for 4yrs been numb in the general area. I refused opiods for treatment. I wanted to be fixed,  not pasified, and addicted. I've had countless imaging by hundreds of Dr's, but NONE of them have EVER sat me down to examine my x rays and explain in detail what's going on in my back. I finally was approved for surgery and the Dr was going to cut me open without an x ray consult. When the surgeon canceled my surgery and I was super pissed but it turned out to be a blessing. That's is when I met Dr Healy. I thought oh no, another physical therapy place, but I was wrong. Dr Healy did xrays and sat me down to show me and walked me thru my entire back. From my neck to my lower back. First time ever!!!! I was in tears! I hugged him, thanked him, and asked him to please help me. I looked into his eyes and I can tell he was all in and committed to assisting me to a road of being pain free. I am entirely greatful for Dr Healy, and his staff. You won't find any place in town that are sincere as they all are NO JOKE. I've been to so many in the past 5 years, and I had already given up on finding someone who cared enough to motivate me into another treatment plan. This time I know I'm in good hands and I'm in the right place. Thank God! I'm so happy. If your in pain, and you find nothing is helping, before you give up,  I urge you to try Dr Healy before you give up. You won't be sorry. I will keep everyone updated on my progress as it's a bit early to give a complete outcome, but I know this time it will be a success story. Thank you Dr Healy.  I can't thank you enough.
Judy Abel|10/10- would HIGHLY recommend.  Life changing experience. My chronic back pain is non existent and I can thank AZ Pain Relief for that. Everyone from the front office, to the providers to the physical therapists treated me like I was family. The professionalism, expertise and kindness in clinic is something to be said for. I would recommend anyone and everyone I know who is struggling with chronic pain to invest in themselves and pay these guys a visit. It will change your life like it changed mine! My only regret is that I waited so long to make my first appointment.|Dr. Clark, Angie, and Julie have been a fantastic team in helping me get through all the back and neck issues I've been dealing with. They do a great job of keeping things interesting and making adjustments to the treatment plan as my targeted pain areas changed and evolved. They also thoroughly discussed any necessary lifestyle adjustments that I needed to make to ensure my body won't relapse into a bad state. Even the fill-in staff has been fantastic when anyone has been out on vacation. Highly recommend AZ Pain Relief!

I originally had a couple issues but it was with the insurance company not Sun Pain Management. I go to the Globe office where I have always been treated well and like a patient rather than just another claim. Dana Cook has always listened to my questions and concerns and alleviated my anxiety's(which have been numerous). I understand treatment for my injuries are a process and do not expect immediate relief, and through communication and understanding from the Doctors and staff I not only know what to expect but trust that I'm in good hands. The receptionist Luisa makes me nervous to talk to her because I think she is truly gorgeous,but she is also very warm,welcoming and comforting and has been very professional throughout my appointments which has also helped me get through my initial anxieties. I often do not like going to any Doctors offices or Provider's because they often make me feel uncertain and untreated,but Dana Cooks office and staff continue to show they care about my health and we'll being. I recommend them 100% and trust they have my best interests at hand,so thank you for all your help.|I was a patient at this facility and was discharged on their behalf. I felt compelled to address the unprofessional behavior exhibited by the doctors and staff. I waited for over two hours while fasting, only to overhear the doctors socializing and playing loud, inappropriate music. As a patient, I believe I deserve better care than what this practice provided.

While I do acknowledge that credit should be given when it's due, it seems clear to me that this clinic does not prioritize patient care; instead, patients appear to be treated merely as insurance claims or numbers. When I raised my concerns with the office manager, they seemed indifferent and dismissed my feedback entirely.

I highly recommend seeking another clinic where you will be valued as a patient, as this facility does not demonstrate that commitment.|I've had a great experience with Sun Pain Management and Debarah so far. She's very knowledgeable, helpful, and caring. The front desk staff and medical assistants are also really friendly and make me feel comfortable. I would recommend this office to my friends and family.|I was not happy at all with services from the providers. I saw the Doctor once and the rest of the time was being seen by a nurse practitioner. I received a steroid injection  that burned the skin n as of today still have a scar in area. I called numerous times, only to have my primary care Doctor prescribe me a medication to help it heal. Third injection left me unable to walk,and again I would leave calls n messages with no reply. The answering machine said I'd get a call back 24-72 hours later and not to leave numerous messages. I still never got calls returned. I ended up in Emergency a few days after injection that cause severe pain. I never got a call back after I had to cancel next injection,  but I got a call to confirm appointment the following day. I let receptionists know I had to wait due to inflammation n pain. I was seen in Doctors office a week later and was told I needed my gamapentin put to a higher dose but it took the nurse practitioner almost a month,  so again I had to go to family physician to get medication situated. Previous visit I was in pain and my  blood pressure was high so had to get a shot of Tordal to help, it didn't help pain but I could feel my blood pressure had lowered and just went home n slept because it made me have drowsiness. Last call I told them I didn't feel I was being taken care of by nurse practitioner if I could see Doctor. Only to be told Doctor only does procedures n mind you that Doctor wasn't the one who did my injections. So I am now in a wheelchair n was told not to use it because it's doing me more harm than good, but I can't stand more than a few minutes before I have severe pain standing on right foot. I was ordered to go get a MRI n waited over two weeks before I was sent to Arizona diagnostics only to be there three n half hours and wasn't able to get imaging done because I have a internal pain device through spine/ battery and needed a order for CAT scan not MRI. That was the last straw so I had to ask family care doctor for a referral to see a new doctor because I'm not happy with the service at Sun Pain Management at all n would never recommend this place to anyone. If I was seen by a Doctor that I thought I was going to be seeing would have been different especially if calls were returned to assist patients.|My continued care and treatment with Sun Pain has allowed me to continue to do what I .  I am 60 something and bone on bone everywhere,  to include neck and shoulders.  My MIRACLE. 08 / 23/24

Dr Anghel has been my pain managemet to specialist since 2001. I was diagnosed by Barrows Neuro institute in'98 work and am entering the PhD vvwith degenerative disc disease. Many drugs. Braces and tractions later: I was blessed with this Dr. With his care and treatment I was able to work,continue to 3 graduate program s and am currently enrolled in the PhD Criminal Justice program. He is truly the Miracle in my life!
9.tthrthe the Mi lotreatment I was ablecontinued

I was able to|Years have passed and I've moved to another state, however, I can't forget the inadequate care that I received from this office. They let me leave with a blood pressure over 240/160. If you want a pain management that doesn't take accountability, you got the right one Sun Pain is your guy.|I was with sunpain management back in early 2022, they were the absolute worst employees I have ever dealt with before. So the option was to stay on oxycodone which didn't touch my pain. They only did a medial block with lidocaine and never tried steroid injections, nothing. Mountain View Headache and Spine

Mountain View Headache and Spine is a premier pain management clinic in Phoenix, Arizona, led by Dr. Omar Viswanath, MD. The clinic specializes in comprehensive treatment for chronic pain conditions, offering personalized care for patients seeking relief from headaches, spine-related discomfort, and other pain disorders.

Dr. Omar Viswanath brings extensive training and experience to pain management. As a board-certified physician, he focuses on interventional techniques and innovative therapies. Dr. Viswanath's approach combines medical expertise with compassionate patient care. His educational background and ongoing professional development ensure patients receive current, evidence-based treatments.

Specialized Services

The clinic offers treatments for various pain conditions including:

- Migraine and tension headache management

- Spine pain interventions

- Nerve block procedures

- Joint pain relief

- Non-surgical pain management options

- Minimally invasive procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

Each treatment plan addresses individual patient needs and concerns. The team takes time to understand pain history thoroughly. Patients receive clear explanations about their condition and treatment options. The clinic emphasizes both immediate relief and long-term pain management strategies.

Location and Contact Information

Mountain View Headache and Spine welcomes new patients at their Phoenix location:

- Address: 4729 E Union Hills Dr, Phoenix, AZ 85050

- Phone: (602) 767-0007

- Website: https://mountainviewheadacheandspine.com/locations-phoenix

The clinic's convenient location serves residents throughout Phoenix and surrounding communities. Same-week appointments are often available for urgent pain concerns.

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP)

Advanced Spine and Pain is a comprehensive interventional pain management clinic in Phoenix, Arizona. The practice specializes in personalized treatment programs for chronic pain conditions using evidence-based, multi-disciplinary approaches.

Dr. Todd Turley, MD, leads patient care as a fellowship-trained pain management physician. Board-certified with specialized training, Dr. Turley focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain. His approach combines interventional procedures with comprehensive pain management strategies for optimal patient outcomes.

The clinic offers specialized treatments for back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment program is customized based on the clinic's physician-developed outcomes program that tracks patient progress and effectiveness.

ASAP's medical team includes Board Certified specialists and experienced non-physician providers with extensive backgrounds in interventional pain management. This team approach ensures patients receive comprehensive care addressing all aspects of their pain condition.

Treatment options include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and advanced interventional techniques. The clinic emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction.

Located at 2525 W Greenway Rd, Suite 125, Phoenix, AZ 85023, Advanced Spine and Pain welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Appointments can be scheduled by calling +1 480-573-0130 or through their website at www.asappaindocs.com/contact-us.

Advanced Pain Management

Advanced Pain Management has been a trusted provider of pain management services in Arizona for over 20 years. The clinic specializes in interventional pain treatments for adults throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson. With 10 convenient office locations, patients can access specialized care close to home.

Led by Dr. Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini and Dr. David Delatte, the clinic focuses on delivering long-term pain relief solutions. Both physicians are board-certified interventional pain management specialists with extensive experience treating acute and chronic pain conditions.

The practice prioritizes prompt care through next-day appointments, ensuring patients receive quick diagnosis and treatment initiation. This approach helps minimize suffering and accelerates recovery timelines for those experiencing debilitating pain.

Advanced Pain Management offers comprehensive treatment options tailored to individual needs. Their services include diagnostic evaluations, minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies. The clinic addresses various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain.

Patients appreciate the clinic's commitment to affordable care and convenient scheduling options. The Chandler office is located at 815 E Warner Rd #104, with appointments available by calling 602-560-4742. Additional information about services and locations can be found on their website at advancedpainmanagement.com.

At their 10 offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson AZ, interventional pain management specialists Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini, MD, and David Delatte, MD, focus on providing patients with long-term pain relief from a variety of acute and chronic conditions.The practice offers next-day appointments, so patients can get an accurate diagnosis and begin treatment as soon as possible.

Dr. Lee is absolutely awesome: I've said it before, but what I admire most about her is that she actually listens and compromises with me than to completely disregard my concerns like some other pain management offices.

I love her!|They truly need to do a better job of answering phones and checking messages. I have tried several times to simply schedule an appointment.|This clinic takes the time to treat you. I suffered for 6yrs not knowing what was wrong went to dr after dr and they couldn't figure it out. APM not only found the problem but found the right treatment.  I appreciate it  more than they'll ever know.|Only interested in their agenda and not your issues with pain. I can't tell you how disappointed it is to have a Pain Dr. not ask you about your pain. The Dr. only seemed to be interested in whatever there agenda was and tried to get me to get a regular x-ray done she knew would not show anything. When I called her on this she told me it was for insurance that she was ordering a useless procedure. I told her no, and asked her for the proper and needed imaging procedure, and she grudgingly agreed. Bottom line if you really don't know what you issue is, you should not go here, they will most likely order tests you don't need just so they can bill for it. My opinion here, but if you do actually go here, ask questions, a lot of questions, so you can decide for yourself if the tests they want to do make any sense to you!|Kristen has the best mix of incredible bed side manner, and incredible knowledge. column3:
Advanced Spine and Pain

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a premier interventional pain management clinic serving Gilbert, Arizona and surrounding communities. Our comprehensive approach focuses on creating individualized treatment plans for patients experiencing acute and chronic pain conditions. Located at 2563 S Val Vista Dr #101 in Gilbert, our clinic specializes in evidence-based pain solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

ASAP's team consists of Board Certified pain specialists with extensive training in interventional techniques. Our physicians have developed a proprietary outcomes program that guides our treatment recommendations and measures patient progress. Non-physician providers at our practice typically bring years of specialized experience in pain management to enhance patient care.

We welcome patients at all stages of their pain journey. Whether you're experiencing recent low back pain without prior treatment or dealing with complex pain issues following multiple surgeries, our specialists provide thorough evaluations and personalized care plans. Our stepwise approach begins with conservative measures before considering more advanced interventions.

Services at Advanced Spine and Pain include:

- Comprehensive pain evaluations and diagnostics

- Medication management for pain control

- Interventional procedures and injections

- Coordination with physical therapy providers

- Chiropractic care recommendations

- Advanced imaging referrals when necessary

Our Gilbert clinic specializes in treating conditions such as spinal pain, joint discomfort, nerve pain, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques to reduce recovery time and improve outcomes.

For appointments or more information, contact Advanced Spine and Pain at (480) 573-0130 or visit our website at www.asappaindocs.com. Our Gilbert location offers convenient access for East Valley residents seeking effective pain management solutions.

column40:
I'm constantly having to fight the pharmacy and insurance company to get my meds.  The local pharmacy thought they should decide my pain level and ignore the order that my doctor sent in.
After many,many,many phone calls the nurses and MA got my meds to be filled that day! This may sound trivial but when you live in pain and can't get your meds, it effects you and everyone around you.
Thank you so much|Mary Steiner is an amazing person!  She checked out my spine and told me things that I haven't ever been told.  Very caring and listens to me and my concerns.  Front office is really professional as well.  Thank you!|Its certainly a wonderful feeling to know you are being treated with the up most care and respect but mainly not being treated as it's  just in your mind.

I am also going through some other procedures for my condition and knowing that their are options to assist you in your healing process to feel at least 70-80% pain free. It's so comforting knowing that their are pa's/doctors who actually care for their patients well-being, they take the time to listens to their patients and just generally cares, instead of just allowing you feeling like a pin cushion!  Its quite refreshing!!
The staff as well with AZ Pain is also very friendly every time I am in the office  and when I need procedures they are precise, when authorizations are needed for other treatments.

Mary Steiner (PA @ Mesa location), Thank you for everything you have been doing to assist me on my journey to become pain free or at least decreasing the amount of my pain greatly. You're definitely one of the best out there! She is such a sweetheart and takes her time explain your condition or the procedure(s) you're having when you get to that point. She is absolutely amazing|Honestly, the staff is great, the provider was amazing. My whole experience here was awesome! I really appreciate the doctor being sensitive to my medical circumstances and empathetic about my plan of care. I truly appreciate that she understands this is temporary care and she really did help me! I recommend this facility! 5 stars, hands down.|My Dr and the staff here has always been courteous, have patience and helpful. I've never had a problem what so ever. The Staff has always been willing to listen to my concerns and address them right away. I would forever be greatful for my care as I've been in the Healthcare industry since 1995 and this is wonderful to see people in this industry still have deep concerns and care about their patients.|01/06/2003- Friendly, professional, & informative staff. My provider is very attentive, takes the time to go through options & ensures I understand everything, is sympathetic to my suffering & I really believe she wants to help me. I'm very happy with AZ Pain Doctors & would highly recommend them to anyone who's in need of such services.

NOTE: I've seen a couple of patients deeply unhappy w/the front desk to the point of yelling & arm waving @ the woman there. This was - awfully childish behavior on the part of the patient & speaker-on-behalf of the patient - NOT the fault of AZ Pain, nor because the front desk was being rude (in fact, she remained extremely calm, polite, & highly professional throughout the entire incidents, explaining & then re-explaining why the patients just couldn't be seen), or anything she was inherently doing wrong. The patients simply couldn't be treated because of insurance issues; they were in pain & needed medication, yes, but their insurance did not allow for the appts. The facility COULD NOT LEGALLY treat them, & it had nothing to do w/whether they WANTED to treat them or if AZ Pain staff lacked in sympathy.

Now, I haven't seen any ratings on this business yet... I'm rating from a prompt from my email, so I've never googled them. I don't know how many good or bad reviews they have. But I do know that when someone can't get what they want, for example: treatment & pain meds, then that angry (& yes, suffering) person occasionally leaves one of those, "Rude staff, doesn't care about patients in pain," etc. reviews. I just felt the responsibility to notate what I've witnessed. And let me just say that if those patients weren't willing to pay out of pocket (they weren't, or maybe couldn't), then insurance was the only other option.

Remember, this place is still a business & still needs to be paid, otherwise it shuts down & all of its patients are SOL. Including me... which I'm willing to admit that I'm selfishly not okay with (I'm in pain, I love this biz, I want to continue going there, I don't want them to charity themselves into bankruptcy, forcing me somewhere else), so I saw NO problem w/them refusing service to those 2 individuals who wouldn't (personally or through insurance) pay.

AZ Pain Doctors is a very GOOD business, w/very professional staff all around. They ARE caring, & informative, & willing to help out in whatever way they can in order to make sure your pain mgt needs are met - but you still have to do your part. I've had no issues w/them myself, I've made sure I follow their instructions (for example: if a long enough period of time has passed in-between visits, they'll have told me @ my last appt that I'll need a new referral from my referring dr, so I do just that: call my dr & ask for a new referral a week before my next appt w/AZ Pain. Then, when I show up @ my next appt, I don't have any issues w/my insurance & my appt goes on as normal), they are almost always on time (hey, sometimes medical facilities run late. It just happens. I've worked for a dozen diff med facilities & know exactly how that happens & it's NEVER the facility's fault - I have stories!), & I'm in & out & happy that I have all the info I need to go on & try to manage my pain.

NOTE (yet again): this is not the place to opiate shop. On my 1s appt the very 1s thing I said to my provider was, "I'm a former addict so I refuse to take any opiates." And she said, "Good, because I don't prescribe them."

So yeah, if you've gotten this far, AZ Pain Doctors is a great place & I very highly recommend it for anyone's pain mgt needs.|The staff at AZ Pain Doctors is great! Professional and friendly receptionists and Mary, NP is amazing. She is very knowledgeable and always takes the time to listen to your concerns. She's respectful and willing to explain things to you if you have questions. I wish all health specialists were like this!|I absolutely love my P.A Mary Steiner! She is communicative, precise with medication, answers every question and explains the best treatment for the pain issues I experience.
I would highly recommend! Luis, her assistant is wonderful as well.

column3:
Arizona Pain

Arizona Pain is a premier pain management clinic dedicated to providing world-class care���the same quality care we would want for our own family members. Our comprehensive pain management services span multiple locations across the Phoenix valley, including Scottsdale, Glendale, Gilbert, and Chandler.

Our team specializes in diagnosing and treating various chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We take a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, combining advanced interventional procedures with therapeutic modalities and medication management when appropriate.

At Arizona Pain, patient education is central to our practice. We maintain an extensive database of pain-related information to help patients understand their conditions and explore treatment options. This educational approach empowers patients to participate actively in their recovery journey.

Our Gilbert clinic at 875 N Greenfield Rd #110 offers state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment facilities. The clinic features advanced imaging technology and specialized treatment rooms designed for patient comfort.

The physicians at Arizona Pain bring extensive training from prestigious medical institutions and years of specialized experience in pain management. Our doctors stay current with the latest pain management techniques and research to provide evidence-based care.

We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options. New patients can expect thorough evaluations to identify pain sources and develop targeted treatment strategies.

For appointments or more information, call +1 480-573-8696 or visit https://arizonapainrelief.com/ to learn about our services and locations throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area.
column11:
Arizona Pain was created with one mission in mind: Provide world class care that we would want for our own mom or dad.

In addition, we aim to help and educate people about their pain conditions, treatment options and find a doctor who can help end their pain issues.

To do that, we've created a database of pain-related information, and it keeps expanding every day.

By visiting Arizona Pain, you can help find out what your pain issue may be, what the comprehensive options are for treatment, what tools are used when getting treatment and how to find a doctor in your area. Come see us at one of our conveniently located Phoenix valley offices (Scottsdale, Glendale, Gilbert, and Chandler).

column40:
Front office ladies are so kind and patient. Dr Sims is a God send. He is all about preventing pain, while helping heal your current condition. Everyone here truly listens to chief complaints, concerns you may have and takes the extra time if needed to explain the benefits of chiropractic treatment. I am so grateful to have found thiss place and highly recommend to all.|My experience with medical procedures can be a testament to the importance of clear communication between healthcare providers and patients. Initially, I was scheduled for a Medical Branch Block (MBB) procedure with Dr. Ray, who had provided me excellent care during my first MBB. That procedure had gone smoothly; thanks to sedation, I felt no pain and experienced minimal bruising afterward. However, my second appointment was a different story due to a lack of communication.
When I had to reschedule my second MBB, the scheduler did not inform me that I would be seeing a different doctor, nor did the surgery center. This vital detail only became apparent as I was about to enter the operating room. Without the opportunity to discuss my concerns or preferences, I felt unprepared. The procedure began abruptly without the calming effects of sedation, causing me to react mid-procedure. The result was excruciating pain and noticeable bruising, in stark contrast to my previous experience.
In the aftermath of this second MBB, I found myself unable to put weight on my right side due to shooting pain. Simple tasks such as getting dressed, showering, and even finding comfort on the couch became impossible let alone being able to sleep and being up all night even after taking muscle relaxers for the back spasms . I also struggled with nausea and joint pain that made eating challenging. To complicate matters, I have experienced blurry vision, further hindering my ability to prepare for my daughter's engagement party this weekend. This experience highlights the critical need for clear doctor-patient communication and understanding, which ultimately impacts patient outcomes. A procedure that could have been routine and manageable turned into a significantly distressing situation. It's essential that healthcare providers prioritize patient comfort and make sure they are fully informed.|What a refreshing place to walk into. We were referred here by a friend for my mothers neck pain. From the moment we walked in the door we were treated like royalty. The staff, doctors, radiologist all were so friendly and very attentive to moms pain. I can't say Thank you enough. Dr Church explained more in one visit than we'd heard from other doctors for over a year. I feel truly blessed to have found this place for mom. When checking out, Laura took fantastic care of us as well, which was sprinkles, on the icing, on the cake! Knowing there's relief for moms pain is the greatest feeling in the world. We very much recommend this facility.|Arizona Pain is a horrible corrupt company. Their management is a nightmare. They have no customer service skills and have no idea how to treat people who are in constant pain, mentally and physically. All they have done is added more pain to my life.
I called the office specifically asking about opioids and they never asked me if I was taking a benzodiazepine. When I got there for my new patient appt, the MA said they don't prescribe opioids to anyone taking benzodiazepines. And the doctor said the same thing. I declined treatment and left. There were no services or evaluations done. I was so frustrated that this wasn't handled over the phone. They had wasted my time, energy, travel, gas and my break time. The new patient appt didn't happen and yet they still billed my insurance and got $117 from them. This is a fraudulent claim, and yet, they still want more. They have been fighting me over a tiny $13 patient charge just to prove a point. And yes, I have been rude to them and I said one swear word. My insurance never should have been billed in the first place. And I am not paying the $13 to prove the same point...that THEY are being ridiculous and childish. For an office not to just write this off, just proves how unprofessional they are. Stay away from Arizona Pain!|Horrible! Waste of time!
I saw an interview on YouTube from 2 of the doctors about the MILD procedure and was impressed. I thought I'd give them a try.
Laura, office manager?? Was supposed to help me find someone outside of their office to do a procedureTHEIR doctor ordered, but Laura never called me back! When I called her back she pretty much left it up to me to find someone!
Great 1st impression! Is that supposed to be the patients job??|My first week walking into AZ Pain was difficult and painful.   I am on my 3rd week and feeling the difference daily. I am more steady on my feet and stronger, then I have been in 6 yrs.  From Injections with Dr.Kathlene,  Dr. Brian Sims my  Chiropractor and Physical Therapy with Jonathan.
Their one on one care and therapy is making a considerable difference. I am confident I came to the right place for the multiple issues I have.  Scoliosis, Degenerative Disks, Arthritis and a few more.
I thank each and every one at the office in Gilbert. You truly have given me renewed hope for enjoying things that I have not been able to do in over a decade.
And feeling stronger after every visit.

Sincerely Grateful, Anna Filotei|Went to AZ Pain with neck and shoulder pain.  The staff was great.  Set me up on a treatment plan that included chiropractic adjustments.  A few visits later and my pain is pretty much gone.  I would definitely recommend them.|Everyone at Arizona Pain in Gilbert was absolutely amazing. The entire staff made the recovery process better with their caring and courteous attitude towards my entire recovery. Thank you so much!

Advanced Pain Management

Advanced Pain Management stands as a premier pain management clinic serving the Phoenix metropolitan area and Tucson, Arizona for over two decades. With ten conveniently located offices throughout Phoenix, Glendale, Chandler, Mesa, Surprise, and Tucson, the clinic provides comprehensive interventional pain management services for adults suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Led by distinguished specialists Dr. Vikramjeet (Vik) Saini and Dr. David Delatte, the clinic focuses on delivering long-term pain relief solutions through personalized treatment plans. Their patient-centered approach addresses various pain conditions with evidence-based interventional techniques. The medical team combines extensive clinical experience with advanced diagnostic capabilities to identify pain sources accurately.

The clinic prioritizes accessibility with next-day appointments, ensuring patients receive prompt diagnosis and treatment initiation. This commitment to timely care helps patients begin their pain management journey without unnecessary delays. Advanced Pain Management maintains a balance of high-quality care that remains both convenient and affordable for patients throughout Arizona.

Services include comprehensive pain evaluations, minimally invasive procedures, and ongoing pain management strategies. The clinic specializes in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary approach may incorporate interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative techniques.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can visit www.advancedpainmanagement.com or call +1 602-353-7624. The main Phoenix location is situated at 4140 N 108th Ave #134, Phoenix, AZ 85037.

column2: Elite Pain and Spine Institute Phoenix, AZ
column3:
Elite Pain and Spine Institute

Elite Pain and Spine Institute is a premier pain management clinic located in Phoenix, Arizona, dedicated to relieving pain, restoring function, and renewing hope for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our highly skilled physician group brings extensive experience in comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

The clinic offers advanced treatment options for various pain conditions including:

- Neck and back pain management

- Joint pain relief

- Neuropathic pain treatment

- Interventional pain procedures

- Minimally invasive spine treatments

Personalized Approach to Care

At Elite Pain and Spine Institute, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. Our physicians develop individualized treatment plans combining cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care. The team focuses on identifying root causes rather than simply masking symptoms.

Physician Expertise

Our pain management specialists bring decades of combined clinical experience and advanced training from prestigious medical institutions. Each doctor maintains board certifications in pain medicine and related specialties, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of care using evidence-based approaches.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

The clinic's philosophy centers on three core principles: relieving pain through effective interventions, restoring functional capacity for daily activities, and renewing hope for patients who have struggled with chronic conditions. This comprehensive approach addresses both physical symptoms and quality of life concerns.

Location and Contact Information

Elite Pain and Spine Institute is conveniently located at 1641 E Osborn Rd, Suite 6, Phoenix, AZ 85016. For consultations or questions about pain management options, patients can call +1 480-900-7373 or visit https://elitepainandspine.com/ for detailed information about conditions and available treatments.
column11: Our highly skilled physician group specializes in chronic pain management. If you are looking for a clinic that will relieve pain, restore function and renew hope - you've come to the right place! Explore our website to learn more about conditions and treatments. Our combined experience and personalized approach to relieving pain, restoring function and renewing hope is unique. We care - it shows.
