column2: HonorHealth Pain Management - John C. Lincoln
column3:
HonorHealth Pain Management - John C. Lincoln

HonorHealth Pain Management - John C. Lincoln specializes in comprehensive pain relief solutions for Phoenix residents. Our dedicated team addresses chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Located in North Phoenix, our clinic offers advanced interventional procedures and multidisciplinary approaches to pain management.

We provide expert care for a wide range of pain conditions including neck pain, back pain, hip pain, knee pain, and shoulder pain. Our pain specialists utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic techniques to identify the root cause of discomfort. Treatment options include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and therapeutic interventions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our pain management physicians employ leading-edge treatments such as nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. These evidence-based approaches help patients achieve meaningful pain reduction and improved function. We focus on both immediate relief and long-term pain management strategies.

Experienced Medical Team

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive training and clinical experience to every patient interaction. The medical team stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine through ongoing education and research. This commitment ensures patients receive the most effective and innovative care available.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand how pain affects quality of life and daily activities. Our compassionate staff works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans. We emphasize education and self-management techniques alongside medical interventions for comprehensive care.

Location: 9250 N 3rd St, Suite 2015, Phoenix, AZ 85020

Phone: (602) 786-0030

Website: https://www.honorhealth.com/locations/specialty-care/pain-management/john-c-lincoln

Part of the respected HonorHealth network, our clinic maintains the highest standards of medical excellence and patient care.

column3:
Advanced Spine and Pain

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a premier interventional pain management clinic serving Sun City, Arizona and surrounding communities. The practice delivers comprehensive pain solutions through individualized treatment programs developed by their board-certified specialists. At their convenient location on Bell Road, ASAP physicians combine extensive clinical experience with evidence-based approaches to address both acute and chronic pain conditions.

The clinic welcomes patients at all stages of their pain journey���from those experiencing recent low back pain without prior treatment to complex cases involving multiple surgeries and long-term discomfort. ASAP's integrated approach begins with thorough initial evaluations, followed by appropriate diagnostic imaging and a stepwise treatment plan tailored to each patient's specific needs.

Treatment options at Advanced Spine and Pain include medication management, physical therapy referrals, chiropractic care coordination, and interventional procedures such as targeted injections. Their medical team consists of board-certified pain specialists supported by non-physician providers with years of specialized experience in pain management techniques.

ASAP's patient-centered philosophy emphasizes functional improvement and pain reduction through carefully monitored treatment protocols. The clinic's comprehensive services address various pain conditions including spinal disorders, joint pain, nerve pain, and post-surgical discomfort.

Patients can schedule consultations at their Sun City office by calling 480-573-0130 or visiting their website at www.asappaindocs.com. The clinic is located at 9949 W Bell Rd #100, Sun City, AZ 85351.
column11:
Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a comprehensive, interventional pain practice. ASAP prides itself on individualized patient treatment programs driven by an outcomes program developed by our own physicians. ASAP physicians are Board Certified specialists and non-physician providers typically have years of experience in interventional pain management.

We are happy to see patients at any stage, from those with recent low back pain and no treatment, to more complex patients with years of pain and multiple surgeries. We offer initial evaluation and will recommend imaging or other studies as needed, with stepwise conservative care, including medications, physical therapy, chiropractic care and injections.

I had looking for a solution for over 3 years and Dr. Roth solved in 10 minutes just by asking me a few question.  My quality of life has increased so much.  I would recommend Dr. Roth for any pain management I wish he could be my primary care doc that's how good I think he is.|I had several injections given by my AZ Pain Doctor into the muscle in my upper left side of my back for pain relief.  He did a very good job---have had relief of pain since.  The injections were easily tolerable---good job again.

column2: Premier Pain Institute: Sham Vengurlekar, MD
column3:
Premier Pain Institute

Premier Pain Institute, led by Dr. Sham Vengurlekar, MD, offers comprehensive pain management services in Phoenix, Arizona. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic back pain, neck pain, and complex pain conditions using advanced interventional techniques.

Dr. Vengurlekar brings exceptional credentials to pain medicine, with fellowship training in cardiovascular and thoracic surgery. His extensive background enables him to address complex spinal conditions with precision. As a respected back pain specialist, he develops personalized treatment plans for each patient's unique needs.

Our pain management approach combines minimally invasive procedures with comprehensive care. We offer treatments including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Many patients experience significant relief without major surgery.

The clinic serves Phoenix and surrounding communities with compassionate care. Our team prioritizes patient education and comfort throughout treatment. Most insurance plans are accepted at our modern facility.

Visit Premier Pain Institute at 7010 E Chauncey Ln, Suite 215, Phoenix, AZ 85054. Schedule a consultation by calling +1 480-314-2288 or through our website at www.azpainmd.com. Same-week appointments are often available for new patients seeking pain relief.
column11: Dr. Sham Vengurlekar is a back pain specialist, as well as fellowship trained in cardiovascular and thoracic surgery.
column38: RoseAna Dodge|Omeed Paknejad|Dr Food|Mehrdad Davoudi|Lisa Moe|april and k rodrigu|Roseanne Giudice|James
column40:
Dr.V is great, very knowledgeable, gets to the bottom of your problem. My pain gone with no pain medications. He knows his stuff and is direct with you as the patient, they got me scheduled and in right away. He and his staff are very friendly and efficient. He treated my disk in my back 6 years ago, pain gone, when I noticed it starting to be in pain he was the only one I wanted and felt wouldn't string me along. Pain gone again. If your in pain don't wait, it so good to not live in pain. He's done a great job for me and family members. My mom was alleviated of her pain and has recommended several of her friend's that also had great success with Dr. V.|Dr. Vengurlekar is incredibly approachable and caring. On my consultation, he took his time in explaining the likely cause of my lower back pain, talking me through available treatment options, and thoroughly explaining how each treatment method is done and what it entails. He is incredibly skilled at what he does and has a competent and friendly team surrounding him. The team at Premier Pain Institute has helped alleviate my chronic lower back pain completely.|Having issues with both knees finally lead to consultations with Orthopedic Surgeons, both of which recommended replacement.  Not wanting to go through a low rehab, I consulted with Dr. Vengurlekar, whom I knew through one of his patients.  After reviewing the results of CT Scans on both knees, Dr. Vengurlekar recommended a series of injections.  After the completion of the series of three injections in my right knee, the pain level has been decreased to a very tolerable level which I can live with, and even play golf again pain free.  Last month we began the process on my left knee and after having my first injection, the improvement is noticeable.  I highly recommend Dr. Vengurlekar to any person that is living with pain that disrupts their daily life. His professional experience and accomplishments are very broad reaching far beyond simply pain management.  He is highly skilled, and will tell it like it is.  After consultation, his diagnosis will always address the best course of treatment for the patient.  I am grateful he provided a viable option to replacement surgery.|Dr. Vengurlekar has been my pain management doctor for many years. His devotion and care for the cause has been evident in the type of work that he does starting with the exceptional and professional staff that he hires down to the amount of care that he provides for each individual patient. Dr. Vengurlekar is caring, concern about the location of your pain and he pays an extra attention to the level of care that is needed to make you get comfortable and treated. For the past twenty five years I have been treated by Dr. "V" and each time I visit with him, he makes me feel like brand new again. I have recommended Dr. "V" to all my family members and they all have sought the help of Dr. "V" for their ailments. Currently,  my father and my nephew are both under his care and supervision and  they are both pain free because of his years of vast experience in the field of pain management . He is the best physician for the job!! HE IS THE BEST, PERIOD!!!!! Thanks Dr. "V". Michael D.|In 2003 Dr. V did my sciatica nerve and  I haven't had a problem since. I went to a pain specialist in Chandler and he was a QUACK. I was given 3 choices, cortisone shots, PRP or stem cell treatments. I searched and searched and found the Miracle Man. Dr. V he is so amazing and  wealth of information. I was at pain level 10 now I'm at 6, after only 1 treatment. I'm so excited about all of my upcoming treatments  back to work the next day is another plus. Thank you Dr. V  and all your staff. You all are amazing.|The best pain management clinic and best pain doctor I have ever had. If you are a Veteran and use the VA Choice program, you need to come here. This clinic goes above and beyond to help you with VA paperwork to get authorization for you. Dr. V is an amazing doctor who will help you with chronic spine pain. Try it here and you will see for yourself how good this clinic is.

I have been coming here for years for my back and neck. I wouldn't have use of either if it weren't for DR. V. If there is a negative review it's because they are cry babies who don't value a great doctor! Don't listen to the fake reviews!|After getting nothing but grief from The Pain Center of Arizona (useless procedures, constant unprofessionalism, the incessant pushing of pain pills) I knew I had to find another option.  I had 3 procedures and zero relief.  After some research, I found Dr. V and his office.  He is a miracle worker and I don't say that lightly. I sought treatment from him for broken vertebrae in my lower back which was causing pain, tingling and numbness in my hips and into my feet.  I began seeing him in May of 2017 and my initial consultation alone between paperwork and speaking with him was a few hours because he took the time to speak with me and understand why I was seeking treatment with him.  It was THAT in-depth.  The office staff (between Michele and Jackie and the rest) are top notch.  They know you by name and actually take care of you.  I had numerous procedures between May and December of 2017 and I feel like I have my life back.  My pain level is down at least 70%, I am standing straighter, I've been able to get active again and lose 25 pounds.  And this is ALL WITH ZERO NARCOTICS.   I am at the point where he released me from treatment in December and told me to "call me if I need him".  I know I will need him here and there because I will never be 100% pain free but to know that I have him in my corner and that I will actually see relief when I need it most is truly a Godsend.  I've seen a lot of doctors in my lifetime and he is, by far, the most brilliant I've ever met.|Dr. Vengurlekar is the real deal! I have known him for many many years and he has never ever let me down when it comes to getting my pain taken care of. His staff and facilities are top notch and they are genuinely passionate about providing the best care possible to his clients.  I highly recommend him!

column3:
The Pain Center - Gilbert

The Pain Center - Gilbert offers comprehensive pain management services in Arizona. Established in 2002, this full-time clinic specializes in treating chronic, severe, and acute pain conditions through advanced diagnostic techniques and therapeutic interventions.

Located at 3645 S Rome St #216, Gilbert, AZ 85297, the center provides integrated pain care with a multidisciplinary approach. Their physician teams conduct thorough diagnostic evaluations to identify the root causes of pain. Patients receive personalized treatment plans combining medical interventions with therapeutic approaches.

The clinic utilizes cutting-edge therapies for effective pain diagnosis and management. Their specialists have extensive experience treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, and neuropathic conditions. The medical team brings years of specialized training in pain medicine to each patient consultation.

The Pain Center emphasizes compassionate care, offering hope to patients and families affected by chronic pain conditions. Their holistic approach addresses both physical symptoms and quality of life concerns. New patients can expect comprehensive evaluations during initial consultations.

For appointments or information about pain management services, contact The Pain Center - Gilbert at +1 623-241-6146 or visit their website at https://www.thepaincenter.com/locations/gilbert/ to learn about treatment options available at their Gilbert location.

column38: Melonee|Arlo Henley|MJ L|Lisa J.|Tyler|IMMORTAL JAKE|Valerie Goodrich|Kirby
column40:
I am sharing a review on behalf of my son, who is a patient of Dr. Narain. I am extremely disappointed with the treatment he has received after his sacral fusion procedure. Our experience with the clinic has been subpar overall. They do not provide a proper medication management plan to help him manage his pain. Instead, they quickly resorted to procedures for a young man under 30, which will have a permanent impact on his life.

Additionally, the decision to fuse only one side of his SI joint without considering his individual needs was concerning. It seems that the clinic prescribes the same medication for all patients, regardless of their specific requirements. My son had to visit the ER for medication management less than 48 hours after the operation. Despite the ER doctor's instructions to take more of the prescribed medication and contact the prescribing physician for further assistance, we were met with resistance and were ultimately denied. As a result, my son is now at home less than a week post-operation from a spinal fusion without adequate pain medication because his surgeon believes in a one-size-fits-all approach.

I am planning to report Dr. Narain to the board of medicine for his lack of care for my son, his patient.|On 07/09 I saw Jason Genko to address my 4th potential treatment for debilitating Cervical Radiculopathy. In spite of being low functioning due to pain from collapsed/bulging disks, and extreme stenosis. PT was ordered before an MRI. WENT TO PT THE NEXT DAY and it was determined that I could not participate in this PT at this time due to the extreme nature of my condition. This report was sent to PA Genko on 07/12. In the mean time I'm getting slow and indignant responses from my attempt to use their messaging system for appointments. This is a joke. They bounce you back and forth to some redundant "scheduler " that asks if you are a new patient, press1 or 2, are you scheduling a procedure press 1or 2, have you received confirmation to schedule this procedure? Press 1 or 2. This is after having texted directly with a person who already had all of this info and offered a slot. By the time they get back to me that slot is no longer available. This is frustrating at best. When my MRI was ordered a week later it was not ordered stat and no PT report was attached so 14 days later I get a denial requesting 6 weeks of PT. Insurance says the PT report nor his opinion attached to the MRI request. Now it's been three more weeks of agonizing pain. I get a call from the Pain center telling me the MRI denied and I need to schedule to discuss how to move forward. So I schedule for yesterday. I get there. They have no clue why I'm actually there. Jason Genko informs me he has no PT report nor does he have an xray of my hand which was also ordered for potential metatarsal tarsal injections. I tell him it was sent and confirmed and I would probably leave his office only to find out late that I'm right. It was in fact sent and confirmed sent by "Sp*****" PT ON 07/12. In the context of me asking him why they weren't received and reviewed by him he turned to me and bowed up and said, and I quote, "I don't sit by a fax machine all day just waiting for a fax". This response aggravated me as well as his poise and bedside manner. I said "young man, I never suggested that was the case but why would it not be there. Can we look again? Perhaps somewhere else? He raise both hands palms towards me in passive-aggressive and bemused manner and fixed his gaze and said "I don't know". At this point I went off and demanded to be seen by someone else even if it meant scheduling again. I expressed my anger for his exasperating dismissal of me and my situation and that I felt every step of the process was confusing and not aided by discussion or explanation by him and that I didn't appreciate his bold and disrespectful response. He said he was leaving the room and I could leave the practice. Beyond appalled my trigger was pulled. I told him how frustrating this all was and that I would report him and take my business elsewhere. He said "GOOD, GOOD and pointed me to the door. As I was leaving the Medical assistant, standing listening in her office doorway also pointed me out the door with a sweep of her hand. I was absolutely aghast and as angry as I have probably ever been. How dare a wet behind the ears middle of the road practitioner treat me and my situation with such disregard and to bow up on me was just all that. Really? How dare you. I'll point out that in all of the frustrating and humiliating bureaucracy they seem to have their billing down to a science,  They were paid within a day or two in every case. Isn't that just a hoot?|I give 2 stars as this practice used to be sooo much better and I have been with them over 15 years, but seeing decline over last 5 years in a lot of great long- term doctors and PAs leaving. This review is in regards to my most recent appointment in June 2024 for a radio frequency, ablation procedure . Waiting 2.5 hours to get to the point ( taken back to get IV started)  and then another wait for getting actual procedure done is unacceptable.If a doctor has a valid reason for that, I would like to hear it, apparently this delay was happening all morning so a call should have been made advising patients to arrive later or re- schedule. Not enough seats in waiting room for all the people waiting ( 25 to 30) Patients plus drivers. If this was an over- booking scenario, even more unacceptable. Can't eat or drink and one person was diabetic, I had to pay my riding service more money and my driver had to re- schedule one of her appointments. Doctor should respect that their  actions or practices have a domino effect. No one poking around in spinal cords, administering medications should be rushed.  My procedure and after care felt rushed in the staffs attempt to herd people through. Unacceptable, I am going to start looking at other pain management practices. My last few  prescription refills have been a mess and the 2nd time an insurance pre-authorization was messed up. Seen quite a few doctors and experienced PAs leave this practice and this may be a huge red flag. No one wants huge waits and feel like a spinal procedure is being rushed with no concern after the procedure for increased pain and nausea. Very disappointing process and many people in that waiting room felt the same and heard at least 4 say time to look for another doctor. I also have nausea with anesthesia and they always give me Zofran during procedure into IV and give me a little more in recovery if needed. I felt more pain after this procedure than I ever had with RFA and was nauseous and they offered me crackers. No concern. They used to prescribe me nausea medicine to have on hand at home but their PA not the doctor decided to stop refilling that medication. I asked the nurse to have the doctor contact me regarding that and I never heard a word. I couldn't figure out why I felt so bad after this procedure and then realized upon looking at my discharge paperwork ( next day) that I got absolutely no Zofran as part of this procedure and they refused to give it to me in  recovery because they were so busy rushing everybody out because they were so far behind on their appointment. This is so unacceptable. This is not how you build peoples confidence People as patience. As noted I have been 15+ years and may have to consider other arrangements|I am going to have to agree with Sam's review. Dr Narain did the same thing to me & I believe every negative review of Dr Narain, he's a joke. If I could give him negative zero stars I would. I felt discriminated against the minute he walked through the door. I was seeing Dr Curletta for quite a few years before he retired (I don't blame him for retiring from this pathetic place. He lasted a whole 5-6 months & I can see why) & I ended up having to see Dr Narain. WORST Dr that I have ever encountered in my life!!!
He would not listen to anything that I had to say regarding my back pain & keep in mind that I have been going to pain centers/clinics for the last 30 years & have had every procedure done that can be done to my back, multiple times.
The Drs have all come to the conclusion that it is most likely pain from failed back syndrome & also extreme inflammation from my Hashimotos & that they would just keep me on my pain medication protocol that I have been on which is Tramadol, have been on forever (30 years) & it helps a lot. Some pain Drs laugh because that drug shouldn't even be considered a controlled drug, which it wasn't when I started on it. It doesn't make you high.
And because I took a Xanax while having a heart attack, which was legally prescribed to me as well, ( I showed him the bottles) he had a conniption fit & came at me like the Tazmanian Devil.
Mind you, I was on Xanax & tramadol for about 20 years before I even came here. My cardiologist said that the Xanax is probably what saved my life & they also prescribed it to me in the hospital while I was there along with my tramadol.
Because I continued to take it periodically because of high stress & I didn't want to have another heart attack which Dr Curletta completely understood, Dr Narian dropped me from the pain management part of the practice but not the procedure part. All he does is push procedures whether you have had them or not and if you don't agree with him he refers you to get help for drug abuse & dismisses you by writing HIGH OPIOID USAGE across your papers. He wrote that because my Xanax script was older & that no one was watching me. Trust me, if I was going to die from it, I would have died years ago. I only take .25mg of it when I do take it but am prescribed 1.50mg per day. Big deal.
He left me in the room crying, with no care in the world to listen to what I had to say. I sat there for 25 minutes so I got up & left. I told the girl at the front desk that Dr Narian was causing me a lot of distress (which is why I was put on Xanax to begin with. I have PTSD & other things & he was triggering them) so I was leaving & if they wanted to send me anything then they could. 2 weeks later I receive dismissal paperwork. I am here to tell you that us pain patients are already fragile enough from dealing with pain 24/7 & there is no reason to be treated that way by a so called professional. I have done everything & anything that any pain Dr has asked of me to do with no problems at all & now Dr Narian wants to start at the top AGAIN with procedures just to make money. You mean zero to him if you are just on a maintenance plan to get refills. This was my first appointment with him. I also paid to get my medical records from him & he has lies in them. I would RUN as fast & as far away from Dr Narain as you can & this Pain Center.
No joke,I would rather throw my money out the car window than ever giving it to him. After 30 years of pain centers/clinics I am done with them all. They were fine up until about 7 years ago with the exception of Dr. Curletta, he truly cared & it has been a constant fight since.
I have since found my own meds & they are not from a pain center.

Screw Dr Narain!!! & this Center but don't forget their motto: 

"At The Pain Center, it's our mission to develop strong patient-provider relationships before recommending therapies for pain. Once we've administered a thorough evaluation, we use a number of pain management techniques to tackle your pain head-on. Simply put, your needs are always made a top priority"

Bull Sh*t!!!|I was told this location stopped offering telehealth appointments, so now I have to drive out here every time I have an appointment. It also takes about 15 minutes to get ahold of anyone in scheduling.|This office is very exceptional! Dr. Narains staff is Very kind and genuinely listened and cared about My pain and how they could help. I did a 7 day test trial on a Implant prior to a surgery. during which Walker consistently called me and asked about my Pain to check on how I was doing.
Would for sure recommend.|Dr Narain is professional and what I consider superb giving epidurals. I've been getting epidurals in all areas of my spine and RFA's for years. I've had bad experiences. I've had one other most excellent Dr that retired. Dr Narain rates up with my last Dr. I've been looking for over a year, to find a Dr.|I'm still getting over the trauma of my last provider, AZ Pain Doctors (3 years with them). Staff and doctors here at TPC, have been amazing and have helped me regain trust through their treatment towards me as a patient, not a customer. Instead of leaving every appointment and procedure frustrated and upset (like with my last office), I leave content and confident, feeling heard, understood and updated on upcoming surgeries, procedures and tests.

They are available in real-time should something go wrong at home. I'm not waiting weeks and weeks to see them when something needs to be addressed urgently. I feel more a part of my medical team and not just their subject. It is refreshing.

And when it comes to scheduling procedures and surgeries, they aren't scheduled months out but weeks. That's a very big improvement and they watch orders submitted for prior authorization as often as they can. Meaning I don't have to do it, like I did in my last clinic. It's not perfect, and it will take some time for them to know me and my complex medical history but we will figure it out, as we have been since I first entered their practice.

column3:
Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP)

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a comprehensive interventional pain management clinic serving Surprise, Arizona and surrounding communities. The practice specializes in creating individualized treatment programs for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. ASAP's approach is driven by a proprietary outcomes program developed by their in-house physicians, ensuring evidence-based care tailored to each patient's needs.

Dr. Abram Burgher leads the clinical team at ASAP's Surprise location. As a Board Certified pain specialist, Dr. Burgher maintains an active interventional practice while contributing significantly to pain management research. He has served as principal or sub-investigator in over 100 FDA-regulated clinical trials, bringing cutting-edge pain solutions to Arizona patients.

The clinic offers specialized interventional procedures for spine conditions, joint pain, nerve pain, and complex regional pain syndromes. Patients benefit from minimally invasive techniques that target pain at its source. ASAP's treatment options include epidural injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and comprehensive medication management.

All ASAP physicians hold Board Certification in their specialties, and the non-physician providers typically bring years of specialized pain management experience. This expertise ensures patients receive the highest standard of care for conditions ranging from herniated discs to arthritis pain.

Located at 15571 N Reems Rd, Building D in Surprise, AZ 85374, the clinic provides convenient access for West Valley residents. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 480-573-0130 or visiting their website at www.asappaindocs.com.
column11:
Dr. Abram Burgher is an active clinician and researcher at Advanced Spine and Pain. In addition to a busy interventional practice, he has been a principal or subinvestigator in more than 100 FDA-regulated clinical trials.

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a comprehensive, interventional pain practice. ASAP prides itself on individualized patient treatment programs driven by an outcomes program developed by our own physicians. ASAP physicians are Board Certified specialists and our non-physician providers typically have years of experience in interventional pain management.

Dr. Burgher was very patient and listened to all my worries and helped put my mind at ease when needing to try something new for my pain. Very awesome bedside manner which is something pain Dr's lack in this state. I'm happy to have him as my pain dr and his team!|Dr. Burgher is a very knowledgeable and caring physician. He spends just enough time with you to know that you're not just a number but not so much that you're kept waiting forever to be seen.|Dr. B was fine... not happy at all with office staff.

While checking in for epidurals, clerk signing us in said they were going to deny us service due to non payment.... we were up to date.. after an arguement they permitted the epidurals.

The day before another epidural appointment, they called us and said we couldn't get the epidural until after another office visit... Then why did you set our appointment? That left us with a great deal of pain for an extended period of time.

I called twice to speak to the office manager and was left on hold for 30+ miniutes each time and the office manager never picked up or called us.

Bye bye Dr. B.... we are off to another clinic.|Dr. Burgher is a great doctor. He has listened to what I say and is working hard to alleviate my pain. I would recommend ASAP to anyone.|Wonderful doctor, wonderful staff!  I'm so happy to have been directed to Dr. Burgher. My back is better already as is my knee.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart!l|Dr. Burgher is the most knowledgeable and professional doctor I've met. He has an outstanding and caring bedside manner. He has helped me immensely with my neck pain. I'm so happy to have him as my doctor and highly recommend him to anyone suffering with pain. He is A+.|It's nice to  meet a Doctor that really  seems to care for the patient.  Wonderful experience. Your staff is just terrific. Thanks.|We have been seeing Dr Burgher for the last 6 months or so...he is great and the best one to go to

column2: Innovative Pain and Wellness - Central Phoenix
column3:
Innovative Pain and Wellness - Central Phoenix

Innovative Pain and Wellness offers comprehensive pain management services in Central Phoenix. Located at 1277 E Missouri Ave #102, this specialized clinic focuses on restoring patient wellness through personalized treatment plans. IPW distinguishes itself by rebuilding the doctor-patient relationship with compassionate, individualized care.

The clinic specializes in interventional pain procedures, medication management, and holistic wellness approaches. Patients experiencing chronic pain, sports injuries, or post-surgical discomfort receive customized treatment protocols. The medical team evaluates each condition thoroughly before recommending appropriate therapies.

At Innovative Pain and Wellness, education forms a cornerstone of patient care. The physicians take time explaining pain mechanisms and treatment options. This empowering approach helps patients actively participate in their recovery journey. Treatment plans often combine medical interventions with lifestyle modifications for optimal results.

The Central Phoenix location provides convenient access for residents throughout the Valley. The modern facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. Patients appreciate the welcoming environment designed for comfort during appointments.

New patients can easily schedule consultations by calling +1 480-467-2273. The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and offers flexible appointment options. Additional information about services and the medical team is available at http://ipwaz.com/.

Innovative Pain and Wellness stands committed to helping patients regain function and improve quality of life. The practice philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just symptoms. This comprehensive approach addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term wellness goals.
column11: Innovative Pain and Wellness is not your ordinary clinic. At IPW, we strive to bring the personal relationship back into medical care. We consider it a privilege to be involved in restoring your wellness and do so with compassion. When you become our patient, your team will not only treat your pain, but also create a unique environment that empowers and educates you.

I have been going to this pain management for the last three years.  Over a year ago Dr. Christine Haddad joined the practice.  I have been getting pain injections in my back, knees and shoulder forover 10 years. Of all the doctors that I have been too, Dr. Haddad is the least painful.  I have always gotten anesthesia for my back injections.  No need for that with Dr. Haddad.  She is that good.  I have received pain injections in my shoulder for just a few years. Dr. Haddad is the only doctor that has given me two different injections in that shoulder.  She saw something that other doctors didn't see.  Her entire team is excellent.  They are personable, compassionate and very knowledgeable.
From my experience, I HIGHLY recommend them. They will take good care of you.|I went to my 1st appt and it went great, I got an injection in my shoulder and that went great. column3:
Pain & Wellness of Arizona

Pain & Wellness of Arizona is Gilbert's comprehensive pain management clinic specializing in interventional treatments and holistic care approaches. Located at 610 N Gilbert Rd #309, Gilbert, AZ 85234, our medical team provides personalized solutions for chronic pain conditions affecting Arizona residents.

Our board-certified physicians combine advanced diagnostic techniques with targeted therapies for effective pain relief. The clinic offers specialized treatments for back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and neuropathic conditions. Patients receive customized care plans addressing both symptoms and underlying causes.

Dr. Sham Vengurlekar leads our clinical team with over 25 years of experience in interventional pain management. His extensive training includes fellowship completion at prestigious medical institutions and pioneering work in minimally invasive procedures.

Services at Pain & Wellness of Arizona include:

- Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain relief

- Radiofrequency ablation for nerve-related discomfort

- Spinal cord stimulation for complex pain conditions

- Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation

- Medical management of chronic pain syndromes

- Physical therapy integration for functional improvement

The clinic utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment for precise treatment planning. Our facility features comfortable treatment rooms designed for patient privacy and relaxation during procedures.

New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 480-926-1111 or visiting our website at https://painwaz.com/. Most major insurance plans are accepted, and our staff assists with coverage verification before appointments.

Pain & Wellness of Arizona serves Gilbert, Chandler, Mesa, and surrounding communities with compassionate, evidence-based pain management solutions.

Arizona Pain Relief is a specialized pain management clinic in Chandler, Arizona dedicated to treating underlying pain conditions rather than simply masking symptoms with medication. Our comprehensive approach addresses the root causes of discomfort through targeted interventions and personalized treatment plans.

Located conveniently off Queen Creek Road, our clinic specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, joint pain, headaches, migraines, and sciatica. Our pain management specialists have extensive experience treating whiplash, scoliosis, TMJ disorders, and various forms of arthritis. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual pain patterns and promote long-term healing.

The clinic's approach integrates advanced diagnostic techniques with evidence-based treatments. Patients receive thorough evaluations to identify pain sources before beginning treatment. Our medical team stays current with the latest pain management developments to provide optimal care.

Visit our Chandler location at 1055 W Queen Creek Rd #3, Chandler, AZ 85248 to begin your journey toward a pain-free life. Contact us at 480-630-8279 or explore treatment options at https://arizonapainrelief.com/.

column40: The providers and staff are great but the billing and payments are atrocious. They mislead you by showing you a payment plan for a treatment package on your first visit, but the costs end up being way more for the quoted treatments; however, they don't tell you your cost has changed, even when you ask during your visit. They only send your final bill when you've completed your treatment plan, but by then, you've already racked up a giant bill. You are better off going somewhere with honest and up-front pricing.|Dr. Voisin, Amy Martin and the entire staff are  such a delight to visit with. I've never had a complaint and they're always on time. The office vibe is very inviting and the physical therapy is top notch. They got me back to moving in no time. I wouldn't hesitate to refer them in a heart beat.|I went to AZ Pain for my back pain and although their pt service was amazing and they were able to help relieve my pain. Their billing team is a nightmare! I had originally agreed to an out of pocket amount during my consultation which covered my visits, injections and adjustments. I paid off this amount in two installments, however i was hit with huge outstanding bill after 2 months! Apparently the office did not provide the documents necessary to justify the need for the xrays and other services they asked me to have during my consultation when billing my insurance. When I called the office about this they directed me to billing, billing told me this was an insurance issue and when I started a claim and called my insurance they said the billing department was unresponsive and hard to get a hold off. I am still going back and forth with their billing and my insurance in order to get the outstanding amount taken care of (pt ended Sept '23). Please do your research before choosing this place, hope no one else has such an bad experience!|I take my mum there and I have to say they are all so sweet. Their kindness puts me and my mum at ease. We are always welcomed with a smile. They are also thorough and ask how my mom is doing. I recommend AZ Pain on Queen Creek Rd. Thank you for caring|I've been going to this clinic for a few months now and they have consistently provided full-circle care for me as I've been healing from issues throughout my whole back. Scheduling is always flexible enough around my hectic schedule, and contacting them has never been an issue. There's always an open line of communication between everyone who works there in order to make my visit feel personable and as transparent as possible. Each person there specializes in something in order to make treatment as stress-free as it can be. Emilio is always super thorough about how to do stretches and exercises, and is always 1 on 1 so there's no room for error. Taylor is great with trigger point injections and always chooses placement based off of where it's needed, even if it's in a different place. I am extremely happy with my care from them, and would recommend them for sure!|Been using Arizona Pain Relief for 3 years combined. Started in Scottsdale and now utilize Chandler location. Staff is phenomenal. They are all friendly, professional, and accommodating. They want what's best for you. They help reiterate through the process that your body recovery will be a lifetime process that you need to discipline yourself to do even after you leave their care. I definitely feel like the tools and knowledge are given to me to make this happen once my most recent treatment plan is up!|I've been coming to AZ Pain Relief for about a month. column40:
Im leaving this review in hopes you can all fix it for the next patient. Since day 1 I've had issues at this place, my chiro asked them to contact me to make an appointment for medical due to a car accident injury. Two weeks went by with no contact. Finally I get an appt in and the person in the front was so confused on why I was there. I met with a dr for her to just tell me there's no way I'm still feeling pain even after I described my pain. She then offered some injections (epidural) and I agreed. I finally get the approval from attorneys and I request an email stating I have an appointment for my employer. They send me a vague one saying "so and so has an appointment on this day" no time or any other info. I ask them to please send me one with the time and recommendations such as someone to drive me there and back. Crystal calls me and says they can't do that because of HIPPAA. So you can't send me the patient and email stating "you have an appointment on this day at this time . We recommend you to bring someone to drive you there and back" same info I was give on the phone but in writing to my email? I would've loved to give my job a heads up about this as I've missed work due to my injuries and I'm required to document it. I decided to cancel my appointment as I no longer trust or feel heard as the patient.|Dr. Fox brings such a native and intuitive understanding of his patients to this practice. I'm so glad this clinic opened and everyone is so friendly. His staff is big on going the extra mile and I'd highly recommend to anyone. It can be hard on you to open a new business but Dr. Fox has years of experience and it clearly shows.  I don't review many businesses but felt the need to recommend this one.|Dr. Fox is an amazing chiropractor.  I recommend him to everyone. I have recommended him to my sister and her husband, who are moving to the area soon, and they are very excited to try him out. He knows his anatomy and is also very caring. Highly recommend seeing Dr. Fox at this clinic.|I spent most of my adolescence going to chiropractors for sports related injuries. 25 years later I've found one who can really help. Dr Fox is highly skilled and a master of his craft. He isn't just some code talking doc but he explains what he is doing so that I can avoid the pitfalls that landed me in his office in the first place.|Dr. Fox and his staff are very caring and attentive. They do a good job to help their patients recover. They are a great team to work with.|I have struggled with back pain from a car accident and was missing time at work. Dr. Fox was able to help me. Now I am hiking again and my back feels so much better. The staff is always very friendly and knowledgeable.|I decided to write about my experience at Pain Stop Maryvale because I know that it can help you the same way it has helped me. I started going because I was having neck pain. I was having trouble sleeping and I would experience back pain while at work. Ever since I started getting treatment and adjustments I've started feeling better and I'm not having problem sleeping anymore. I look forward to my appointments because their staff is very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this office to anyone that is experiencing pain. It's a great place to go and get help.|So about a year ago I came here after I got into an accident while my case was going on. Before the accident I felt good I was doing great. Once the accident happened I was in so much pain I could barely walk my back hurt so bad. So I went to painstop maryvale on 71st Avenue and Thomas. I talked to sherry and told her about my incident and she made me go through the whole process. After the treatment she never gave me a call
Back or followed up with me. A few months later I got a call from my Lawyer saying that she told him that the injuries in my back were not due to the most recent accident I was in, that they were from previous accidents. Well of course they were from previous accidents but I felt great before and then it was reaggravated during my most recent accident and she failed to tell my lawyer that. I was in a car accident and was in the hospital all for her to tell me that my injuries weren't from that accident which made me feel awful. With that being said, my lawyers told me that I was lying about my injuries. So I got stuck with a lower settlement because of what sherry said. Or I'd be left with nothing. Sherry ended up getting a much bigger share of the settlement than I believe she deserved because of the words she used and I was left with much less than I deserved. I do not recommend this chiropractic office. Her words made everyone look at me as a liar and I felt extremely betrayed. All they wanted was money they didn't actually care about helping me,and I know that because I didn't get any call about my treatment afterwards. She shouldn't have made me go through the whole process for her to just say it wasn't from the accident, knowing it was. If you are in a similar Situation I would suggest having a lawyer double check everything or look elsewhere for treatment.

Active Life Pain Center in Litchfield Park, Arizona provides comprehensive pain management services using advanced non-invasive treatments. Located at 13575 W Indian School Rd, Suite 700, our clinic specializes in helping patients understand and control their pain conditions. We focus on empowering patients through education about their specific pain issues.

Our pain specialists utilize cutting-edge technologies to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Treatment plans are customized for each patient's unique needs. The center offers alternatives to surgery and medication-dependent approaches when appropriate.

At Active Life, we harness the body's natural healing abilities through innovative therapies. Our approach combines medical expertise with patient education for lasting results. Many patients experience improved mobility and reduced pain after treatment.

The clinic's medical team brings extensive experience in pain management techniques. Our physicians stay current with the latest advancements in pain science. We prioritize treatments that minimize downtime and maximize function.

Common conditions treated include back pain, joint discomfort, and nerve-related issues. We also address sports injuries and age-related degenerative conditions. Our goal is helping patients return to their normal activities quickly.

For personalized pain management in the Litchfield Park area, contact Active Life Pain Center at (623) 535-9777. Learn more about our services at www.activelifepaincenter.com.

column40:
From the moment I walked in to the moment I left, I felt taken care of by this office.  I've been suffering with knee and shoulder pain for far too long and all the other drs want me to either have surgery or find a new job.   They immediately got an ultrasound and mri scheduled and are putting together a plan of action to fix long term the ailments I have and are willing to work with me on payment plans.  Most dr offices won't, they want half upfront. I'm looking forward to the next few months to see what treatment we decide on and how soon I can get back to "normal"|Staff and doctors are excellent here!!  They listen and explain all that they are going to do.  Friendly, helpful and caring to your health needs and wants.  I have had 3 appointments so far and I look forward to each one moving forward in my pain n discomfort recovery.|I received the best of care during my treatments at Active Life Physical Medicine's Litchfield Park Surgical Center.
Every time I've called with any questions I've spoken to the front desk receptionist, Priscilla, who has always been, patient kind and helpful when I had to cancel and reschedule twice due to sickness.
And nurse, Casie-she's here there and everywhere, is great too, putting me at ease with her straight forward demeanor to answer any questions I've had regarding my medications, and during the prep time for readying me for the anesthesia, and making sure I understand the process, and helping me and post injections care, and getting me safely to my car, her assistant, Ashley(?), was so friendly as well, which put me at ease the day of my injections.
Sean, who seems to be the all-around can do whatever is needed guy, did a great job of putting me at ease for my blood draw-so good that I only had a tiny spot where the blood draw needle went in-which I usually, in other blood draws, always leave with a large bruise... and his knowledge regarding the blood draw put me greatly at ease about the whole process pre-injections, leading up to  the day of my PRP / A2M injections, for general idea of how it all works.
I briefly met Dr. Lundquist, and her friendly personality upon introduction, and bright smile put me at ease as well.
The anesthesiologist, George, really put me at ease pre going under, and especially the regarding thoughts I had about a medication I take, which I had to stop taking pre-procedure, and very importantly when best to start the medication back up post injections procedure.  Very thorough and friendly, putting me at ease.
I had heard very good things about Dr. Wendi Lunquist and her staff, from friends of mine who told me about the doctor and her staff, that I would be in good hands, the same as what they experienced... and they were right!
I am looking forward to future, additional treatments I am in need of via Active Life Physical Medicine and Pain Center... hoping for great results regarding these innovative, non-invasive treatments -- vs what I was facing with the recommended invasive joint replacement operations.|Doctor Lundquist is an amazing Doctor. Grateful for her experience, knowledge & cutting edge procedures. Her staff is friendly & calming. Makes my appointments stress free. My treatment today was quite helpful in easing my pain. Understanding person.

To explain everything about the procedures.

deeply appreciate doctor L for her work!!!!|I've been going to Dr Wendi Lundquist and her staff for 12 years for a permanent back injury that I got at work. She has taken care of me very well . column3:
Integrity Pain & Wellness

Integrity Pain & Wellness delivers advanced treatment for spine, joint, and neurologic pain across Arizona. The clinic specializes in minimally invasive interventional procedures targeting pain directly at its source. With locations in Scottsdale, Mesa, Glendale, and Prescott, patients throughout the Valley receive personalized care.

The medical team utilizes state-of-the-art fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance for precise treatment delivery. Each treatment plan is individually tailored based on comprehensive diagnostic studies and patient symptoms. This targeted approach helps minimize reliance on oral medications, particularly addictive opioid prescriptions.

Patients seeking relief from chronic back pain, sciatica, joint inflammation, or nerve conditions receive compassionate care focused on long-term solutions. The clinic's interventional pain specialists hold extensive training in pain management techniques that address underlying causes rather than masking symptoms.

The Mesa location at 7436 E Main St serves patients throughout the East Valley. New patients can schedule consultations by calling 480-325-9600 or visiting integritypainaz.com. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and offers various treatment options for both acute and chronic pain conditions.
column11:
Integrity Pain provides the most advanced and effective treatment for spine, joint, and neurologic pain. Our practice specializes in minimally invasive and non-invasive solutions for spine, joint, and nerve pain, with locations in Scottsdale, Mesa, Glendale, and Prescott, AZ.
Our team focuses on interventional treatments, which minimize reliance on oral medications. The goal is to treat pain directly at the source, utilizing fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance. We aim to reduce or avoid the use of addictive opioid medications.
Committed to providing compassionate pain relief to patients throughout the entire Valley, we always provide an individualized approach to care, based on diagnostic studies and symptoms.

From the moment I walked in, the staff greeted me warmly and made me feel comfortable. The front desk team was efficient and friendly, ensuring that my check-in process was smooth.

Alina took the time to listen to my concerns and answer all my questions. I truly appreciated their thoroughness and the personalized care I received. The office was clean and well-organized, which added to the positive atmosphere.

I also want to highlight the MA's & Front desk staff--they were attentive and compassionate throughout my visit. It's clear that everyone at this office genuinely cares about their patients.

I highly recommend Integrity Pain and Wellness to anyone looking for a caring and professional healthcare experience!|I have been coming to this clinic since 2021. It's now 2024 and I am doing muscle type of therapy. More like pressure points. The guys name is Steve and he genuinely has helped me so much. I was running out of help from the clinic I felt, the pills weren't working. Then here comes Steve helped and helps so much. The office staff and doctors are also wonderful.|I usually have my procedures done at the Scottsdale location and they are wonderful there. Unfortunately, the anesthesiologist and the doctor at the Mesa location performed the epidural, and caused me much more pain than I had when I walked in. I scheduled the procedure with sedation and anesthesia, because I know my pain threshold is very low. And during this particular procedure I felt everything. I did not feel sedated, nor did it feel like there was any anesthesia. Prior to the procedure, I informed them that I usually need higher doses than normal folks due to my EDS, and I was dismissed. When I had previous procedures with Dr. Patel, he reassured me from the beginning that he understood and he had no problems making adjustments. His procedures always went beautifully. This other set of doctors inflicted more pain on me than I've ever experienced with this clinic, and then attempted to put a lidocaine patch on my neck despite my repeated explanations that lidocaine does not work on me. I am quite traumatized and I'm very disappointed by the way I was treated today.|If your looking for a pain Management specialist LOOK ANYWHERE ELSE! Today, after being a patient for four years, I was abruptly informed that the practice would no longer be providing medication Management for Pain patients between "procedures." I drove an hour to be told something a phone call, email or text would have sufficed. I got this pathetic excuse for a justification from them. If your looking for a practice where you won't see a new P.A. or F.N.P. EVERY MONTH, or have your calls returned, provided basic consideration and courtesy look elsewhere. Attached are the letters I received with my termination of service (which was immediate, not 60 days from the date listed, as it says).|I have only been there 3 times but from the front desk to Alaina(hopefully that is her name) I have had a great experience with her as I have been dealing with severe lower back pain and gone through  three Drs asking for referrals to someone to help me. His empathy and customer service skills were superb!|Dr. Patel and Alina were amazing, very professional and welcoming. I recommend this clinic for pain management.

column3:
Elite Pain and Spine Institute

Elite Pain and Spine Institute in Mesa, AZ offers comprehensive pain management services for patients seeking relief from chronic conditions. Located at 535 E McKellips Rd Suite 121, our specialized clinic provides evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive experience in interventional pain management techniques. The medical team specializes in treating back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, and neuropathic conditions. Patients benefit from minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source.

The Institute offers advanced treatment options including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. We also provide regenerative medicine therapies such as PRP injections for tissue healing and recovery.

Our doctors combine their medical education with years of clinical practice to deliver exceptional care. Each treatment plan addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies. The clinic emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction.

Conveniently located in Mesa, we serve patients throughout the East Valley area. Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment for precise care. New patients can typically schedule appointments within one week.

The ultimate goal at Elite Pain and Spine Institute remains consistent: helping patients return to daily activities without debilitating pain. We focus on improving quality of life through personalized treatment approaches.

Contact us at +1 480-900-7373 to schedule your consultation or visit https://elitepainandspine.com/ for more information about our services.

OrthoArizona Pinnacle Pain - Scottsdale

OrthoArizona Pinnacle Pain - Scottsdale is a premier pain management clinic conveniently located at 9815 N 95th St, Scottsdale, AZ 85258, near the intersection of East Mountain View Road and North 96th Street. The clinic specializes in comprehensive interventional pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced treatment options with personalized care plans. Patients benefit from a complete range of services including assistive devices, adaptive equipment, and medication management protocols. The clinic excels in minimally invasive procedures designed to reduce recovery time and improve outcomes. Physical therapy and rehabilitation services are integrated into treatment plans for optimal pain relief.

The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. Our team consists of board-certified physicians with specialized training in pain management techniques. Nurse practitioners work alongside doctors to ensure continuous patient support. Physical therapists and massage therapists complement medical treatments with hands-on therapeutic approaches.

Conditions treated include chronic back pain, joint disorders, and neuropathic conditions. The clinic addresses both acute injury pain and long-term chronic pain issues. Treatment plans focus on improving mobility while reducing dependence on medications.

Patients appreciate our commitment to comprehensive care in one convenient location. The clinic prioritizes minimizing wait times for appointments and procedures. Our staff coordinates with primary care physicians for integrated healthcare delivery.

For pain management solutions in Scottsdale, contact OrthoArizona Pinnacle Pain at +1 480-407-6400 or visit https://orthoarizona.org/locations/orthoarizona-pinnacle-pain-scottsdale to schedule a consultation.

column3:
Advanced Spine and Pain

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a premier interventional pain management clinic serving Surprise, AZ and surrounding communities. Our comprehensive approach focuses on creating individualized treatment plans for patients experiencing acute and chronic pain conditions. Each patient receives a customized care program developed through our physician-designed outcomes methodology that tracks progress and adjusts treatments accordingly.

Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including low back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and post-surgical pain. ASAP physicians are all Board Certified specialists in pain management with extensive training in interventional techniques. Our non-physician providers bring years of specialized experience to complement our medical team.

At Advanced Spine and Pain, we welcome patients at any stage of their pain journey. Whether you're experiencing recent onset low back pain without prior treatment or dealing with complex pain issues following multiple surgeries, our team provides comprehensive evaluation and care. We begin with thorough assessments and recommend appropriate diagnostic imaging when necessary.

Treatment options include stepwise conservative approaches such as medication management, physical therapy referrals, chiropractic care coordination, and advanced interventional procedures. Our interventional techniques include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and other minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source.

Located at 15571 N Reems Rd Building D in Surprise, Arizona, our modern facility offers a comfortable environment for patients seeking relief. Contact us at (480) 573-0130 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

Visit our website at www.asappaindocs.com for more information about our services and providers.

column11:
Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a comprehensive, interventional pain practice. ASAP prides itself on individualized patient treatment programs driven by an outcomes program developed by our own physicians. ASAP physicians are Board Certified specialists and non-physician providers typically have years of experience in interventional pain management.

We are happy to see patients at any stage, from those with recent low back pain and no treatment, to more complex patients with years of pain and multiple surgeries. We offer initial evaluation and will recommend imaging or other studies as needed, with stepwise conservative care, including medications, physical therapy, chiropractic care and injections.

Very efficient.  Having been going there for over a year i would not go anywhere
else. Nurses ,anesthesiologist and Doctor are amazingly.  Always a great experience.|I was very nervous but the staff was very accommodating and sweet. Caring made me so much more comfortable and I loved everything about being there. Great experience! Thank you!|After reading the reviews and my initial interaction with the front desk, I was very optimistic about this place.  But after an hour of waiting and no one checking in on me, I've decided not to reschedule my appointment.  My appt was at 10am (12/16).  I was asked to come in at 930am to fill in the necessary intake forms.  I came in before 930, filled out the intake forms and was actually called back at 10:10... not bad for a 10am appt.  I can understand that doctors may be a little late and from the reviews,  it seems that the doctors really take the time to listen and understand the patient.  So, it wasn't lost on me that some appointments may run over as I can appreciate the provider making sure the patient was getting the best care possible.  But an hour later, I was still in the room.  No one had come to see me to see how I was doing or say that the doctor was running late.  It has been an hour and a half since being there and I couldn't wait any longer.  I went back up to the front desk to check on how long it would be. I was  told that he still had 1 more patient before me.  Unfortunately, I just couldn't wait anymore.  After stewing on it for a day, I just can't see myself rescheduling.  Having to take a day off from work, the long wait, and no one checking in on me... that kinda soured me on the entire situation. Hopefully someone will read this and use this as a learning experience.  Checking in on the patient and maybe giving them a heads up on any delays if possible.|Struggling a little with foot drop due to some lumbar back issues,  but couldn't of  asked for a better Dr than Dr Burgher to help get me through this challenging time with his wealth of knowledge,  amazing bedside manner, and coming up with a great plan of action. Integrated Pain Consultants

Integrated Pain Consultants, led by Dr. Nikesh Seth, provides comprehensive pain management services in Scottsdale, Arizona. The clinic specializes in identifying and treating the root causes of chronic pain through personalized treatment plans. Dr. Seth, a double board-certified Anesthesiologist, brings extensive expertise to each patient consultation.

At Integrated Pain Consultants, each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the underlying reasons for their pain. This individualized approach ensures effective treatment strategies tailored to specific conditions. The clinic offers advanced interventional procedures alongside conservative pain management options.

Dr. Nikesh Seth serves as CEO and lead physician, consistently recognized as "Top Doc" in pain management by Phoenix Magazine. His double board certification reflects his commitment to excellence in patient care. Dr. Seth's philosophy centers on treating each patient as a unique individual with specific needs.

The clinic addresses various pain conditions including back pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Treatment options range from minimally invasive procedures to medication management. Patients benefit from the latest evidence-based approaches to pain relief.

Located at 9500 E Ironwood Square Dr, Suite 125, Scottsdale, AZ 85258, the clinic provides convenient access for residents throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 480-626-2552 or visiting www.azipc.com for more information.
column11: Hi, I am Nikesh Seth, MD - CEO of Integrated Pain Consultants. I will be posting regularly about new topics ranging from managing pain to the current Opioid epidemic. I truly believes that every patient is a unique individual which is why each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the actual underlying reason for a patient's pain and discomfort.

column3:
Camelback Pain Center

Camelback Pain Center specializes in interventional pain management with a narcotic-free approach. Located in Paradise Valley, Arizona, our board-certified physicians focus on diagnosing root causes of pain conditions and developing customized treatment plans. The center emphasizes minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source.

Our pain specialists bring extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology. Each physician completed fellowship training in interventional techniques and stays current with advanced pain management protocols. This expertise allows us to address complex pain conditions that haven't responded to conventional treatments.

Patients receive individualized care plans based on comprehensive evaluations. Treatment options include nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine approaches. Our goal is helping patients return to normal activities without dependency on pain medications.

Camelback Pain Center offers flexible appointment options to accommodate diverse needs. Patients can schedule in-office visits at our Paradise Valley location or arrange concierge services where our providers travel to you. Telemedicine appointments are also available for appropriate consultations.

The clinic's modern facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment. Our compassionate staff coordinates all aspects of care, from insurance verification to procedure scheduling. We emphasize patient education throughout the treatment process.

Visit our Paradise Valley location at 5410 N Scottsdale Rd #B200, Paradise Valley, AZ 85253. Contact us at (480) 572-2444 or through our website at camelbackpaincenter.com to schedule your consultation.
column11: We are an expert pain center with board certified pain care physicians. Our focus is on a narcotic-free, interventional pain management approach to your health. We will diagnose your condition and build a custom individualized pain care treatment plan to effectively and quickly get you back to living a pain-free life. Our pain care providers and experienced staff can answer your questions and help coordinate the care you need, including traveling to you as a concierge pain service or scheduling your office visit. We also currently offer telemedicine appointments during the pandemic.

Arizona Pain | Anthem

Arizona Pain | Anthem specializes in comprehensive pain management solutions at our convenient Anthem location. Our clinic focuses on treating underlying conditions causing pain rather than simply masking symptoms with medication. Located at 3624 W Anthem Way c108 in Anthem, Arizona, our facility offers specialized care for patients throughout the region.

Our pain management specialists address a wide range of conditions including back pain, joint pain, headaches, migraines, and sciatica. The clinic provides effective treatments for neck pain, knee pain, and injuries resulting from auto accidents. Patients suffering from carpal tunnel syndrome, tendinitis, and osteoporosis find relief through our targeted treatment approaches.

The medical team at Arizona Pain | Anthem has extensive experience treating cervical stenosis, whiplash injuries, and scoliosis. We offer specialized care for TMJ disorders, arthritis, and sports-related injuries. Our comprehensive services extend to plantar fasciitis management and other chronic pain conditions.

Our physicians combine advanced medical training with years of clinical experience in pain management. The clinic utilizes evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our integrated approach may include minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, and rehabilitation exercises.

Arizona Pain | Anthem is conveniently located right off Anthem Way, making it accessible for patients throughout the community. The clinic maintains a patient-centered philosophy focused on improving quality of life. New patients are welcome to schedule consultations to develop personalized treatment plans.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, call +1 623-505-1493 or visit https://arizonapainrelief.com/. Start your journey toward living pain-free today.

column40: This office of Arizona Pain Relief has been so helpful to me. The office staff is so friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Dr. Frogley takes time to understand my unique symptoms and uses his knowledge to get my pain improved quickly. Within a week I was feeling so much better! Thank you Arizona Pain Relief?|No Brainer. You want personable people who have your best interest. This is the place. Mark, Megan, Cindy, Michelle, Elizabeth and the rest of the staff truly care. Appreciate these people taking care of me and getting my body back to a healthy status.|Amazing! I have never felt better. I struggled with back pain for years and never felt so good as when I started seeing Dr. Frogley and team. Highly recommend for pain relief!|I couldn't be happier with the care that I received at Arizona Pain Relief in Anthem.  For me, after following the treatment plan I was prescribed, my pain completely subsided.  I was thoroughly impressed with the consistent care and respect that I was shown each visit by Dr. Frogley and my Physical Therapist, Mike.  I would also be amiss if I didn't mention the fantastic front office staff! By far some of the best customer service I've ever received.  Every time I arrived, I was greeted by name and, although I'm sure they interact with many patients, their personalized touch made me feel welcome and appreciated.  I highly recommend Arizona Pain Relief if you're searching for compassionate and effective treatment for your pain.|Dr Frogley and his medical staff are great, but I had a major issue regarding collections. Initially I was to pay $2,164.65 for my portion of my care. I was to pay no more and that my insurance already paid $7,000 for my spinal shots. However, two weeks later I get a bill for $174.98 covering $25 per visit for my treatments. When I mentioned to the girl, Chloee in the billing department about her saying  that I would be paying no than the initial  $2,100 +, she said "there must be a mistake, let me look into that." The following week she told me that she made a mistake and that I was to pay an additional $45 per week to cover the therapy and chiropractic treatments. This is totally unprofessional. she is now saying that I will have to stop my scheduled shots or something else to correct the matter. To me that is like purchasing a car and then the salesman saying we are going to remove your radio or air conditioning because I made a mistake. I' be been in sales myself, and when I made a mistake I found ways to correct it, and have NEVER asked the end user to pay more than the quoted price! My suggestion would be for anybody going there to get you costs all in writing and signed, stating that there would be no more future costs. Update: We are currently trying  to work things out via negotiations. I hope we can because Dr. Frogley, Pat, and Jamie deserve all the best!|My experience at Arizona Pain Relief in Anthem has been nothing short of amazing. The staff is very personable and they really take the time to listen. Their expertise along with the hands-on guidance during physical therapy has definitely helped ease the back pain I was experiencing. Dr. Frogley was very intentional with each adjustment and I could not be more pleased with my first experience with chiropractic care. I highly recommend their establishment!|After over 15 years of experiencing occasional, but debilitating, back spasms, I was ready to try ANYTHING to get these spasms under control. My daughter, who lives in Anthem, had been present at her Anthem Rotary meeting, where a representative from Arizona Pain Relief had spoken, and my daughter insisted that I give them a try!  BEST THING I EVER DID!!!  Dr. Mark Frogley, Chiropractor, Pat Domanico, PT and Jamie Ahner, PA,, worked miracles! I was released from their care today, and I am pain free! This group of professional, caring individuals, and all those who I encountered while I was being treated, including their office staff, were remarkable. I looked forward to every appointment, and was always welcomed with the utmost courtesy, dignity and respect! If you are in pain, any kind of pain, give them a visit. You'll be glad you did!|Absolutely the best Walk in with a 10 pain 4 weeks later my pain is a 0 The best staff and a wonderful doctor he listen to you and work with you Thanks to all of them and above all to dr Frogley for giving back my life

column3:
Integrity Pain & Wellness provides advanced treatment for spine, joint, and neurologic pain across Arizona. With locations in Scottsdale, Mesa, Glendale, and Prescott, our pain management specialists deliver targeted interventional treatments using fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance. Patients throughout the Valley benefit from our minimally invasive and non-invasive solutions that address pain directly at its source.

At Integrity Pain, we focus on reducing reliance on oral medications, particularly addictive opioids. Our interventional pain techniques target the precise pain location rather than masking symptoms with medication. Each treatment plan is individually tailored based on comprehensive diagnostic studies and patient symptoms, ensuring effective pain relief with minimal side effects.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating various painful conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

Compassionate Care Throughout Arizona

Patients seeking pain relief can visit our Glendale location at 6677 W Thunderbird Rd g101, Glendale, AZ 85306. Our commitment to compassionate care extends to all patients throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area and beyond. Contact us at (480) 325-9600 to schedule a consultation and begin your journey toward effective pain management.

Learn more about our comprehensive pain management services by visiting our website at www.integritypainaz.com.
column11:
Integrity Pain provides the most advanced and effective treatment for spine, joint, and neurologic pain. Our practice specializes in minimally invasive and non-invasive solutions for spine, joint, and nerve pain, with locations in Scottsdale, Mesa, Glendale, and Prescott, AZ.
Our team focuses on interventional treatments, which minimize reliance on oral medications. The goal is to treat pain directly at the source, utilizing fluoroscopic and ultrasound guidance. We aim to reduce or avoid the use of addictive opioid medications.
Committed to providing compassionate pain relief to patients throughout the entire Valley, we always provide an individualized approach to care, based on diagnostic studies and symptoms.
