column40:
I can't say enough great things about Jen Sutton and the staff at the Glendale office, and the incredible care they provide. From the moment I walked into her office, I felt like more than just a patient--I felt truly cared for as a person.

Jen is cleaning a critical part of this location and there would be a huge decline in care provided and functional operations of the office if she was not there. Jen is not only highly skilled and knowledgeable but also compassionate and attentive. She takes the time to explain everything clearly, listens to your concerns, and ensures you feel comfortable every step of the way. It's clear that she genuinely cares about her patients' well-being, both physically and emotionally.

The results of her work speak for themselves--she's a true professional, and her expertise is unmatched. Whether you're seeking relief from pain or looking for solutions to improve your overall health, Jen at the Glendale location is the person to see.

I'm beyond grateful for the care and attention I received. If you're looking for a dedicated and talented pain doctor who truly puts her patients first, I highly recommend Jen Sutton and all the staff at the Glendale office!|I've been a patient at Integrity Pain Clinic since 2017.  I began at the Scottsdale office location and as the practice has grown over the years,  I then moved on to receive my care at the Glendale office location. I am writing this review to let others know of the caring, courteous, and qualified team of employees who have provided me with exceptional customer/patient service at the Glendale office location.

First, I want to thank Jennifer Sutton, FNP for always taking the time to listen to me. I always feel listened to and I so appreciate her candor when we are discussing treatment/options. Jennifer is so thorough and she always makes me feel valued and respected as a patient.

Secondly, I want to thank both Kim and Audrey for their timely responses when providing me solutions whenever I leave voice messages asking for scheduling changes or requesting prior authorization requests or simply needing clarification on an issue.  Both Audrey and Kim have directly made things easier for me through effective time management of my monthly appointments, or by offering me a telephone appointment as a solution whenever a last minute conflict arises in my schedule.

Thirdly, I want to thank additional members of the staff,  Diana, Katera, and Manderz. The interactions I have had with them in either a front or back office capacity or as part of a lab collection interaction have all been provided to me with the utmost professionalism and kindness.

In closing, I commend the entire staff at the Glendale office location for a job well done.  I hope the owners and/or the management team at Integrity Pain Clinic are aware and will continue to recognize these specific employees for their dedication for a job well done.|The staff are all amazing people, you walk in and you are greeted w/smiles n genuine care...Dr. Jennifer Sutton takes the extra time and care you may need, never rushed and always answers any questions you have. I look forward to my appointments and highly recommended them! I am grateful they manage my pain needs.|I recently visited Integrity for injections to treat my back pain, and I am extremely pleased with the outcome. From the moment I arrived, the staff was welcoming and professional, creating a reassuring environment.

The medical team took the time to thoroughly assess my condition and clearly explain the injection procedure. Their expertise and attention to detail made me feel confident and comfortable throughout the process.

I am happy to report that since the injections, I have experienced significant relief from my pain. This improvement has greatly enhanced my quality of life, and I am grateful for the care I received.|Years of no medication change, so medicine no longer works, I am forced shots and get to feel injection site for a week. I have repeatedly asked for help, it's also wonderful to be allowed to run completely out of medication. Considering I have had to take this medication for 30 years off and on, one day ahead would be considerate, no we can't have that, if I couldn't get out that day, out. I absolutely do not feel cared for at all, and I have been with your company for years. I wish I could say thank you, I am not hurting, though that is not the case, I fractured my lower back twice and it is excruciating all the time, I screws and plates, degenerative disc, bulging discs, spinal stenosis, arthritis I am extremely grateful to be walking etc. I am extremely tired of being in pain 24/7 yet I am in pain management, begging for pain management. I don't know what else to do anymore .|I've been a loving loyal patient of integrity pain & wellness coming on like 7 to 8 years. I have nothing but good things to say about my care here. As someone who has Army injuries and been through 4 severe motorcycle accidents with life time permanent and painful injuries, someone with dextroscoliosis, severe neuropathy and other things, this place helped me out during probably the darkest time of my life. As a single father, they have allowed me to be as functional in my daughters life and be a part of it as much as I can be despite everything I have wrong! And that I can never ever thank them enough for!!! From my nerve burn injections to my medications/pain management plan, to my MRI & nerve study tests, Jennifer Sutton who I've been seeing for about two years maybe 3 has always put my concerns on the top of my total care plan. To Dr Patel who does my nerve burning injections in my cervical neck and lumbar spine. Sometimes they can be very painful depending on how my spine & neuropathy is acting up on that given day. But well worth the extra pain. as I don't do sedation just because of bad problems with major surgery sedation of previous other doctors not related to this place. But 99% of the time the injection pain subsides about 3-7 days later along with relieving pain in said areas by about 30-50% and giving me better sleep and daily life functions!! That I otherwise would not have! I cannot thank them enough!|I brought my Father-in-law to this location for tests that he needed. I was his driver and was waiting with him.  After waiting more than 45 minutes he needed to use the restroom. When I asked the person behind his desk where the bathroom was she informed me that the restroom was for patients only. I understand they don't want people walking in off the street to use their restroom, but to not allow someone waiting with the patient to use it is ridiculous.  After he was done and we were back in the waiting area another patient entered and the person with her inquired about using the restroom and he was directed to the gas station outside of the complex and told he could go over there.  I am glad I will never have to go back to this place.

Edited to respond to their response: There was only ONE other patient in the waiting area, this was NOT a busy time. The person that I spoke with was VERY rude to me when I asked about the restroom, despite the fact that she had checked my Father-in-law in, knew I was with him and saw me pushing him in his wheelchair. It seemed pretty obvious to me that HE was the one that needed the restroom, I certainly would not bring him with me if I need to use it.|Jennifer is an amazing doctor and always listens to my problems and concerns and makes sure I have what I need to feel better

Kim the office manager is also so amazing and has always treated me very nice and respectful for many years that I've been a patient

column3:
Arizona Pain Treatment Centers has been serving Phoenix, Arizona and surrounding communities since 1997, providing specialized pain management solutions for patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our dedicated medical facility combines advanced treatment modalities with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Our clinic offers a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management treatments. The medical team specializes in:

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Epidural steroid injections

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Joint injections

- Nerve blocks

- Medication management

- Physical therapy coordination

Expert Medical Team

The practice is led by Board-Certified Pain Management Specialists with extensive training in pain medicine. Our physicians completed advanced fellowships in pain management following their primary medical education, ensuring patients receive care from doctors with specialized expertise in treating complex pain conditions.

column3:
AZ Pain Doctors provides comprehensive pain management services in Phoenix, Arizona. Our specialized team takes a complete approach to managing chronic and acute pain through advanced diagnostic techniques, innovative treatment methods, and personalized care plans. Located at Highland Avenue, our clinic combines medical expertise with compassionate patient care to help residents throughout the Phoenix metropolitan area find relief from debilitating pain conditions.

At AZ Pain Doctors, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our services include interventional pain procedures, medication management, chiropractic care, and advanced diagnostic assessments. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs of individual patients, targeting the root cause of pain rather than just symptoms. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and post-surgical pain.

Our Clinical Approach

Our physicians employ evidence-based practices to develop effective pain management strategies. The clinic utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment to accurately identify pain sources. Treatment options range from minimally invasive procedures to comprehensive rehabilitation programs. We emphasize patient education, ensuring you understand your condition and treatment options fully. Our goal is providing long-term pain relief while improving overall quality of life.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in building strong doctor-patient relationships based on trust and communication. Each patient receives personalized attention during their visits, with ample time to discuss concerns. Our staff coordinates care with other healthcare providers when necessary. We accommodate urgent pain issues with flexible scheduling options. The clinic environment is designed for comfort and accessibility.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with AZ Pain Doctors, call us at +1 602-795-8700. Our clinic is conveniently located at 2222 E Highland Ave, UNIT 220, Phoenix, AZ 85016. For more information about our services and treatment options, visit our website at https://azpaindoctors.com/. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to address financial concerns.
column11: At AZ Pain Doctors we take a complete approach to manage your pain with the most advanced pain management methods, diagnostic techniques, chiropractic care and more. We work with each individual patient to develop a plan of treatment that best fits your chronic or acute pain. Contact us today to schedule an appointment.

column40: I've suffered from chronic pain for the better part of 20 years, due to degenerative issues of the spine. For the most part I've lived a fairly active life and thankfully Dr. Ray, and NP Salazar (I think I spelled that wrong) have continued to allow me to keep living it. When I moved here a little over two years ago, I left a great pain management Dr who really helped me regain my life and retain my dignity as a chronic pain patient. To say I was worried, was an understatement. As I've heard pain management care in Phx is  abysmal. In fact, the first two pain dr's I went to were horrid and treated me like a drug seeker (I, in fact, refuse most pain meds). Az pain doctors restored my faith and have kept me functioning. Even their front desk staff is amazing and caring. Heck, they know you by first name basis there. You never feel like another number there. I'd definitely recommend (and have) to anyone who is looking for compassionate and effective pain management.|Staff very nice. Jonathan Salazar the NP, was very informative and took his time explaining everything. I'm excited about working with this pain practice to resolve my back problems. Highly recommend them. I had a pain management Dr. I was seeing, he left his practice suddenly and no one knows where he went.|They're always so kind there they do me good they put shots in my knee so I can walk preventing myself from having to have surgery. Thank you, Pain Center, Doctor Siwek you're great.|They provide excellent care with great quality service. The staff is very professional every visit I came too. I highly recommend this office to provide care for the health issues I need.|I always have a wonderful experience when I go there my doctor is great and the nurses are very respectful and kind.|The whole team is awesome.!! Dr.Salazar does an incredible job. He listens to you and helps you and every way above and beyond his job I would recommend him to anybody who struggles and needs pain management.!!|They are amazing, the staff is friendly and very caring. John Salazar is so caring and very understanding.  I just started going to this facility and already feeling better. Thank you|Dr David Ray has been a true lifesaver for me. He is very proactive truly cares and thinks out of the box. And he listens! Arizona Pain | Arrowhead provides comprehensive pain management solutions in Peoria, Arizona. Our dedicated team focuses on treating underlying conditions causing pain, not merely masking symptoms with medication. Located conveniently off Thunderbird Road, our clinic serves patients throughout the Arrowhead area with personalized care plans designed for long-term relief.

At Arizona Pain Relief, we offer specialized treatments for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Spine-related issues: Back pain, neck pain, sciatica

  • Joint problems: Knee pain, arthritis, tendinitis

  • Neurological conditions: Headaches, migraines, carpal tunnel syndrome

  • Structural concerns: Scoliosis, cervical stenosis, osteoporosis

  • Injury recovery: Auto accident injuries, whiplash, sports injuries

  • Specialized treatments: TMJ disorders, plantar fasciitis

Our Treatment Philosophy

We believe in addressing the root causes of pain through evidence-based approaches. Our physicians develop individualized treatment plans combining interventional procedures, physical therapy, and appropriate medication management when necessary. This comprehensive strategy helps patients achieve lasting relief and improved function.

Convenient Peoria Location

Our clinic is easily accessible at 7558 W Thunderbird Rd #4B, Peoria, AZ 85381. We welcome patients from throughout the Arrowhead area seeking effective pain management solutions in a supportive environment.

Begin your journey toward a pain-free life today. Contact us at (623) 432-0630 to schedule your consultation or visit arizonapainrelief.com for more information about our services.

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) delivers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Mesa, Arizona. Our practice focuses on creating individualized treatment programs for patients experiencing acute and chronic pain conditions. Each care plan is driven by our physician-developed outcomes program that tracks progress and ensures effective pain relief.

At ASAP, we welcome patients at any stage of their pain journey. Whether you're experiencing recent low back pain with no prior treatment or dealing with complex pain issues following multiple surgeries, our team provides thorough evaluations and personalized care plans. We offer:

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Advanced diagnostic imaging

  • Medication management

  • Interventional procedures and injections

  • Coordination with physical therapy

  • Chiropractic care referrals

Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by Board Certified pain specialists with extensive training in interventional techniques. Our non-physician providers typically bring years of specialized experience in pain management. This combination of expertise allows us to address complex pain conditions with the most current evidence-based approaches.

Stepwise Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in starting with conservative treatments when appropriate. Our physicians develop customized care plans that may include medication management, therapeutic exercises, and minimally invasive procedures. This measured approach helps patients find relief while minimizing risks.

Visit Our Mesa Location

Advanced Spine and Pain welcomes new patients at our convenient Mesa office. Contact us to schedule your consultation:

Address: 4566 E Inverness Ave STE 205, Mesa, AZ 85206

Phone: (480) 573-0130

Website: www.asappaindocs.com

Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP) is a comprehensive, interventional pain practice. ASAP prides itself on individualized patient treatment programs driven by an outcomes program developed by our own physicians. ASAP physicians are Board Certified specialists and non-physician providers typically have years of experience in interventional pain management.

We are happy to see patients at any stage, from those with recent low back pain and no treatment, to more complex patients with years of pain and multiple surgeries. We offer initial evaluation and will recommend imaging or other studies as needed, with stepwise conservative care, including medications, physical therapy, chiropractic care and injections.

column40:
The staff are all very kind, they are very well organized & professional.  My doctor (Kallgren) is very straightforward & honest. I have complete confidence in him.|Great experience, I got to my appointment 15 minutes early and got in immediately.  I got in to room to have my procedure done quickly and it went well.|I had a good appointment.  I have to get my nerves burned in my neck because of my pain and Kelly and staff were helpful in getting me on the schedule.  Dr. Leatham is so nice and really cares about my health care.  Nurse Nikki is my favorite nurse. She always makes me feel welcomed and is so nice.|I was very upset last Monday as my husband and I drove three hours to the Gilbert office to be told I was late and they cancelled my appointment.  The appointment was for 1:45, I got there at 2:03.  I was told I had to check in at 1:30!!! The girl said I should of called to say I was running late.  I said why, you can never get through to a person so why bother????  I started having a panic attack and tearing up.  While I was standing there another young lady called my name to come back for my appointment and the one who CANCELLED me took it out of her hand and said I was CANCELLED.  I said I needed to be seen  in person.  My husband is having open heart surgery on the 20th and I can't come back for a while.  They said they didn't have any openings and they had a virtual appointment with Rick Allen.  I was told this was my only option so I took it.  While I was in the parking lot the Mesa office called for virtual appointment and I asked the young lady if Rick was in the office and if I could come in and see him since I was already up in Phoenix.  She said yes!!!  We drove over, the appointment was about 7 to 8 minutes and we drove back to Yuma.  When I have seen Dr. Leathem in the past, he has said  that since we drive 3 hours away he would still see me.  I apologized for being late.  I usually have a positive experience with staff and doctors.|Another example of a medical practice that could care less about your wellness. I am a young dad in my 30's, but I had a double spinal fusion 3 years ago. My wife and I both called to confirm that the treatment I utilize was offered by ASAP, and we both were told yes on recorded calls. At my intake appointment, the provider talked to me like a piece of gum on the bottom of his shoe, and quickly told me that I would need to find a different provider. I have never experienced such poor ethics or bedside manner. Fortunately Phoenix is a massive market, and my business and care will be provided for elsewhere. I would not recommend this provider.|My experience was very good, and better than I expected.|I want to publicly thank Dr Richard Allen and Dr Jason Neilson for, not only the care that they have provided, but for the hope that they have given me.
My pain due to a hereditary disease, multiple injuries, and a few surgeries that didn't go right have left me in so much pain that my wife and I had to make the hardest decision, to live in separate states so that I could get the medical care that I needed and also so that my negativity would not affect my son as he grows up. It was so hard to see beyond my pain that that had become my only reality.
With the help of Advanced Spine and Pain and their staff, I have quality of life in this moment. I'm not 100% out of pain or any where near but it has been drastically reduced and I've been able to FaceTime with my family and laugh and smile and hear about their days instead of just complaining as I'm writhing in pain.
On top of that they have given me hope that with nerve blocks, minimally invasive surgery (if necessary), braces, and some at home traction that I will most likely have reduced my pain to have a fairly normal life. Which is not what I've heard from my doctors in the past. I've had so many warnings and so many times been given the worst case scenarios as my only option that I've become agoraphobic and a hypochondriac.
Over night, I'm not cured but, I do have some comfort and believe that I will be able to live and not just be alive for the first time in a very very long time.
If you need help, this is the place to start.|Dr Latham is and outstanding doctor. From check in, to vitals and specifics. Outstanding

**COMPREHENSIVE PAIN MANAGEMENT** serves the Scottsdale area with specialized pain treatment solutions. Located at 8841 E Bell Rd Ste 101, our clinic focuses on addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized care plans.

At COMPREHENSIVE PAIN MANAGEMENT, we utilize evidence-based techniques to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies. Each treatment plan is tailored to address specific pain conditions while minimizing medication dependence.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating:

- **Back and neck pain**

- **Joint pain and arthritis**

- **Neuropathic pain conditions**

- **Post-surgical pain**

- **Sports injuries**

- **Work-related injuries**

- **Complex regional pain syndrome**

Advanced Treatment Options

The clinic offers numerous interventional procedures including:

- **Epidural steroid injections**

- **Facet joint blocks**

- **Radiofrequency ablation**

- **Spinal cord stimulation**

- **Trigger point injections**

Physician Expertise

Our board-certified physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine. Each doctor has completed specialized fellowship training in pain management techniques and stays current with the latest advancements in the field. This expertise allows our team to address even the most challenging pain conditions.

Patient-Centered Care

We prioritize patient education and involvement in treatment decisions. First appointments typically include comprehensive evaluation of pain history, physical examination, and review of previous treatments. Our goal is creating sustainable pain relief strategies that improve daily functioning.

Contact COMPREHENSIVE PAIN MANAGEMENT at +1 602-971-8200 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about our services can be found at http://azcpm.com/.

Each time he's done procedures for me, I've heard from a variety of surgery center staff (front desk, nurses, other doctors) how good Dr. Keller really is - and I've found it all to be true. I trust each and every person who works for these Doctors.  I saw Dr Schurgin and then started with Dr Keller during a transition .  Dr Kell is one of the Best and nicest Doctors you could have. The entire staff, the nurses, the very friendly anesthesiologist, and of course Dr. KellerShabrokh really went a long way to making this experience less traumatic for me. Thank you so much I will for sure recommend.|Never ever have I had a doctor that is so in tune to listening to my issues and reviewing my records. Dr Khan is amazing when ever I am in pain he seems to know what to do. Last time with my lower back I had pain running all the way down to my feet, after 2 visit my pain is 90 % better. He is so friendly I feel almost like he's my friend. He really cares about his patients, if you have any pain this is the doctor to go to.|I have been seeing Dr Khan for the past 4 years following a car accident that left me with chronic pain. Dr Khan is very attentive and compassionate and I truly appreciate the level of care I've received. I'm extremely grateful for the improvement in my quality of life thanks to Dr Khan's expertise.|Do not come here. They're completely money hungry and the least compassionate care team I've ever seen. My disabled partner got hip injections in both hips and they refused to give a doctor's note for her work. She was in so much pain I had to help her to the bathroom and they made us come in office to prove she was in pain! On top of that they made her pay a $60 copay for the doctor's note!|I've been a patient of Dr. Asim Khan at AZ Pain and Spine Institute for over a decade. My experience has been nothing short of exceptional. From the warm and friendly staff to my personal experience with Dr. Khan, I am incredibly grateful. For their attention to detail and support, I couldn't imagine going to another practice for my chronic pain care.  I have and will continue to recommend to everyone I know who needs treatment/consultation for spinal care needs--highly recommended. Five stars, and only because they don't have six or more available.|If I could leave a zero, I would.  In August of 2024,  my husband saw Dr. Kahn for an SGB.  He told him that HealthChoice (AHCCCS) would not pay for the procedure and it would be $500 out-of-pocket.  He paid it and had the procedure, which didn't relieve the pain.  After speaking with our insurance company, we found out that they would've paid for it.  We called the office and spoke with the rude "office manager" and asked them to submit the bill and reimburse my husband.  She refused and said they don't submit to any AHCCCS plans, yet they accepted it for the initial office visit.  If you still end up there for treatment and have AHCCCS, call your insurance company and ask if the procedure is covered.  It's obvious they're out for money and I would steer clear of this company.|I can't thank Dr. Khan enough for the incredible care and relief he's provided for me over the course of my treatment. He has helped me manage multiple areas of pain and I am able to enjoy my daily life without being held back by the constant discomfort. If you're struggling with pain, I highly recommend Dr. Khan!|Edit: I've decided not to go here anymore since they won't give me relief where it's painful and swollen. Dr Ryklin thinks "minimal disc bulge" is insignificant and that's unacceptable!
If it hurts then they should do something!
I've been in pain all year. Every MRI I've had is changing for the worse. Several issues here and there throughout whole spine. No matter what I tell Kaitlyn about certain areas that hurt, Dr Ryklin has his own plan.. He doesn't like to talk much at all. Just stick with needles and out the door. Meanwhile the rest of my back is in pain!
Whenever I get sedation, the lady always blows my vein and has to do it again on other arm. And it is true what other reviews say about staff when calling/front desk people... They seem clueless and/or somewhat rude.
I thought a place like this would have more sympathy about pain. I'll go somewhere else! Not wasting my time trying to tell him I'm in pain!|I have been a patient since 2008 with Dr. Khan and his staff. They are committed to helping you in getting your pain under control. I would highly recommend this for your pain needs!

East Valley Pain Management provides comprehensive pain relief solutions for residents throughout Tempe and the greater Phoenix area. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized, multidisciplinary approaches. Located at 2600 E Southern Ave in Tempe, Arizona, our team delivers evidence-based treatments designed to improve quality of life and restore functional abilities.

At East Valley Pain Management, patients receive tailored care for various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain management

  • Joint pain treatment

  • Neuropathic pain relief

  • Post-surgical pain care

  • Sports injury rehabilitation

  • Arthritis pain management

Our physicians combine advanced interventional techniques with comprehensive treatment plans addressing the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of chronic pain. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and goals of individual patients.

Our Approach to Pain Management

The clinic employs a holistic methodology focusing on identifying and treating pain sources rather than merely masking symptoms. Our board-certified pain specialists have extensive training in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and rehabilitation techniques. Treatment options may include:

  • Minimally invasive procedures

Patient-Centered Care

East Valley Pain Management prioritizes patient education and active participation in treatment decisions. Our team takes time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. We believe informed patients achieve better results and maintain improvements longer.

New patients can expect comprehensive evaluations that include detailed medical history reviews, physical examinations, and when necessary, diagnostic testing. This thorough approach ensures accurate diagnosis and effective treatment planning.

Contact Information

Dr. Sraow is top notch. Very skilled with an excellent bedside manner and a genuine concern for the health and outcomes of his patients. Highly recommend.|Very professional. I was referred by a spine surgeon and was able to be seen within 1 week.  The office is clean and nice. Staff is responsive and the doctor is excellent. Had 2 epidural shots and my pain is gone. Good experience and recommend.|Very good pain management office. They really care about you and the staff works hard to make sure everything is taken care of for you - they are very nice girls in the office. I thought the doctor is also really good and easy to communicate with. I feel like he really wants to help me get better and  I am happy with his plan.|I have to agree with the other people that It was helpful for a few months and than downhill from there.  When I started getting bills in December 2018 for visits in 2017, made me wonder what kind of billing system they had.  There office staff changed so often except for a couple of the girls and it was always hard to get questions answered.  If you called in to have a question for the Dr. you never received a call back when you would be told they would have the Dr. return your call.|I came here after going to Valley Pain Consultants for two years. They were great for the first year, then their service started plummeting. So I decided to seek treatment elsewhere and get a fresh look at my lower back pain.
He's a very nice Doctor, but unfortunately his clinic doesn't offer sedation for injections. I came in for two injections and at the last minute, I had to back out when he told me they only offer Xanex for relief. I cannot take Xanex as it makes me feel sick and anxious (I understand the irony, as Xanex is supposed to relieve anxiety). I've had countless injections in the past and tried them without sedation... worst mistake of my life. I squirmed so bad, they had to hold me down. I thought I was a tough guy till that day. I'm not sure if they just hit a certain nerve or what happened? Hope that helps.|DON'T GO HERE. The doctor (Sraow) punctured the derma of my vertebrae and I ended up leaking cerebral spinal fluid for a month and a half. I had to go into the hospital three times and pay thousands of dollars to fix this problem. Then the doctor sent me a bill for the procedure he botched repeatedly, even after learning he did irreparable damage to my body! I say again: DON'T GO HERE.|This place is so horrible
Their staff is so stupid!
If you need a referral don't expect for it to go through the staff has no idea what their doing

column2: Desert Sky Spine and Pain Tucson Clinic
column3:
Desert Sky Spine and Pain serves Tucson residents seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team at Desert Sky understands how pain restricts daily activities, disrupts sleep, and prevents you from enjoying life's moments. We focus on identifying and treating the root causes of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Desert Sky Spine & Pain, we believe effective pain management begins with comprehensive evaluation. Many patients come to us after enduring pain for months or years, having tried numerous treatments without success. Our specialists develop personalized treatment plans addressing your specific condition, medical history, and lifestyle needs.

Rather than relying solely on medication, we implement integrated treatment strategies that may include:

  • Interventional procedures
  • Physical therapy recommendations
  • Minimally invasive techniques
  • Advanced diagnostic imaging
  • Targeted medication management

    • Conditions We Treat

    Our Tucson clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain
  • Joint pain and arthritis
  • Neuropathic pain
  • Sports injuries
  • Post-surgical pain
  • Sciatica and radiculopathy
  • Complex regional pain syndrome

    • We understand that each patient's experience with pain is unique. Our physicians bring extensive training and experience in pain medicine to provide the most current and effective treatments available.

    Visit us at 6585 N Oracle Rd, Tucson, AZ 85704 or call +1 520-229-2080 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about reclaiming your active lifestyle at https://desertskymedicine.com
column9: Anesthesiologist|Doctor|Medical clinic|Medical examiner|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician
column11:
Reclaim your life with Desert Sky Spine & Pain.
We know what it feels like to be restricted by pain - to lose sleep, take time off work, to have to skip fun adventures or to constantly worry about disruptions in your life because of the next flare up. We want our patients to live life on their terms, enjoying active and fulfilling lives.

Most people wait until they are desperate to address their pain and at that point, they need strong medication to get their pain under control just to be able to sleep or make it through the day. This doesn't address the root of the pain and can become a vicious cycle.

At Desert Sky Spine & Pain, we believe in addressing the root issue behind your pain, so you don't have to worry about the next flare-up.

I have been very impressed with both Arizona Pain Solutions and Scottsdale Pain Solutions, the latter of which I have had the majority of my visits. Dr. Derian has been amazingly helpful with pain issues in my hands, wrists, and knees. I am still in the final stages of PRP working on those areas, but I am very pleased with the results so far. The medical staff at SPS (and APS) have always treated me with courtesy, professionalism, and kindness. I could not be happier with the care I have received in their hands.|I thought my neck pain would never go away but after 5 months with physical therapy Dr Derian worked a miracle and my pain is gone. Thank you Dr Derian for the great work|The Dr and staff are so kind and helpful. I always feel at ease and less pain after my visits. I know they have my best interests in their concerns and show it in their care for me.|I had to put one star but would have preferred zero.
My husband went in for an epidural pain blocker.
We had an over the phone consultation with the doctor a week ahead and were told he would have 50 to 90% improvement from the first shot and from there we would decide if another was needed after 2 weeks.
He had zero change from the epidural. When my husband called to ask the doctor about it the front desk said she would talk to him. She called back to let him know he would need another round. When pushed on the fact that we were told 50 to 90% improvement their answer was surgery. However, my husband multiple times asked to talk to the doctor and was told "well its his choice if he decides to call you back."
Well any doctor that cannot talk to a patient on the phone or have the decency to call back within a day or two should not be trusted.|Nurse staff and dr. Derian very knowledgeable, attentive and thorough. Polite and accommodating. Dr. And his staff well versed and engaged throughout procedure. The injections to shoulders , then to scalp painless, and good job on blocking on scalp, the poking was discomfort, but bearable, thx to blocker. Again, all staff and docs attentive and knew the science and explained options available so I could make informed decisions . Thx u, will be back!|I love this office. Dr. Derian and the rest of the staff are great. They truly offer the best patient care out here in the wild Wild West.|The staff at APS have been so nice and professional. They answer all questions and have been tremendous in helping with scheduling and the treatment I have received. 100 percent would recommend them.|The staff is always so friendly and caring. I may be in pain when I arrive but I know within a few days, (maybe even sooner) I will be feeling so much better! I highly recommend AZ Pain Solutions.

column40: I have been coming here for pain management for over two years.  I have had both shots in my knees and shoulders and find the procedures are done very professionally.  Julie is such a sweet and compassionate doctor.  All employees are friendly and kind.|Sun Pain Manager has taken care of my needs for years now! The staff is incredibly nice and professional and the Doctor's really really listen to what you have to say! Now a days that's a rarity! I would most Definitely Recommend you giving them a try!|The Surprise Pain facility is a hole in the wall office, and they purely just want your money, but I just used them to prescribe my cronic back pain medication. I have suffered from chronic low back pain for years. I recently pinched my Sciatic nerve, which is a new injury, and it was the most pain I have endured in my 67 years of life. I was forced to come in for an appointment with Nurse Practioner Julie Overbey as they wouldn't allow a zoom appointment even though I was in excruciating pain. I mean tears from a grown man type of pain. At this brief appointment, I told her my regular pain meds were not even slightly helping the pain. After begging, she prescribed a week's worth of additional pain meds, that were actually a less strength mg dose than my existing pain meds, and I scheduled some injections in my back. I called, and called leaving message after message stating the additional pain meds were not working, and it was going to be an additional week or more before I could get in for the injections. I could not even get a call back, they just ignored my messages. Meanwhile, they had sent a message to my primary Dr. for approval, and they didn't even check back when they hadn't heard anything from him. I had to schedule a zoom appt with my primary Dr. to explain I need approval from him, which he knew nothing about. I'm changing Pain Management doctors after dealing with mediocre service at best, and they are closed on Fridays. I would not recommend Sun Pain Mangement to anyone.|Julie is amazing! I truly feel listened to when I come here. She's helped me tremendously throughout multiple surgeries. I'm so happy I found this office.|I just recently moved to AZ a year ago and needed to find a pain specialist. Talk about the anxiety of having to find all new everything, especially in the pain management field where sometimes you feel judged and maybe not believed! I can say that I've been coming here for over six months and I couldn't be more grateful for Julie and the whole staff! I feel welcomed at every visit, even on my zoom! Also their billing has been so easy to work with as well. Thank you Miss Julie and to everyone on your staff :)|Great doctors here and the staff too. I see my pain doctor every month, (usually through Zoom).  When I told her I was starting to have pain in my knees when I have to squat down, she suggested some injections. Two injections (Which by the way are quick and not really painful, like if you accidentally stuck your finger with a pin.), and no more pain in my knees.|Love Sun Pain! Everyone is so kind and nice. The staff is always willing to help.|I have been going to Surprise Pain management for years and I am so happy that I found them. They always take the time to listen to me  and Dr Annette is the BEST!  We have tried several different methods to help relieve my constant back pain. Without the help I have received my quality of life would be much more diminished . I count my blessings every day and know I have found the right place for me.

column40:
My wife comes here every month to see Miss Bonne. She really cares about her patient's well being and overall health.
Since Bonne left, Kathy has taken over seeing my wife, and I must say, she DEFINITELY is so much like Bonne is! She listens to us, really cares about her patients, she always asks how we are doing, if we had done anything in the past month. The MAs Oliver and Erica are so nice and friendly as well, they are very caring. Also, Kayla the receptionist is such a sweetheart!! She always welcomes us with a warm smile and friendly hello! The staff here is just amazing!! I wish I could give them 100 stars!!

Thank you Bonne, Kathy, Dr. Uhrik and his team for taking great care of my wife!!|Dr. Uhrik's calm demeanor is reassuring and comforting. His knowledge and insight gives me confidence in his ability to provide me with quality and compassionate care, and his treatments provide me with the relief I need to find comfort from my condition. The staff at the clinic are always friendly and helpful. I am very grateful for the pain management care I receive from Dr. Uhrik and the Clinic for Pain Relief.|Great facility.  Staff is professional, and considerate.  The on call formula that they have could use some improvement.  There is a big issue with message relay from the on call agent, to the intended physician.  I don't expect perfection, but they should at least have the basics of their job nailed.|I've been going here 4 years. Doctor Uhrik us the only pain management doctor who listened to me about my chronic illnesses and took me seriously. He helped me find physical therapy and medical treatments that helped lower my pain so I can function and not need a caregiver. I appreciate him not ignoring my chronic migraines as "just a headache" and taking me seriously. I saw 4 other pain doctors before him who either told me to take some excedrin or said I just had anxiety, despite my neurologist saying otherwise.

This office helped me get some of my life back.|Attempted to call all morning to reschedule appointment for a friend who was in the hospital. OMG!!! Don't answer until 1:20 in the afternoon, rude, tweenager, Brandon, answers the phone with loud crashing noises in the background!! Couldn't hardly hear him or tell his rude and aggressive demeanor what I needed!! My poor friend going here really needs a better office to go to!!|Dr Otto seemed like he would help me. Then the next Dr. You see (Wilson) is a terrible person.  They have no willingness to help I spent 5 months in continuing painting without them assisting me in anyway. They basically looked me in the eyes and told me, "No, suffer." Because of what they "Usually do." Well im not usually. Even though i complied in every way. Im a recovering paraplegic i literally came to them sobbing pleading for help only to be turned away. The only way I suggest if you to go to this clinic is if you want to remain in pain. I was a complying patient literally doing nothing wrong for 5 months with open wounds and they could look me in the face and tell me they wont help. I came to them crying. Crying. To no avail. column3:
Mountain View Headache & Spine Institute

Mountain View Headache & Spine Institute serves Phoenix residents seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Located in Phoenix, Arizona, this specialized clinic provides personalized pain management services to patients throughout Maricopa County, including the Biltmore, Paradise Valley, and Arcadia neighborhoods.

The practice is led by Dr. Ruchir Gupta, MD, a highly qualified pain management specialist committed to delivering individualized treatment plans. Dr. Gupta focuses on helping patients find effective pain relief solutions while avoiding surgery whenever possible.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

The institute specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions:

- Back pain management and treatment

- Neck pain diagnosis and relief options

- Nerve pain interventional procedures

- Joint pain therapeutic approaches

- Headache specialized treatment protocols

Advanced Diagnostic Capabilities

Mountain View Headache & Spine Institute utilizes cutting-edge diagnostic technologies to identify pain sources accurately. Their diagnostic tools include:

- X-ray imaging for structural evaluation

- CT scans for detailed anatomical assessment

- Comprehensive physical examinations

- Thorough medical history analysis

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinic prioritizes one-on-one consultations, ensuring each patient receives personalized attention. Treatment plans are tailored to individual needs, focusing on non-surgical interventions when appropriate.

Location and Contact Information

Address: 2222 E Highland Ave Suite 110, Phoenix, AZ 85016, United States

Phone: +1 602-767-0007

Website: [mountainviewheadacheandspine.com/locations-phoenix](https://mountainviewheadacheandspine.com/locations-phoenix)

Patients seeking relief from debilitating chronic pain can schedule a consultation to explore effective management options with Dr. Gupta and his dedicated team.

column40:
Dr. Gupta is an amazing pain management doctor. He is very empathetic, is a good listener, has excellent bedside manner, and truly cares about his patients. He took the time to answer all my questions and was very thorough. He is well educated and educated me on the different services I will be trying plus with my neck arthritis. I am truly blessed to have a great doctor that finally cares about my well-being. I look forward to feeling better soon and trust that I am in good hands with Dr. Gupta and all the caring assistants as well. Thank you truly.|I had my first appointment with Mountain View pain clinic today and I was extremely happy with the staff and Dr.Gupta. The staff and nurses were very friendly and knowledgeable as well as prompt. I would definitely recommend this clinic to anyone who needs special care for chronic pain. Dr Gupta listened to me and set up a treatment plan with some new procedures and I look forward to working with him. I am new to the area and feel like I'm getting better care than I was from the clinic I have been going to for over 15 years.|Dr.Gupta & his staff are top tier! I've been living in pain and very depressed. During my time under the care of Gupta I have felt relief and peace in my life for the first time in a very very long time. I just want him & his staff how much they've positively impacted my life!|Dr. Ruchir Gupta is extremely knowledgeable in his area of expertise. He is on the cutting edge of the newest & best procedures out there for patients. He actually listens to what you're dealing with then puts in place a treatment plan accordingly.
I was in a dark place when he set up a treatment plan for me. I now feel like I'm living life again. I enjoy my loved ones & go on outings I never thought would be possible again.
The staff is outstanding, always smiling & happy to help you!
If you think there is nothing more that can be done to help just like I did please give Dr. Gupta a call & at least discuss the possible treatment options available for you. I believe you will be very glad you did!|The office staff was awesome and helpful to my needs, which I came in with a cane and not my normal upright walker, which was making my pain worse, and they set my worries at ease. Dr Gupta was extremely thorough and also awesome. I can't wait to start my treatment plan|Easy to find-2222 E Highland (Biltmore) location. Super efficient & friendly check in. No wait. Kind EMT & nurse. Dr V came in & explained exact procedure to my spouse. Overall, I felt very cared for in a professional environment.|In February of this year, I had my first appointment with Dr. Gupta, which lasted about 15 minutes. During our discussion, we both agreed that Mountain View was not equipped to assist me with my type of spinal injury. I accepted this outcome and paid the $40 copay. However, later in the year, I received an itemized bill from Mountain View detailing the charges they submitted to my insurance company, and I was outraged. In addition to the office visit charge, they billed hundreds of dollars for behavioral health care and pain management services--neither of which I received.

This highlights a significant issue within the healthcare system. In the future, I believe patients should have the opportunity to review charges before they are sent to insurance companies. Implementing such a process could reduce instances of overbilling and help lower healthcare costs for everyone.|After 10 years of different doctors and drugs that have not helped with my daily headaches, I feel like I finally have a partner who with diagnose and treat my pain.  Very comprehensive first meeting experience.  Left the office with more hope than I have felt in a decade.

**Arizona Pain and Spine Institute** serves Mesa residents seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Located at 7525 E Broadway Rd #1, Mesa, AZ 85208, our specialized clinic delivers comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our Pain Management Specialties

Our board-certified physicians treat a wide range of painful conditions including:

- **Neck pain** and cervical spine disorders

- **Low back pain** and lumbar spine issues

- **Disc herniation** and related nerve compression

- **Fibromyalgia** and widespread pain syndromes

- **Migraine** and chronic headache disorders

- **Pelvic pain** conditions

- **Cancer pain** management

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain disorders

Advanced Treatment Approaches

At Arizona Pain and Spine Institute, we utilize evidence-based interventional procedures including:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Nerve blocks

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Medication management

- Physical therapy integration

- Minimally invasive procedures

Patient-Centered Care

Our physicians combine extensive clinical experience with compassionate care. Each treatment plan addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies. We prioritize minimally invasive options before considering surgical interventions.

The clinic environment is designed for patient comfort, with accessible facilities and flexible scheduling options. New patients typically receive comprehensive evaluations during their first visit.

For appointments or questions about specific pain conditions, contact us at **+1 480-986-7246** or visit our website at [gotpainarizona.com](https://gotpainarizona.com/).

column40:
After going to this medical clinic for years I've decided to move on. Staff are not on same page and don't communicate. when I got there, I asked if I had to leave a urine sample. I was told no that I could go to the bathroom went to the bathroom, then went into the room for my visit and was told I needed to go to the bathroom after I already went. I have lupus arthritis everywhere and fibromyalgia and I'm on ssi for my illness. Been on pain meds for years. It's starting to get cold and pain is getting worse but yet they want to change my medication, I said no. My medicine is working. They refuse to let me see doctor, and it's been over a year. I can't believe I have to change. This sossoman location shouldn't be in practice. Instead of me having a one on one, the doctor and his helper and talking and making decisions with out me. I'm very sad to have to leave cuz I've built a relationship with my doctor.|I've been going here for a year and a half....starting out in a wheelchair, crippled with pain. Today, after 4 surgeries to kill the nerves in different key areas of my spine, I am 85% pain-free!! The entire office is amazing, from the front desk to the medical assistants to the doctors (Dr. Ryklin being my doc....who I HIGHLY recommend!!!) Even the assistants in the procedure room are cheerful, compassionate, and knowledgeable. If you're looking for a spine or pain management doctor...this is definitely the place to go!|My husband has extreme neck pain and could barely move. We saw on their website that they take same day appointments. We called them and they said we needed to call the insurance to see if they are covered. We called our insurance like they wanted and our insurance covered it and they said they we didn't need a referral to see them. And on arizona pain and spine center they even said they take referrals from patients and doctors so we figured it wouldn't be a problem. So we called them back and they said they needed a referral from the doctor, which would have been nice to know the first time we called since we wasted so much time. So we called our primary and got them to send a referral but by that time arizona pain and spine was closed. We called first thing in the morning to make sure they got it and they told us to call back on monday! We told them we couldn't wait that long and we were hoping to be seen since their website said same day. The girl we spoke to said no that they were pretty booked up and so were the other locations and the next available appointment was in mid February. They weren't even willing to even ask the doctors if they could squeeze us in just to look, even at a different office! We ended up calling another pain center all together and even though they were booked up they asked and were able to squeeze us in so my husband could actually move his neck. These people were a complete waste of time and we could have gotten help a day earlier if not for the run around.|Total knee replacement end of Dec.2022, I can not sing the praise's enough for the care I received at this hospital. Hip replacement is next...and here.|These dr's  & pa's Are amazing!!
Been going here for 10 + years. Love these people's|Doctors and staff are knowledgeable and compassionate|I have been a patient for many years!|Sweet doctors

Very hard to speak to somebody when you need it. It really feels that you're just a number to them. Appointments are usually in and out and it does not feel like proper individual care. I'd suggest seeking another doctors office.|Dr. Donald Hair was very patient, understanding and willing to provide alternative treatments for my chronic pain. He educated me on the areas of question with details and explanations which is truly welcomed and appreciated. I have confidence in the chosen plan and look forward to addressing my pain issues . Staff was professional and kind throughout my visit.  Thank you.|I was injured playing indoor soccer roughly 16 years ago, hurt my lower back (left side) and have had high pain while sitting ever since (I have a desk job and sit full time). I've seen over 15 doctors over those years and had everything done under the sun, including laproscopic surgery at the laser spine institute in Scottsdale (no longer exists). Mary Grace is the FIRST person to listen to me describe all my symptoms and details of my pain and dialed in almost immediately to what was wrong with me. I couldn't be more confident in our treatment plan moving forward. She was a godsend to me. She corrected me when I called her "Doctor", but in my experience she did more good for me than like 10 doctors all put together. The office staff was also very friendly as well. I HIGHLY recommend this office if you are dealing with issues they treat and are having difficulty getting answers like I was!|They don't believe in pain medication and require procedures even when they've made pain significantly worse in the past. The people I spoke with were kind and knowledgeable, this review is not about them, but about the facility.

Also, I did paperwork online, and I had to do 100% of it again despite following instructions and doing it 4-5 days before my appointment.|I went here because my severe back pain. They needed an MRI. I Went and got one they seen the problem and it was severe. They said we will numb the nerves to stop the pain. But first we got to try Cortizone injections. I said OK. After a few months of waiting for my appointment I went in. I laid on the table. I don't know if it's a doctor or a PA but he didn't tell me how painful these shots were going to be. Nobody said anything he just stuck me. I let out a big grown it hurts so bad. I said you should tell me before you're going to stick that needle in my back. After the first shot when I said how bad it hurt the assistant said we can put you out, I said I had nobody to drive me home. He said here comes two more and he did it twice again, and he said now here comes the big one. Unbelievably painful. I could actually feel the needle piercing my muscle and hitting on my spine. I wanted to ask the Dr a few questions. Like why didn't you tell me it was gonna be this painful but he was gone before even turn over. That is the most pain I've actually felt in any doctors office, during any procedure. When I got home I canceled all future appointments. I still have severe back issues and can't hardly walk at times. But I will not go back to that clinic. I'm going to find somebody who can actually help me without causing massive amount of pain.|I usually never write reviews, however this clinic truly deserves one. Dr. Hair is one of the most compassionate doctors i have ever met!! He took a lot of time with me, attentively listened to me and made me feel like I was important to him. Never once did he try to rush me out the door,  and was determined to find anything he could to help me gain some mobility. Dr. Hair clearly went into medicine because he profoundly cares about helping people. I cannot say enough about how amazing he is!!! One of the best doctors I have ever met. Thank you to the pain center and Dr. Hair for making me feel well taken care of and like what I am going through is important. I am very fortunate to be one of your patients|Belittle my questions rushed through steps had to stick me 3x for IV did not perform procedure explained at previous kept looking me as was asking a stupid question did not explain post op instructions handed me paper and told me to read it later|I have been struggling with pain for years. I had the worse experience at TOI with Dr. Chen putting me through the worse pain possible. Dr. Donald Hair was very attentive and his assistant Jessica Ruiz listened to my fears and both made me feel reassured and comfortable. Let me say Dr. Hair has the hands of an angel. I felt no pain, in fact I didn't even realize he did anything and was surprised when he said he was finished. I'm am so happy that I found a Dr. that truly cares about his patients. Thank you too all the wonderful staff.

**Arizona Pain Care Center** is a specialized medical facility dedicated to diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions. Located in Glendale, Arizona, our center provides comprehensive pain management services to help patients regain control of their lives and improve their overall well-being.

At Arizona Pain Care Center, we focus on enhancing patients' quality of life through effective pain syndrome diagnosis and treatment. Our approach combines medical expertise with personalized care plans tailored to each individual's needs. We offer a wide range of services including:

- Interventional pain procedures

- Medication management

- Diagnostic evaluations

- Customized treatment plans

- Follow-up care

On-Site Fluoroscopy Suite

Our facility features a state-of-the-art fluoroscopy suite that allows us to perform many procedures in-house. This advanced imaging capability enables precise treatment delivery while saving patients from costly hospital fees. Procedures performed on-site include:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Nerve blocks

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation trials

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our team takes time to understand each patient's unique situation, developing individualized treatment strategies that address both symptoms and underlying causes. Our commitment to personalized care means we:

- Listen carefully to patient concerns

- Explain treatment options thoroughly

- Set realistic expectations

- Provide ongoing support

- Adjust treatments as needed

Contact Information

Arizona Pain Care Center is conveniently located at 17100 N 67th Ave, Suite 600, Glendale, AZ 85308. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at +1 623-263-6340 or visit our website at [www.azpaincarecenter.com](https://www.azpaincarecenter.com/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=gbp&utm_id=google).

Anthem Pain Management is a specialized clinic dedicated to comprehensive pain relief solutions in Anthem, Arizona. Meet Our Specialist

Specialized Services

- Back and neck pain management

- Joint pain relief

- Neuropathic pain treatment

- Post-surgical pain care

- Chronic condition management

- Interventional pain procedures

Our clinic utilizes innovative combinations of pain medications, topical treatments, and complementary modalities to enhance treatment outcomes while minimizing side effects and dependency risks.

At the Pain Center at Chandler, our team of leading pain management specialists delivers a comprehensive and compassionate approach to patient care. column40:
I'm not sure about this place. I got an I jection and it messed up my back completely. I was suppose to have a dr apt on the 19th instead of another procedure but they def still have both open still. I called to schedule the procedure since I had canceled it and was gonna do a dr visit. Called to set up and the woman was crazy sick..sounded like death and just repeated everything I said to her lol (SO NOT PAYING ATTENTION TO WHAT IM SAYING)and then was rude lol after all i had done was be nice...WHAT!! DOUBLE THINKING THIS PLACE|Dr. Jae H Park is a negligent provider who creates adversarial relationships with his patients while disregarding their needs and disrespecting them as people.

I attended an appointment yesterday  as a patient advocate, and thank God I did, because doctors in this field specifically love wielding the authority of their position to mistreat patients and then act as if it is normal. You can't do that when someone else is there to call out your abysmal behavior.

We waited at least 40 minutes in the waiting room alongside a patient who was scheduled at the exact same time as us at a clinic with one doctor. We witnessed the two patients before us exit their appointments EXTREMELY upset, stating Dr. Park is a terrible provider who treated them both poorly, and how this treatment had them both immediately relocating. One patient stated Dr. Park had pressured them into treatment they weren't comfortable with while denying medication. When we were called back for vitals we waited an additional 10-15 minutes for Dr. Park to arrive.

During the appointment he barely made eye contact with us and clearly was not engaged in the conversation. He downplayed my partners symptoms and failed to discuss significant findings in MRI and xray results, and when we brought them up tried to imply they were normal. He made us both argue for a doctors note for a prior reaction to medication that put my partner out of work, and that he could not obtain until this appointment due to this clinic relocating every other provider resulting in last minute cancellations. He was intermittently smiling during all of this, and when we asked for the note specifically he laughed right in front of us. He tried to prescribe medication as my partner was telling him that specific medication no longer worked for him. He tried to tell us it is regular to wait an hour to see a specialist, when my partner's last prescriber saw him at the exact time he was scheduled, however that doctor was a professional who actually cares about his patients. He told us to lower our voices while we were talking at a normal volume simply because we were pushing back on every nonsensical thing he said. As my partner became increasingly upset at having to argue for any basic treatment or respect and I continued to disrupt Dr. Parks attempts to normalize his horrendous maltreatment of his patients he clearly realized this appointment was ending like the last two he had that morning. He finally conceded to a doctors note and prescribed meds. My partner took a moment to calm down and then scheduled at another location with the receptionist.

It should be noted that the nurse and receptionist we saw were both very professional and kind. The issue here is Dr. Park. People who cannot maintain professionalism and care for other people should not be in this field. This exact behavior is what drives people away from care that can save their lives. To laugh and smile in your patients faces while actively causing them distress isn't just unprofessional but absolutely despicable behavior from someone who took an oath to aid those in need.

It is absolutely shameful that this man has a medical license. Hopefully this is rectified soon, but until it is I highly recommend you seek care anywhere else. If you don't want to hear it from these reviews you'll be hearing it from every other patient in the waiting room.|I agree with everyone who has mentioned communication as being very poor. They won't even allow reply's to emails making communication nearly impossible. The doctors also push everyone to get nerve blocks and then overbook the procedures. I waited more than 2-hours past my appointment time in a cramped waiting room made for 10 people, but had 30 plus people plus overflow outside in the heat. I finally gave up.  Save your self pain and frustrations and go anywhere else.|Everyone was great! The problem is my 86 yr old grandfather was seen for the 1st time. Had a problem with prescription. Called over 5 times left messages and call back number. Have not received a call back to fix this problem. He's in a great deal of pain and is wheelchair bound. No body should have to go through this. All we need is a call back to fix this issue.|Ty front desk person is awesome she remembers my name seeing me only a few times.
Maria medical assistant very nice and professional
Jason Doctor so down to earth. He listens to my complaints and also non complaints ( I talk a lot)
Very very nice clinic. I'm 69 yrs old and the previous places I've been to make me feel like a drug addict but they understand my Medicaid problems resulting from chronic pain.?If I could give them 10 stars I would do it.
Thank you Pain Center of Arizona

Ver|Dr Curletta is so caring and compassionate. He spent so much time with me and helped me finally get some answers on why I have chronic pain. He answered all my questions and helped me get a treatment plan to get out of pain. Thank you Dr Curletta you are amazing!|I'm bringing my mom today, but I'm a patient of Dr. Curlettas as well. He is joining their practice which can often be hectic. I've had to call several times and Ty has been nothing but very helpful and patient through this whole transition.  Some would often lose patience but she continues to smile and make us feel welcome and heard.  Thank you Ty|In the last year, I noticed the practice (Chandler) go through some changes.  A big red flag to seek out another clinic was the high turnover of practitioners. Another flag was hearing the staff complain about the company. I initially ignored it because sometimes workers have bad days and just need to vent.  But the last 6 months, my experience with The Pain Center was eye-opening.  Frustration with miscommunication. Multiple appointments needing to be rescheduled (requested by the clinic, not me).  New providers wanting to add things to my plan of care that were discussed/decided on by the previous provider.  And don't bother calling after-hours because the on-call provider will tell you to go to the ER rather than listening to the actual problem/issue or make an effort to help resolve it.  Patient Relations representative was so unprofessional.  The rep made a comment about "I don't know why she (a previous employee) gave you my information...should have handled it herself".  Really?  I mean, you might feel that but you don't SAY it to the patient. My last interaction left me feeling like I was just a drug seeker looking to get my next fix.  I was so relieved when my insurance decided to discontinue their contract with The Pain Center. Now I just have to wait weeks for my records to be sent to a new office.

.|I'm a practicing Physical Therapist with over 30 years experience in Orthopedics' bone and joints and treatment of the Spine. It was very humbling when I became the patient. I was told by a Debra you can not use Mercy care in a car accident case. They use balance billing which means they bill your insurance they get paid do not care if it was negotiated to a lower rate. They bill you the balance so they can charge you a 1000 for a a visit have a agreement with you insurance which my primary is UMR and they have agreement to pay 200. They will regardless put a lien on your case for the remanding 600. If you where coming in and they did not know it was a car accident they just write it off and you pay your 35 co pay Greed at it best!!!!!! Stay far away from this office. They do not take my secondary because I was told by several billing companies that it would be illegal for them to charge the remaining balance!!! LEARNER AND ROWE SENT ME HERE AVOID ASK TO BE SENT SOME WHERE THAT DOES NOT DO BALANCE BILLING IT IS A SCAM!!!!! Also when asked for billing was put on hold but she needed to do a better job of whispering because I heard her say she asking for you. Was left thier because they where leaving for the day. Phoenix Pain Treatment

Phoenix Pain Treatment is a specialized pain management clinic in Phoenix, Arizona dedicated to managing your condition, not just treating your symptoms. Our comprehensive approach focuses on identifying and addressing the root causes of pain through advanced interventional techniques.

Our clinic offers interventional pain management solutions designed to provide relief within your first few visits. We prioritize minimally invasive treatments that often help patients avoid heavy medication and surgery. Our physicians develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific condition and medical history.

Why Choose a Pain Specialist?

If you're experiencing chronic pain, consulting with a pain specialist is crucial. Early intervention significantly increases your chances of complete recovery, while delaying professional treatment can worsen your condition over time. Our specialists have extensive training in diagnosing and treating complex pain conditions that might be difficult to address in general practice settings.

Auto Accident Injury Care

Have you or a loved one been involved in a car accident in Phoenix? We provide specialized care for accident-related injuries at no cost to you. Our clinic works with over 40 personal injury attorneys to ensure you receive the treatment you need while navigating insurance claims. Our team understands the unique challenges of accident-related pain and offers targeted therapies for optimal recovery.

Patient-Centered Approach

We pride ourselves on our New Patient Concierge Service, making your transition to our care seamless and comfortable. Understanding that pain doesn't wait, we offer appointments within 48 hours of your call, ensuring you receive prompt attention for your condition.

Visit Us

Located at 9140 W Thomas Rd b106, Phoenix, AZ 85037, our clinic is equipped with modern facilities and staffed by compassionate professionals dedicated to improving your quality of life.

Contact us today: Call +1 602-449-9430 or visit [www.phoenixpaintreatment.com](http://www.phoenixpaintreatment.com/) to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

column40:
This is one year after treatment for frozen shoulders. The Doctor performed an MUA (Manipulation Under Anesthesia). I no longer had the ability to lift either shoulder, i.e. can put on clothing and the rest of the impacts to my life.

I had consulted with 4 Orthopedic Surgeons, the Mayo Clinic.. and had received the following options....

1. Wait 18 months to Two years and it will hopefully heal itself...
2. Inject the joint capsule with fluid and it will break it up.   When asking the physicians the follow up question... ok you inject the fluid wound it go to the point of least resistance and exit at the one point... they had no answers.
3. Do an MUA

We did the MUA surgery, it was the B E S T choice that we could have made, I had full range of motion in both arms after the surgery, one year later I still have the same range of motion.

So now that we have talked about the why and the results, let's talk about the experience and the Dr and team.

The procedure is simple, they put you under and adjust the area.  Had two Dr's and Anastesiologist.  The procedure takes about 15 minutes it is out patient and you will like and surgery have pain after.

Dr. Quackenbush was the Dr and not only is it his passion the improvement in my lif e that he was able to give me I can't say enough about.  He is AMAZING.  Great bedside manner and really really cares about you.

If you have frozen joints limited mobility, for your sake give them a call and see what they can do to make your life better..|The staff was very friendly and  professional, I enjoyed my visits, I would recommend this location for their services!!

They would leave it there, and I found him through my primary Dr. I will always have my Dr. Gibbs, he likes my song. Professional *************|I've had a chronic pain problem on the right side of my neck for over two years. Have been to 5 pain management Doctors that didn't help me at all. It was all a waste of time for me until I went and saw a Neurologist and after testing me sent me too Dr. Gibb.
I was thinking that this to might be a waste of time but after meeting with Dr. Gibb I was very impressed with his bedside matter very much. He's young and enjoyed answering my questions in detail. That was a first for me, believe me. He conferred with my Neurologist and decided their plan of action.
My first procedure included 3 nerve blocks and it was over a month after I started feeling less pain. Today I still have pain but not a 10 anymore on the scale. It was nice to have some of my pain gone.
My second procedure was a nerve block to my left hand which had severe carpal tunnel syndrome. Prior to the block the pain and discomfort from the carpal tunnel kept me from sleeping at night even though I wore a brace. I'm happy to report that I'm able to sleep for 6-7 hours a night now.
I would recommend Dr. Gibb to anyone who needs help in relieving their pain. He listens too you and answers all your questions and he's there for you if you have questions later down the road.
I going back for another procedure this coming Monday and I'm looking forward to possibly less pain than I go in there with once more.|I've been seeing Dr. Gibbs for almost a couple of years now.. I had a Plastodermy surgery two years ago for a fractured Lumbar. Surgery went great. I was so pleased with everything, including scheduling, his staff and of course the outcome of the surgery.  I felt so good after surgery and still do as far as my fractured Lumbar . I asked Dr. Gibbs if there was anything that he could do for all the pain I have in my lower back?  Well he made a couple of suggestion and I decided to go with it. My back hasn't fell this good in over 15 years. No pain. I feel really really good! My last visit a week ago I called Dr. Gibbs my big MIRACLE WORKER! Dr. Gibbs many thanks to you !. I appreciate you and yours services so much! Dr. Ben de Miranda, MD brings extensive training and experience in pain medicine. His approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Dr. de Miranda works closely with patients to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management.

Kristy Dean, APRN complements our practice with her advanced nursing expertise in pain management. Her patient-centered approach ensures thorough assessment and ongoing support throughout the treatment process.

Patient-Centered Approach

Any way she had to wait for hours at the office to be called back then wait some more then to be taken into the office of DR. Deaver.
