Natural State Pain & Wellness Clinic

Natural State Pain & Wellness Clinic provides comprehensive pain management services for patients throughout central Arkansas. Located in Little Rock, this specialized medical practice focuses on treating chronic pain conditions using multimodal techniques tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Natural State Pain & Wellness Clinic, we believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain. Our team works collaboratively with other healthcare professionals to develop multi-specialty approaches that consider all aspects of a patient's condition. We emphasize minimally invasive procedures whenever possible to help patients find relief while minimizing recovery time.

Meet Our Specialist

Dr. Neesa 'Jill' McCollum Flaxman, M.D. leads our clinical team with extensive experience in pain management. Dr. Flaxman specializes in comprehensive treatment options for chronic pain conditions, focusing on evidence-based approaches that improve quality of life. Her expertise includes advanced interventional procedures for spine-related pain and complex pain syndromes.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic provides specialized care for numerous chronic pain conditions, including:

- Spine-Related Pain: Back pain, neck pain, sciatica, degenerative disc disease, spinal stenosis, failed back surgery syndrome, radiculopathies

- Neurological Pain: Migraines, trigeminal neuralgia, complex regional pain syndrome, diabetic peripheral neuropathy

- Musculoskeletal Pain: Arthritis, joint pain, fibromyalgia, whiplash injury

Treatment Options

We offer a comprehensive range of treatments designed to address pain at its source. Our multimodal approach may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and coordination with physical therapy and rehabilitation services.

Contact Information

Patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions can schedule a consultation to discuss personalized treatment options with our experienced team.

column40:
A little over three years ago, I was diagnosed with severe gastroparesis. For two years, I was trapped in a relentless cycle of daily vomiting and constant pain. My weight plummeted by 70 pounds due to the incessant vomiting. Despite trying every available medication, including one sourced from Canada, I found no relief. Eventually, I underwent surgery to have a gastric pacemaker implanted, hoping for a reprieve. Sadly, it offered none.

The relentless vomiting and pain persisted, driving me in and out of the hospital. My gastroenterologist eventually told me there was nothing more he could do and referred me to a pain management specialist and for a feeding tube. Initially, I resisted the idea of pain management, fearing daily pain medication. But as my quality of life dwindled, I relented, seeking a way to dull the pain if nothing else.

I walked into my first appointment with Dr. Flaxman, tears streaming down my face, utterly hopeless. At 31, I felt I had lost everything to this disease. I could no longer work or enjoy activities with my daughter. Most days, I was confined to bed. Dr. Flaxman sat with me, not just addressing my physical symptoms, but also acknowledging the emotional toll gastroparesis had taken on me. She listened as I shared my frustration with the four GI doctors who had declared there was nothing more to be done. She didn't promise a cure but offered hope for a 50% improvement. Skeptical yet desperate, I trusted her and her compassionate staff. After that appointment, I called my husband from the car and cried, feeling hope for the first time in two years.

Over the past year, I've undergone hypogastric plexus injections in my back with Dr. Flaxman. It took months, but my symptoms have improved by at LEAST 50% without relying on pain medication. Not just the pain, but the vomiting has significantly slowed down. Though I still have difficult days, I'm slowly reclaiming my life. Thanks to Dr. Flaxman and her team, my daughter is getting her mother back, my husband his wife back, and I'm regaining my quality of life. Our lives have transformed for the better.

While I may never be completely cured, Dr. Flaxman has helped me more than any GI doctor or surgeon. I avoided the feeding tube thanks to the injections. Would I recommend Natural State Pain and Wellness? Absolutely. Every person in that office is dedicated to going above and beyond to help. From Gayla at the reception, always greeting me with a warm smile and genuine concern, to Kerry and Gayle in the procedure room, ensuring my comfort and well-being, everyone there feels like a lifesaver.

Thank you, Dr. Flaxman, for giving me my life back and supporting me through the darkest times. My family and myself are forever grateful to you and your incredible staff. Much love to you all.|Dr. Flaxman was phenomenal! Her staff was very welcoming from the moment I entered the clinic. They ensured they answered all my questions, and my examination was thorough. I would recommend this clinic to anyone looking for relief from pain. I am so happy that she tried other measures for my headaches. Don't hesitate to give her a try.|1st first was yesterday. Everyone was friendly and very obvious they know what they are doing.
I have been struggling with pain for 7+ years and no one could tell me the cause until my very first visit here!!!!|The girls went above and beyond this weekend at The Stanley Cup golf tournament held in Russellville! Highly recommend going to see them if you're in Little Rock! You will not be disappointed!|My young adult son went to this clinic for chronic pain he has had (post operative) for 6-7 years.  To say I am impressed with this ENTIRE group of medical professionals is a MAJOR understatement!  They helped relieve his pain but also gave him hope!  They didn't just care for his body but also his heart, his soul, and his spirit.  The compassion, skill, humility, and knowledge they displayed has changed my son's life and mine as well.  I'm so encouraged to know that this kind of medical integrity still exists.  I will sing their praises loudly wherever I go.|Absolutely love this office! The staff is wonderful and caring.  The hormone replacement therapy is life changing.   I recommend them for all of your wellness needs, whether it be pain, hormones, weight loss, hydration therapy, immune boost.  Dr.Flaxman knows what's she is doing!|Dr Flaxman and her team are absolutely amazing. If you have chronic pain go see her. She doesn't give up!! She is a blessing from God! I know he put her in my path. I absolutely love her. She takes her time, she gives you details, they call you back and she explain in detail whats going on.|The first pic was taken Oct 2022, then a current picture. I am so proud of myself for choosing to make a change. I feel so much better, not at my goal yet but getting close. My dad, sister & husband keep me going!! Special thanks to Natural State Pain & Wellness Clinic &their wonderful staff!!

Interventional Pain Specialists of Northwest Arkansas, PLLC provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout Fayetteville and surrounding communities. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based interventional techniques and personalized treatment plans.

Our board-certified physicians offer advanced treatments for various pain conditions, including:

Spinal Pain Management - Treating herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and degenerative disc disease

Joint Pain Relief - Addressing arthritis, bursitis, and sports injuries

Nerve Pain Solutions - Managing neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and sciatica

Cancer Pain Treatment - Providing comfort for patients with cancer-related pain

Headache Management - Treating migraines, cluster headaches, and tension headaches

Our Approach to Pain Treatment

At Interventional Pain Specialists of Northwest Arkansas, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach combining minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and physical therapy. Our physicians have extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology, with decades of combined experience treating complex pain conditions.

Advanced Interventional Procedures

Facet joint injections

Radiofrequency ablation

Peripheral nerve blocks

Regenerative medicine options

Patient-Centered Care

We prioritize creating individualized treatment plans based on each patient's specific needs. Our goal is improving quality of life and restoring function while minimizing medication dependence. Most insurance plans accepted, including Medicare and Medicaid.

They sent me to a specialist who didn't want to touch me right now due to the nature of my situation. Come back, they offer si joint fusion, I agreed as long as it wouldnt pose issue to other affected areas. Had to do procedures to appease the insurance and then they never scheduled the surgery.. I rarely see the main doc, mainly the aprn's is what I see and I ask consistently about the surgery offered and get the same damn answer the judge says "but you're so young and healthy" if that were true, I would not be coming there and would not be stuck on a pain medication I do not even want but have to fight for because they keep putting the dates off further and further and insurance won't let me have it. Tired of being pushed away with a pain medication that doesn't allow me to function normal or be an active participant in society. Tired of condescendingly being told I'm so young and healthy when I'm walking around missing a disc in my back, bone on bone, with si joint and hip problems. Can't even get in for procedures to help with the pain even though I complain of it EVERY TIME I GO. They just give me another appointment card and refill and send me out the door without acknowledging anything. I can't get a good nights sleep, can't sit properly and can't stand long but I'm young and healthy.. ok. 0/10 DO NOT RECOMMEND|The are so understanding and don't push You off to the side they actually listen. My Back is in better shape from the injections and burning of the nerves in my low back I have some Hermon discs but with the Meds and support. They are a Great  Doctor and place to go to it's been so helpful|Wait times are way to long and we have appointments. Most of the staff are nice and friendly. Only a couple who makes me feel uncomfortable. Wait time I'm sorry I can't give any stars for very unhappy  staff 5 star for the ones that actually care about the patients ***** and zero stars for the ones who act like they don't want to be there and deal with the patients,.

column3:
Pain Treatment Centers of America - Conway is a specialized pain management clinic led by Dr. Brian Malki. Located in Conway, Arkansas, our clinic provides comprehensive interventional pain management services for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. We focus on personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while improving overall quality of life.

At Pain Treatment Centers of America, we believe in treating the entire patient, not just their symptoms. Dr. Malki implements a multi-disciplinary approach that may include:

- Interventional pain procedures

- Medication management

- Physical therapy recommendations

- Lifestyle modifications

- Minimally invasive techniques

Meet Dr. Brian Malki

Dr. Brian Malki brings extensive training and expertise to our Conway clinic. Born and raised in Montreal, Quebec, Dr. Malki completed his residency in Anesthesiology before pursuing specialized fellowship training in Interventional Pain Management at Wayne State/Detroit Medical Center in Detroit, Michigan.

Dr. Malki discovered his passion for pain management early in his medical career and has dedicated his practice to helping patients overcome pain challenges and regain functionality. As a member of the American Society of Regional Anesthesia, he stays current with the latest advancements in pain management techniques.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain

- Neuropathic pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Sports injuries

- Arthritis pain

- Complex regional pain syndrome

Visit Our Conway Location

Address: 2425 Dave Ward Dr Suite 302, Conway, AR 72034, United States

Phone: +1 844-215-0731

Website: [https://www.ptcoa.com](https://www.ptcoa.com/?utm_source=GMBSocialClimb&utm_medium=Dr.BrianMalki)

We welcome new patients seeking relief from persistent pain conditions. Our team works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care throughout your treatment journey.
column11:
Dr. Brian Malki was born and raised in Montreal, Quebec. He completed his residency in Anesthesiology and then completed a fellowship in Interventional Pain Management at Wayne State/Detroit Medical Center in Detroit, MI. Dr. Malki knew he wanted to specialize in Pain Management early in his medical career and is passionate about caring for his patients, treating their pain and improving their quality of life.
When it comes to acute and chronic pain, Dr. Malki prides himself on treating the entire patient. He is a firm believer in utilizing a multi-disciplinary approach to treat any patient who comes through his doors. In addition, he is also a member of the American Society of Regional Anesthesia.

column40:
I absolutely LOVE Dr Malki & all his staff!! From the front desk to procedure staff and all between, they treat you like you are their only patient, like you, your pain & getting you comfortable is their main concern. They get to know you, they listen to you & make you feel at ease. I love the Conway Ar location, they are the Best!!!|I had a great experience. I had some horrible pain about 2 months after extensive neck surgery. (4 plates and 8 screws) the pain got so bad I was having issues sleeping and it was effecting my daily life. He did injections in the muscle down my neck, shoulder and  back. About 2 days later the pain improved dramatically. I am over 2 months and the pain is still better. I'm not saying I never have pain but now I know it's muscular, I can take a muscle relaxer and use a heating pad if it flares up. I have more good days than bad!  He also did the injections that day, all in one visit. He took his time with my visit, explained everything and answered my questions.|After trying several pain treatment clinics,  I was really not looking forward to this visit. After being scrutinized,  looked at suspiciously, distrusted,  and treated like I was a drug addict before I was even given a chance, was just plain old nerve wracking.  After giving up and excepting my fate a year earlier, and my quality of life being nonexistent,  I knew I had to try again for my family.  And I'm so glad I did.

Dr. Malki and his team are the most compassionate  I've encountered since the day of older doctors. You know, the ones whom truly cared
about their patients. If you put in the work along side of Dr Malki and his crew, you become a team. Life has become easier and less painful in the year (little over) since I've been going to Dr Malki, and I'm so glad I did.|I like Dr. Malki a lot! I was a previous patient but had to move away for a while and now have moved back to Conway. I'm happy to be under his care again. He is very kind and has a way of getting right to solutions.|Chloe & Dr. Malki are the absolute BEST! They are caring and attentive to patient needs. They take the time to listen and hear what each patient says & carefully explain all treatment options. I would highly recommend PCTOA to anyone struggling with chronic pain!|I am a new patient at pain treatment centers of America,  I was very happy with Dr. Malki and his team. I was treated with the utmost care.  Every one treated me like I was a person and not a number.  Dr Malki was very nice and actually gave me a check up and said he could help me, being a total and permanently disabled veteran I was happy that someone could understand the pain I was in and how to treat it. Thank you for being so kind.

Joseph Cogburn|Dr. Malki has helped me so much with my pain. I have been to a few clinics and met with different doctors. All I have to say is Dr. Malki is the most considerate and caring provider I have seen. He gets all the stars!|Dr. Malki was amazing on my first visit to PTCOA. He was straight to the point and gave me the real diagnosis of my MRI. I went seven months to Conway Regional Pain Management and they never mentioned my spinal stenosis. This clinic truly wants to fix my problems and not just shove medications down my throat. Thank you so much Dr Malki and staff. God Bless you all!

PTCOA physicians and nurse practitioners understand how chronic pain can invade and disrupt daily functioning, and leverage their expertise to restore functionality and improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain conditions.

As Arkansas's largest fully comprehensive pain management practice, PTCOA offers specialized treatments for various pain conditions. The clinical team utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and personalized treatment plans to address chronic pain at its source. Patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach that may include interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies tailored to individual needs.

Experienced Pain Specialists

The medical team at Pain Treatment Centers of America consists of board-certified physicians and highly trained nurse practitioners with extensive experience in pain medicine. These specialists focus on identifying the underlying causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Their comprehensive approach helps patients achieve long-term relief and improved functionality.

Conditions Treated

The clinic specializes in treating a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Headaches and migraines

Patient-Centered Approach

PTCOA prioritizes patient comfort and convenience with multiple locations throughout Arkansas. The Conway clinic at 2425 Dave Ward Dr Suite 302 serves as one of their primary treatment centers. Patients appreciate the compassionate care and individualized attention provided at each visit. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to navigate coverage options.

For those seeking relief from chronic pain, Pain Treatment Centers of America offers hope through advanced treatments and dedicated care. Contact their team at +1 844-215-0731 or visit their website to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain.

column40:
My experiences have been positive. Dr. Hunt listens to me. I do understand that it's not necessary to see Dr. Hunt each time. His team is more than capable to handle patients in his stead. They have addressed every issue I've had.
I'm satisfied. Aamof, I want Dr.  Hunt to take over the chiropractic part of my treatment as well. The receptionist could use a few lessons in courteous customer service. If anything goes outside of what she's expecting, my God the woman has the nastiest look on her face. I hope that's not because I'm black.|I waited almost 3 months to get to see a physician for a treatment that I have gotten several times in the past 20+ years.  Once arriving to their office, I was told that I would have to submit to blood and urine tests BEFORE even seeing the physician.  I have never experienced this before and I declined. They need to make this known to their patients before making them wait so long. Three months of pain, waiting to see a doctor for an initial office visit for nothing.  I made this appointment for a procedure, not to get drugs.

After owner response; I repeat, I was not there to get drugs. If I would have gotten to see a doctor I could have told him that.  This "practice" of having new patients submit to urine and blood test before even seeing a doctor makes absolutely no sense. Patient and doctor should meet and come up with a treatment plan.  If that treament plan is drugs, then send the patient for the urine and blood tests.  I am sure my insurance company would appreciate not getting unneccesary bills for unneccesary lab work.|Worst appointment I ever had.  The nurse was rude and not helpful. I ask if they forgot me she said I work for some other Dr. Not pain management. Waited over a hour and still haven't been called back there.|Dr. Hunt and Rachel are very caring for all my pain health issues. They have provided me with a better quality of life.  Simply the best in the entire state of Arkansas. I highly recommend North Little Rock PTCOA.|Everybody does an awesome job! Rachel and Dr Hunt do a wonderful job of taking care of you. They show that they really care about you and your well-being. I recommend pain treatment centers of America to anybody and everybody!|I feel like iam not being taken seriously. My pain has gotten worse but my treatment has stayed the same. I had x- rays and I was told some bands about my situation but, when they read my x-rays it was like nothing was wrong. They gave the same treatment nothing changed. The only reason I gave a high score is becuse of the people. They are so nice and the clinic is clean. Overall it's a great atmosphere.|My wife had her first appointment here and she came home excited about her visit saying how Dr Hunt listened and explained how he could help her out with her chronic pain, her second appointment she never got to see the doctor, the receptionist who's name is Lisa at the clinic on Richards road NLR Arkansas; was very unprofessional, when she arrived at her appointment she was told her insurance was invalid, the receptionist didn't have the right id number so my wife went back the next day and gave her the correct insurance, Lisa told her that she couldn't run the insurance until the day of appointment, my wife spoke with Tom and got a appointment for the next day and my wife told Lisa this, and Lisa goes on to say, Tom wasn't supposed to schedule you without our approval..fast forward to today, my wife went in for appointment and Lisa told her the insurance wasnt good, so my wife contacted her insurance, then insurance contacted the office now she's back in front of Lisa, my wife handed Lisa her insurance card for the 4th time and when she was done entering her insurance Lisa throws the card at her, this intimidated my wife, being she was already frustrated with bring told her insurance was invalid and it wasn't, but instead of trying to help Lisa made my wife look like a fool, my wife works in the healthcare field and pursuing her bachelor's in Healthcare Management, just because she hurt herself and had to go to pain management she shouldn't be treated the way she was treated. She came home in disarray, crying and upset . Spoke with someone via text about the situation, and got a text saying she's discharged because of a threat to the receptionist, my wife and I have a paid lawyer and video of the entire argument and a lobby full of witnesses, she was humiliated, hurt and embarrassed and we will contact attorney for this matter to be resolved so it won't happen to anyone else.|I really like Dr. Hunt and his staff.They are very patience with you....and they are really concerned about your well being. They take the time to see how your feeling and how the medication is working for you. I really like the North Little Rock location...and you don't have to stay long in the waiting room either.They see you really quick...and the waiting room do not be crowded. I like the whole staff..There are all very friendly and show compassion...They are the best PTCOA..I ever went too.

column3:
NEA Baptist Pain Management Center provides comprehensive pain management services for patients throughout Jonesboro and Northeast Arkansas. Located at 4916 Medical Blvd, Jonesboro, AR 72405, our specialized clinic offers evidence-based treatments for both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At NEA Baptist Pain Management Center, we understand that pain affects each person differently. Our board-certified physicians develop personalized treatment plans using the latest medical advances. We focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists address a wide range of pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Cancer-related pain

- Complex regional pain syndrome

- Fibromyalgia

- Headaches and migraines

Treatment Options

We offer multiple treatment modalities tailored to each patient:

- Interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections and nerve blocks

- Medication management with careful monitoring

- Physical therapy coordination

- Spinal cord stimulation for appropriate candidates

- Radiofrequency ablation for nerve pain

- Joint injections for arthritis relief

Our Expert Team

column3:
Pain Treatment Centers of America - Dr. Terry Fletcher

Pain Treatment Centers of America provides comprehensive pain management services in Searcy, Arkansas. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions with evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Dr. Terry Fletcher leads our Searcy location with extensive medical expertise and a commitment to improving patients' quality of life.

Dr. Terry Fletcher brings a unique background in both scientific research and clinical medicine to his pain management practice. Born and raised in West Memphis, Arkansas, Dr. Fletcher's educational journey began at Harding University where he earned his B.S. degree in Biochemistry in 1987. He furthered his education by obtaining a Ph.D. in Physical Chemistry from the University of Arkansas in 1993.

His scientific career includes a prestigious two-year post-doctoral research position at the City of Hope Beckman Research Institute in Duarte, California, where he studied Alzheimer's Disease. Dr. Fletcher then served four years as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemistry at Harding University before pursuing his medical education.

In 2003, Dr. Fletcher received his medical degree from the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences. He completed his residency training in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine at UAMS, providing him with specialized expertise in pain management techniques and interventions.

Our Pain Management Approach

At Pain Treatment Centers of America, we offer:

- Comprehensive pain evaluations with detailed medical history assessment

- Customized treatment plans addressing the root causes of pain

- Minimally invasive procedures for effective pain relief

- Medication management when appropriate for pain control

- Physical therapy coordination to improve function and mobility

- Patient education on self-management techniques

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain

- Headaches and migraines

- Complex regional pain syndrome

- Post-surgical pain

- Work-related injuries

Contact Information

Location: 118 Central Ave, Searcy, AR 72143, United States

Phone: +1 844-215-0731

Website: [www.ptcoa.com/about-us/doctors/terry-fletcher-md](https://www.ptcoa.com/about-us/doctors/terry-fletcher-md/?utm_source=GMBSocialClimb&utm_medium=Dr.TerryFletcher)

Patients seeking relief from chronic pain can schedule a consultation to discuss personalized treatment options with Dr. Fletcher and our dedicated team.

After graduating, he completed his residency training in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine at UAMS.

column3:
Arkansas Spine and Pain

**Arkansas Spine and Pain** in Benton offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout central Arkansas. Located at 115 McNeil St, our clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's needs.

Our board-certified physicians provide interventional pain management techniques that target the source of discomfort. We treat various conditions including:

  • **Neck and back pain**
  • **Joint pain and arthritis**
  • **Sciatica and nerve pain**
  • **Sports injuries**
  • **Work-related injuries**
  • **Post-surgical pain**

    • Treatment Approaches

    At Arkansas Spine and Pain, we utilize a multi-disciplinary approach that may include:

  • **Epidural steroid injections** for spinal inflammation
  • **Radiofrequency ablation** for long-term pain relief
  • **Spinal cord stimulation** for chronic pain conditions
  • **Joint injections** for arthritis and inflammation
  • **Medication management** when appropriate
  • **Physical therapy coordination** for rehabilitation

    • Why Choose Our Benton Clinic

    Our physicians combine years of specialized training with the latest pain management techniques. We focus on improving function and quality of life while reducing dependency on pain medications. Most insurance plans accepted, including Medicare and Medicaid.

    Contact Information

    **Address:** 115 McNeil St, Benton, AR 72015, United States

    **Phone:** +1 501-227-0184

    **Website:** [https://www.arkansasspineandpain.com/benton](https://www.arkansasspineandpain.com/benton?utm_source=GMBSocialClimb&utm_medium=ArkansasSpineandPain)

    New patients welcome. Call today to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

column3:
Arkansas Pain Therapy provides comprehensive pain management services in Mena, Arkansas under the direction of Dr. Mike Adams. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's needs. Dr. Adams and his team are committed to improving quality of life through effective pain management strategies.

Dr. Mike Adams is an Arkansas native with extensive medical training and experience in pain management. His educational journey includes:

- Graduated from Indiana University Bloomington in 2005

- Earned his MD from Indiana University School of Medicine in 2009

- Completed residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in Little Rock

- Board certified with the American Board of Anesthesiology

Before pursuing his medical career, Dr. Adams served in the United States Navy as an Information Technologist, bringing discipline and technical expertise to his medical practice.

Professional Affiliations

Dr. Adams maintains active membership in several prestigious medical organizations:

- American Board of Anesthesiology

- American Society of Anesthesiologists

- Arkansas Society of Anesthesiologists

- Arkansas Medical Society

Our Pain Management Services

At Arkansas Pain Therapy, we offer specialized treatments for:

- Chronic back and neck pain

- Arthritis and joint pain

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Post-surgical pain management

- Sports-related injuries

- Work-related injuries

Our approach combines interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative techniques to address pain at its source.

Location and Contact Information

Address: 1102 Crestwood Cir, Mena, AR 71953, United States

Website: https://arkansaspaintherapy.com/

Patients throughout Mena and surrounding communities can access our specialized pain management services in a comfortable, supportive environment.

I hope these shots work. Because pain meds alone do not do the trick. But so far I really like this doctor and his staff|PTCOA has been great at helping to implement every therapy and procedure out there so that I can maintain my mobility.  Dr. Mike Adams and his team in Hot Springs are AWESOME.  They inform me of all of my options and are dedicated to making sure I am able to continue working long days and have lasting quality of life!!  He and his nurse, Robin, seem to truly care about their patients, and I couldn't recommend them enough!|Dr. Adams was amazing!! He listened to me and was very compassionate. I will highly recommend him to anyone looking for a pain management doctor. The center itself was very nice, even had recliners in the triage room  while you wait to see the doctors, only thing missing was a hostess to bring around sodas lol|I want to thank everyone from the front desk when I walk in . Everyone treats you so nice , the nurses and Dr Adams really care about you. At times you have to wait awhile but when when you're called back to see them , you get the same attention. I wouldn't want a doctor or nurse treating me that rushed to treat me. I much rather have  caring ones that take their time. Thank y'all very much I truly appreciate y'all.|Dr. Mike Adams is the absolute best! After 18 months with pain in my neck and shoulder from an injury, I went  through physical therapy and steroid injections for which was thought was a pinched nerve. I was referred to Dr. Adams. He suggested nerve ablation which was not effective and then suggested injections for trigger points in the muscle. After two rounds of trigger point injections I am now finally pain free. He was very kind and compassionate and intent on getting to the bottom of the problem. The medical staff was very kind and caring through my procedures. My heartfelt thanks to Dr. Mike Adams and the staff at Pain Treatment Centers.

column3:
Pain Treatment Centers of America

Pain Treatment Centers of America (PTCOA) serves as Arkansas's largest comprehensive pain management practice. Our fundamental purpose is helping patients regain control of their lives affected by chronic pain. With multiple locations throughout Arkansas, we provide accessible specialized care for those suffering from debilitating pain conditions.

Our team of physicians and nurse practitioners combines clinical expertise with genuine compassion. We understand how chronic pain can invade every aspect of daily life. PTCOA specialists develop personalized treatment plans addressing each patient's unique pain challenges. Our comprehensive approach focuses on restoring functionality while improving overall quality of life.

Specialized Services

Interventional Pain Management - Targeted procedures to address pain at its source

Medication Management - Carefully monitored treatment plans for pain relief

Physical Rehabilitation - Customized programs to improve mobility and strength

Advanced Diagnostic Testing - Precise identification of pain causes

COVID-19 Response

During the COVID-19 pandemic, PTCOA remains fully committed to patient care. We've implemented enhanced safety protocols while ensuring continuous access to essential pain management services. Our team understands that chronic pain doesn't pause during a pandemic.

Locations and Accessibility

With multiple clinics throughout Arkansas, we provide convenient access to specialized pain care. Our Little Rock location at 108 N Shackleford Rd serves as one of our primary treatment centers. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 844-215-0731 or visiting our website at https://www.ptcoa.com.
column11:
During this COVID-19 pandemic, PTCOA is here for you. The purpose of Pain Treatment Centers of America is quite simple - to put our patients back in control of their lives. Our physicians and nurse practitioners understand how chronic pain can invade, capture, and disrupt the lives of those who suffer from it, and it is our mission to leverage unrivaled compassion and expertise to restore our patients' functionality and improve the quality of their daily lives. We accept that challenge and truly appreciate the trust our many patients have placed in us towards achieving this very important goal.

PTCOA is Arkansas's largest fully comprehensive pain management practice with multiple locations to best serve our patients.

column3:
Pain Treatment Centers of America (PTCOA) in Jonesboro provides comprehensive pain management services for Northeast Arkansas residents. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Located at 1710 Mayfield Dr in Jonesboro, our facility offers advanced pain relief solutions delivered by experienced specialists.

At the heart of our Jonesboro clinic is Dr. Ted Shields, DO, an Arkansas native with extensive credentials in pain management. Dr. Shields brings impressive qualifications to PTCOA, holding board certifications from the American Board of Family Medicine, the American Board of Preventative Medicine with specialization in undersea and hyperbaric medicine, and the American Board of Wound Management and Surgery, where he served as a founding member.

Dr. Shields developed his interest in pain management after witnessing countless patients suffering from trauma and chronic disease effects. He received specialized training in pain management techniques under the guidance of Dr. Meraj Siddiqui, equipping him with advanced skills to address complex pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our Jonesboro clinic offers a wide range of interventional pain treatments designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Patients benefit from customized care plans that may include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Advanced diagnostic assessments

  • Minimally invasive treatment options

Conditions We Treat

Our specialized care addresses numerous pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Work-related injuries

  • Sports injuries

  • Chronic regional pain syndrome

Dr. Shields and our clinical team are dedicated to improving quality of life for Northeast Arkansas residents. Throughout his career, Dr. Shields has held numerous leadership positions while maintaining his commitment to exceptional patient care.

Contact our Jonesboro pain management clinic at (844) 215-0731 to schedule a consultation. We're located at 1710 Mayfield Dr, Jonesboro, AR 72401. Learn more about our services at ptcoa.com/jonesboro-ar-pain-management.

column11: Dr. Shields is an Arkansas native, and is board certified by the American Board of Family Medicine, the American Board of Preventative Medicine (specializing in undersea and hyperbaric medicine), and the American Board of Wound Management and Surgery (of which he is a founding member). During his career, Dr. Shields has held numerous leadership positions and strives to offer the best patient experience and care. He became interested in Pain Management after years of seeing patients in pain from the effects of trauma and chronic disease, and was trained in pain management by Dr. Meraj Siddiqui. Dr. Shields is honored to serve the community of Northeast Arkansas and be a part of the PTCOA family.

column3:
Pain Medicine Specialists of Arkansas provides comprehensive pain management services in Little Rock, Arkansas. Our dedicated team recognizes that your pain is real and requires personalized attention. We focus on relieving, reducing, and managing pain to improve overall quality of life for our patients throughout Arkansas.

At our clinic, we utilize minimally invasive procedures specifically designed to diagnose and treat various pain conditions. Our interventional pain management techniques help patients return to everyday activities quickly and safely. We create individualized treatment plans that address the root cause of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

Specialized Pain Treatments

Our specialists offer treatments for:

- Chronic back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Post-surgical pain

- Sports injuries

- Work-related injuries

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in putting patients first in a clinical environment that emphasizes compassionate care. Our team takes time to help patients understand their diagnosis and encourages active participation in treatment decisions. We explain procedures thoroughly and answer all questions before beginning any treatment.

Visit Our Pain Management Clinic

Location: 1225 Breckenridge Dr #106, Little Rock, AR 72205

Phone: (501) 451-2500

Website: https://painmedicinespecialistsofarkansas.com/

Our convenient Little Rock location serves patients throughout central Arkansas who seek effective pain relief solutions from experienced specialists.
column11: At Pain Medicine Specialists of Arkansas, we recognize our patients' pain is real. That is why our goal is to relieve, reduce or manage pain and improve our patients' overall quality of life. We use minimally invasive procedures specifically designed to diagnose and treat a range of pain conditions. Our personalized treatments put our patients first in a clinical environment that emphasizes compassionate patient care. We help our patients understand their diagnosis and want them to be able to actively participate in treatment decision. Our interventional pain management approach is key to helping patients return to their everyday activities quickly and safely.

column40: I recently started going here and for the first time a pain Dr is looking at the cause of some of my back pain and is taking steps to actually fix it!! I am more then impressed with him and his whole office. 13 yrs of pain Drs and only 5 months at this one!!|Dr. Olaya is hands down the best pain specialist in Arkansas. I have a chronic health condition and he is the very first doctor I have been to that was familiar with my condition and the obstacles it presents. I felt cared for and listened to...because I was. I've never felt like family at a doctors office before and that's exactly what it was like. I'm excited to start this new journey with Dr. Olaya and his staff and thank them with everything I have for giving me hope for a better tomorrow. Please, if you are having pain and just aren't getting answers, go see him. It will change your life.|I fell and hurt my back in December 2021. I started having excruciating pain in February. I saw my PC and he sent me to Baptist Rehabilitation. Three months of stretching and working it out and my back was getting worse. My PC sent me to Prestige Spine and received 3 injections into my spine. This gave me a little relief for about three days. A friend came by my house and saw the pain I was in and recommended Dr. Alaya. I set up the surgery and the difference was felt as I walked out the door. Sore from the staples in my back but a noticeable difference in how I could walk like a normal person. It has been six weeks and I am teaching tennis again. I get sore after four straight hours but the difference is amazing. I have been teaching tennis for forty six years and thought I was done. I'm back and starting to feel like my old self. For the past year I couldn't sleep, heck I couldn't even sit without being in great pain. I was taking 2000 milligrams of extra strength Tylenol and ibuprofen along with gavapantin for the nerve pain. I am taking a couple of Tylenol every once in a while but it has basically gone away.  Thank you everyone at Dr. Alaya's.|Dr Olaya has been wonderful to listen, advise, and help with relief of my back and knee pain. I would highly recommend him to any patient in need of pain management.|LOVE Dr Olaya...so caring,  so compassionate,  would recommend to anyone|Dr Olaya is an amazing Dr. He listens to yiu, he doesn't gaslight you, and he want to find the root of thr problem to help you have the best quality of life possible|This man seems to really care about helping with your pain instead of rushing you in and out like cattle.the staff is also very nice and patient to help|Terrible experience

Arkansas Pain Care Clinics offers comprehensive pain management services in Sherwood, Arkansas. Founded with a mission to help patients live healthier, more normal lives, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain through personalized care plans. Located at 7481 Warden Rd, our team combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate service to address various pain conditions.

At Arkansas Pain Care Clinics, we utilize both opioid and non-opioid treatment methods to effectively manage chronic pain. Our integrated approach addresses the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and specific pain condition. Our healthcare professionals work collaboratively to develop the most effective strategies for pain relief and improved functionality.

Specialized Pain Treatment Services

Our clinic offers specialized care for various chronic pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain management

  • Joint pain treatment

  • Neuropathic pain therapy

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Experienced Medical Team

Our physicians bring extensive training and experience in pain medicine. The medical staff at Arkansas Pain Care Clinics stays current with the latest advancements in pain management techniques. This commitment to continuing education ensures our patients receive the most effective and up-to-date treatments available in pain medicine.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We understand how chronic pain disrupts daily activities and quality of life. Our clinic's core mission focuses on restoring functionality and improving life quality for those suffering from persistent pain. The team at Arkansas Pain Care Clinics takes time to listen to patients' concerns and develops individualized treatment plans that address specific needs.

Arkansas Pain Care Clinics welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Contact us at (501) 918-9192 to schedule a consultation or visit our website at https://arpaincareclinics.com/ for more information about our services.

Located conveniently in Sherwood at 7481 Warden Rd, Arkansas Pain Care Clinics serves patients throughout central Arkansas with compassionate, comprehensive pain management solutions.
column38: Nae Nae|Gerald Cox|Gayle Middaugh|Jaynie Fisher-McClain|Ashley Jennings|Bonnie Bojeisaacson|Jj Watts|Kc Andrews
column40:
Certain persons should find something better to do than pass judgement on people who legally obtain & NEED pain medication to have any type of quality of life. The persons who posted people are addicts by choice is uneducated in the crisis!. When an elder, a disabled person as well as others who may sadly be Afflicted. With pain daily, does NOT make them an addicts! Etsvtry to learn & not throw riccks, when uts obvious you are not informed.  SMH|When Dr Ahmad was here as a Physician the service and treatment programs was more than satisfactory. He truly understood that a person in my line of work and with my injuries needed help controlling my pain. He worked with several different meds to control and relieve pain to a tolerant level.
Now that there has been interim physicians and practitioners the service has began to slip to less than satisfactory level.  And it's primarily the office manager or whatever his title is.  He is rude to say the least and uncaring and just not a good person to be greeting patients that are already in pain and doesn't respond well to sarcasm and harsh words.
Not every person that is seen at a pain Clinic is a drug seeker. Many are like myself and just trying to get enough relief that we can make it through the work day and help someone else in the process. I have been a paramedic for almost 12 years and an EMT for 19 yrs so it's very common for me to have to go out on a call and help lift someone that weighs twice my size. And some of the calls requires a great deal of stress on the body.
The strict laws have made it difficult to get prescriptions from our PCP's and forced us to rely on "Pain Clinics" and now the laws are trying to limit the help we are able to get from the Pain Specialist.  Does the government want us on disability and unable to care for ourselves. There is many a day that it takes all I can muster up to get out of bed and go about my day and get to work to help others who probably feel much better than I do at any given moment. Even with my treatment regimen that the government says should treat my pain ailment. They don't take in to account that my injuries and the pain from them has been increasing since 1985.
I sincerely hope that Dr Ahmad returns to UPC as I am seeking another facility to provide treatment in the near future if this deterioration persists.|My first visit to Dr. Ahmad at United Pain Care, was 10 September, 2015. I printed out the paperwork from their website and had it filled out to save myself some time. I arrived 15 minutes early and was told the Doctor hadn't arrived yet and the wait was about an hour, which it was. The waiting room had about 12-15 people in it. After getting checked in, I waited in the waiting room about an hour and was called back to the nurses station, where my BP was taken, my height and weight was recorded ( I was only asked for it, not actually weighed) then given a cup to pee in and told where to put it when done. I sat outside her office for about 10 minutes, then Dr. Ahmad called me into what I thought was an exam room, but it turned out to be his office, where another young lady also had a desk. He looked at my paperwork, asked me a few questions like where my pain was, how long I had this pain, etc., even though all this information was on the paperwork he had in front of him. He then asked me how long it had been since my last pain medication, I told him, he said he was only able to prescribe a maximum of 3 pills a day, which I said was fine since that was what I had been taking, then a machine spit out my prescription and I was told to go to the front desk to get my appointment for the next month. All in all, not a bad experience, but no hands on exam or anything like that. So, to recap, this pain clinic is like a cattle call with no real exam by the doctor and no real consultation of any type, just get your prescription and come back next month. I gave it 4 stars for the ease in getting my prescription but not 5 stars since I had no real consultation with the doctor.|When Dr. Ahmad was here at the clinic, it was slow progress to get in to see him, but you felt like he knew you. He put you on meds that helped with your multiple conditions. After Dr. Ahmad lost his license, the staff was in constant flux-- including the doctors. You never knew who you would see when the door opened!
I liked Dr. Ahmad. He was no pill mill doctor, as he was made to appear. He was trying to help us with our pain. If people are addicted to opioids, it is nobody's fault but their own. You can control how you take them. You can learn how to function with pain, and block some out.
Now, it seems that Dr. Shajaat has become our regular physician.
Dr. Shajaat is a very good, and caring physician. The longer I get to know him, the more I like him. He smiles, has a little small talk with you. He is young. Hopefully, he will be with us for years.
If you like to be treated like a child by the 'Office 'Manager' then you are in luck! Because Kash, who is at the front desk, is rude. He always manages to make you feel like you are holding up every one from seeing the doctor!
Having been an Administrative Assistant, as well as worked in a a few medical offices,  I know the job. I also know that you don't treat the clients/patients as problems. No matter how bad you feel or they act. AS A PROFESSIONAL, you never speak to them rudely, or take out your misery at having a job you obviously hate!! Without US IN THAT WAITING ROOM, the doctors would have NO need for you or your attitude.
The young man who does the labs, urine test cup--which by the way, you will now do EACH MONTH WHEN YOU VISIT!--(used to be 3-4 months), weight, BP, pulse Ox, is named Dill. He is nicer than Kash, but has begun to pick up his 'rush-rush, hurry-hurry' babel.
There is no "exam". No touching of the patient's body by the doctor at all. Never has been. I imagine that Dr. Shajaat will do the same.
But that just means that my painful, deteriorating spine, is not being monitored by MRIs, X rays, eyeballs, palpation, or any other means. This is very concerning to me. It adds to the depression, as you have signed a contract to not seek pain care from another physician, but the one whom you are seeing is not going to look at your aching body parts.
Be sure to arrive early or close to on time. It doesn't mean that you will be seen then--- it is after all, a waiting room----, but "Office Manager" Kash, will be more than happy to exercise his authority and penalize you by either fining you $25 or $50, depending upon how late you are!
You can expect to spend about 2.5 to 3 hours in the office, in one or the other of the two waiting rooms. But you won't be alone!  The front waiting area is usual filled with other desperate people who are also in as much pain as you are.
I wish that every DEA agent, official and all the rest that don't suffer from chronic, never ending pain, had to experience the same pains that all of us suffer daily with, and suffer for months with it.
They need to realize that if we could,  throw away the canes, braces, pills--all of it--we would! We'd love to go back to work! We're not here to get a 'fix'! We can scarcely get our prescription filled for all the rules now! A lot of us need help to get out of bed every day and we don't take them illegally!|I love the the staff they take time do not just medicate but other things like back braces and annoy other braces such as knee and back. She teaches you about your condition and exercises that you can do at home. This is one clinic I can say h will go to for life!|Each time we go here not only are they very friendly but they are compassionate and knowledgeable. They are prompt your not waiting for long time. I will be recommending them to all my friends and family!!|My experience went perfect. I have gone thru my pain for 9 years now and he is very understanding and is willing to help u.|Excellent straight to the point, no bs!!

column3:
Pain Treatment Centers of America - Stuttgart

Pain Treatment Centers of America in Stuttgart provides comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Heather Whaley. Our clinic specializes in interventional pain treatments designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions affecting Stuttgart residents and surrounding communities.

At our Stuttgart location, we focus on personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced interventional techniques with medication management and rehabilitative strategies. We treat various pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Work-related injuries

- Sports injuries

- Chronic regional pain syndrome

Meet Dr. Heather Whaley

Dr. Heather Whaley brings exceptional medical expertise to our Stuttgart clinic. She attended the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, fulfilling her childhood dream of becoming a physician. Her specialized training includes:

- Completed residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences

- Member of the American Medical Association

- Active participant in the Arkansas Medical Society

- Member of the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians

Dr. Whaley works alongside our talented team at PTCOA with a dedicated focus on alleviating pain and improving patients' quality of life.

Treatment Options

Our Stuttgart clinic offers advanced pain management solutions including:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Nerve blocks

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Joint injections

- Medication management

Visit Our Stuttgart Location

Address: 413 E Michigan St, Stuttgart, AR 72160, United States

Phone: +1 844-215-0731

Website: [www.ptcoa.com](https://www.ptcoa.com/about-us/doctors/heather-whaley/?utm_source=GMBSocialClimb&utm_medium=Dr.HeatherWhaley)

We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options. New patients are welcome, with convenient scheduling available for consultations.
column11: Dr. Heather Whaley attended the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences to fulfill her childhood dream of becoming a physician. Dr. Whaley completed her residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences. She is a member of the American Medical Association, Arkansas Medical Society and the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians. Dr. Whaley is thankful for the opportunity to work with the talented team at PTCOA to alleviate pain and improve their patients' quality of life.

At Chenal Pain Management, we provide targeted therapies for various pain conditions including:

Chris and Ashley are amazing, and they do their job well and I would give all of you a 10. They also treat your patients with dignity, respect, & compassion. But Eli is very rude & disrespectful & far from compassionate. You know that I've always got along with your staff until now. He hung up on me twice right in the middle of my sentence, he told me that he was working on the letter for my surgeon for 2 weeks and after calling several times to get that letter and hearing his promises of working on it, his 1st excuse was because he was thrown into the middle of chaos, then he tries to tell me that they aren't allowed to give me any pain meds!? and lastly, he tells me that my surgeon's office needs to call him and then when they first called, he wouldn't answer the phone!? When Ashley was in the middle of scheduling my next appointment, he called her into his "office" to teach him how to do something as if I weren't standing there discussing a date for me to come back and that was very unprofessional. If he hangs up on your patients like he did me, or picks up the phone and never answers but immediately puts you on hold, talks down to them like he did me, as if he is better than others, you are going to lose more patients than just me.
I honestly don't know why you didn't offer Chris or Ashley that position because it seems like Eli's position has gone to his head. I was an office manager for a few years and I would have been fired if I did all of that, but then again, I would never treat people the way he did me. He didn't bother to tell you the TRUTH about why I was having to call over & over again. I'm not sure what he told you but of course I'm going to keep calling when I get upset because he hung up on me or he is not doing what he promised.  He is also making the rules as he goes along because he was telling me that the surgeon can't give me a stronger pain med after surgery but I looked it up and called a pharmacist and that is not the law and it wasn't a problem with your office sending a letter over for the 2 surgeries I had before this one and they were able to give me the appropriate amount needed according to what they had to do, & sadly, this is by far the worst painful surgery out of them all but now all of the sudden, Eli's law says that they are not allowed to give me anything. It breaks my heart to leave but I will not be treated that way when I am a paying customer. And it's really sad that I, the patient, humbled myself & apologized for reacting the way I did on Monday when he was so rude and his response was, "oh well, we have our days" but he never acknowledged nor apologized for the way he was treating me.
I will miss the 3 of you and your kindness. Thank you for taking care of me all of this time, you really did an awesome job.|The best pain doctor ever. This man is always willing to help you, he's kind, compassionate and does a super great job.

Advanced Interventional Pain Management, led by Jacob Abraham, MD, has been providing cutting-edge chronic pain treatments in the Hot Springs, Arkansas area for almost 25 years. As a cornerstone of healthcare in the community, the clinic specializes in interventional pain management techniques that help patients find relief from persistent pain conditions.

Dr. Abraham, a double board-certified interventional pain specialist, offers personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Unlike many providers in the region, Dr. Abraham is a local resident who has been serving the Hot Springs population since 1996, ensuring continuity of care and deep understanding of the community's healthcare needs.

The clinic provides advanced solutions for various pain conditions, including:

- Spinal pain management

- Joint pain treatment

- Nerve pain therapy

- Minimally invasive procedures

- Comprehensive pain evaluations

Multiple Convenient Locations

Advanced Interventional Pain Management maintains an extensive network of facilities to serve patients throughout Arkansas:

- Two locations in Hot Springs, including a specialized surgery center

- Additional offices in Little Rock, Texarkana, El Dorado, Arkadelphia, and Mena

This regional presence ensures patients can access quality pain management care without extensive travel.

Expert Medical Leadership

Dr. Jacob Abraham brings decades of specialized experience in pain medicine to his practice. His double board certification reflects his commitment to maintaining the highest standards in interventional pain management. Patients benefit from his extensive knowledge of innovative pain relief techniques and his dedication to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

For appointments or more information about pain management options, patients can contact the clinic at +1 501-624-7246 or visit their website at www.getpainfree.com. The main Hot Springs location is conveniently situated at 1 Mercy Lane #304, Hot Springs, AR 71913.

column3:
Spa City Pain Management is a specialized clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions in Hot Springs, Arkansas. Founded by Dr. Crabtree, the clinic offers personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, Spa City Pain Management combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives.

Dr. Crabtree brings extensive medical training and experience to Spa City Pain Management. He earned his undergraduate degree at Northeastern State University in Oklahoma before receiving his medical degree at Oklahoma State University for Health Sciences Center. His commitment to excellence continued through his fellowship training, after which he served as an Assistant Professor and Associate Program Director at the University of Arkansas for Health Sciences, where he was responsible for resident education. Before establishing Spa City Pain Management, Dr. Crabtree gained valuable clinical experience practicing for two years with Advanced Spine and Pain practice.

Our Services

Spa City Pain Management offers a comprehensive range of treatments for various pain conditions, including:

- Interventional Pain Procedures

- Spinal Cord Stimulation

- Medication Management

- Joint Injections

- Nerve Blocks

- Radiofrequency Ablation

Our clinic specializes in treating conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs of individual patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Spa City Pain Management, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our team takes time to understand each patient's unique pain experience and develops customized treatment strategies. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible and focus on improving quality of life while reducing dependency on pain medications.

Visit us at 117 Piper St Suite L, Hot Springs, AR 71901, or call us at +1 501-651-0018 to schedule your consultation. For more information about our services, please visit our website at https://spacitypainmanagement.com/
column11: Dr. Crabtree earned his undergraduate degree at Northeastern State University in Oklahoma and received his medical degree at Oklahoma State University for Health Sciences Center. After his fellowship, Dr. Crabtree returned to the University of Arkansas for Health Sciences as an Assistant Professor and Associate Program Director in charge of resident education. Dr. Crabtree spent two years practicing pain management with Advanced Spine and Pain practice prior to opening Spa City Pain Management.

Rossetti Cindy E MD at PTCOA offers comprehensive pain management services in Fort Smith, Arkansas. Dr. Cindy Rossetti joined Pain Treatment Centers of America (PTCOA) in 2021, bringing specialized expertise in interventional pain management techniques. Prior to joining PTCOA, she practiced at North Arkansas Pain Management - White River Health Systems Pain Clinic, where she developed extensive clinical experience treating various pain conditions.

Dr. Rossetti's academic foundation includes a Bachelor of Science in Kinesiology and Exercise Science from the University of Arkansas at Fayetteville. She furthered her education by obtaining her medical degree from the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS). Her specialized training in interventional pain management was completed under the mentorship of Dr. Meraj Siddiqui in Batesville, Arkansas. Dr. Rossetti has enhanced her expertise through multiple advanced courses in pain management interventional techniques.

Specialized Pain Management Services

At PTCOA Fort Smith, Dr. Rossetti provides personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Her approach combines interventional procedures with comprehensive pain management strategies. The clinic specializes in:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Chronic pain management

  • Spinal pain treatment

  • Joint pain relief

  • Nerve pain therapies

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Rossetti focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain. Patients benefit from her comprehensive assessment process and evidence-based interventions. The clinic emphasizes minimally invasive techniques when appropriate, helping patients achieve pain relief with reduced recovery time.

Location and Contact Information

PTCOA Fort Smith is conveniently located at 3017 S 70th St, Suites F, G, H, Fort Smith, AR 72903. Patients seeking pain management solutions can schedule a consultation by calling +1 844-215-0731 or visiting the clinic's website at www.ptcoa.com/dr-cindy-rossetti.

The clinic welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans. Same-week appointments are often available for those seeking prompt pain relief solutions.

WRMC Pain Management Clinic offers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Batesville, Arkansas. Our specialty-trained providers deliver effective outpatient treatments designed to relieve chronic pain, restore function, and reduce dependence on prescription pain medications. Located on the White River Medical Center campus, our clinic takes an integrated approach to pain management, coordinating care with your other ongoing treatments.

Our interventional pain specialists employ advanced techniques to address various chronic pain conditions. We understand that chronic pain often accompanies underlying medical conditions, which is why our program specifically integrates with your complete healthcare plan. Patients receive personalized treatment plans following referral from their primary care or specialty physician.

Treatment Approach

At WRMC Pain Management Clinic, we focus on minimally invasive procedures and comprehensive pain solutions. Our goal extends beyond pain relief to improving overall function and quality of life. We emphasize reducing reliance on pain medications while providing effective alternatives for long-term pain management.

Patient Information

New patients must be referred by their primary care or specialty physician. This referral process ensures coordinated care and appropriate treatment planning. Our clinic maintains close communication with referring physicians to provide integrated care for optimal outcomes.

Location and Contact Details

Visit us at 1700 Harrison St T, Batesville, AR 72501, conveniently located on the White River Medical Center campus. For appointments or questions, call 870-262-6155. I felt that he genuinely listened to my problems and they all took very good care of me when I came in in January 2021 to receive pain shots for my DDD. The issue now is that I have to transfer to a different clinic because of a billing mistake by the clinic that hasn't been fixed. The clinic never submitted my 2021 procedure to my insurance and instead sent me a bill for the whole amount remaining. When I contacted them about getting this fixed, they said they would address it with billing and get back to me. That was six months ago. I'm more than ready to pay my dues for the procedure, but I expect everything to be submitted properly to my insurance first. They're so down to earth and genuine, I actually look forward to the appointments like it's a breath of fresh air. They even made some pretty painful injection appointments way less scary by just simply hanging out with me and calming me down while I was panicking. Trust me, you won't regret coming here! Thank you Dr. McCarver for all you've done! For the first time in 10 years I feel optimistic and confident that I have a plan to tackle my chronic pain.|I was a patient of Dr. McCarver's . I had no problems with him, but the staff was deplorable. Twice I was given an appointment for a cervical ablation with sedation, which they only do once a month. Both times I never got on the books. The second time was after a failed attempt in the office. The pain was so severe I could not stand it so the doctor promised they would work me in for sedation at the hospital. Never happened and the staff could not have cared less. I've had eight major orthopedic surgeries in the last 19 years giving me a great deal of experience with doctors and staff. First time I've ever felt obligated to warn people to stay away.

Pain Treatment Centers of America - Little Rock

Pain Treatment Centers of America in Little Rock provides comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Mikhail Ivanovsky. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions with personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's needs.

Dr. Ivanovsky brings extensive training and experience to our Little Rock clinic. He completed his residency in Anesthesiology with specialized training in Pain Management at The University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 2001. His educational background includes additional training in Anesthesia and Pain Management from The Moscow Academy of Postgraduate Education.

Board Certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology, Dr. Ivanovsky has served the Little Rock community since 2001. His professional accomplishments include founding Metropolitan Anesthesia P.A. and serving as Chief of Surgical and Anesthesia services at North Metro Medical Center.

Our Pain Management Services

Our clinic offers advanced treatments for various pain conditions:

- Chronic back and neck pain

- Joint pain management

- Neuropathic pain treatment

- Interventional pain procedures

- Comprehensive pain assessments

- Customized treatment planning

We focus on improving quality of life through effective pain control. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care.

column3:
Advanced Interventional Pain Management provides comprehensive pain relief solutions in Hot Springs, Arkansas. Led by Dr. Ryan V. Stuckey, our clinic specializes in minimally invasive treatments that reduce pain while improving patients' functional capacity.

Dr. Ryan V. Stuckey MD is a highly qualified Anesthesiologist with subspecialty training in Interventional Pain Management. His impressive credentials include board certifications from both the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine, establishing him as an expert in his field.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Advanced Interventional Pain Management, we understand that pain affects each person differently. Dr. Stuckey creates personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our primary goal is to:

- Reduce chronic and acute pain conditions

- Improve functional capacity and quality of life

- Decrease reliance on pain medications

- Provide long-term pain management solutions

Specialized Services

Our clinic offers fluoroscopic-guided procedures that precisely target pain sources. These minimally invasive techniques provide effective relief while minimizing recovery time. We treat various conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain

- Neuropathic pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Chronic regional pain syndrome

Visit Our Clinic

Located at 1717 Malvern Ave, Hot Springs, AR 71901, our facility is equipped with advanced technology for accurate diagnosis and treatment. Contact us at +1 501-624-7246 to schedule your consultation.

For more information about our services, visit our website: [getpainfree.com](http://getpainfree.com/)
column11:
Ryan V. Stuckey MD is an Anesthesiologist with subspecialty training in Interventional Pain Management. Dr. Stuckey is board-certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine.

At Advanced Interventional Pain Management, Dr. Stuckey's treatment goal is to reduce pain and improve functional capacity utilizing minimally invasive fluoroscopic-guided procedures in order to decrease reliance on medication. He believes each patient experiences pain differently and understands the importance of creating a personalized treatment plan.

Led by Dr. Butch Garlapati, MD, our clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain quality of life.

At Arkansas Pain Center, we offer a wide range of interventional pain management treatments. Our approach includes diagnostic evaluations, medication management, and minimally invasive procedures. About Dr. Butch Garlapati

Dr. Garlapati brings extensive experience in pain medicine to our practice. Board-certified in pain management, he completed specialized training in interventional techniques. Our Pain Management Philosophy

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Our team works to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that may include physical therapy, interventional procedures, and appropriate medication management. We emphasize minimally invasive options whenever possible. Our goal is long-term pain relief and improved function.
