If "inconsistent" was a physical place, this would be it. Staff here are rude and demeaning. You can NEVER talk to anyone when you call. I've communicated more with them by text than over the phone. They never followed up on anything. I've already contacted several former patients because of the things I've heard.  A 74 year old patient from there had a bad fall once with a brain bleed and they weren't getting relief to the lower back(hit in the lower back from behind by heavy equipment when they fell and hit their head). They told this person, over text, they don't treat acute pain and that they need to go see PCP.(Patient still has the text too!)  Well they did go see the PCP after a stay in ICU, and had PCP contact them to okay the extra meds. The next appointment they were chastised and talked down to horribly and denied telling patient that. Then REDUCED the patient's meds. Then got a letter in the mail terminating the contract. They couldn't have told them at the appointment? The letter also stated patient can't set foot within 100 feet of establishment... A 74 yr old patient who can barely walk. This place is a joke. After the first visit you may not see the doctor again for months. I hope they understand they're messing with someone's way of life, and quality of life. "Do no harm" seems to be a dead concept these days.|I have given this place a 1 star because it was literally the lowest I could go.   Today was my first day visiting with Dr. Garlapati.   This man was utterly rude and disgusting and very disrespectful.

He began to speak to me in a manner that I was not pleased with.  I asked him to not speak to me in that way and he began to escalate his tone.     He was trying to make me feel like I have something wrong.   And I asked him to check again.   He began to speak to me in a very rude way.   I again asked him not to speak to me in this manner.  He then threatened to call the police on me if I said anything else.( he was the only one yelling ).   All I asked this unprofessional to do was watch the tone he had with me. I even asked the nurse is he always like this. She seemed so shocked and upset that he was speaking to me in this manner   Wow.         I should have followed my first mind and canceled this appointment.     When I walked into the place I knew I did not belong there based off the energy.  And when I walked into the room.  I felt it even more. And now I see why.  No matter the reason. He should have been professional. And was not.    I would not recommend this place to anyone not even your dog. Because I treat my dog way better than this.  This doctor is not for the people of America.  Simple as that. $60 copay Down the drain.    This man tried to treat me in a manner that goes completely against my character.|This clinic is very unprofessional and don't like communication. Ms Cora won't return calls n they're all judgemental. They terminated me after having surgery and releasing me a day after I had a serious procedure that could've left me blind if not treated. They asked me if I've had any surgeries or been to er which I stated I had surgery the day prior. They cancelled my appointment without properly notifying me. No calls or nothing just cut me loose after 6 yrs of being a pt there. Now I'm having to protect my reputation n find another pain doctor. I didn't have time to find another doctor or nothing very unprofessional n I wouldn't recommend a dog get treated there cause that's exactly how I was treated like an animal I'm no damn drug addict n I'm looking for an attorney due to patient abandonment.|Yesterday I had my first visit with Dr. Garlapati. He did in one visit what multiple doctors have not been able to do, or see in TWO years. When I got to my car I cried tears of joy, because I felt like someone finally had a plan to help me.|This Man pain center,behind home depot off smokey ln.North little Rock Ar..He was rude to me ask me where was my teeth..NO people skills at all..The America pain treatment of Arkansas, in little Rock..Is awesome. Dr.takes time to help me..|This clinic is horrible. Never answer phone calls and you never see the same person twice, so no one knows what they are doing. After being in pain management for over 5 years, my Dr retired and referred me here, but my treatment plan is changed every month due to seeing someone different. One month I was told I only needed a laxative to take away my pain from degenerative disk disease and my auto-immune disease. $90 co-pay and no meds. Next month another Dr asked me why the last one wouldn't fill my meds. I'm on the search of a new clinic. Rude people, no constant Dr, and they don't care. They threaten to drop you every month|Worse place ever to go to. They lie to you constantly, you can never speak with your doctor, they do not have a person to answer the phone 24/7 it takes days to get an answer to your messages or questions if you are lucky. Their policies change from one day to the next. Their staff is beyond Rude and hang up on you for asking important questions. This clinic will drop you as a patient and refuse to see you if you press them too much with questiions. My pharmacy can never get in touch with them. Totally sucks|I was a patient here for about 7 yrs. Turn over got so bad I would never see same person twice. They hardly ever answered phones so when they hadn't called in meds I would have to go in personally to get in contact with anyone and that was just so I could leave message at front desk. Several times I would go weeks without meds because of prior authorization needed with insurance. I finally had enough and moved on. The Indian doctor was wonderful though. I don't think he knew what was going on with his patients though because he never would of allowed this to continue.

column3:
Pain Treatment MD

Pain Treatment MD, led by Dr. Sameer Jain, provides comprehensive interventional pain management services in Bryant, Arkansas. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures and personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life without excessive reliance on medication.

At Pain Treatment MD, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your daily life. Dr. Jain employs evidence-based techniques to address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our treatment philosophy centers on restoring function and improving mobility while reducing dependence on pain medications.

Meet Dr. Sameer Jain

Dr. Sameer Jain is a board-certified interventional pain management physician with extensive training in advanced pain relief techniques. His educational background includes specialized fellowship training in interventional pain procedures, equipping him with expertise in precise diagnostic methods and targeted treatments. Dr. Jain stays current with the latest developments in pain medicine to offer patients the most effective solutions available.

Conditions We Treat

- Spine-Related Pain: Back pain, neck pain, sciatica

- Joint Pain: Knee, shoulder, hip arthritis

- Nerve Pain: Neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome

- Cancer-Related Pain: Supportive care for oncology patients

- Post-Surgical Pain: Management of persistent pain after operations

- Headaches and Migraines: Advanced treatment protocols

Our Services

- Epidural Steroid Injections: Targeted relief for spinal inflammation

- Radiofrequency Ablation: Long-lasting pain relief for joint pain

- Spinal Cord Stimulation: Advanced technology for chronic back pain

- Joint Injections: Precise delivery of medications to affected areas

- Medication Management: Carefully monitored prescription plans

- Physical Therapy Coordination: Integrated rehabilitation approaches

Patient-Centered Care

Every treatment plan at Pain Treatment MD begins with a thorough evaluation. We take time to listen to your concerns and develop strategies tailored to your specific needs. Our clinic provides clear explanations of treatment options, helping you make informed decisions about your care.

Location and Contact Information

Address: 408 Office Park Dr Suite 3, Bryant, AR 72022, United States

Phone: +1 501-553-0000

Website: [http://paintreatmentmd.com/](http://paintreatmentmd.com/)

Our Bryant clinic serves patients throughout central Arkansas with convenient scheduling options and prompt appointment availability for those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Care provides specialized pain management services in Monticello, Arkansas. Our clinic delivers personalized treatment plans combining both opioid and non-opioid medical management approaches to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located at 1222 Old Warren Rd, we serve patients throughout Monticello and surrounding communities with compassionate, evidence-based care.

At Comprehensive Pain Care, we offer multidisciplinary treatment options tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our medical team specializes in:

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations and diagnostics

  • Medication management for chronic pain

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Non-opioid treatment alternatives

  • Responsible opioid prescribing when appropriate

  • Ongoing pain monitoring and management

Specialized Treatment Approach

Our physicians bring extensive training in pain medicine to develop effective treatment strategies. We understand that pain affects each person differently, requiring individualized care plans. Our balanced approach considers both medication management and alternative therapies to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic addresses a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Patients seeking care can schedule appointments by calling +1 870-224-4545. Our clinic is conveniently located at 1222 Old Warren Rd, Monticello, AR 71655. For more information about our services, visit our website at www.comprehensivepain.net.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We believe in establishing strong doctor-patient relationships built on trust and communication. Our team takes time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly explain treatment options, and develop realistic goals for pain management. This collaborative approach helps patients regain function and improve daily activities.

Hot Springs Pain Clinic provides comprehensive interventional pain management services to residents throughout Arkansas. Our specialized team at Advanced Interventional Pain Management focuses on treating chronic pain conditions using minimally invasive techniques. We help patients find relief without surgery and with reduced reliance on medication.

At Hot Springs Pain Clinic, we believe in addressing the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our physicians develop personalized treatment plans using evidence-based interventional procedures. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Non-Surgical Pain Relief Options

Our clinic offers numerous non-surgical interventions including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Peripheral nerve blocks

  • Regenerative medicine treatments

Our Expert Physicians

Our board-certified pain management specialists have extensive training in interventional techniques. With decades of combined experience, our doctors completed fellowships in pain management at prestigious institutions. Each physician stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine through continuing education.

Patient-Centered Care

We take time to listen to each patient's concerns. Your first appointment includes a thorough evaluation of your condition. Our team works with you to create realistic goals for pain reduction and improved function. We coordinate with your primary care physician to ensure comprehensive care.

Visit Our Hot Springs Location

Located at 1 Mercy Lane, Suite 304, Hot Springs, AR 71913, our modern facility offers a comfortable environment for consultations and procedures. We serve patients throughout Hot Springs and surrounding communities.

If you're ready to manage your pain effectively, contact Advanced Interventional Pain Management today. Call (501) 321-4772 to schedule your consultation or visit www.getpainfree.com for more information. As one of Arkansas' leading pain management practices, we're committed to helping you return to a more active, pain-reduced lifestyle.

About Dr. Julio R. Olaya

Dr. Olaya brings extensive expertise to pain medicine practice. He graduated from La Salle University in 1986 and completed his fellowship at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1990. Dr. Olaya established Pain Medicine Specialists of Arkansas with a mission to provide effective pain relief solutions. His approach integrates medical innovation with personalized attention to address each patient's unique pain challenges.

Pain Treatment Centers of America - Conway is a specialized pain management clinic serving the Conway, Arkansas community. Our clinic provides comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs, helping them regain control of their lives through effective pain relief strategies.

At our Conway location, patients benefit from the expertise of Dr. Noemi Ramsay, a fellowship-trained pain management physician dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Dr. Ramsay completed her anesthesia residency at Boston Medical Center, followed by specialized pain management fellowship training at the University of Baltimore Medical Center. Her educational background provides a strong foundation for addressing complex pain issues.

After practicing general anesthesia for 10 years on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, Dr. Ramsay made a pivotal career decision. She realized her true calling was making a more significant difference in patients' lives beyond the operating room. For the past 3 years, she has focused exclusively on treating and alleviating pain as a board-eligible pain management specialist, taking a personalized approach with each patient.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our Conway clinic offers advanced treatment options for various pain conditions including:

- Chronic back and neck pain management using evidence-based approaches

- Joint pain relief through targeted interventions

- Neuropathic pain treatment utilizing specialized techniques

- Cancer-related pain management for improved quality of life

- Post-surgical pain solutions for better recovery outcomes

We employ a multidisciplinary approach combining interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative strategies to address pain at its source.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

At Pain Treatment Centers of America, we believe effective pain management begins with listening to our patients. Our team takes time to understand each person's pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals before developing customized care plans. This patient-centered approach leads to more successful outcomes and higher satisfaction.

Location and Contact Information

Our Conway clinic is conveniently located at 2425 Dave Ward Dr, Suite 302, Conway, AR 72034. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Ramsay, please call +1 844-215-0731. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans.

Visit our website at [ptcoa.com](https://www.ptcoa.com/about-us/doctors/noemi-ramsay-md/?utm_source=GMBSocialClimb&utm_medium=Dr.NoemiRamsay) to learn more about our services and Dr. Ramsay's approach to pain management.
column11: Dr. Noemi Ramsay completed her anesthesia residency at Boston Medical Center, after which she completed a pain management fellowship at the University of Baltimore Medical Center. She practiced general anesthesia for 10 years on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, then realized she wanted to make more of a difference in her patients' lives than just getting them through their surgeries. So for the last 3 years, Dr. Ramsay has dedicated her time helping treat and alleviate pain as a fellowship trained, board eligible pain management physician, one patient at a time.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in educating patients about their pain conditions. Each treatment plan addresses immediate pain relief and long-term management. Our staff coordinates care with primary physicians when necessary. We accept most major insurance plans and new patients.

Conway Pain Clinic welcomes patients throughout Central Arkansas. Contact us at +1 501-358-6560 to schedule your consultation. Our office hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

column40: When I first came to Brad Lindsey I thought I had found the best team to help me with all my body had been through. His nurse Candy is AMAZING!! His wife Jennifer is also GREAT! Every other nurse their needs some serious lessons in compassion and manners. Lindsey began weaning me off an extremely strong, round-the-clock patch too rapidly and then went on spring break. He had to take time from his vacation to call in a med for me. When he got back from his vacation, he told me to come in. He then had me brought to a room "they never use" (according to the nurse who walked me back) and took his time their to belittle and yell at me about how "not special" I am and that he could just send me away as he wished, which is exactly what he ended up doing. Of course, Crystal, the nurse, said she was dismissing me for non-compliance, but isn't it funny how my records all say "patient is compliant with medications and follow ups". So when they get tired of you complaining about mistakes or how long it takes them to return messages, they'll just find a way to get rid of you. I feel like people need to know the true level of care when seeking a pain management Dr and this was my true experience. It started off well, but just like every Dr who has had to deal with me since this all started....they can't figure it out, so they dump you.|I went in switching from another pain doctor in Little Rock. Arkansas Spine and Pain offers comprehensive pain management services at their Jacksonville clinic. Dr. John Brown, DO specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and personalized treatment plans. The clinic provides relief for patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, and neuropathic conditions.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Dr. Brown and the medical team at Arkansas Spine and Pain deliver targeted treatments for various pain conditions. Services include epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. The clinic focuses on minimally invasive techniques to reduce recovery time and improve outcomes for patients with persistent pain.

About Dr. John Brown, DO

Dr. Brown completed his medical education and specialized training in pain management and interventional techniques. His approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, developing individualized treatment plans for each patient. Dr. Brown stays current with advanced pain management technologies and procedures to provide optimal care.

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinic prioritizes thorough evaluation and diagnosis before treatment. Patients receive comprehensive assessments to identify pain sources and contributing factors. Treatment plans may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications for long-term pain relief.

Location and Contact Information

Arkansas Spine and Pain's Jacksonville clinic is conveniently located at 140 John Harden Dr, Jacksonville, AR 72076. The facility features modern equipment and comfortable treatment rooms. For appointments or questions, patients can call +1 501-227-0184 or visit their website at https://arkansasspineandpain.com/providers/.

The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to maximize coverage for necessary treatments. New patients are welcome, with convenient scheduling options available.

column40: Dr. Brown is very understanding.  He works to find the best solution. He makes sure that my pain has reached a tolerable level. I don't always speak correctly.  He is like a friend . He is able to decipher what I mean or am wanting to learn. I just had my third visit with him. I highly recommend him.|Dr. Brown is the absolute best pain mgmt doc I have ever been to! He actually takes the time to listen to you & genuinely cares about your pain. He is very easy to talk to & explains things to where you can understand them. Also we have seen his nurse Ruth for years @ their other clinic &  she is the absolute best!!! Jacksonville & Dr. Brown are blessed to have such a amazing nurse|Dr Brown is an absolute gem! As a recovering addict, dealing with chronic pain, it was difficult to walk into a pain clinic. There's always this worry that I'll be judged or that I won't get the help I need. My worries were completely unjustified! I was up front with my doctor about what I had been through and told him that I needed a non-narcotic course of treatment and he listened to me, really listened to me and treated me like a human being. Even told me he was proud of what I had accomplished. We agreed on a treatment plan that wouldn't interfere with my progress but would give me some relief and I left his office feeling inspired and positive! I highly recommend him and his sweet staff. And if you're also in recovery, it's okay to stick to your guns and be honest! There are doctors who will respect you for doing so, Dr. Brown being one.|Dr, Brown takes the time to work through problems with me. He is compassionate and empathizes with me. After My neck surgery he even asked if everything went well Thank you Dr. Brown and Staff  for being very friendly and The staff Makes you feel comfortable as well Sincerely ;Cynthia Bailey Jacksonville AR|I can tell dr brown cared n wanted to help me. column3:
Interventional Pain Management - Harrison serves as Boone County's only fully comprehensive pain management clinic. Located in Harrison, Arkansas, our board-certified physicians and dedicated staff specialize in treating patients suffering from all types of chronic pain conditions. We provide personalized care for those experiencing neck and back pain, cancer-related discomfort, post-surgical pain, neuropathy, arthritis, and fibromyalgia.

Our clinic offers a complete range of interventional pain management techniques designed to address the root causes of pain. We utilize advanced diagnostic procedures and innovative treatment approaches to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. Our goal is to develop individualized treatment plans that combine the most effective therapies for each patient's specific condition.

Specialized Care Options

At Interventional Pain Management - Harrison, we provide:

- Medication monitoring through our CLIA certified laboratory

- DEA suboxone program for patients struggling with drug dependency

- Minimally invasive procedures to target pain at its source

- Comprehensive evaluation of complex pain conditions

- Coordinated care with other healthcare providers

Our Commitment

The entire team at Interventional Pain Management is dedicated to helping you live a life free from debilitating pain. We understand how chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living and work diligently to provide solutions that restore function and improve overall wellbeing.

Location and Contact Information

Address: 114 E Crandall Ave Suite A, Harrison, AR 72601, United States

Phone: +1 870-365-0130

Website: https://www.baxterhealth.org/locations/interventional-pain-management-harrison/

We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans. Contact our office today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

column3:
Advanced Interventional Pain Surgery Center

Advanced Interventional Pain Surgery Center has been providing cutting-edge chronic pain treatments in Hot Springs, Arkansas, and surrounding areas for almost 25 years. As a cornerstone of healthcare in the community, the center specializes in interventional pain management techniques designed to address chronic pain conditions with minimally invasive approaches.

The center offers a wide range of treatments for patients suffering from various pain conditions, including:

- Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back and leg pain

- Radiofrequency ablation for joint and nerve pain

- Epidural steroid injections for spinal inflammation

- Nerve blocks for targeted pain relief

- Regenerative medicine options including PRP therapy

Multiple Convenient Locations

With a commitment to serving Arkansas residents, Advanced Interventional Pain Management maintains offices throughout the state:

- Two locations in Hot Springs (including a dedicated surgery center)

- Little Rock

- Texarkana

- El Dorado

- Arkadelphia

- Mena

- Fayetteville

Expert Medical Team

The practice features board-certified pain specialists with extensive training in interventional techniques. Their physicians combine decades of clinical experience with ongoing education in the latest pain management advancements. Each doctor develops personalized treatment plans based on individual patient needs.

Patient-Centered Approach

Patients at Advanced Interventional Pain Surgery Center receive comprehensive evaluations to identify the root causes of their pain. The center emphasizes minimally invasive procedures that promote faster recovery times and reduced reliance on pain medications.

For consultations or to learn more about available treatment options, contact the center at +1 501-321-4292 or visit their main Hot Springs location at 1717 Malvern Ave, Hot Springs, AR 71901.

Additional information about services and locations can be found on their website: [www.getpainfree.com](https://www.getpainfree.com/)
column11: Advanced Interventional Pain Management has been providing cutting-edge chronic pain treatments in the Hot Springs, Arkansas, area for almost 25 years and is a highly valued asset to the local community. In addition to two locations in Hot Springs, including a surgery center, the practice has offices in Little Rock, Texarkana, El Dorado, Arkadelphia, Mena, and Fayetteville Arkansas.

column2: Optimal Pain And Wellness - Dr. Regina Thurman, Dr. Mary Frances Daut & Dr. Ornette Gaines
column3:
Optimal Pain And Wellness provides comprehensive pain management services in Fayetteville, Arkansas. Our dedicated team of specialists, led by Dr. Regina Thurman, Dr. Mary Frances Daut, and Dr. Ornette Gaines, offers personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Located at 1708 E Joyce Blvd, our clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive experience to pain treatment. Dr. Regina Thurman specializes in interventional pain procedures and comprehensive pain management strategies. Dr. Mary Frances Daut focuses on integrative approaches to chronic pain, while Dr. Ornette Gaines brings expertise in spine-related conditions and minimally invasive treatments. Together, our doctors have decades of combined experience helping Fayetteville residents find relief.

Conditions We Treat

At Optimal Pain And Wellness, we address a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Sports injuries

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Work-related injuries

Our Treatment Approach

We believe in multimodal pain management tailored to each patient. Our treatments include:

  • Medication management

  • Interventional procedures (nerve blocks, epidural injections)

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Behavioral health integration

Patient-Centered Care

Our approach focuses on improving function while reducing pain. We work closely with patients to develop realistic goals and sustainable treatment plans. Most insurance plans accepted. New patients welcome.

Contact us at +1 479-301-2565 to schedule a consultation. Serving Fayetteville and surrounding Northwest Arkansas communities with compassionate, evidence-based pain management.

column40:
The office manager is an absolute nightmare. Incredibly rude and hateful in every interaction. She will call you names for simply asking questions about how things work. DO NOT RECOMMEND unless you enjoy being treated like a bug. I have been in pain management for seven years and I've never been so appalled by the way patients are handled.|Tested positive on urine test, got threatened and yelled at then next appointment I brought it up, once again stating I had taken nothing that would cause me to fail a test. The doctor shrugged, said, "it's OK, the followup test was negative, so the first test was a false positive. No apology. No professionalsim!|I have been in pain management for 11years now. I see Dr. Gaines who is great at what he does. Most of the office staff are friendly and kind as well. I do have reserved feelings about 1 whom is not very friendly and seems to be a little harsh, however, with that said, this office is very busy so getting things done in a quick manner is a must. A smile and a please and thank you is a great customer service skill however and goes a very long way when dealing with patients. Otherwise, the office is clean, office staff are great. Dr Gaines listens and answers any questions I have.|My husband suffered a back injury in 1988 and was advised it would get worse over time. He tries hard to bear the pain and go about his day. Over the years, he's had to change pain management clinics several times for various reasons. He's seen a vast difference between each clinic. Optimal Pain and Wellness has far exceeded our expectations!! The staff have always been kind and treated us with the utmost respect. Dr Gaines takes time with us and listens to our concerns! He works with us as a team to ensure my husband is as comfortable and functional as possible! Thank you for treating us with respect and not as drug seekers! It truly makes a difference in my husband's quality of life!

We absolutely love the new office!|The Van Buren has hired a new APN and he fired my mother today. She's been with Dr. Gaines for about 8 years. She struggles so much with pain and there isn't a lot she can take for pain because she's in end stage kidney failure on dialysis. She has severe RA, degenerative disc disease and a hip she's waiting to have surgery to be replaced (she's not physically strong enough for the surgery right now). She has never been seen by this nurse practitioner and he has NO CLUE about her history!!! He accused her of selling them and was downright rude! She had a bad fall that landed her in the hospital off and on for three weeks in Late July early August she told him upfront that she had taken some extra because the pain was excruciating. The hospital doctor told her to alternate with ibuprofen, she can't take ibuprofen because of her kidney function. I would recommend staying away from this pain clinic if this is the way the new APN is going to run the practice. My mother is an honest woman with a lot of pain. She's not some young person or even middle aged person trying to work the system. I'm not one to give a totally negative review, but this is just wrong! Dr. Gaines is wonderful and is very kind, but my mother rarely has an appointment with him. Again this review is for the new APN at the VB office.|I have so much anxiety when it comes to pain management and Doctors in general. From the front desk to the Doctor I was treated with the upmost kindness, compassion, and understanding. I was not made to feel like some drug seeking lunatic scratching at the door like 95% of other pain management practitioners do. Dr Gaines is amazing and so are the staff.|I did like going here only when I saw Dr. Gaines. He is a great pain doctor. The new APN is not good, he's rude and doesn't know anything about you but still has the audacity to try to tell you about you and he doesn't listen when you try to explain anything to him. They need the one they had before. The new one fired me and that's fine, because if I can't see Dr. Gaines then I would rather go somewhere else. I give Dr. Gaines 5 stars, but the APN gets zero stars!!!! I also like the ladies/nurses that are there because they are very nice. Thank y'all for being so nice and sweet to me. I give y'all 5 stars as well.|I have been a patient with Dr. Daut for close to two years. She has been wonderful in helping me with my pain management program. I especially like her RN Amber. Amber is very responsive and helpful.

Yes, this office has longer wait times, a front staff that does not make small talk, but the lady who checks you out and calendars your next appointment is delightful.

Be absolutely sure to follow all the rules. And tell the nurse and the doctor everything you need them to know. It is so important to have anything out of the ordinary DOCUMENTED in your file. Without it, you could be dropped.

Dr. Daut is straight forward, no nonsense but cares. She has helped me greatly.

column3:
WRMC Pain Management Clinic offers comprehensive interventional pain management services in Batesville, Arkansas. Our specialty-trained providers deliver effective outpatient treatments designed to relieve chronic pain, restore function, and reduce dependence on prescription pain medications. Located on the White River Medical Center campus, our clinic takes an integrated approach to pain management, coordinating care with your other ongoing treatments. Our interventional pain specialists employ advanced techniques to address various chronic pain conditions. We understand that chronic pain often accompanies underlying medical conditions, which is why our program specifically integrates with your complete healthcare plan. Patients receive personalized treatment plans following referral from their primary care or specialty physician.

Treatment Approach

At WRMC Pain Management Clinic, we focus on minimally invasive procedures and comprehensive pain solutions. Our goal extends beyond pain relief to improving overall function and quality of life. We emphasize reducing reliance on pain medications while providing effective alternatives for long-term pain management.

Patient Information

New patients must be referred by their primary care or specialty physician. This referral process ensures coordinated care and appropriate treatment planning. Our clinic maintains close communication with referring physicians to provide integrated care for optimal outcomes.

Location and Contact Details

Visit us at 1700 Harrison St T, Batesville, AR 72501, conveniently located on the White River Medical Center campus. For appointments or questions, call 870-262-6155. Additional information about our services is available on our website at https://whiteriverhealth.org/facilities/pain-management-batesville.

Told the DR what I was taking and it didn't work and his advice was keep taking it even though it didn't work. Didn't listen to a word I said. Had a one track mind like he knew everything and could do no wrong. So I'm gonna take his advice and do what he says and when I get liver disease from his dumb ass advice I'm suing the the shit out of them|After talking with a couple of friends the pain clinic seems to be in dire need of a Doctor ( neurologist) who specializes in treating pain and at least do follow up to their patients after having injections ,this is so unprofessional I'm from the Carolina,s and I believe you have to have a license to perform this and not having one visible on the wall is a no no|This clinic is only open Monday through Thursday. When someone returns your call and something is finally called in for pain relief, it is right about the time they're closing for 3 days, so you literally have no choice if the medication does not work, or you have an allergic reaction, but go to the ER, or suffer through the entire weekend and start all over again on Monday ONLY to then repeat the cycle.I have an allergy to certain medication and I was literally prescribed this type of medication recently even though my medical records state the allergy and I've been very vocal of this allergy.  I am NOT a new patient. I've been a patient for approximately a year and a half. Dr. Rossetti listened to me and I felt genuinely cared, but unfortunately she moved on to another area.Furthermore, I had to find out through Google, after certain problems started occurring for the first time ever, that I should have also been under the close care of a dentist given the medication I was on for so long. Yet, EVEN THOUGH I have expressed my concerns and showed them proof of what the medication done....they're telling me basically if it relieved my pain I should consider getting back on the medication or I can find a new doctor if I wish.... I have gotten the "you're welcome to find a new doctor/clinic several times. As a patient who has always complied and done as they directed, how about they start giving the patients they have quality care? Simply calling in meds on Thursday especially ones that a patient has allergic reactions too IS NOT OKAY. Do your research before becoming a patient here. If you must work yet you live with chronic pain this clinic may not be your best option. I am just tired of having to start all over being a military spouse for more than 16 years, it would be nice to have a healthcare team who really cared about quality care verses quantity.|This place is absolutely horrible. My husband has been going for years and they have done nothing to control his pain. One time he went to his apt and when he got there the Dr had cancelled because of an emergency and the office told him they would reschedule his apt. It took them 8 days to get him back in and he was out of pain meds the whole time. And when he went back for his apt the NP asked him why he missed his last apt and he told her he didn't he went and the dr had an emergency and he had been out of medication the whole time. She had the nerve to ask him why one of the other drs didn't call him in something to get him thru and he told her he didn't have any idea that was her job not his. I've been a nurse for over 20 years and worked around the state and this is the worst pain management facility I have ever seen. They don't care about patients only the money. And heaven forbid if you have to work for a living waiting for a disability claim because then you obviously don't deserve any pain meds. . What a joke for a medical facility. Such a disservice to the state|This place is horrible! Being told my herniated disc and pain is because I'm fat and I need to exercise. I weigh less than I have in 9 years. My lowest weight since becoming an adult and I'm still deserving of this pain. This place doesn't help. I never have been so mistreated in my life and judged so hard. Carol mccourt is the worst and needs to get a reality check just because you're small doesn't mean everyone can be.|If you want to be disrespected and treated like you don't know your own body then this is the place for you.I got told by the nurse that she doesn't perscribe opiods before anyone even looked at my reccords. I have 10+ years of other Dr.s saying differently. I regret moving into this area and ever going here. It took them a week to call and make an appointment and then 2 more weeks before I even saw them.Srishti Srivastava doesn't care about her patients or their suffering.|I loved all the staff here. They took very good care of me and i would use them always! You guys are the best!! Thank all of you.

column3:
Arkansas Spine and Pain offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Krishnappa Prasad. Located in Little Rock, our clinic provides specialized treatment for chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. Dr. Prasad and our medical team develop personalized treatment plans addressing the root causes of pain while improving patients' quality of life.

Dr. Krishnappa Prasad is a board-certified Pain Management Physician with extensive training in interventional pain techniques. His approach combines advanced medical knowledge with compassionate care. Dr. Prasad specializes in treating complex pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures and comprehensive pain management strategies. His commitment to patient education ensures each person understands their condition and treatment options.

Our Pain Management Services

At Arkansas Spine and Pain, we offer specialized treatments for:

  • Spinal pain conditions including herniated discs and sciatica

  • Joint pain management for arthritis and inflammatory conditions

  • Nerve pain treatment including peripheral neuropathy

  • Interventional procedures such as epidural injections and nerve blocks

  • Comprehensive medication management for pain control

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

Our clinic prioritizes individualized care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. We focus on improving functionality and reducing pain through targeted interventions. Many patients experience significant pain reduction after completing our recommended treatment protocols.

Location and Contact Information

Arkansas Spine and Pain is conveniently located at 5700 W Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72205. For appointments or questions about our services, call us at (501) 227-0184. More information about our providers and services is available on our website at arkansasspineandpain.com.

column40:
When I first started seeing Dr. Prasad last year, everyone was so nice and compassionate, and Chris & Ashley are still the amazing people that they were when I first started there but unfortunately they have had to endure a turnover there and have hired some new people. 1, being the new "office manager" Eli, that has obviously let his "title" go to his head because he is very rude and demeaning, and he talks down to you, as if he is better than you and has no compassion what so ever and honestly has no business being in the medical field.

I called 2 weeks before having surgery on my arm to have a letter sent to my surgeon so that he could prescribe something stronger because they were doing an osteotomy to shorten my ulnar bone and placing a metal plate in to hold the bone together, which is very painful. I called several times and spoke to Eli, when I could get someone to answer. He promised every time that he would take care of it. I called the day before my surgery and still yet, nothing had been sent over but was promised yet again that he would take care of it.
Thursday morning rolls around & I'm getting ready to go back for surgery & something told me to call and see if Eli had sent the letter over, so l called my surgeons office and they still had not received it. So I called and spoke to Eli once again and he said he apologized but he had been thrown into chaos and was doing his best, I told him that I understood but I had to have that in order for the surgeon to give me anything.
Luckily my surgeon gave me enough for the weekend but I called back first thing Monday morning and spoke to Eli again and now he's going to tell me that the surgeons office needs to call him!?!? Ok & why couldn't he tell me this 2 weeks ago!? I'm not sure what he told Dr. Prasad that I was calling for but I can only assume that he told him I was calling to get drugs and that's far from the truth. I know what I'm given and I've had no issues thus far with my med count ever but I know that he didn't bother to tell the doctor the truth. So I had to go in to be seen today to find out that I now just have to deal with the pain and when I said, how in the heck does he expect me to
rest, Eli says really loud, "you don't have to cuss at me!" Ok, so I might slip with a bad word ever so often when I smash a finger or toe but heck is not usually the word that comes out of my mouth. And not only that, but when I was in the office, Ashley asked me what they had to do to my bone, I was explaining it to her and he "Eli" had the audacity to tell me he knew what I was talking about, the doctor reset his broken bone without giving him anything, like his was way worse pain than having your ulnar bone cut into and a metal plate being put in!? Well, I'm sure it would hurt to reset a broken bone but l've never heard of anyone having to have that done without any meds. There must have been a reason, if that happened at all. Dr. Prasad has been a really good doctor and I've never given him a reason to be upset with me or see me as being a pest by calling several times but I will not be going back simply because if the doctor believes Eli's lies now, it will probably only get worse. It really looks like Dr. Prasad could have figured out that I've been going there for a long time now and I've never had an issue with anyone there and it just started now with this so called office manager. I hope that Dr. Prasad will soon see that Eli is out to make him look bad with his terrible excuses for not doing his own job. He will only be able to blame Dr. Prasad and the office issues for so long and eventually it will come back on him. I hate that I have really liked everyone there until now and because of that 1 bad apple, he's ruined the way that I see that office now altogether. It's really very sad.
My son-in-law is an orthopedic surgeon that I've recommended them to him & his colleagues for their patients but I will not recommend them any longer nor will I refer anyone else to them simply bc of their new office manager.
Kathy Gordon
Posting publicly across Google|Dr. Prasad has managed my back pain by knowing exactly what to do for my pain. He's always professional, kind, and knowledgeable. His medical office building is clean and the office staff are professional too.  I'm in good hands.|Oh my goodness!! I'm so thankful for a member at my church for recommending Dr. P  and his amazing team to me. I went to him in major pain but as of today I can truly tell a difference after my 1st procedure. He's a great listener and go above and beyond to help you. I appreciate you Dr.P!|Dr. Prasad and his staff are very profesional.  This isn't the typical office visit where you sit in the waiting room for 30 minutes and then in the examination room for another 30 just to see the doctor for two minutes. Dr. P listened to what I said, asked me questions, examined my back and showed me on a chart his diagnosis. If you want real help, Dr. P and his staff are the way to go. You will not be disappointed.|Always considerate and helpful to patients.  They have helped me with my back and neck so that I can do everyday things I couldn't do before.  I would recommend them to everyone. I have been with them for over 20 years. I am very happy with the help they offer me.|My husband and I are very pleased with Dr. Krishnappa Prasad. He listens to us as well as give us and showing the information that he's tei is and we truly do appreciate that. Most Doctors tell you things but don't go in to details about anything. I hope to have him for Many more years to come|Dr. P is great. He listens to his patients and does whatever he can to help with their pain issues. I love the way he explains every treatment and procedure so the patient is comfortable and understands what's going on.|My DOCTOR P is an Outstanding #1 I Recomand Every One 100%

The Mocek Spine Clinic provides compassionate, patient-centered care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions in Little Rock, Arkansas. Our dedicated team focuses on personalized treatment plans to help patients return to their daily activities with reduced discomfort and improved quality of life.

At The Mocek Spine Clinic, we offer specialized treatments for a wide range of pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Cancer-related pain

- Hip and knee pain

- Neuropathic pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Complex regional pain syndrome

Our clinic specializes in managing advanced implantable devices such as intrathecal pain pumps and spinal cord stimulators, providing long-term relief for patients with persistent pain conditions.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our pain management approach includes both interventional and non-interventional therapies:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Intrathecal drug delivery

- Peripheral nerve blocks

- Medication management

- Physical therapy coordination

Patient-Centered Approach

Each treatment plan is tailored to address individual needs. We take time to understand your pain history, previous treatments, and personal goals. Our team works closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care throughout your treatment journey.

Visit our clinic at 9101 Kanis Rd, Little Rock, AR 72205, or call us at +1 501-224-4001 to schedule a consultation. For more information about our services and treatment options, please visit our website at http://www.mocekspine.com/

column40:
I have recieved exceptional care from Dr. Mocek, Dana, and staff! I have a pain pump, and it has changed my life for the better. I'm even considering going back to school.  I'm very grateful for the treatment I have received.|Today I had another target shot for a pinched nerve at L2. Previously had one at L4. Dr. Mocek is an amazing doctor and an even better man. He truly cares about his patients. Can't recommend him and his staff enough. They are the best!|I had a mostly good experience from them but due to rules I keep having to jump through hoops to be able to keep my meds and it wasn't entirely there fault I ended up leaving both the doctor as it.was physically painful to keep having to go to one thing with them and another with the other doctor  but by far they are a great team I just could not keep up with all the jumping it was wearing me down but they always tried to work with me that and I don't fill they took the falls as serious as they were 3 months after I left I fell and hit my head and got a TBI  I don't blame  them I just wish someone had taken it more seriously there the best in little rock and he tries to work with you  he is an amazing  doctor  and the staff is nice|I absolutely love Dr Mocek and his staff!! He is so nice, caring, and funny. He always puts me at ease and puts a smile on my face. I never feel rushed and he always answers any questions I have. I've had my share of horrible doctors and experiences but Mocek made me feel comfortable the minute I met him. Dana Houston takes care of my pain pump and I love her!!! I have never felt ignored or treated like a number instead of a patient. I will stay with Mocek for as long as he practices!|Dr. Mocek has changed  my husband's life. He is able to do all the things he used to do. He is back mowing our yard. Dr. Mocek is so caring of his patients. We highly recommend him.|I have been nothing but pleased with Dr. Mocek and staff. I recommend Dr. Mocek to everyone that lives with chronic pain. I've been under his care for a few months now and I cannot say enough good things about his quality of service. I experienced a complication during a procedure and Dr. Mocek treated me like I was his actual family. He had a chair brought into the recovery area where I was being monitored and he himself sat in it and watched over me until things stabilized. Dr. Mocek personally maintained contact with my wife through the following day and then his staff was following up daily for the rest of the week.
As long as I have a choice Dr. Mocek will be my number 1 pick. He asks me questions and get this, he actually cares enough about the answers to listen to my response.
Don't pay attention to negative comments, generally they are made by angry unhappy people that were denied something and are therefore lashing out.|My first experience with Dr Mocek was with my father Don Eichler and his back he was in such bad shape. He went out of his way to try to help him have a better quality of life. He also set him up with an additional doctor to go further into finding out what other things could be going on with his condition. What they found out through testing they were able to pinpoint other area's in his heath that were contributing to his condition and his overall health. Between what Dr Mocek found and the other doctor which I feel he teamed with he was able to treat him to make my father's last 3 years of life better and he was able to do more things in his final years.
Why I have told this is my father challenging me as to why I was not going to Dr Mocek. The old saying do as I say not as I do, also even though I'm in my mid fifties I still did what my dad told me. So here's my experience due to other problems I have from stomach issues and allergies to steroid injections I wasn't your regular patient. Where other doctors had just told me sorry there's nothing they could do he didn't give up on me. He is one of a handful of doctor's I believe that truly cares for his patients. He has helped me to have a better quality of life than I thought possible. I often felt I would end up like my father. It has been a process which has taken a good year but I am in such better shape and don't feel like I'm looking at having to have surgery now. He also has done such a great job to make me understand what is going on with my back which for me is great, knowledge is power. I believe he will continue to find new ways to help his patients in the future as well.
Now about his staff I feel they are wonderful from the people at the front desk to the nurses and physician assistants and his staff in the procedure department. You can tell that they care about what  Dr Mocek   is trying to do with his practice to help his patients live better lives. I FEEL HE WANTS HIS PATIENTS TO LIVE THERE LIFE'S AND NOT JUST WATCH IT GO BY.|I have been a patient of Dr. Mocek for about 18 months. I was originally experiencing sciatic nerve pain due to arthritis, scoliosis and disc damage from a fall. I got x-rays and an MRI before any treatment and then I met with Dr. Mocek. He explained and showed me the problem and the procedures which would help my condition and went into detail about how it would work. I agreed to the treatment and began a series of three injections over a four month period and the relief has been great as I have no sciatic nerve pain at all. While dealing with my sciatic problem on my left side for several years, I had abused my right hip and right lower back. I again went to Mocek Spine Clinic and x-rays showed that a nerve in my lower back and hip was being irritated in that joint. I am now getting treatment for that and the relief is fantastic. I would recommend Dr. Mocek and his very professional staff to anyone who is experiencing pain in the spinal area. He has helped me immeasurably. I cannot guarantee everyone will get my level of relief but the procedures worked for me.

column40: There bedside manner is ridiculous.  They came across and very nice and accommodating but they're not.  They don't listen to you when you want to talk.  The np wanted nothing to do with hearing what my husband had to say.  This clinic is all about the money.  They do not care about your pain.  They will even sabotage any chance you have of getting procedure if they don't like you.   They do not care.  You are a dollar sign to them. That's it.|I went to this clinic for severe chronic back pain had all the paperwork sent to them with imaging they decided they wanted to put a steroid shot in my back they put me on Tylenol 4S would not prescribe anything stronger I have failed three times and was in a car accident would not help me with the acute as they would say pain I had to go through my primary physician for something stronger than pain I went there on the 28th for an appointment talk to them about why they wouldn't up the dose why they would not help me with the acute pain and that you know why couldn't they have done something when I called them when I was an emergency room from a car wreck to help me with pain. On September the 2nd they called me and said that they was going to have to fire me as a patient because I was in a car wreck that makes no sense this clinic only wants to do shots in your back so they can charge your insurance more. The Tylenol 4 is like taking a baby aspirin would not recommend this place to anybody|Dr. Slagle appeared to be a good doctor and I had no bad experiences while I was with this clinic.  Then I was involved in a car accident in which another party was liable.  I called to get an appointment to check everything out and was told by Michael (office manager) that I would have to find another clinic, because they do not see patients with pending liability insurance settlements.  I was disappointed but understood their position.  However, this was a huge inconvenience when i had soreness from the accident and was in need of services - and it can take months to get an appointment at another clinic.  Two clinics and 1.5 years later, I called and tried to get back in with Dr. Slagle.  The receptionist would not allow me to talk to the nurse.  She put me on hold and then came back and told me that I can never come back to their clinic - that their policy was to never take a patient who has left there and gone to another clinic.  When I said they left me no choice, and I would like to talk with the nurse - she hung up on me.  I sent a message to them on facebook saying what a good doctor Slagle is, and how disappointed I am in their policies - that I would prefer their clinic over any other.  I did mention the unnecessary rudeness of the receptionist.  About a half hour later I got a call from the nurse saying the doctor did not like my post at all and I should take it down immediately.  She said it was not true - I said which part, that Dr. Slagle is a good doctor?.  When I explained what happened, she said that I was asked to leave due to collections on my account!   This last, even though I have good insurance and paid every procedure in full at the time of service.  After all of this negativity you could not pay me to go back to this clinic.  Since this experience, I have spoken with the Arkansas Association of Neurologists and gotten much needed advice on the pain management specialty.  These are very risky procedures that are being done, and it's important to check out a physician carefully - thank God no permanent damage occurred to my neck before I found this out.  There are only a handful of doctors in Arkansas certified by the American Board of Pain Management, meaning that they have served a year fellowship and formal certification after obtaining their license in neurology.  While a neurologist can legally do the procedures, they are not all properly trained to do them.  None of the doctors in the Hot Springs area are certified in the pain management specialty, including Dr. Slagle.|Dr Slagle changed my life for the better. I could barely get around when he started treating me and now I can physically do pretty much what I want to do. I highly recommend him and his kind and caring staff.|This place is a great place if you need pain management everyone is great friendly and wonderful to do business with|Horrible human being , could care less about people.  Filthy mouth, filthy office.  Untrained rude staff|Great Staff Beautiful Office|

Arkansas Pain, Wound & Wellness Clinic provides comprehensive pain management and wound care services in Russellville, Arkansas. Our specialized medical facility combines advanced treatment options with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions and complex wounds. Located at 2621 W Main St Ste 2A, our clinic serves patients throughout Pope County and surrounding communities.

Our pain specialists utilize evidence-based approaches to treat various pain conditions. We offer interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies tailored to each patient's needs. Our team specializes in treating back pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain through comprehensive assessment and multimodal treatment plans.

Advanced Wound Care Treatment

The wound care center at Arkansas Pain, Wound & Wellness Clinic provides specialized treatment for non-healing and complex wounds. Our protocols include advanced dressing techniques, debridement procedures, and infection management. We treat diabetic ulcers, pressure injuries, surgical wounds, and vascular ulcers with personalized care plans designed for optimal healing outcomes.

Comprehensive Wellness Approach

Beyond pain and wound management, our clinic embraces a holistic wellness philosophy. We incorporate nutritional guidance, physical rehabilitation recommendations, and lifestyle modifications into treatment plans. This integrated approach addresses underlying health factors that contribute to chronic conditions.

Experienced Medical Team

Our physicians bring extensive training in pain medicine and wound care. With board certifications and specialized education, our doctors stay current with latest medical advancements. The clinical staff receives ongoing training in patient care excellence and advanced treatment protocols.

Arkansas Pain, Wound & Wellness Clinic welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain or requiring specialized wound treatment. Contact us at +1 479-567-5467 to schedule a consultation at our Russellville location.

column40:
I never leave bad reviews. I'm waiting to have a pain stimulator trial implant, and I hoped this clinic was a good referral...
I'm sorry, but this place is really unprofessional. If they would actually make sure they took care of the patient, as much as collecting the bill, they might actually be a good clinic. I thought the office staff was very nice. Unfortunately, I feel like the actual appointment was rushed, and left me uniformed about the causes of my pain. I was willing to chalk that up to a busy doctor. Not anymore! It's been well over a week since my visit. I still haven't been able to get my medication filled, because they won't take the right steps to do so. I've went out of my way, as well as my insurance company, to make it as easy as possible for them to take care of the issue. On the few rare moment's I spoke to the nurse/(s), they assured me they would take care of it, but they didn't. I had to inform them of what was going on, and that shouldn't be the patient's job. So, over a week after the appointment, I'm left in the same situation I was in beforehand. It's just really annoying they don't have the professional courtesy to at least inform their patients of what's going on, and prove they're actually making, (solving the problem), a priority. Expect to get an answering machine, and don't expect a call back anytime soon. Hopefully this is a fluke thing, and it's resolved soon. Otherwise, I'll be finding another doctor.|I have received great treatment from Optimal Pain and Wellness. I have been treated by Dr Thurman for several years. Now that I have moved, I see Dr Naples. I don't like change at all, but it ended up a great experience. She informed me of my new in between treatments, and gave me all the information I could possibly need and what to expect. Office staff has always been friendly.|My first visit went very well.met with Karen reynolds aprn.she was very nice and was in no rush to understand my pain issues.
Very happy with optimal and have confidence in Karen and her treatment program for me.|My wife had an appointment today with Dr. Hanley.  My wife suffers from Peripheral Neuropathy and we hoped Dr. Hanley could help with treatment  as we were referred to Dr. Hanley by her Rheumatologist.  We thought since there is pain associated with the neuropathy Dr. Hanley could help with treatment.  It was probably the worst Doctor visit I have attended.  Dr. Hanley was absolutely useless and seemed not to care at all.  I would not recommend Dr. Hanley to anyone.|Dr.  Hanley and her staff are Very caring and knowledgeable!!  EVERY pain management physician has differently... Just as every chronic pain patient has different needs! I would recommend calling and speaking with the staff regarding your Needs prior to seeing Any PM  physician!|I had terrible sciatic nerve pain running all the way down to my foot and I could hardly even walk around in the grocery store or stand without putting my leg up on something.  Dr. Hanley made it go away with a deep steroid shot and I wish I had gone to her months earlier.|Unprofessional, receptionist not thorough on what need brought. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating various chronic pain conditions including:

- Neck and back pain

The clinic features a state-of-the-art surgical center equipped with X-ray, ultrasound, and fluoroscopic guided interventional techniques. These advanced imaging capabilities allow our specialists to deliver precise treatments with minimal discomfort.

Specialized Programs

I been going to this office for going on five years I changed pharmacies and when I went in, I told the person checking me in. I told the person checking me out. You shouldn't have to go through this much trouble changing the pharmacy, but no one never returned my calls and let me know what was going on if it wasn't for me following through with these two pharmacies that I wouldn't have had my prescriptions for the weekend. It seems like they don't care and that's the job that they're in to care about the people but the staff the people who do the aftercare gave me no response and I'm truly disappointed in the care that they provided me|Greetings,
My name is Michael Mesplay.  I have been in a pain management program since about 2012 in Colorado until 2021, then moved here to Arkansas. My medication history will show I have never abused my medication by any means. It will show I never took more than prescribed, and always took them as prescribed. In 2022 I have some symptoms from high blood pressure that I mistook for being caused by my pain meds. (Oxycodone). I then agreed to stop taking them to see if that was the problem. (I found out later it was high blood pressure causing the symptoms)
Dr. Chapman offered me alternative pain meds to opiates. One of them was an addiction treatment medication, which was not explained to me. Once prescribed this medication, apparently it is impossible to be prescribed opiate medication ever again.
I feel this was an unfair decision.|Dr. Price has been extremely helpful, knowledgeable, compassionate, and clear in explanations. My husband (the patient) is optimistic and believes this is the right path.|Office visits have been good. Dr. Knight actually listened to my concerns, and we discussed several options for pain management. My first procedure was quite painful, though due to no fault of Dr. Knight. Afterwards, I spoke with Dr. Knight, and we discussed plans to help alleviate or at least reduce the pain caused by the procedures themselves in the future. Overall, I was very pleased with how they responded to my concerns and their actions to make future visits go more smoothly. Everyone there has been courteous, caring, and professional.|This place is a joke. Doctor was really rude too. Everything that was suggested my doctor could do. No point in me coming back. This place is just like all the other doctors in Mountain Home.

I've tried calling mutiple times and left messages to get dismissed as a patient and I'm not getting any response at all.|Do not come here if you're absolutely expecting that you will receive any type of hydrocodone or anything like that. In addition as a cost saving effort I presume they lobster theirselves in the actual hospital and you will get s bill over $100 bucks for me called hospital outpatient services that I was not alerted to and am currently appealing to my chagrin. They will tell you it's about regulation and laws but it says right on their paperwork they give you that it's a clinical decision that they've made on their own. I understand the doctors concern but disagree with his decision in my case and had to move on. Outside of that I can say that the doctor I saw there was again a concerned person even though his opinions of opioids is very negative and I can see why with many people dying from fentanyl and stuff. He was very informative and very kind and the entire staff was very kind and informative to me as well.|Received an authorization for injections from insurance over a week ago. Been trying to call the office to schedule for a week now and have only been able to leave one voicemail. Calling all the time and only getting a busy signal. I need pain relief treatments as soon as possible and can't even get them to answer or call back!  I hope I'm not forced to drive there for a  conversation!|They are very caring compassionate and very friendly I really like Dr. Mc Nelly he is my hero

column49:
No, there is no Federal law  requiring limits on prescribing. In 2016, the CDC, with the help of conservative, anti-opioid  "experts" (PROP, other entities and, Dr
Kolodny, a psychiatrist who never treated a chronic pain patient) came up with the dangerous, one-size-fits-all GUIDELINES (NOT laws) for those prescribing opioids, thereby creating the genocide of chronic and intractable pain patients for whom opioids are their greatest or only source of pain relief. Not only do they relieve suffering, they allow patients functionality and quality of life. Pain relief must be a human right.

column40:
Dr. Nichol is the most caring physician I know. In an age of "fast care doctoring", it is refreshing to experience the focused care that he provides. Right away you'll discover that he truly cares about making you feel better without rushing you out the door. Dr. Nichol will take the necessary time with you to find the optimal treatment path for you. If anyone is seeking management of their chronic pain, fibromyalgia, depression, anxiety, PTSD, ADHD, memory issues, and neurodegenerative diseases, I recommend Dr. Nichol.|Dr. Nichol is an amazing Doctor. I would say the best, and I am not alone in this opinion. I am blown away by his knowledge, compassion, authentic rapport, and results. It has been 7 months  since I was last treated by him and the pain has not returned after many years of suffering. Dr. Nichol changed my life, in that his treatments gave me a peace I had forgotton and seemed unattainable. I am very happy that I was wrong and Dr. Nichol encouraged me to keep going until my painful condition had subsided. This changed my life. I encourage anyone suffering to look into Dr. Nichol and his treatments and begin the healing. Amazing Doctor and recommended highly. Thank you for everything.|Love Dr. Nichol & his assistant Spencer!  They are Compassionate & he cares about my quality of life!   He will take the time to talk you through your treatment plan like no other pain doctor has ever done.  I have been a pain patient off & on for 25 years, I had my 1st of 4 back surgeries when I was 18 yrs old.  In that time I have been to many doctors that have herded me through like I was cattle.  Dr. Nichol is not like that at all.  He takes as long as you need to explain & make sure you understand your treatment plan. Also, if you're not happy with your treatment plan he will work with you to get you on the treatment plan that works.  I am never scared to ask him questions or talk about what my issues are, unlike past doctors I have seen.  He does not judge you like in most pain clinics.  In most clinics, that I have been to, it always felt like I was being treated like I was a criminal.  I have never been treated with more care & empathy by any doctor as I am with Spencer & Dr. Nichol.

Thank y'all so much for helping me get my life back!  I can never express my gratitude enough!!!|Dr. Nichols is an absolute credit to his profession. He listens with great humanity and empathy. This approach allows for chronic pain suffers to have an individualized treatment plan that in my humble opinion allows a better chance at an overall improvement  in quality of life.|I have unfortunately been in contact with many doctors and can honestly say that Dr. Nichol is an exceptional doctor. He is very intelligent and knowledgeable without being arrogant or condescending, which many others are. He is honest without being rude and takes time to listen to any questions or concerns I might have. I am truly blessed to have him as my doctor and would recommend him to anyone who needs a pain specialist!|Dr. Nichol is awesome. He really listened to my specific issues and setup a treatment special to my needs. He was very caring and spent well over an hour of his time consulting with me. I highly recommend him and will be going back myself!|I left this office feeling content because I knew Dr. Nichol listened to me with care and concern. He is a medical professional who genuinely wants to help, and that's all any patient could really ask for|Dr. Nichol is the first doctor I've ever been to, who is knowledgeable when it comes to any and everything! He honestly cares about his patients, and does everything in his power to treat our issues. I couldn't be more blessed to have found him!

They do all they can to keep me on the min about of meds but still keep my pain also at a min. Love them!|If I could give this place a 0 I would. These people don't care about your well being. The big lady at the front the tall lady is very Rude..She is convinced that everyone that comes to that office is a drug addict. So they don't let you explain to them what's going on. they send your prescriptions to the wrong pharmacy. Then they don't return your phone calls until they get ready like a week or so. By then you have ran out of medicine because they won't return your call so you that you can explain to them what's going on. I have not seen the doctor  but 1 time since I have been a patient. Don't waste your time....they send your prescriptions to the wrong pharmacies and then you have to call to get it sent to the right one. They return your calls when they get ready for weeks...|I have had very good care from Dr Saleem and his APRN Lauren. The staff has been friendly and efficient. Lauren listens to me and answers my guestions and adapts my treatments as needed.
Trudy Wortham|Today my partner went there today for his appointment at 7:20, apparently the doctor overslept today. So he waited 2 hours for Dr. Ghaleb Ahmed.

When he finally got to talk to the Dr. about
His medical issues. The Dr. did not care at all and gave my partner  the same medication, that doesn't not work for his pain. Basically the Dr was also fat shaming him for his pain. Very unprofessional and uncaring for people. Seems like they just care about money more then anything.

I recommend do not go here. Nobody cares at that pain management. Please start caring and show some compassion to everybody. Stop the fat shaming on human beings...|I have been a patient of Dr. Saleem for about a year now. I was in a lot of pain before I saw Dr. Saleem for the first time. He gave me some shots for my lower back pain. It took a few days for those shots to work but after that I was able to sleep through the night without waking up because of pain. I am also seeing him for my neck pain. I have always had a great experience at both of his locations. His staff is highly professional and extremely courteous. They are always willing to work with you to accommodate any request you may have. I highly recommend him.|I'm reviewing the office in North Little Rock where I was under the care of Dr Donald Crabtree.   I have never been to pain management where I was so poorly mistreated. I would give them a zero if it were possible. Beginning with the front desk receptionist. On one occasion she actually began discussing my financial situation in front of an office with several patients. I believe that was violating HIPAA laws. On every occasion in there she was extremely rude. I told the doctor about her and he supported her. I was rather shocked. One day she actually sent me home crying. When I called five weeks later to reschedule for the Little Rock office I was told I'd been fired. No phone call no letter nothing. My primary care doctor had not received anything either. She faxed them as to why I'd been let go and all it said was I'd been let go. I called the office manager who said there was nothing in my file and he would have to talk to Dr Crabtree and get back to me. I never heard back from him either. I was told you are supposed to receive a certified letter when you've been let go. Nothing. It was a horrible experience.|Horrible experience with Dr Ghaleb and his colleagues!  I tried every pain relief method he offered  (including nerve injections) . When I went in for my 1st visit my pcp already had me on hydrocodone 10mg 3 times a day When it no longer helped my pain , I was referred here. He "adjusted my meds to 5mg hydrocodone without talking to me. I NEVER failed a drug screen in the year I saw him. Finally I was referred to a diagnostic center where I was diagnosed with polyneuropathy which is a nerve disease where nerves in my ankles, feet and legs are dying. I have drop foot because it and excruciating pain along with sensitized sensory overload  (caused by nerve damage) that makes the slightest sounds, touch and lights cause my ears to be extremely sensitive to sound and I get migraines because of light sensitivity. The day I told him the specialist told me to STOP taking injections , he wrote me a script for half of what he adjusted in the 1st place and blatantly LIED to me. He said there was no med in my system but the lab detected METHAMPHETAMINE!  I've never touched that crap in my life! When he gave me the lab results, I of course argued and called him out! He got mad and told me to leave his office and snatched my prescription from my hand and had me escorted out. This office does NOT care about people in real pain with legitimate health issues!  He churns people out the door if you can't take injections which is a $900 visit billed to my insurance rather than the $80 just to give me my dam meds. The very day he tested me, I also was drug screened for a job and my labs were just as I expected.  Only meds I was prescribed appeared on the results NOT meth. He has horrible bedside Manor and is an ass! He should not be treating patients AT ALL
