column40:
My daughter had an appointment with Dr Ennis last week for one last procedure in Arkansas before she has surgery in New York City. Dr Ennis and his team were all so kind and professional! Their office arranged nothing short of a miracle, getting us in quickly to work with my daughter's scheduled surgery date.

Dr Ennis spent time educating us about my daughter's condition and we left the consult feeling informed and supported. He made sure we understood the procedure, the potential for how it could help my daughter, and what he could do in the future (after her surgery) if she needs it.

The day of the procedure we arrived a few minutes early and they got us back immediately. It went by SO quickly and she did great!

After some less than stellar experiences this year, a compassionate, knowledgable doctor and a team so willing to go above and beyond absolutely meant the world to us. They infused such an enormous amount of care into every part of their process- from scheduling, to billing, to the procedure itself. We truly can't sing their praises enough- what a GREAT experience!!

Highly recommend! All the stars!|Impressive!  From the reception staff, to the nursing staff, physician's scribe and Dr. Jason Holt--  They asked and answered pertinent questions, and were the epitome of professional.  Dr. Holt gave me clear concise options to address my dilemma and gave me a plan of action to ascertain a working diagnosis.  I could not be more pleased and am delighted with the quality of care I received today. Thanks to All.|I found Dr. Holt to be very competent. He did an excellent job of explaining exactly what procedure he was going to do, what I could expect from it and how long the results would last. He provided a much more detailed outline of my MRI results than my neurologist and answered all of my questions. I really appreciated the time he spent with me and his knowledge. I have a family member who is a doctor and they had provided me with a list of questions to ensure this was the right treatment for me. Everything was worked out very well.|Super doctors, nurses and staff. They are the most professional staff and nurses who actually help you get the treatment to solve your pain issues. Arkansas Spine and Pain in Jacksonville provides comprehensive pain management services for patients throughout central Arkansas. Our specialized clinic at 140 John Harden Dr offers advanced treatment options for chronic and acute pain conditions. The medical team combines evidence-based approaches with personalized care plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At Arkansas Spine and Pain, we address a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Spinal disorders - herniated discs, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease

  • Joint pain - arthritis, bursitis, sports injuries

  • Nerve pain - sciatica, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome

  • Cancer-related pain - comprehensive management for oncology patients

  • Post-surgical pain - rehabilitation and recovery support

Treatment Approaches

Our Jacksonville clinic offers multiple treatment modalities tailored to each patient's needs:

  • Interventional procedures - epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management - carefully monitored pain relief protocols

  • Physical therapy - coordination with rehabilitation specialists

  • Minimally invasive techniques - reducing recovery time and complications

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

The physicians at Arkansas Spine and Pain bring extensive training in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and physical medicine. Our doctors completed fellowships at prestigious institutions and maintain board certifications in their specialties. The team stays current with the latest advances in pain management through continuing education and research.

New patients can expect thorough evaluations to identify pain sources and develop targeted treatment plans. The clinic emphasizes functional improvement alongside pain reduction, helping patients return to daily activities and work.

Location and Contact Information

Arkansas Spine and Pain is conveniently located at 140 John Harden Dr, Jacksonville, AR 72076. The clinic serves patients from Jacksonville, Little Rock, and surrounding communities. For appointments or questions, call +1 501-227-0184 or visit our website for more information.

I have been in chronic pain since 2019. I had an accident pandemic and everything else going on with the last administration left me with no insurance. I have an appointment the 25th. I have been on the telephone with these people for about three weeks they are very helpful. I'm looking forward to meeting with the doctor and being able to proceed with aI have been in chronic pain since 2019. I had an accident pandemic and everything else going on with the last administration left me with no insurance. I have a appointment the 25th. I have been on the telephone with these people for about three weeks they are very helpful. I'm looking forward to meeting with the doctor and being able to proceed with a quality of life as of this far. I have no complaints three stars for the receptionist and I'll make another God bless|Confrontation with the Dr and no help from staff getting information to the Dr. even with a written list of what needs to be addressed. Nice staff but they didn't help when I needed it the most. Only being able to try to talk when I'm on the table in a painful position and being bombarded with questions and commands. Then when I finally get in a less painful position, I couldn't get him to listen. So much confrontation that nothing got addressed. I just can't get help here. There is no communication.|Great staff. Only bn there three months. Only problem have had is getting them my.meds in on time. 3 months in a row I have had to call and remind them after Melissa told me she would have them sent on in anput on hold. But I play tag with the office and pharmacy. And seems like Melissa hasn't bn there every time to ask why they weren't called in like she said they would be. OTHER THAN THAT. GREAT STAFF|Dr. Savu listened. He listened to me. I went to him not knowing what to think, as I was soooo anxious. I was scared, as I had a horrific experience at another pain management facility; the procedure was so painful, I said to myself "I will never go back there". I explained my concerns. He listened to me! Our very first conversation I voiced the need to have a MRI before coming to see him. He said "No you don't. I want you to show me where your pain is. The best way to help is for you to show me, and we can go from there". He was kind to me! I repeat, He was kind to me! This is huge, as I have had doctors not be very kind to me in the past (they would not listen and caused an ungodly amount of pain) so this means a lot!  When doing the first procedure he knew I was very nervous. Dr. Savu talked to me through the whole thing. He wants to get to the root of the problem (no pun intended! Haha!) As of right now I have had two procedures, which have not helped much... and that is okay because it is part of it (trial and error) but he wants to find the source! What exactly is causing so much pain. It may take some time, but I trust the process. I trust Dr. Calin Savu! Thank you so much!|It has been over a year and the things I have witnessed still disgust because I was supposed to have been made this review a while. The doctor himself is fine but the staff is horrible and rude. I have never seen such callous behavior towards a disabled person. This man had to ride public transportation two hours every month to see this doctor and for his procedures. On his last visit he arrived two hours early for his appointment. When it was time for his procedure he still wasn't seen and other people kept going in before him. When he tried to ask someone a question they closed the door in his face. Since everyone was so rude, and this wasn't the first they have been rude, he left. They used to try and be sassy with him when they thought he was by himself. I have heard through the phone how they have talked to him, even from the head nurse or coordinator, whatever she was called.This man always came in laughing, smiling, or joking. I wonder to this day if the doctor knows he lost a patient because of the attitude of his staff. And for clarification purposes, I was his aide that traveled with him when I could.|Dr.Savu is a terrible Doctor and a terrible person. Doesn't listen and is always in a hurry.  I had a car bad car wreck at a red light where a SUV totalled my little Ford Focus. The last time I went to him he accused me of not doing the exercises he gave me. I told him every since the car wreck that my right side of my back was hurt more than ever and I was unable to do them. I told him again about the wreck and he said "what wreck." Also his pain shots don't help a bit!!!!|Going to be a new patient.  I haven't seen him yet, but my family has.  Even though I'm not a patient yet, he has messaged to check on me.  Most Dr's aren't personable anymore.  He is very compassionate  and caring.  He has helped my brother and my sister in law tremendously and they love him.  He has made a drastic difference in their overall quality of life.|Dr. Savu is incredible! Not only does he help me with my chronic pain, he also explains everything in detail! He's very knowledgeable in a lot of things. He's always educating me. His nursing staff is excellent!! They're always kind. There literally aren't enough words for me to express what I think of all of them! I've had shoulder, back, hip, and knee injections! 5 stars isn't high enough!! I will never be able to show my gratitude for all they've done for me!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

*I just read some of the comments and I had to stop. I have no idea why anyone would say a negative word against Dr. Savu or his staff! Whoa! I literally tell everyone to go to him. Insane!! They're the best!!*

Pain Treatment Centers of America (PTCOA) stands as Arkansas's largest comprehensive pain management practice. With multiple locations across the state, including our Fayetteville clinic at 262 W Van Asche Dr, PTCOA delivers specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of dedicated physicians brings together the most combined pain management experience in the region, offering personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At PTCOA, we provide a full spectrum of pain management solutions under one roof. Our approach integrates advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment options. Patients benefit from our state-of-the-art surgery centers where minimally invasive procedures are performed with precision. Our in-house CLIA certified laboratories ensure accurate medication monitoring and diagnostics, allowing for more effective pain management protocols.

Specialized Treatment Approaches

Our physicians specialize in treating various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

Treatment options at our Fayetteville location may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and advanced pain relief techniques. Each treatment plan focuses on addressing the root cause of pain while minimizing reliance on medications when possible.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

PTCOA operates with one clear mission: helping restore quality of life. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living. Our physicians take time to listen, thoroughly evaluate each case, and develop effective strategies for pain relief. This patient-centered approach has established PTCOA as a trusted provider throughout Arkansas.

For appointments or consultations at our Fayetteville location, patients can call +1 844-215-0731. Additional information about our services and other locations is available on our website at www.ptcoa.com.
column11: PTCOA is Arkansas's largest fully comprehensive pain management practice with multiple locations to best serve our patients. We have dedicated physicians, state of the art surgery centers, medication monitoring, CLIA certified labs and the most combined pain management experience of any practice in the region. All of this excellence in medical care with one focus - to help restore quality of life.

Assistants were nice but I thought Bobbie lacked a good bedside manner. It could improve. Also in the end the appointment was not needed. I feel time was wasted and when the appointment was confirmed a few leading questions could have avoided the situation.|The Dr. is doing what he can for the end game for my situation but I'm still sitting here in horrible pain. I know he can give me stronger medicine while we're waiting for a pain pump but so far he's refusing to. I know this because my last pain Dr had me on stronger medicine. But at least he's trying for a solution so I'll give him that much. He changed my script but just to give one more a day of what I was already taking which is what I was having to do anyway running me short most of the time. He thinks it's giving me stronger meds but it's not. It's the same as it's always been. At least we're both trying to get something that hopefully works. Sometimes I wish he could feel this pain but in reality I wouldn't want it for anybody. Hopefully it won't take too long to see if this new thing works. At least he's trying.|Don't waste your time with the Rogers or Fayetteville offices. I started coming here about 2 years ago, and it was great. Then all the doctors and good nurses left.
Every single month there are issues with them send my prescription, they don't bother calling you back until you call everyday for several days, they don't bother relaying messages to the Doctor when Dr Amidi tells you to call and let him know if something wasn't done.
This is one of the worst pain management clinics I have ever been to, which is sad because they were great. Do yourself a favor, go anywhere but here. Unless you enjoy being treated like you're "just a junkie looking for a fix".

Dr Amidi is great, and so is the main lady who answers the phone. That's why I gave them 2 stars.|I can only comment on the doctor that I have seen. The staff there is very nice and friendly, and the facilities are pretty clean. The doctor I see is very unprofessional, in that the doctor uses personal experience that has happened to the Dr family member, and treats me as if  they are treating the family member, and not ME. Everyone is not the same! This doctor freaked out on me because of a medication that I have been taking for years, and refused to give me a stronger medication  Again, based on "personal" experience with their family member. This doctor also told me specific health information about said family member, this is a huge HIPAA violation!!!!  I also have to see this doctor via Zoom/ Teams in the office, and I normally talk to a black screen as they can't figure out how to work their camera.  This place is a joke, but unfortunately, due to the "opioid crisis", everyone is treated as a drug addict/abuser, so you are at their mercy. Just praying I can find a "real" doctor to perhaps do some kind of surgery to not only relieve my pain, but to get away from this clinic, and off the pills altogether. If you don't mind an unprofessional place, so you can get your pain meds, go for it.|I recently had issues with getting and keeping health insurance. I suffered a bad fall last year, and am out of the workforce these days. Those at Pain Treatment Centers of America Fayetteville, have been great to work with me during this time, trying to get medication and proper procedures for my injuries and accidents. Thank you all there!|I was an actual patient here and I saw Dr. Shyanne Price. This isn't a meme or attention-seeking stunt.

I have never before been so ill-treated, dehumanized and uncared for as I was with my time at this facility. It was a terrible experience and I strongly recommend you avoid it. If your doctor sets up a referral here, ask for elsewhere. Here's my experience that lasted all of one month.

Before coming here I had found a great solution to my chronic pain from EDS in the form of light exercise and prescribed Tylenol 3. No side effects, no addiction or dependence issues. It really helped. My doctor eventually referred my care to Pain Treatment Centers of America and a situation that was improving immediately regressed.

On my very first day which should be pretty much just gathering information, asking what works and such, they tell me that I was wrong. That my medication, Tylenol 3, wasn't good enough. That I needed something different. I tried telling the doctor that it was working but she assured me she had something better. She prescribed me a new medication called Diclofenac, saying it was a better and more effective medicine. I don't know why we were disrupting something that worked but I trusted her because she was a professional.

I had a terrible reaction to the medicine. Sorry this gets a little graphic, but after just two days of taking it as prescribed my pain wasn't being assisted and instead I developed extreme stomach discomfort, bloody stools and uncontrollable bowel movements. This resulted in missed work, worsening pain and extreme embarrassment .

i immediately contacted my doctor to let them know of the situation. Their new medicine wasn't working  so I'd like to resume the one that I know works. Guess what they did? Instead of being medical professionals, listening to the patient and following what works, they did something unacceptable. She told me to stop taking the diclofenac and then advised she has no further medical recommendations for me.

So, I go there on the right path just seeking treatment, and all they do is make me sick, make my pain intolerable by removing my medication that has worked for a year and then casting me to the side for reasons I'm assuming are to do with the fact they cared little about me and saw me as just a number that they'd worry about later.

Screw this place and I strongly caution anyone that goes here as, although I can't speak for everyone, it's quite literally the only medical facility where I've come out worse than I was before.

If any of you reading would like photo evidence of our conversations or medications to prove i actually went here and am telling the truth, I will provide them if needed.|Well the there are so understanding and polite and helpful  me and cinnamon love everybody there|Small but a very nice facility. The lady up front was very helpful, knowledgeable, and just wonderful. I met with Shyanne Price and she was fantastic. Honest, and advised me what I needed to do. I look forward to coming to this facility, plus it's close to home.

Pain Management and Rehabilitation Consultants provides comprehensive interventional pain management services in Fayetteville, Arkansas. Dr. Cathy Luo leads our specialized clinic with expertise in treating chronic pain conditions that affect daily life. When traditional therapies fail to provide relief, our advanced treatment approaches offer new hope for patients suffering from persistent pain.

At our Fayetteville clinic, we focus on treating a range of chronic pain conditions including:

- Chronic neck pain

- Mid back discomfort

- Low back pain

- Joint pain

- Persistent headaches

Dr. Luo's approach combines interventional procedures with appropriate medication management. This comprehensive strategy addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term management, helping patients return to their normal activities with reduced discomfort.

Dr. Cathy Luo's Expertise

Dr. Luo specializes in interventional pain management techniques designed to target pain at its source. Her treatment philosophy centers on identifying the underlying causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Patients appreciate her thorough diagnostic process and personalized treatment plans that consider each individual's specific needs and goals.

When to Seek Pain Management Care

Consider consulting our pain specialists when:

- Pain persists despite conservative treatments

- Discomfort interferes with daily activities

- You need alternatives to long-term medication use

- Pain affects your quality of life

Our Treatment Approach

Our clinic offers a range of interventional procedures and medication management strategies tailored to each patient's condition. Dr. Luo carefully evaluates each case to determine the most effective treatment path for lasting relief.

Contact Information

Location: 350 E Millsap Rd, Fayetteville, AR 72703, United States

Phone: +1 479-587-8753

Website: [pmrcnwa.com](http://pmrcnwa.com/)

We welcome new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Our office staff can help schedule consultations and answer questions about our services.
column11: Dr. Cathy Luo specializes in interventional pain management for chronic neck, mid back, low back pain, joint pain, and headaches. Chronic pain can disrupt anyone's life. column40:
I've been seeing Dr. Luo for almost 15 years and she's always been helpful and understanding.  Her staff has changed throughout the years, but they've always been attentive and helpful when needed & I'm sure that's difficult, having to deal with people, at times, at their most desperate and vulnerable.  The receptionist has been pleasant, even though she's always busy. Nurses are friendly and take time listening, to report to Dr. Luo.  I can't imagine going to anyone else.|Felt rushed with the doctor, offered no help in my pain management, was supposed to be set up for MRI, brace, etc, never heard back from the office|Dr. Lou is great, and the staff is great! The gal (callie) at the front desk is awesome as well very polite and super helpful. If you are looking for a great medical staff look no further.|The receptionist (I think her name is Callie) always has an attitude and will be short with you if you ever call to cancel an appointment even if its an emergency. I let it go because I thought maybe she was just having a bad day but I've overheard her being rude to other patients on the phone multiple times along with how badly she treats my family member. I would go somewhere else if there was another option simply because of how rude she is.|Was refered to her from my Private Care physician because I am on Pain meds. So she told me she was refering me to ain management. I said YEA right been refered 7 times now they never called. But Dr Cathy Luo actually clinic actually called. Got  an appointment. Though the front desk woman is rather rude. I can live with it. So I seen Cathy Luo 1 time and she scheduled me for Steroid epidural injections. I told her I had them before they do not work on me. So wanted to know what I was on for pain. I told her tramadol. She wanted to change it. She wanted Oxycodone, or Oxycotten, Or Morhine. I said NO WAY those have to many side effects and my Body Does not Do well On them. So I went in April 5th for my Epidural and it has been 34 days. The right side is doing really good the left is kind of touchy. But I go back May 20th so I will let her know then.|Dr Kathy Luo pays attention to her patients, listens, & ACTUALLY CARES.  She is Conscientious, thoughtful & REALLY GOOD AT HER JOB- it is MORE than just a job to her.  I truly appreciate how Dr Kathy Luo LISTENS to my issues and concerns & she's extremely knowledgeable! She's cares about her community and public education as well- & she works so hard every year, during her time off- to help bring Culture &the art of dance, as well as Cuisine to the  young people in her community.  She's an asset everywhere she goes.
If you are looking for a pill mill THIS IS NOT THAT.  Dr Luo is a very smart, thoughtful doctor.
Callie answers the phone up front, schedules appointments, & everything! She is such a wonderful person! Always helpful, and pleasant to talk to! It's so nice to have someone up front that is actually NICE, & HELPFUL! I JUST ADORE CALLIE!!
THE NURSES & staff in the back, also very NICE, & personable.  It sure helps make your day a nicer one when greeted by professional and friendly people!!
**I have been elsewhere - you will not find this level of Care,  or Committment anywhere else! @!8
** The other places I have been to- you can tell by the disposition of the staff - if the doctors care about the staff and patients- then the nurses and other personel feel good about their job-
On the other hand- if when you walk in to a PAIN management Clinic & the Dr always begins his conversation with you ( the patient) with a very demanding sentence like. "Good News; I ONLY want to here GOOD NEWS" and then very quickly follows that with "Everything is just fine, right? Good News, only, right? "
Then you already know-

Thank you, always- to Dr Luo, Callie,  & her entire staff: For being CARING & PROFESSIONAL &  FOR LISTENING TO YOUR PATIENTS, & for HELPING as much as you possibly can!!|I really haven't liked Dr Luo. You never get to have a real sit down with her. She rushes in for no more than 5 minutes. She'll just walk out of the room and you are left just sitting there waiting for her to come back. Prestige Spine - Interventional Pain Management provides comprehensive pain management solutions in Conway, Arkansas. Formerly known as Baptist Health Comprehensive Spine and Pain, our specialized clinic delivers expert care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our fellowship-trained, board-certified physicians Dr. Daniel Judkins and Dr. Sheffield Kent have combined their expertise to create a patient-centered approach to pain relief.

At Prestige Spine, we offer a wide range of interventional pain management treatments including:

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Nerve blocks

- Medication management

- Minimally invasive spine procedures

Expert Physician Team

Our physicians bring extensive training and experience to every patient interaction:

Dr. Daniel Judkins completed his fellowship in pain medicine and is board-certified in interventional pain management. His approach combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address complex pain conditions.

Dr. Sheffield Kent specializes in advanced spine interventions and comprehensive pain solutions. His fellowship training and board certification ensure patients receive the highest standard of care using the latest techniques.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of life. Our treatment plans are individually tailored to each patient's specific condition, medical history, and lifestyle needs. We focus on improving function and quality of life while reducing dependency on pain medications.

Visit us at 650 United Dr #340, Conway, AR 72032, or call +1 501-358-6791 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at [www.prestigespine.com](http://www.prestigespine.com/).

I am sitting outside their offices right now. My appointment was for 3:45. There is a little bit of traffic and I got there at 3:50. I was told the doctor had already left for the day. They told me that I could have called and let them know that I was going to be late.... I was driving through traffic and I don't make phone calls when I drive. Being 5 minutes late and not being able to be seen is the most ridiculous thing I've ever seen. Dr Kent.... Very unprofessional. I would not recommend this office at all. They do not have the patient's best interest at heart.|Hands down the kindest clinic in Conway. They have gone out of their way for my specific situation and I will be forever grateful. Dr. Kent is very knowledgeable but also has great bedside manner which is very hard to find in the area. Although it is a clinic for pain, you don't feel as if you are an experimental subject like other clinics. Great communication with their patients!|The medical staff as well as the ladies at the front desk are wonderful! Dr. Kent was direct, to the point and performed my injections quickly and comfortably. The downside to this office is the insurance person. She is rude, unprofessional and clearly doesn't understand how insurance actually works. They will over bill you up front and then take over six months to return the overpayment. It's sad that one person can ruin the experience and quality of an entire clinic. I will not be back.|This facility went above and beyond to help me urgently! The office runs smoothly, they are very kind, lots of welcoming smiles. The nurses are so nice and helped me feel very comfortable. I was very happy with Dr. Kent. He helped me feel reassured with procedures he was going to do. I highly recommend this office.|I have been a patient of Dr. Kent and his staff for about 5 years. I have always been treated with the utmost of professionalism and courtesy. I have had many procedures over the years including surgeries. Dr. Kent is a very skilled surgeon who I trusted for some very delicate procedures. I highly recommend Dr. Kent and Prestige Spine practice as a whole!!|If I could only rate "0"
Words can't express the suffering I have went through, physically, mentally and emotionally after going through an ablasion procedure. I have visited ER, Primary Doctor, and referral to a new pain management Doctor. This place is the worse. My procedure was done in August and I am still trying to understand how I was using a cane periodically, to using it daily. The receptionist was rude (did not have one ounce of empathy post procedure), Doctor was very smooth in his talking, as if he actually cared. He proceeded to do this procedure without doing an MRI, nor using the MRI imaging from previous doctor (out of state ). No previous medical records (adequate time to receive) solely done with notations. I was under the impression from this Doctor, the office had received "all" information (a month later). I would have never agreed to this otherwise. I have been dealing with this chronic pain for over 20 years including 2 back surgeries. I trusted them to do their job efficiently and effectively. I can't believe I allowed this to happen. The procedure was done quickly and the medical staff (for procedure) was very unprofessional. It was like an assembly line. I had no recovery time after drugs had been administed, and was rushed out the office. (I have had this procedure done once before, so the way this was done is just absolutely gut wrenching). I called the office 3-4 times regarding excruciating pain. Spoke with Doctor, who was more concern with business reputation, than me, the patient. (That I stated without biases) "Nothing" was done. During the follow-up, the Doctor proceeds with possibly correcting the issue with steroid injection. I asked for a referral, at this point, I am livid, never again would my care be in his hands. Four months later and I am still trying to get answers. All insurance companies should do an assessment on this facility. Insurance schemers for sure. I am not done in proceeding in gathering information regarding this facility and making them accountable.|I love this clinic. The front office staff are super friendly, as are the nurses. I was a bit intimidated by Dr. Judkins. He is not a big talker but he listens. I have had spinal ablation done 4 times and I was terrified bc another doctor had hurt me during the procedure. Dr. Judkins did and amazing job. He was gentle, his nursing staff were amazing and I will not go anywhere else to have this done! Thank you Dr. Judkins and the entire staff bc you all are amazing!|There isn't a better doctor in the world!  Dr. Sheffield Kent is absolutely the best!  Have had numerous procedures performed in the office as well. His staff is not only professional but kind and caring. If a patient is looking for a physician, I highly recommend Dr. Kent.  You will be glad you chose Dr. Kent and his staff to meet your needs!  You can't go wrong with the BEST in his field!

Neurosurgery Spine Center provides comprehensive pain management services in Fayetteville, Arkansas. Led by Dr. R. David Cannon, MD, our clinic specializes in interventional pain management techniques that address chronic and acute pain conditions. We offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and medical history.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

At Neurosurgery Spine Center, we deliver advanced treatments for various pain conditions. Our interventional approaches include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. We focus on minimally invasive procedures that provide effective pain relief while minimizing recovery time.

About Dr. R. David Cannon, MD

Dr. Cannon is board-certified in interventional pain management with extensive training in neurosurgical techniques. His educational background includes specialized fellowship training in pain management procedures. Dr. Cannon brings years of clinical experience treating complex pain conditions, particularly those involving the spine and nervous system.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic addresses numerous pain-related conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Headaches and facial pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's complete health profile. Our team takes time to explain diagnoses and treatment options thoroughly. We coordinate care with primary physicians and specialists when necessary for comprehensive pain management.

Visit Our Fayetteville Pain Management Clinic

Neurosurgery Spine Center is conveniently located at 2793 Millennium Dr STE 1, Fayetteville, AR 72703. Contact us at +1 479-582-9025 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services at neurosurgeryspinecenter.com.

Washington Regional Interventional Pain Management Clinic provides comprehensive pain relief solutions in Fayetteville, AR. Our specialized team delivers personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Located at the Washington Regional J.B. Hunt Transport Services Neuroscience Institute, we offer the most comprehensive neurological care in Northwest Arkansas.

We specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Joint pain and inflammation

  • Neck and back pain

  • Sciatica and nerve compression

  • Postoperative pain management

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Migraine and chronic headaches

Comprehensive Treatment Approaches

Our clinic offers multiple treatment modalities tailored to each patient's needs:

  • Targeted nerve blocks for immediate pain relief

  • Physical therapy and rehabilitation programs

  • Advanced electrical stimulation techniques

  • Minimally invasive surgical interventions when necessary

  • Psychological support for pain management

Meet Our Physician

Dr. Brent Weilert, MD leads our pain management team with specialized training in interventional techniques. His expertise helps patients regain function and improve quality of life through evidence-based treatments.

Part of a Larger Network

As part of Washington Regional's Neuroscience Institute, our pain management services integrate with comprehensive neurological care. This connection allows for coordinated treatment approaches across specialties.

Washington Regional remains committed to improving community health through compassionate, high-quality care. Our pain management clinic embodies this mission by helping patients find relief from debilitating pain conditions.

Fayetteville, AR 72703

column40:
First initial visit went great! Staff and the Dr were very friendly and they listened. Finally, someone who's actually listening & trying to help! Or so I thought.
My follow-up appointment I had to reschedule because of an impromptu meeting I had to attend. I called to reschedule & was given a date 2.5 months later & was told to call at a later date to see if someone cancelled. Well, I did. And after the 3rd time calling & nothing was still available, I started thinking this was pointless & was just going to wait on my appointment. Plus, I believe they were getting irritated with me calling. (Deducting one star) No biggie, as I'm aware this is becoming common at Dr offices. However, I'm now out of medication and wanted to get a refill....but, after waiting several days for it to be sent to the pharmacy (because I was told they were going to) I finally called the office again; only this time to be told that I can't get any meds because I haven't had my follow up appointment. Which is now 2 months away. (Deducting another star)
Fast forward to appointment date. I leave work in order to make it to the appointment 30 minutes early as they suggest. The sign in process is a bit long. As she's finishing she states, the Dr isn't in so we're just taking specimen samples & calling in refills. Now, I'm very irritated for several reasons. 1-No one called and said the Dr was out, nor to reschedule. 2-what am I giving a sample for when I've had no medication to take so therefore it's impossible to have any in my system, so what are you checking for!? And had to leave my purse on the counter unattended while doing so. 3-Next appointment date is now 3 months away!
I went to the pharmacy several hours later, and I'm told they have no prescription for me & it's now after 5 and the Dr office is closed so there's no one to call to see what's going on with the transmission of the prescription or if it's ever been sent. (Deducting another star)
I left a message, so I'm currently waiting on a call back.
Needless to say, I'm feeling very unsure about the treatment at this facility. As I mentioned, the initial visit was great, but it went downhill after that.
I just want to know what's going on & get treatment for it. Medical options are limited for this rural area, so I may have to find someone outside of this area.|This was my first visit and I was very pleased with every thing. The staff was very courteous.  Dr. McCoy is very polite and he listen to what I to say. I like the fact that he wanted to check into my conditon further to get to the real cause. No one else had mention this to me.  If I could grade him it would be A+x3.  I am very pleased. My experience was Great!|I'm so thankful for Dr. McCoy!! He truly takes the time and listen to you and your concerns and explain to you to the best of his ability, everything that seems to be wrong. Dr. McCoy is very easy to talk to and honest with you about what's going on in your body. I recommend him to everyone.|I've been a patient of Dr. McCoy for eight months ,within that time frame. I received quality care & A informative  treatment plan to better my health.  Dr. McCoy is the real. McCoy|Dr. McCoy is a wonderful person and he really listens and cares about his patients. The entire staff is very nice and helpful and I would refer anyone to his office.|Pain treatment center of America very nice courtesy!! Dr McCoy Thank you ! Very caring and concerned and makes sure your patient is well and treated......|Loved dr McCoy he was super nice and the staff was too took awhile to get my first appointment but I couldn't ask for a better dr he has done shots on my back and he was awesome cause I am terrified of needles but he didn't hurt me and was very nice threw out the procedure I highly recommend him to anyone and staff was also very nice also thank y'all|I recently had my first visit in the Blytheville office.I was extremely satisfied from the lady at the front desk ,the nurses and Dr .Everyone was so nice and made me feel very comfortable with my visit .Dr was very informative and kind .Looking forward to my future visits with this team .

Located at 9001 Jenny Lind Rd #3, we serve the Fort Smith community with personalized care focused on improving quality of life.

- Epidural steroid injections

These minimally invasive techniques target pain at its source, providing longer-lasting relief than medication alone.

About Dr. Joseph E. Miller

Dr. Miller brings extensive training and experience to pain management. Board-certified in interventional pain medicine, he completed his medical education at prestigious institutions followed by specialized fellowship training. His approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, focusing on each patient's unique pain experience.

Dr. Miller stays current with the latest advances in pain management through ongoing professional development and research. His commitment to patient education ensures individuals understand their condition and treatment options.

column2: Pain Treatment Centers of America - Interventional Surgery Institute
column3:
Pain Treatment Centers of America - Interventional Surgery Institute provides comprehensive pain management services in Little Rock, Arkansas. Our purpose is simple: to put patients back in control of their lives. Located south of the Rodney Parham/I-630 intersection at 9 Freeway Drive (next to U-Storit Self Storage), our clinic offers specialized interventional pain treatments for chronic pain sufferers throughout central Arkansas.

At PTCOA, we understand how chronic pain disrupts daily functioning. Our team specializes in treating various pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures. We focus on restoring functionality and improving quality of life through personalized treatment plans. During the COVID-19 pandemic, we remain committed to providing essential pain management services while following strict safety protocols.

Our Specialized Treatments

Our interventional pain specialists offer advanced procedures including:

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back pain

  • Joint injections for arthritis relief

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain management

  • Radiofrequency ablation for long-term pain reduction

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal inflammation

  • Minimally invasive surgical interventions

Patient-Centered Approach

Each treatment plan begins with thorough evaluation and diagnosis. We believe in addressing the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures with comprehensive pain management strategies for optimal results.

Convenient Location and Access

Our Little Rock facility features state-of-the-art equipment in a comfortable setting. We accept most major insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling options. For appointments or consultations, contact us at +1 844-215-0731 or visit our website at ptcoa.com.

Pain Treatment Centers of America is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. Our Little Rock location serves patients throughout central Arkansas with compassionate, evidence-based care.
column11:
During this COVID-19 pandemic, PTCOA is here for you. Welcome to the Pain Treatment Centers of America in Little Rock, Arkansas, where our purpose is quite simply to put our patients back in control of their lives.

We understand how chronic pain can disrupt the lives of those who suffer from it, and it is our mission to restore our patients' functionality and improve the quality of their daily lives.

Our Little Rock Interventional Surgery Institute is conveniently located South of the Rodney Parham / I-630 intersection, next to U-Storit Self Storage at 9 Freeway Drive.

column38: Kelly O|Andrea Schatzman|Nanette Fischer|CocoJM92|Don Brown|Marion Kalmar|Kennedy|Alan Redmon
column40:
If I could give this place negative stars, I would. I came here seeking help for severe degenerative spine issues and a neck fracture, hoping to avoid surgery. Unfortunately, the only option offered was spinal injections.

I received two injections--one in my neck and one in my lower spine. While the neck injection provided slight relief, the one in my lower back was completely ineffective. I was informed that these injections contained numbing medication, similar to the epidurals I received during pregnancy. However, I was never made aware that they also contained steroids.

I take responsibility for not doing thorough research beforehand, but my pain was overwhelming, and I was desperate for relief. Sadly, the injections affected my mood and menstrual cycle. When I raised these concerns with the clinic, the staff suggested I was experiencing menopause rather than acknowledging the potential side effects of the injections.

The staff were rude and lacked basic bedside manner. I would never recommend this clinic to anyone, not even my worst enemy. I felt misled, and every time I mentioned my concerns, they dismissed me as if I were imagining my symptoms.

I urge anyone considering treatment here to do thorough research on their own. When the injections failed to help, I was told there was nothing more they could do for me. They never discussed medication management or alternative options; it felt like they were simply brushing me off because I raised concerns about the adverse reactions I was experiencing. Overall, I left feeling unheard and abandoned|What the Hell kind of pain management place is this. Even after readying many negative reviews I still gave them the benefit of the doubt.  I should have listened to the majority.  PLEASE  PLEASE DON'T GO HEAR. These people not only don't care but literally go out of their way to downplay your  injuries/surgeries/pain..whatever is going on. Before seeing the doctor his nurse came in and the first thing she said after getting my vitals is, "our doctors do not prescribe pain medication for any reason no matter what".  Other than to say hello, I hadn't spoken yet at this point.
I've had one visit so far on 9/4/24 and ultimately decided to do a procedure on my neck scheduled for 9/12/24. The doctor seemed pretty confident this procedure will give me some relief after around 1 week following the procedure. I'm desperate and willing to try and I've been waiting for about 3 months for this 1st visit.
Today I speak to the nurse who says let's schedule your follow-up. My follow-up is October 21st.  That's over a month after the procedure.  What if it doesn't help? I've already waited 3 months for my 1st appointment. I've had multiple car accidents,  broken bones and surgeries. Although I didn't ask for medication of ANY kind it's a bit disheartening to be told that it can never be an option.  Seems odd for a "pain management clinic ".
So far...they're in no hurry to see me, no hurry to follow-up after a procedure to check for effectiveness and very quick to inform me of their no "pain medication policy."  This was my experience on my first day.|Not helpful at all. Was referred by my 'doctor' for my neuropathy issue. Got a prescription for antidepressants and told to use otc capsaicin cream. I'm paying over $300 after insurance paid their part for absolutely nothing. Very disappointed.|Absolutely wonderful people! I have always been treated with the upmost respect by every person at this clinic. None of the nurses, APRN's or doctors do anything without making sure I feel comfortable. They are so warm and inviting. The front desk girls are so sweet. They always welcome me with a big smile and joke around a little to put me at ease. I go here for spinal procedures and am always nervous about it but their team has a way to put you completely at ease and I trust them 100% with my care.|Dr. Benson is very thorough. I have been to numerous pain clinics and he is by far the most thorough in explaining why and what is causing the issues that I'm having.|Dr Green has absolutely no bedside manners. I find him rude and unpleasant.
I can say the same thing for his nurse practitioner. After I spent a big amount of money in this place he would not even see me for the follow up but put it off on his nurse practitioner.
Every surgery appointment I had, he busted in the room without a hello and just carried on making jokes with his staff.
Once out of 3 times I had a more pleasant experience. The other times I was not well attended to. Treaded rude.
I will not return especially since the treatment did not work but maybe 30%
I hope you read this Dr Green. You need to change your ways. I felt almost violated laying there trusting you with my body and you could have cared less!!!!
He was ordered by my Neurologist to perform Ablations on my Cervical Spine but found it more important to do my Lumbar Section First. Nice Ego|These doctors do not care about your health or wellbeing. They deny seeing people for no reason and can't even be considerate to call and let you know. Please read the reviews here. Even mercy pcp's talk about how much of a hell hole this place is. They are "opiate free" which is a joke. Oh but they'll prescribe garbage medication that makes your teeth fall out because that's the medicine they get the kickbacks on. Can only hope that these barbaric doctors who treat people like this end up in excruciating pain and no one will help them.|There needs to be a zero star option. Dr. Green has absolutely zero empathy or compassion. He argued with me over my diagnosis, which has been confirmed through extensive imaging by a neurosurgeon, two orthopedic surgeons, and a specialized upper cervical chiropractor -- four different doctors. I've been all the way to Johns Hopkins (three times), and Dr. Green had the audacity to question Johns Hopkins! I've been living with severe chronic pain for over 6 years, and am on the verge of being bedridden and disabled. Some days I can't even be upright for more than a few minutes, due to the extreme pain I experience, from all the pressure / compression my brain stem is being subjected to. Currently in treatment doing stem cell / platelet rich plasma therapy, but if these fail, I will have to get cervical fusion neck surgery. In the meantime, my neurosurgeon suggested that Dr. Green prescribe something I could take on an as needed basis -- just on the days where the pain threshold is too much to handle; something I could take to help get me thru the work day. Dr. Green not only argued with me about my diagnosis (he went on and on about stuff that's way out of his area of expertise, and it was clear he had no idea what he was talking about), but he also refused to prescribe anything, outside of the medications that I've already tried, which have not helped. I'm absolutely baffled and stunned that the local medical system is so broken, that a person who has endured as many years of extreme pain as I have, would be turned away. I can't help but wonder, according to Dr. Green, if I don't "qualify" -- then who in the world would? Makes me feel sad for anyone else who may also be turned away, after experiencing as much pain and hardship. There's no telling how many people Dr. Green has turned away. There is absolutely no way this man actually cares about any of his patients, or how much pain they're in. Given his distinct lack of empathy, it's clear that he has no concept of what it's like to have to live with extreme chronic and disabling pain. Dr. Green is an absolute and utter disgrace to the profession, and should be completely ashamed of himself. Don't waste your time here, save yourself the disappointment, and go ahead and look elsewhere.

Proper Pain Solutions, PLLC offers comprehensive pain management services in Little Rock, Arkansas. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and personalized treatment plans. Located at 5800 W 10th St Suite 205, we serve patients throughout central Arkansas with compassionate care focused on improving quality of life.

Our practice provides advanced interventional pain management techniques including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain relief

  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammatory conditions

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain control

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back pain

  • Radiofrequency ablation for long-term pain reduction

  • Medication management with focus on minimizing opioid use

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists address a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain from herniated discs

  • Sciatica and radicular nerve pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

  • Arthritis and joint-related pain

  • Post-surgical pain management

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Fibromyalgia and widespread pain syndromes

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Proper Pain Solutions, we believe in multimodal treatment approaches. Each patient receives individualized care plans combining interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and appropriate medication management. Our goal is functional improvement alongside pain reduction, helping patients return to daily activities with minimal discomfort.

Experienced Pain Management Physicians

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology. With backgrounds from leading medical institutions, our doctors stay current with the latest pain management techniques and research. The team combines decades of clinical experience with compassionate patient care.

Patient Information

New patients can expect comprehensive evaluations during initial visits. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to maximize coverage benefits. Our office provides convenient scheduling options with minimal wait times.

Contact Proper Pain Solutions today at (501) 476-3914 to schedule a consultation. Visit our website at http://properpainsolutions.com/ for more information about our services and approach to pain management.

Located at 5800 W 10th St Suite 205, Little Rock, AR 72204, our clinic offers accessible parking and a comfortable environment for all patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

I've had a great experience going to Proper Pain Solutions. The staff is caring and friendly. I was able to get a trial stimulator fairly quickly after my initial appointment and then the indwelling device a month after.|Dr. Becker is the BEST. I've had back problems for many years at a young age unfortunately the problems are not surgical. Every other Doctor would ignore me and not really take my problems seriously until I met Dr. Becker. Dr. Becker really cares and listens to his patients concerns and tries to give them the best possible treatment plan. Courtney at the front desk is absolutely TERRIFIC as well!|Absolutely wonderful facility! The staff are kind, patient, knowledgeable and accommodating. Dr Ramon is truly wonderful and I feel that he and his staff are par none. I highly recommend this facility and Dr Ramon.
.|I've been seeing Dr. Roman since 2008. I started seeing him for shots in my back, and in 2009, I had the first of 10 back surgeries. In 2023, I also had a knee replacement surgery.  Dr. Roman has gotten me through a lot of painful medical issues and I wholeheartedly recommend him.|I've seen Dr.Roman for seven years. He's kind and caring. He really has your best interest at heart.The nurses and the office staff are very kind as well.|I got my husband in with Dr. Becker for his back pains. He told him he didn't think his back was "that bad" and sent him for PT then a MRI. Turns out according to the MRI he has several problems with his back. Now we're getting billed for this so called service. Not worth a dime!|Dr Becker is the worst pain doctor ever. This place doesn't even know how to claim off 2 different insurance. Not sure  why it's so hard to file on Medicare and what they don't pay medicaid picks up . They don't follow threw on thier word . But they want you to go do as policy and write a quiting letter . Let me jump right on that letter. I'll jump on that letter like the help I got . Which was none but a headache lost time and money for traveling expenses|I spent 10 months in excruciating pain and tried everything to alleviate it while waiting for imaging and referrals to go through and finally get a surgery scheduled. I went to a chiropractor a couple times a week, did acupuncture, massage therapy, bought a $250 far infrared heating pad, ice gel packs, topical pain relieving gels, a cervical traction collar, and a pricy cervical pillow. It wasn't anywhere near enough. My PCM and my surgeon wouldn't prescribe me anything for pain. Dr. Becker and his amazing, caring staff actually listened to me and gave me the care I needed. Dr. Becker is incredibly knowledgeable and is a standout in the medical community. He helped me manage my pain before and after my surgery. It's not often that you get a chance to be treated by such an accomplished physician who actually looks you in the eye, thoroughly examines you, and through his attentiveness he truly gains your trust. His management plan for me was very responsible, and he gave me my life back. Also, I can't leave out this office's exemplary staff! From the front office to back office staff they're all sympathetic, patient, and considerate! They're all so sweet and radiate positive energy, and genuinely make you feel like you're going to make it over the tough road you're traversing. My surgery was successful, thank goodness. But, it was Dr. Becker and his staff that helped to relieve my anxiety and depression during my months long ordeal. I'd never wish my troubles on anyone, but if you're in need of treatment and healing reach out to this office. Things will immediately turn around for you.

column3:
Institute of Interventional Pain Management offers comprehensive pain relief solutions in Russellville, Arkansas. Led by Dr. Rafi, who brings over 25 years of specialized experience to every patient consultation. Our clinic provides individualized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Our treatment options include both medication-based and interventional techniques. Dr. Rafi expertly administers spinal injections, joint injections, and nerve blocks to target pain at its source. For patients requiring more advanced care, we offer nerve ablation procedures that disrupt pain signal transmission for longer-lasting relief.

Treatment plans often incorporate physical therapy and lifestyle modification strategies to enhance recovery and prevent pain recurrence. We carefully evaluate each patient's condition before recommending either opioid or non-opioid medications as part of a comprehensive approach.

Advanced Interventional Procedures

For complex pain conditions, our clinic provides cutting-edge interventional treatments including:

  • Spinal Cord Stimulators for managing chronic back and leg pain

  • Peripheral Nerve Stimulators for targeted nerve pain relief

  • Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD���) for spinal stenosis

  • Vertiflex��� procedure using the Superion��� Indirect Decompression System

  • SI Joint Stabilization with PsiF��� for sacroiliac joint dysfunction

  • Kyphoplasty and Vertebroplasty for vertebral compression fractures

Specialized PRP Treatments

Dr. Rafi has extensive experience with Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) injections for multiple applications including aesthetic concerns, sexual health disorders, and musculoskeletal conditions. This regenerative approach harnesses the body's natural healing capabilities.

Visit Our Russellville Pain Management Clinic

Located at 3110 W Main St, Russellville, AR 72801, our facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. Contact us at +1 479-967-7770 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11: Dr. Rafi has more than 25 years of experience. He uses a wide range of approaches from opioids or non-opioid types of pain medications; spinal injections, joint injections and nerve injections or ablations; physical therapy and lifestyle changes to the most technically advanced interventions and surgeries, like Spinal Cord Stimulators, Peripheral Nerve Stimulators, Minimally Invasive Lumbar Decompression (MILD(tm)) and Vertiflex(tm) procedure (Superion(tm) Indirect Decompression System), SI Joint Stabilization with PsiF(tm), Kyphoplasty, and Vertebroplasty to give his patients the best possible chance of pain relief. Dr. Rafi also has wide experience in Platelets-Rich-Plasma (PRP) injections for aesthetic, sexual and musculoskeletal disorders.

column40:
Very nice people and helped me on my first visit. The nurses, all were very nice even at reception. It really wasn't that long of a wait either, I waited maybe 30 minutes before I saw the doctor. There were plenty of seats as well. There were people there, of course, but there were enough seats for everyone. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who has chronic pain.|I can't say enough about how happy I am with Dr Rafi. He basically saved my life with his expertise He suggested that I get a spinal cord stimulator. Well it worked and I am out of pain. Believe me I have some bad days but most are excellent. They have a very good experienced staff who is always considerate and supportive but most of all they are truly compassionate. They have my vote and I would never consider a change
My thanks to Dr Rafi and his staff|Dealt with back pain issues for 20 years. Have gone to multiple pain doctors over the years. This Doctor is the first one to figure it out and get me some relief. Great Doctor! Great guy and super staff!|Doctor doesn't talk much.  Rude nurse does the talking.  She doesn't listen to what u have to say.  When you call they don't answer.  That's your job to answer phones. WAITING time is 2 + hours. You see him for 5 minutes.  THEY need to do injections in the morning. They over book.  They treat you like u r dumb.  The good reviews are the staffs family.  Unorganized|I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. First of all you have to wait hours before the Dr. will even see you. When he does he barely even speaks to you he has one of his nurses do all the talking for him. Also, the staff is rude. The only reason I keep going there is because I have arthritis in my lower back and the injections he gives me are the only thing that helps, long lasting anyway, otherwise, I would have seen if my doc could have referred me to anyone else. I also have to say that when you call them wanting refills on any of your prescriptions they forget and you end up having to call again. You shouldn't have to call twice just to get your prescription refilled. They also shouldn't have to ask you when was the last time you saw Dr. Rafi all I want is refills on my prescriptions so I don't think that's even necessary|Don't bother going here if you want to get in, get seen and then leave. Be prepared to wait over 2 hours in a cramped waiting room with floor seating only. I saw the lady scan my cards in the computer and she didn't hand them back until I was about to give a urine sample. I even heard her say, and I quote 'I wasn't going to use them for anything bad' when I asked for them back before giving the sample. Plus they have a sign in the bathroom, with a door that barely closes and refuses to lock easily, stating not to wash your hands until the unloved lab tech has your sample. That is unsanitary and sickening on many levels. If you scan the cards you should hand them back immediately.  I had five people in front of me and that was fine but the lady two people ahead of me was there for almost over two hours at that point. People that are hurting shouldn't be treated like cattle so a pain specialist can see them. I have never felt more dehumanized before entering this office. I will NEVER return and will NOT recommend this place to anyone. I would rather deal with the pain I am in rather than return here. It may make me feel crazy but at least I'll have my dignity.|5 hour wait to find out that had no information. I had been on Tylenol 4 for months. That is all my pcp could do I seek out this place to help my pain. They cut my meds in half for no reason. Then told me I was in a contract and couldn't go elsewhere for meds. I have mri showing herniated disc in my neck and spinal stenosis, arthritis. So not even knowing what my mri showed he cut my meds in half. I called and let them know I was in severe pain. They said that's what they wanted to do at this point. Do not go here !! They sent me for x rays after I told them I just had them done at my pcp. He does not seem to care. I'm currently speaking to surgeons for my spine surgery maybe it will help. This place will not do anything,bust waste your time.|I've never had a doctor and his Assistant go into such great detail about my condition. Dr Rafi and his SUPERB Assistant and ALL the staff of INTERVENTIONAL PAIN MANAGEMENT Russellville Arkansas  treated me with the utmost respect and spent a lot of time with me. I am so grateful for them. Thank you Dear Lord. THANK YOU Dr Blake Dixon of Dover Arkansas for referring me in the right direction.

column40:
It all depends on who the doctor is. I was treated badly by this one. Ive got a great one after I was fired by this one. I thank God.|The doctors and nurses I have met with in person extremely nice, professional. There is never a long wait. They seem dedicated to keeping appointment times so you're not waiting for hours like in some doctors offices. I only have one minor suggestion. I was dispatched to an out-of-state assignment for 48 hours and of course, during that time is my scheduled appointment. I have never had to reschedule an appointment before. We'll see

Are use the app and asked to reschedule my appointment. My appointment was immediately rescheduled. However, it was rescheduled for four days after my medication would run out.  I asked if there was anyway possible I could be rescheduled before I ran out of my medication I was told no that was the only option available. I've been asked is the doctor would refill my prescription for a few days so I would not miss my medication. The answer was also negative. Then I asked if I could be put on a waiting list in case someone cancel between now and in two weeks when my appointment is scheduled for. I was told "no we don't have a list". I felt the response was rude and insensitive. Understanding how sick my body will be without my scheduled medication for three days is very scary. Knowing that my doctors office was not willing to help in anyway  has given me reason to pause and consider different clinic. However, I do like my doctor and the nurses have been great. When I paid only $40 per month I'm just stuck on how to handle three days with no medication. I can't afford to miss work so I can't stay home . I just wish the person who responded online and offered some type of solution or temporary remedy that could help my situation.

Yes, I am able to reach someone at the clinic this coming week to see if they will give me a refill for three days then I will change my rating to 5 stars.|I've been with ptcoa for 7 pr more years. Everything is wonderful. I've received ablations on my low back that have really helped. I thought they handled the opiate issue with a concern for my welfare. Surgery staff was always caring and efficient. I recommend  ptcoa to anyone who is considering pain management. Providers have been nice, and I feel they are focused on my needs. I have some difficult comorbidities, and I believe these issues are taken into consideration. Glad to have the opportunity to share.|I love going here to see a pain Dr. They are very nice and understanding. But I'm starting to have a lot more pain down my legs and it's causing my legs to go numb so hopefully they can find out what's going on before it's to late. But over all it's a great place. Just as long as they keep doctors. Its hard when you get comfortable with one doctor then they leave then you get comfortable with another doctor then they leave too. So hopefully the one I see now will stay.|Extremely pleased with the excellent care prior, during and post procedure. Follow up visits were relaxed and  I felt I was being kept " in the loop"  . Questions were answered  to my satisfaction with appropriate lab and imaging explanations. The  Physicians and staff were always courteous and willing to work with me on  scheduling  or whatever issue- insurance etc - may arise.I would highly recommend this group for anyone having pain control issues, especially those with chronic pain control problems.|Dr. Rinewalt and her team are all awesome. Jennifer at the desk is so down to earth and always has a great attitude. Dr. Rinewalt truly cares about your well-being and that's truly appreciated. I feel like the whole team goes above and beyond and I'm grateful I'm a patient here|I can't give a review or say anything about her because I've only seen the nurse , I've never seen her. The only Dr I saw last was Dr Rhinewalt and the last procedure I had done was horrible because it didn't help anything. Because the nerve needing burnt was not. So still in the same shape I was before Dr Rhinewalt left.|I've had a pain pump for going on 10 years. Dr. I is more than a Dr. He cares about his patients & takes time to explain things to you.The whole staff takes time with their procedures & will call you back if you are having problems. The pain clinic has been a Godsend to me. Before I got my pain pump I had 3 failed back surgeries for scoliosis'. The rods & screws wouldn't hold. I was in constant pain. The pump is not perfect. Nothing is; but It does it's job & I'm happy with it.

Our Clinical Approach

We utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Each treatment plan begins with thorough diagnostic evaluation. column40:
I'm very confused about this because I've been trying to figure out why I've tested negative 2 times with your pain management and before in other places. And I've done some research and it's what I think is happening. I have 8-10 yeti cups of water a day and some at night because of my blood sugar levels and it's what my endocrinologist has said to do. I truly believe it is the problem. I take my medication and yes I may skip a day or two but after 2 trips to the hospital and shots of very strong opiates and testing negative it hasta be the water Deluding my test. I only post this in hopes that I can help with my pain and medication to be referred and maybe help someone else out if they have the same issues. Please I don't want withdrawals to happen over something I don't understand|4 tries to even get an appointment got canceled 3 times due to no doc or some other reason. So 4 months of waiting to get in.

Told I would be receiving a shot on first appointment only to find out that was not the case. Lucky owner was there and made it happen.

Drug test every appointment no history of illegal drugs.

On follow up after x-rays (already had mri before first appointment) was told I has degenerative disc disease need spacers in my l3 thru l5. Signed paperwork to get on the schedule. Called today almost a month later not even a note in my file about any procedure. Owner was in the room when all this happened.

I will be looking for a new doc again.....|I actually changed to the Conway AR location due to unprofessional treatment at the Little Rock AR office on Markham Street.
Dr. Angela has excellent bedside manners. She is very caring and listens to what you have to say.
I was not aware that I needed to go get my medication without a call from the  pharmacists. (My fault). I also changed my pharmacy in order that I could pick them up all at the same pharmacy I use for all my additional medication. Filling out a form was required however it was not used to call in the prescription. (Really)
Staff please pay close attention to your patients. If we are held to an upmost regard concerning your rules, please pay close attention to our request. We really don't want to feel like a number. Pain is no joke.|Angela is a super Nurse Practitioner. I give her my highest recommendations. She is always pleasant and compassionate. I trust her judgement.|This business requires you to submit to a drug test before they will even let you see a doctor.  They don't tell you that the drug testing costs $661!  The cost to me after insurance is $158.51.  They explain that this drug testing is required for liability reasons.  "What if the patient is on drugs that are incompatible with a prescription?"  I have never experienced anything like this at any other practice.  If this business wants to require drug testing to protect itself from potential liabilities, then the cost of this testing should be covered by the business.

They require this drug testing regardless of the care they ultimately provide and regardless of whether they prescribe a controlled substance.  The only benefits I received from this clinic was a referral for an MRI, a referral to a surgeon, and a referral to a physical therapist.  I don't see how any of these benefits relate to the excessive drug screening.

There is no incentive for AR Spine and Pain to negotiate costs of the drug testing or to search for the most affordable testing.  Since they don't incur the cost, they don't limit the drug testing to patients that require prescriptions for controlled substances.  I would be happy to sign any waivers stating whether I am taking any other drugs, and this should put any liability on me.  This is especially true for individuals that have no medical or legal records of illegal drugs.|Dara did a excellent job of taking care of me. she was very helpful in getting my needs met|Excellent Doctors who actually listens to you. They work too help patients be as pain free as possible|Was a little but of a wait. But totally worth it. I walked in with so much pain and they took thier time to discuss my situation and I walked out of there with a whole lot less pain and  they scheduled surgery pretty quick to get me out of pain totally. Awesome folks. Love Ms Mooney she is amazing!

Mercy Pain Management Clinic, led by Dr. Ronald E. Harbut, MD, provides comprehensive pain relief solutions at 1 Mercy Ln, Hot Springs, AR 71913. Our specialized clinic offers advanced interventional procedures and personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We serve the Hot Springs community with evidence-based approaches to pain management.

At Mercy Pain Management, we address various pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques. Our treatments include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. We also provide medication management and physical therapy coordination for comprehensive care. Each treatment plan is tailored to the patient's specific needs and medical history.

About Dr. Ronald E. Harbut

Dr. Harbut brings extensive experience in pain medicine to Hot Springs patients. Board-certified in anesthesiology and pain management, he completed his medical education at prestigious institutions before specializing in interventional pain techniques. Dr. Harbut stays current with the latest advancements in pain management through ongoing professional development. His approach combines medical expertise with compassionate patient care.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Cancer-related pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in educating patients about their pain conditions. During consultations, Dr. Harbut takes time to explain diagnosis details and treatment options. Our staff coordinates with primary care physicians and specialists for integrated care. We emphasize functional improvement alongside pain reduction for better quality of life.

Located conveniently in Hot Springs, our facility features state-of-the-art equipment for accurate diagnosis and effective treatments. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options. New patients can typically schedule appointments within two weeks.

Delta Pain Management offers specialized interventional pain management services in Pine Bluff, Arkansas. We focus on treating chronic pain through personalized care plans that address the root cause of your discomfort. Our clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain quality of life and functional improvement.

At Delta Pain Management, we take time to understand each patient's unique pain experience. Our specialists develop individualized treatment plans based on the bio-psycho-social model of pain management. This holistic approach addresses physical symptoms while considering emotional and social aspects of chronic pain. Through a series of consistent, well-planned steps, we work toward meaningful pain reduction and improved function.

Specialized Interventional Techniques

Our clinic offers highly specialized interventional procedures for effective pain relief. These minimally invasive techniques target pain at its source with precision. Our multimodal treatment approach may include:

  • Targeted nerve blocks and injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Joint injections

  • Appropriate medication management

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

We believe in building strong doctor-patient relationships through clear communication. Our goal-based treatment plans are developed collaboratively with patients. This partnership ensures realistic expectations and measurable progress in managing chronic pain conditions.

Excellent doctor he takes his time but he knows what he is doing before I came my back pain was excruciating and when I say he help me this year. I reduced my hours to 4 hours a day at work, I can stand longer than what I was at first without hurting so bad. I then had lower back injections,hip bursa, knee injections and I feel way better than I ever did. I been doing more house hold choirs around the house and exercising. I still have to sit down a little but not as much as I had to do at first. So, I thank Dr. Dogra for everything. Now he did say it will come back but, I'm ok with that because of the type of work I do and it requires heavy lifting and turning. He keep everything straight forward with you no sugar coding nothing.|ABSOLUTELY  NO. WAY. I CAN GIVE ANYONE READING THIS REVIEW; words to express how. AWESOME  DR DOGRA AND HIS STAFF ARE!!!!!!!I have b to 2 pain centers in Little Rock who both have excellent reputations.  But I didnt experience very much relief.  I heard thru multiple sources about Dr. DOGRA. My very first appointment with him I found him to be VERY personable, VERY professional and very knowledgeable.  He  REALLY  listened to me and expressed his. Concern for my quality of life, such as it was at that time. Dr. Dogra told me what he would do to "FIX"  me and I left his office knowing he WOULD FIX ME...and he did.  I will always have issues with my right hip and my back.  He burned my nerves last February and I'm just now showing signs of pain coming back.  I again started seeing him 2 weeks ago because of pain in my right shoulder all the way in my fingers. I have no doubt in my mind that he will also succeed in reducing or alleviating my pain yet again I will recommend him to everybody I mate and have been doing so since the first time I saw him.
