I have been on bed rest have had night sweats and left  knee in pain  However, I did get up set up for about two hours so I guess this is pay back for getting up. Okay, so I never post reviews... I'm bad about that... but! This place is absolutely worth it!! It is worth so many more than 5 stars! 10000 stars!!! They're incredible! I will recommend them to literally everyone!
I was referred by my PCP for a spinal herniation in July. In the last 6 months Dr. Abraham and his phenomenal, caring, REAL, staff have provided me with the best quality medical care I have EVER received!!!
I truly cannot thank them enough for how much they have helped me!
My case has been a classic "if it can go wrong, it will go wrong" with insurance being, well insurance. But all of the ladies (and gentlemen) up there have been such a pleasure to work with, they make me feel so validated and have gone above and beyond to get me the treatment I needed!
I have never once felt uncomfortable, anxious or like I wasn't supposed to be there, which is rare for me when it comes to doctors in general.
This is just an awesome place with beautiful souls working to truly help ease their patients pain!
I highly recommend!
And once again, thank you Dr Abraham and all of the staff at AIPM!! Y'all literally changed my life!|This is supposed to be pain management, they don't manage your pain and make you get injects in your back and have procedures done, they make you say you had 80% real for more than an hour after these procedures or you do not get your meds, this is pharmaceutical blackmail, no less insurance fraud. They get to make you keep doing these injections and procedures and making big money off our insurance programs. This is no joke, these injections and procedures screwed his back up way more and he still had to lie and say he got pain relief for at least an hour after the procedures he could get his meds and have a little pain relief. Pain Treatment Centers of America offers comprehensive pain management services at our North Little Rock clinic. Dr. James Hunt leads our team with specialized expertise in interventional pain techniques. Our clinic provides personalized treatment plans addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based approaches.

Dr. James Hunt is an Arkansas native with extensive medical training and experience. He graduated from Baptist Health School of Nursing in 1992 and completed his BSN at University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) in 1995. Dr. Hunt received his MD from UAMS in 2003, followed by a residency in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine at UAMS in 2007.

With dual board certification in anesthesiology and pediatric anesthesiology from the American Board of Anesthesiology, Dr. Hunt brings specialized expertise to our practice. He previously served as Co-Director of Burn Anesthesiology at Arkansas Children's Hospital for over ten years, where he established a dedicated burn anesthesiology and pain management team for pediatric and adult burn victims.

Our Pain Management Services

  • Back and Neck Pain

Treatment Approaches

Patients benefit from our multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Each treatment plan is tailored to individual needs, focusing on improving function and quality of life.

Fort Neuro provides comprehensive pain management services in Fort Smith, Arkansas. Our neurosurgical practice specializes in advanced interventional procedures for chronic and acute pain conditions. At Fort Neuro, patients receive personalized care from qualified neurosurgeons using state-of-the-art technology for precise diagnosis and effective treatment.

Fort Neuro offers a complete range of pain management solutions including:

  • Advanced and traditional spinal epidural injections

  • Facet joint injections for spinal arthritis

  • Arthritis joint injections for multiple body regions

  • Targeted nerve blocks with fluoroscopy guidance

  • Ultrasound-guided precision injections

  • Minimally invasive spine decompression and fusion procedures

  • Radiofrequency ablation of spine and peripheral nerves

  • Spinal and peripheral nerve stimulation therapy

  • Kyphoplasty for osteoporotic vertebral fractures

Diagnostic Excellence

Our approach begins with thorough neurological consultations to understand each patient's condition. We utilize advanced neurophysiological testing including:

  • Electromyography (EMG)

  • Nerve conduction velocity tests

  • Comprehensive neurological assessments

These diagnostic tools help our specialists identify the root cause of pain, enabling targeted treatment plans tailored to each patient's needs.

Why Choose Fort Neuro

Patients choose Fort Neuro for our neurosurgical expertise in pain management. All procedures are performed by qualified neurosurgeons with specialized training in pain intervention techniques. Our team uses real-time imaging guidance for maximum safety and effectiveness during procedures.

Visit Our Pain Management Clinic

Location: 9616 Rogers Ave, Fort Smith, AR 72903, United States

Phone: +1 479-551-2127

Website: www.fortneuro.net

Fort Neuro serves patients throughout Fort Smith and surrounding communities with accessible, advanced pain management solutions. Contact us today to schedule your consultation.

column40:
Horrible doctor and front office!!! I waited 2 hours for my second to last appointment and I went to the  front desk and I told the lady that I had been in the room for almost 2 hours and I couldn't wait anymore from pain from sitting so long and my ride had been waiting, so I'd needed to reschedule. I rescheduled the appointment and when I came in for the appointment, the lady at the front desk told me that my appointment was last week and that I needed to pay a $50 no show fee. I said my appointment is for today and I have never messed up an appointment day and time and I have never no-showed for an appointment. I said do you think I would just come in here making up my own appointment and she said, well some people do. I saw the doctor and expanded everything and he said he'd waive the fee and his assistant was also in the room with us, typing on the laptop. I recieved a bill last week for the $50 no show fee and I called and talked to the lady at the front desk and she said she would contact billing and have it removed. I go in for my appointment today and the same front desk lady says, you owe $50 for the no show fee. I explain everything all over again and said I just talked to you and you were going to contact billing to get it removed and the doctor told me at my last appointment, that he was waiving the fee. She said okay, I'll talk to the doctor. After 30 minutes of me waiting, she says the doctor said he won't see you until you pay the $50. I said this is absolutely crazy and if this is how this doctor and practice is, remove me as a patient and she said, okay great. I can't believe a doctor would lie like this and be so desperate for $50. It wasn't about the money as it was not my fault and I was lied to. I am making sure to let all of my physicians and family and friends know, to not go here.|I've never been treated so well as I have with Dr. Maryanov, he was through and then sat down and showed me everything and talked to me about it. It was great. Doctor and nurses explained every detail of everything he did while examining me. I wasn't expecting the quality of care I received. Excellent bedside manner. Absolutely no complaints.|I know that sometimes they're a little bit slow and the wait can be long but it's well worth  it plus I've never been to a doctor that you never had to wait for. Doctor Maryanov has always took very good care of me,he tells it how it is.  He always takes time to explain things to me and he has taken very good care of my shoulder and back if it wasn't for him I don't know what my shoulder would be like today.|I've always gotten great care. The strive to help patients not just give them medication and send them on|I went to my last appointment and he chewed his nurse out in front of me in the patient room with me next to them , chewed her out over an ink pen and for giving someone a cup of coffee , the Dr should handle his business with his employees away from the patient and he told me that I cam across like some kind of weirdo or something !
He should not allow his anger to take control in from of the patient !
I will never go back !!!!|Everyone is so very kind and helpful. I had to bring my 1 year old son (he had missed his nap and was being distracting) & everyone was so patient and helpful. It was my first visit with him and even though my son was over tired (making the conversations difficult) the dr himself even helped distract him. As far as treatment goes, at this appointment we went over my med history & talked about a procedure he recommends. Unfortunately I have to deal with this pain through the holidays because the procedure was scheduled over a month away. That's the only negative.

column3:
Baptist Health Comprehensive Spine and Pain Management Center

Baptist Health Comprehensive Spine and Pain Management Center offers specialized pain management services in Conway, Arkansas. Located at 650 United Dr #340, the center provides comprehensive treatment options for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The clinic's multidisciplinary approach combines advanced interventional procedures with personalized care plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

The center specializes in treating a wide range of pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain

- Complex regional pain syndrome

- Post-surgical pain

- Cancer-related pain

- Headaches and migraines

Treatment Approaches

Baptist Health pain specialists utilize various evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's needs:

- Medication management for appropriate pain control

- Interventional procedures including epidural injections and nerve blocks

- Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions

- Radiofrequency ablation to target specific nerve pain

- Physical therapy integration for functional improvement

- Minimally invasive techniques to reduce recovery time

Patient-Centered Care

The clinic's approach focuses on comprehensive assessment and individualized treatment plans. New patients receive thorough evaluations to identify pain sources and contributing factors. Treatment goals emphasize functional improvement alongside pain reduction, helping patients return to daily activities with greater comfort.

Location and Contact Information

Washington Regional Interventional Pain Management, led by Dr. Brent Weilert, MD, provides specialized pain management services in Fayetteville, AR. Our clinic delivers comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans.

Dr. Weilert specializes in treating a wide range of pain conditions including:

Treatment Approaches

About Dr. Brent Weilert

Dr. Weilert brings extensive experience in interventional pain management to our clinic. As a board-certified physician, he focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while improving quality of life.

column38: Karen January|carrie crawford|Danny Thomas|Melissa Pacheco|Nicole Girth|Michael Burrell|Dalton Williams|Michael Schutz
column40: I have been seeing Dr. Weilert for 10 years for cervical and/or trigger point injections. He does explain things and gives me options of which injections I want to do and what each injection will target. When I do the Cervical injections, I have to take time getting up because I will pass out. The nurse stays with me until I can get up safely. All the staff have been very nice, helpful, and I feel treated with care.|Had neck pain and was sent there.  I was told I would get a shot in the neck and there would be tightness and I didn't need to be driving due to any affects the shot or medication might have.  But come time for the shot it felt like he was in a hurry and impatient and when he gave it to me he was pushing the medication in fast and I said it was hurting and didn't feel right.  He said it was fine and he was about done and I said I was losing my sight and hearing and he said he was done and walked out.  I became panicked at no sight and by the time he shut the door I couldn't hear and I was doing all I could to not pass out and the nurse had lifted me and I was already getting sick and the pain was horrible.  She got mad and said they needed the room soon for the next patients and asked if I needed help to the waiting room... I still couldn't sit up and my sight was barely there and my hearing was still messed up and I'm over the trash can throwing up.. As soon as I was able to walk they took me to my car to where my driver was and said all was well and I had just a little pain... And I never received any paperwork or anything from them that day saying what they did and what happened.  It was as if they hurry up and got me out of there and moved on.  To this day I can't tell you what they did or gave me because they will not give me my own information. I highly do not recommend this place!|My first appointment with Dr. Brent was terrific!  He has a pleasant bedside manner. He ran a test that confirmed his initial diagnosis. The results were positive, and I look forward to my next appointment.|My 1st appointment I was advised Dr. Weilert would only need my prior mri, CT reports, not disks. He stated at that appointment he would need my disks, as well as every prior treatment in the last 7 years. The next day I brought my disks in, signed consent forms & gave them several doctors offices info, including their fax #'s. A few weeks later I followed up with them & they acted like I was speaking a foreign language, no clue what I was talking about. I thought I straightened everything out, when they assured me they'd get the consent forms sent, but they have yet to call me back, or reach out to prior providers a month later & refuses to see me other wise (despite proof of a recent spine surgery). I've finally given up & decided to just drive the 3 hours to my prior PM doctor. I'm not sure their goal is to treat patients as much as it is to show them on the books.|I had an appointment in December and the doctor made sure my concerns were discussed and agreed to go with a conservative treatment.|He seems to know what he's talking about, but he doesn't really listen to the patient. He goes more off of records and cuts you off when you try to tell him something. And you can forget about privacy in his office. They'll jerk your pants down with the door open for the world to see. Plus they don't tell you about side effects. I got home and couldn't hardly walk. The office staff was very friendly helping me figure out if I needed to go to the ER or not, but he didn't tell me about the after effects. I'll be going to someone else.|I saw Dr. Weilert for just over a year for chronic pain and muscle paralysis. He's a competent physician, but he was either distracted or too busy to take the time to conduct a thorough investigation. Each visit, we'd "try" the same procedure with minimal relief, only to say that we could try something else during the last visit. Regrettably, my pain persists to this day. I just received a call stating that I had been dodging bills from Dr. Weilert's office. They are threatening to send my bills to a collection agency, despite no previous contact regarding these delinquent bills. I'm disappointed by the lack of transparency and care that is displayed by this clinic.|My fist visit with Dr. Brent Weilert was great.  He explain in detail my diagnosis and procedures to resolve my medical issues. We are off to a good start.

column3:
Conway Regional Advanced Pain Management offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Heath McCarver, MD. Our clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's needs. Located in Conway, Arkansas, we provide compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Dr. Heath McCarver is a board-certified Pain Management physician with extensive training in interventional pain techniques. He completed his medical education and specialized training in pain management protocols, bringing advanced expertise to Conway Regional. Dr. McCarver takes a patient-centered approach, developing customized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while minimizing medication dependence.

Our Pain Management Services

Comprehensive Pain Evaluation

Our clinic performs thorough assessments to identify pain sources and contributing factors. Each evaluation includes medical history review, physical examination, and diagnostic testing when necessary.

Interventional Procedures

- Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain relief

- Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation

- Nerve blocks for targeted pain control

- Radiofrequency ablation for longer-lasting relief

- Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions

Medication Management

We offer responsible medication management as part of comprehensive treatment plans. Dr. McCarver carefully monitors medication efficacy and adjusts treatments to maximize benefits while minimizing risks.

Multidisciplinary Approach

Our pain management strategies often incorporate physical therapy, behavioral health techniques, and lifestyle modifications to address pain from multiple angles.

Conditions We Treat

- Back and neck pain

- Sciatica and radicular pain

- Arthritis and joint pain

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Post-surgical pain

- Complex regional pain syndrome

- Fibromyalgia

- Headaches and migraines

Conway Regional Advanced Pain Management welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain conditions. Our clinic is conveniently located at 525 Western Ave, Suite 304, Conway, AR 72034.

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Heath McCarver, call 501-358-6560.

Visit our website for more information: [Conway Regional - Dr. Heath McCarver](https://www.conwayregional.org/find-a-provider/heath-mccarver-md)
column11: Heath McCarver, MD, is a Pain Management physician who practices with Conway Regional Advanced Pain Management. He is accepting new patients. To learn more, call 501-358-6560.

column40: DO NOT RECOMMEND!! Staff are rude, had to call every day for updates because they wouldn't call me back when changes were made. They don't communicate with each other and it caused a delay with my insurance company to approve a procedure, after already waiting a week because of their mistake, when I called them out on it they were extremely rude and hung up on me. I called back 3 days later for an update with my insurance and they said due to my "aggression" over the phone, they are releasing me from their clinic. They hide their mistakes by throwing patients out. Terrible!|I am a 16 year chronic migraine sufferer and I have been seeing Dr. Mccarver over a year and I love it! He does not treat me like a drug seeker as most doctors will and have. He listens to me and makes necessary changes as needed. The ONLY problem I've had is once he's told me one thing in ref to FMLA and then it wasn't charted bc he changed his mind. I wish pain doctors would do FMLA bc seeing a pain Dr is a sign of dealing with a chronic issue. I ended up losing my job, but I'm not blaming Dr. Mccarver; however, FMLA would have been a game changer for me. Other than this, I'm always treated nicely by the staff and I know I may work their nerve sometime. I absolutely love this pain management office.|I've been seeing Dr. McCarver for about 2 years and I am very happy with him and his staff. Mocek Spine & Joint Institute provides comprehensive pain management services in Little Rock, Arkansas. Led by Dr. Christopher K. Mocek, MD, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans.

Our clinic offers advanced interventional pain management solutions for patients suffering from:

Dr. Mocek utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify pain sources accurately. Treatment options include epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, and regenerative medicine approaches tailored to each patient's needs.

About Dr. Christopher K. Mocek, MD

Dr. Mocek is a board-certified pain management specialist with extensive training in interventional techniques. His approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, focusing on improving patients' quality of life through effective pain relief strategies.

With years of specialized experience, Dr. Mocek develops customized treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes. His commitment to patient education ensures individuals understand their condition and treatment options fully.

Patient-Centered Approach

column38: Angela Carr|D B|Becky Cummings|Dottie Belden|concorde9615|Nancy Rose|Lesley McGehee|Twiztid Chris
column40:
I was with Mocek Spine Clinic for close to 3 years and was sent a text that I have been resigned due to no show/rescheduling appointments 4 times this year (January, June, October, and November of this year).  I had an appointment on Friday, November 8th at 8 am and I honestly overslept.  My child was late for school on this date.  I called the office at 8:03 am and was honest and apologized.  I asked if I could just come in and wait until he had an opening to see me.  (Let's be honest these visits are very brief.)  I was told no and that I would be rescheduled for Tuesday.  I did request to not get another 30 late fee because I am struggling financially, but that is neither here nor there.  I was informed that someone would reach out to me because billing was done in Conway.  Around 12:30pm or 1pm, I received a text telling me that my appointment was cancelled and I have been resigned from the clinic.  I was devastated because I struggle with anxiety and finding another doctor and starting again is very hard.  I am discouraged and disappointed.   I asked to be reconsidered and was informed that Dr. Mocek was not willing to do that.  I have never asked for an increase in any medications and would bring my medication as requested to each visit    I never denied doing any random drug screen.  I only saw Dr. Mocek once a year and when I received injections. I am know faced with finding another pain management clinic because the back pain will come back within in six months.

I was excited that I just started feeling better when I was finally able to get the nerve burnt that was causing me so much pain.  I hope to find another pain management clinic that operates differently and genuinely care about patients and their health.|Dr MOCEK is absolutely fantastic. He is highly respected by his patients and by the Medical Community. He's caring, he listens, he's experienced and his staff is absolutely wonderful. The facility is very nice . He & his team will treat your pain with some of the most up to date treatments available.|DrMocek and his staff have been an enormous blessing to me. I have finally found a place that cares and listens to me. My APRN, Forrest, is amazing. He listens and helps me with all my pain issues. He is so understanding and easy to talk to. My life is better due to Mocek Spine Center|I love him i was in a wheel chair when I went to see him and now I don't even need my walker are cane.|No help whatsoever.  I went to Dr. Mocek for chronic back pain.  I saw him in person once then he sent me to PT.  It actually worked and I got better.  Maybe a couple weeks later I had a severe issue with my back and I could not use my right leg.  I could not walk and was in severe pain.  I called Dr. Mocek's office and they told me that I wasn't scheduled to see him for another two months.  They said they would give the info to the doctor.  Well, I never heard back.  I called again the next day and got hit with the same attitude.  They again told me I was not scheduled for another two months, then silence.  It was obvious I was bothering them.  I went to see a great chiropractor in conway who got me walking again.  Then when I went to see my primary care doctor he said Mocek was totally unnecessary.  He said between him and my chiropractor there was no need to see Mocek.  I cancelled the rest of my appointments and haven't looked back.

I can't say whether Dr. Mocek is a good doctor or not but what I can say is that he is WAY overbooked and it is affecting his bedside manner in a very negative way.  All I wanted to do was talk to the doctor an explain what was going on and get his advice.  He could have at least got on the phone with me and said go to the emergency room, or let me call in a prescription to help, or get to my office right away,  or something.  I was totally ignored as if he did not give a hoot.   I'll never go to him again.|I have been a patient of Dr. Mocek 's for over five years. He would not recognize me if he met me in the hall way. After his initial assessment and procedures you are handed over to uncaring/false nurse practitioners. No matter the severity of your pain they could not care less. I know the problems with the government take over of physicians' abilities to prescribe but no one has taken away  their abilities of being sympathetic and kind.  When in pain there are times when you just need a pat. Dr. Mocek's credentials are excellent but he has undertaken to meet the shortage of pain doctors  ( because he cares or because of the money, who knows) and that leaves him on a very tight schedule leaving very little time for courtesy. There is one excellent young lady nurse practitioner there but I apologize for not remembering her name. His front desk staff, lab tech, most of the nurses are nice, helpful, timely, caring, professional,  I would give them a gold star. I am writing this in the thrones of severe pain waiting for a MRI tomorrow A.M. after being put off over a year so I am undoubtedly biased. Summation: Excellent credentials, lousy patient care. Assess what you need, go from there.|I heard of Mocek Spine from my father who was also a patient of Doctor Mocek. Like my father, I've also been very impressed by the level of care from both Doctor Mocek & his team. My first encounter was with Lisa. She is caring & informative. It was a great first impression. During my consultation, It was quickly apparent that Dr. Mocek is extremely intelligent & experienced. He is also detailed oriented. He is professional and he treats me like a patient, not a number.  He spent a considerable amount of time explaining my results and different options during my first visit. For the first time in months, I finally feel like I have a promising go forward plan put in place.

Side note: This plan isn't a bunch of medications that will create side effects & additional issues.|Rude, mouthy, and stormed out of the room when I was talking to him. Told me that I have to go to another clinic after I have been seeing him for 3 years. His assistant kept interrupting and almost raised her voice to me.

Located in Jonesboro, Arkansas, our clinic provides specialized treatment for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Dr. Vecchiarelli and our dedicated team work diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain management needs.

At NEA Baptist Clinic, we utilize evidence-based techniques to diagnose and treat various pain conditions. This physician will spend 5 minutes with you and then act like you are stupid. He doesn't listen to his patients, doesn't care that they have individual lives, stories, injuries and such.
If you are shopping for a new doctor for your pain or your back, don't waste your time or money.
Dr Judkins will make you feel as though you are wasting HIS time yet not even lay a finger on you, no examination, doesn't look at a study- he knows it all.  Allow him to open his mouth around you & it becomes evident he doesn't care about anyone but himself.
He charted falsely about an extensive examination yet never touched me, never examined me, didn't even look me in eye!
Total waste of money. Will be contacting my insurance to report fraudulent documentation.|Judkins acted like I was wasting his time.  He talked to me as tho I had no clue of what I was talking about and the only reason I was in pain was because I am a senior. He dismissed 90% of what I said and laughed at my questions. I do not trust him to do anything to my back. I left his office in severe depression|Dr. Daniel Judkins has been my doctor for some time now, when I first saw him I could barely get around and was in extreme pain.  Now, my life has changed for the better.  I'm able to walk daily, complete household responsibilities, participate in things that I never thought I'd be able to do and more. Of course, all of this comes from determination from yourself as well but Dr. Judkins is a tremendous help.  His staff is also very kind and compassionate.   It's always a positive and pleasant experience.|Not only did Dr junkens not help alleviate my neck pain but his office assistants don't know how to properly bill insurance therefore I keep getting billed for my entire visit when I should have zero out of pocket pay.|Dr.Judkins after 2 years of seeing him just decided one day because I was late for an appt by 15 minutes moved me to his nurse practitioner .I had never met her and she was unfamiliar with my condition .She was condescending and less than interested in me .Drug screened me and said I had nothing in my system not even my non controlled medications I challenged her regarding the lab it was sent to .And she and he terminated me as a pt after two years of being a pt .But while he was branching out on his own away from Conway regional he no problem seeing me .They continue to send me a bill charging at a rate for seeing an M.D which I did not !Do not recommend thus clinic they just want to do procedures because that's where the money is at !|Dr Judkins has taken care of my wife for a couple of years ,she has an unusual condition that he took the time to become familiar with !He listens to her and takes his time !!His office staff is phenomenal with communication and we have never waited for him more than 15 minutes !|I needed to reschedule because I was in such pain that I couldn't get out of bed and they told me I would have to pay a $25 rescheduling fee! I wasn't just rescheduling because it wasn't convenient I was in severe pain! Unbelievable!|

I have been a pain patient with her and PTCOA since 2021 and it is worth the 2 hour drive to me to be seen by them|I would like to preface this by saying that I really like PTCOA for the most part. I was seeing Dr. Whaley, she left abruptly which left her patients having to see Dr. Brown. I had two rounds of injections. The first injections, Dr. Whaley did. I was given, sedatives and pain meds to make me comfortable. I felt minimal pain during the procedure. I have sleep apnea and my BMI is 52 which places me at a higher risk for complications per the anesthesiologist. So When I went to have my second injection done, the only thing I was giving was numbing medication and gas. The gas kind of made my chest hurt a little bit and the pain of the injections was excruciating. I wanted him to stop after he did only the right side, but we went ahead and did both sides. I do want to say that the injection has provided some relief to my lower back, but I am still in a lot of discomfort. They have me on a very low dose of a painkiller twice a day, but it doesn't help at all. I've tried to express this to multiple people And I just don't feel that I'm being heard. I understand the anesthesia but after that, I had a colonoscopy at a different facility and I did anesthesia. Propofol to be exact. I am looking forward to getting the nerve burns to help with this discomfort that I am experiencing, but if they can't find a way to sedate me, I just won't have the procedure. It was way too painful and uncomfortable. This is my honest opinion of the place. The staff at the front desk is phenomenal. The nurses that I have ran into are great even the doctors are great. column3:
Brian Travis Goodman, MD at Mercy Pain Management Clinic offers specialized care for chronic pain sufferers in Fort Smith, Arkansas. Dr. Goodman understands that persistent pain disrupts every aspect of lifefrom careers to relationships. His approach combines thorough patient communication with customized treatment plans that may include medication management, physical therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, or surgical interventions when necessary.

The clinic provides multidisciplinary treatment for various pain conditions. Dr. Goodman works closely with each patient to identify pain sources and develop effective management strategies. Treatment options are tailored to individual needs, focusing on both immediate relief and long-term pain management solutions.

Conditions Treated

Dr. Goodman specializes in treating:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Work-related injuries

  • Sports injuries

Dr. Goodman's Approach

"Living with pain for a long period of time can really be difficult because it interrupts your life - jobs, marriages, everything," says Dr. Goodman. "My job is gratifying because I can help people get relief from chronic pain, whether through medication, physical or cognitive therapy, or surgery. I am committed to communicating thoroughly with my patients to really understand the origin of their pain and to work together to find an appropriate treatment."

Location and Contact Information

Mercy Pain Management Clinic is conveniently located at 3501 W E Knight Dr, Fort Smith, AR 72903. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Brian Travis Goodman, call +1 479-709-6755. The clinic welcomes new patients seeking effective pain management solutions in the Fort Smith area.

For more information about Dr. Goodman's services or to request an appointment, visit the official Mercy website.

column40:
I was referred to Dr Whatcott about 7 months ago. My 1st visit with the Dr was good. He listened and recommended a pain management plan that was a light dose of Tylenol with Codeine. I went back monthly as required but never saw Dr Whatcott. I saw his Nurse Practioner. The NP took urine samples every visit. The NP said my urinalysis had traces of Morphine and Hydrocodone and was abnormal. I've never taken those drugs and did some research. I found out it was common for your body to metabolize Codeine into Morphine and Hydrocodone. It said 93% of Caucasians metabolize Codeine into Morphine, and up to 11% of the Codeine analysis can show as Hydrocodone. I explained this to the NP based upon my research and said it wasn't abnormal. Anyway after 4 "normal" urinalysis were misinterpreted as abnormal, I was told they wouldn't see me anymore.
This is outrageous. Someone supposedly managing your pain kicks you to the curb because they don't know how to interpret a urinalysis. A competent clinic would have researched this and have practioners with better education.|The Dr. & Nurses are very good I've never had a problem with the medical service. But the scheduling department are VERY RUDE, & from month to month the scheduling rules change. 1st it's you only need to call the week before you need to be seen, and the next it's you should've called a month ago. It's a nightmare dealing with them every month! The billing dept. Is also horrible there's only one person & she is RUDE!|The Dr. is nice the APRN ....Depends on which one you get on how you are treated. Overall experience your summary notes will be completely different than what your vist was. My chart says things were discussed that wasn't & says I was warned I was going to be terminated as a patient the APRN I saw didn't warn me or even tell me I was being terminated I had to find out by reading it in my visit summary online. They also don't list all your health problems in your chart and will suggest alternative treatment 1 time then never discusses it again and says you are constantly giving excuses for not having that treatment when in fact they are not following up with suggested treatment. If you use this office you better double check your chart against your visit.|Well  I'm been seeing Dr.Whatcott well over 5yrs  ,He has a great team they all work together,and make an awesome team.give them your business you will be proud you did..I pain free , great job everyone see you soon. Bruce|Not feeling very appreciated for my business as a new customer got a referral becouse new to town waited 2 months for an appointment only to be told the day before the I have to reschedule he's going on on vacay and now I gotta wait another month and a half for an appointment 4 months wait is atrocious when it's such a small town.|Has always been very compassionate and has empathy lacking in so many physician. I always received great care whenever I saw Dr Whatcott.|These are the most compassionate, caring doctors and medical staff hands down.
They have helped me heal and live a better quality life...pain free.|Doctor whatcom was one of the very nicest people I've ever met he was funny and he got me through a very difficult moment in my life I am so grateful for having meeting him Jenny Stevens thank you for all that you have done to get rid of my pain you are such a good old boy as a nurse's say you're a very special man thank you so much

Florida Regional Pain Management, PA

Florida Regional Pain Management, PA is Jacksonville's premier pain management clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our expert team combines innovative techniques with compassionate, patient-focused care to deliver effective pain relief solutions. Located conveniently at 8259 Bayberry Rd Suite 1 in Jacksonville, FL, our clinic serves patients throughout Northeast Florida with specialized interventional treatments.

Interventional Pain Management

Our physicians specialize in precise, targeted interventional procedures designed to address pain at its source. These minimally invasive techniques provide relief while reducing dependence on medication.

Advanced Therapy Options

We offer a comprehensive range of advanced treatments including:

- Laser Therapy - Non-invasive treatment for inflammation and tissue healing

- Plaquex Therapy - Innovative approach for cellular regeneration

- Ketamine Therapy - Effective for treatment-resistant pain conditions

- Regenerative Medicine - Utilizing the body's natural healing processes

- IV Nutritional Therapy - Supporting overall wellness and pain management

- Peptide Therapy - Targeted molecular approach to pain and inflammation

Patient-Centered Approach

At Florida Regional Pain Management, we believe in developing individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Our physicians take time to understand your pain history, perform thorough evaluations, and explain treatment options clearly. We emphasize education and active patient participation in the healing process.

column2: The Institute for Florida Pain Specialists
column3:
The Institute for Florida Pain Specialists in Jacksonville, FL serves patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions throughout Northeast Florida. Our dedicated team of pain management specialists combines advanced diagnostic techniques with comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. We believe in a "find the problem, fix the problem" mentality that addresses the root cause of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify pain sources. Treatment options range from minimally invasive procedures to medication management and physical therapy. Each treatment plan is customized to improve function and quality of life.

Our Expert Medical Team

Our physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine. Board-certified in pain management and anesthesiology, our doctors completed training at prestigious medical institutions. They stay current with the latest advancements in interventional pain techniques. This expertise allows us to offer cutting-edge treatments like spinal cord stimulation and regenerative medicine.

Patient-Centered Approach

We prioritize patient education and active participation in treatment decisions. Our team takes time to explain conditions and treatment options thoroughly. We coordinate care with primary physicians and specialists when needed. This collaborative approach ensures comprehensive pain management for optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

Located at 1604 Margaret St, Jacksonville, FL 32204, our clinic is easily accessible to patients throughout the region. New patients and referrals are welcome to contact us at +1 904-647-5266 or email referral@alifewithoutpainispossible.com. For more information about our services, visit our website at www.flpainspecialists.com.
column11: Email us today for more information at referral@alifewithoutpainispossible.com or tiffps.ga@gmail.com. We have multiple locations including Orange Park, Hilliard, Fernandina beach and our new Southpoint location at 4100 South point DR E, Jacksonville FL 32216.

column40:
I had my SIJ Ablation done on Friday January 24th and it went better then I expected it to be. It wasn't painful at all just a little uncomfortable. I had Danni as my Medical Assistant. She was very gentle and had very good bedside manners she kept me calm and talked me through it all. When I got home I did experience some slight soreness but nothing I couldn't tolerate just a heating pad. But Saturday when I woke up I felt absolutely wonderful like I had a new body. The pain is not even close to where it was 8/10 it's more like 2/10. I recommend Dr. Von Tobel for all your pain management. I'm not only an employee but I'm also a pain management patient and what better way to explain to patients about procedures when your a patient!|My Doctor Travis Randall von Tobel and his staff is amazing and outstanding that SI joint block shot and my Ablation shot is the best thing for me|My first time lowe lumbars, was a success today.....thanks to Dr. Von Tobel and Clarissa for helping ease my anxiety and walking me through the process, you guys are amazing|This office is filled with the most unprofessional staff EVER. Today my appointment is at 1115a. I get here and the office is full of patients while the staff is arguing about who does what and what's not getting done there are 6+ patients waiting to be seen or checked in. Then 1 with pink or purple hair tells all the patients after waiting for 30 mins and all seats are full that all in the triage area have to move in the rudest of ways . We are people in pain who don't move well or fast and your office is full and you close at noon. I took off from work to come to this appointment.  No one here values your time as a patient. I've NEVER been here less than 2 hrs waiting to be seen. If I didn't need the services  my meds and planned therapy I'd be gone. I wouldn't be a patient here if it wasn't so hard to start all over again with another pain specialist I'd be gone! This place is terrible!!!|I am very pleased with the results that I'm getting the injection treatments get better each time I get them the staff is phenomenal very caring and outgoing it's more family to me than just going to a doctor and Dr Vaughn outstanding both comical and professional he really knows his stuff the doctor makes you feel very comfortable when you're around him most doctor visits are not a pleasant trip I look forward to mine|Great experience!! Dr Von Tobel's staff is knowledgeable & cares about their patients. The procedures I've had effectively relieved my lower back pain & have allowed me to jump back into a more active life.|Travis doesn't listen to you at all barely let's u have a word he wants 2 put me on a suboxon even tho I told him it makes me feel suicidal he still gave it to me

Danni is a complete angel. I've never had a problem with and staff there. Just to sum it up. I love them. Mrs. Melissa in authorization is a wonderful person. The share an office with a nerve specialist group and they are great as well. The welcome each other's clients like they're there own. If you are in severe pain or suffer from chronic pain and don't want to have surgery. Give these guys a go. They will never bull crap you and tell you things even though it maybe hard to say. THEY CARE!!!! Dr. Von Tobal makes procedures so much easier. He is so laid back and profesonalized in the procedure room. He sings. He makes you laugh. HE KNOWS WHAT HE IS DOING . TRUST THE PROCESS. I've gotten my sister to go to him as well. Thank you.

Florida Spine & Pain Center offers comprehensive pain management solutions in Hollywood, Florida. Our goal is to relieve your pain today, without surgery. Located at 2 Oakwood Blvd Suite 195, our clinic specializes in non-surgical interventions for chronic and acute pain conditions affecting the spine and joints.

At Florida Spine & Pain Center, we provide personalized treatment plans addressing various pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify pain sources accurately. Treatment options include minimally invasive procedures, therapeutic injections, and medication management tailored to each patient's needs.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Sports injuries and work-related injuries

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Our Approach to Pain Management

We believe in comprehensive care that addresses the root cause of pain. Our physicians combine their extensive training with the latest evidence-based techniques. Patients receive individualized attention with treatment plans designed for long-term relief rather than temporary fixes.

Why Choose Florida Spine & Pain Center

Our practice stands out through our commitment to non-surgical approaches whenever possible. We emphasize patient education and active participation in the recovery process. Our convenient Hollywood location serves patients throughout Broward County with accessible pain management solutions.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation, please contact us at:

Phone: +1 954-447-5206

Address: 2 Oakwood Blvd Suite 195, Hollywood, FL 33020

Website: https://floridapaincenter.com/

Florida Spine & Pain Center welcomes new patients seeking effective pain relief without surgical intervention. Same-week appointments are often available for those experiencing acute pain conditions.

Florida Pain Medicine "Restore Function & Relive Life" provides comprehensive pain management services across multiple Florida locations. The clinic combines cutting-edge technology with a holistic approach to patient health, helping those suffering from chronic pain return to the activities they love. With specialized treatment centers in Tampa, St. Petersburg, Wesley Chapel, Zephyrhills, Brandon, Riverview, and Daytona Beach area offices in Ormond Beach and Port Orange, Florida Pain Medicine delivers accessible care throughout the region.

The experts at Florida Pain Medicine understand that effective treatment isn't just about alleviating pain���it's about helping patients regain control of their lives. Their multidisciplinary team develops personalized treatment plans addressing the root causes of pain conditions. Each patient receives individualized attention focusing on both immediate relief and long-term pain management strategies. The clinic's philosophy centers on minimally invasive techniques whenever possible, reducing recovery time and improving outcomes.

Specialized Treatment Services

Florida Pain Medicine offers advanced interventional procedures for various pain conditions including:

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back pain

  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation

  • Nerve blocks for neuropathic pain

  • Radiofrequency ablation for facet joint pain

  • Epidural steroid injections for disc-related issues

  • Regenerative medicine options including PRP therapy

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

At Florida Pain Medicine, patients experience compassionate care in a supportive environment. The clinical team takes time to educate patients about their conditions and treatment options. This educational approach empowers patients to participate actively in their recovery journey. The clinic prioritizes minimizing medication dependence through comprehensive treatment strategies that address pain's physical and emotional components.

Ormond Beach Location Information

The Ormond Beach office provides convenient access to pain management services for Daytona Beach area residents. Located at 325 Clyde Morris Blvd, Suite 400, Ormond Beach, FL 32174, the clinic offers state-of-the-art facilities in a comfortable setting. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 386-671-0600 or visiting the clinic's website at www.floridapainmedicine.com.

Florida Pain Medicine's board-certified physicians bring decades of specialized experience in pain management techniques. Their expertise covers interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative approaches to chronic pain. The clinical team stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine through ongoing education and research participation, ensuring patients receive the most effective treatment options available.

Pain Medicine Inc

Pain Medicine Inc is a comprehensive pain management clinic located in Lakeland, Florida, dedicated to providing relief for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our specialized medical team offers personalized treatment plans utilizing advanced interventional techniques and multidisciplinary approaches to improve quality of life for those experiencing persistent pain.

At Pain Medicine Inc, we provide a wide range of specialized treatments including:

- Epidural injections for spinal pain relief

- Facet injections targeting specific joint pain

- Radio frequency ablation for longer-lasting pain management

- Intra-thecal pump implantation for precise medication delivery

- Lumbar and lower extremity stimulation for chronic pain conditions

- Comprehensive vein center services for vascular-related pain

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including:

- Low back pain and spinal disorders

- Neck pain and cervical spine conditions

- Upper and lower extremity pain from various causes

- RSD pain (Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy)

- Multiple sclerosis related pain management

- Joint pain affecting mobility and quality of life

- Phantom limb pain following amputation

- Auto accident injuries requiring specialized care

Visit Our Clinic

Pain Medicine Inc is conveniently located at 541 Florida Ave S, Lakeland, FL 33801. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the most effective pain management solutions available.

For appointments or questions about our services, contact us at +1 863-682-7246 or visit our website at http://www.painmedinc.com/ to learn more about how we can help manage your pain and improve your quality of life.

Our medical team specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. At Port St. Lucie Pain & Medical Institute, we offer advanced interventional procedures for various pain conditions. Our treatments include:

Conditions We Treat

I was in a room and seeing Dr. Reyes within 15 minutes of my appointment time and he addressed all of my concerns and came up with a treatment plan that i feel good about! I  will definitely recommend my family and friends!|I have been going to doctor Reyes for a few years. T
past year during the covid-19 out break, I helped one of my neighbors get up off of the floor as He had fell.

Dr Reyes had never seen me like that before crying so hard& in that type , of horrific pain.

I couldn't put any weight on my feet ! Was in a Wheel Chair!!

He went to work right away to get me an emergency referral for injections .

I have had the injections and my back intermittently since 2001.

I had stopped getting injections a few years ago as I had very minimal results IF any?

He gave me the lower injections the following day .

I able to WALK out of the Office!

I really feel like it was a miracle &  the results have been very long lasting!

I would highly highly recommend Dr. Reyes for..ANY...services, he could do for you, to help you!

He is very compassionate and cares about each Person's needs an individual basis .

**MOST DOCTORS DO NOT MEET HISE HIGH STANDARD  OF PRACTICE**

Debi Brand ( Retired Nurse).|After never really knowing anything about chronic pain until I was struck by a car crossing the street, my physicians recommended that I needed to see a pain specialist due to the extent of my injuries. I chose Dr. Reyes based on all the excellent feedback people wrote about him on Google and once I had an appointment and met with him for the first time I thought that the reviews were seriously understated and did not even begin to tell how unbelievably awesome this Doctor really is. My first intake appointment he spent over 3 hours examinaing me and even finding things out that the other Dr's didn't even ever pick up on. He is a very kind, intelligent, caring man with an unbelievable wealth of knowledge in his field of experience. He explains everything to you in a manner that your able to understand him. He's not one of those Dr's that only want to see you for 5-10 minutes and write you a bunch of scripts and send you on your way. He really listens to all of what you relay to him and does a good job at pinpointing the types of medical treatments or medicine that you would benefit from the best. He's not there to load you up with a bunch of pain meds to cover up the pain, he rather use other forms and techniques that are in my opinion much more effective and helpful with my condition and I let him know that I want to be on lowest dose of pain medicine possible so I'm able to function and he said that the less pain medicine is the best course of treatment. So far I've only been seeing him for a little while and like any other specialist you need time to find the correct medicine and treatments that benefit you the best and I think we are just about there. He provided me a new treatment when I last saw him and after filling it and using it I was able to walk without use of my cane for first time, then was able to go for a nice long refreshing night walk that was about 8 miles and didn't feel a ounce of pain, not even after going to bed and waking up the next morning. I'd also like to commend his staff for their professionalism, politeness, kindness, extreme helpfulness and again truly caring about the patients they treat. All in all I would say everyone working there goes above and beyond what is necessary in every single way possible. It's a dog gone shame that all Doctor's offices out there could not be as superior as I feel this one is when it comes down to true and actual patient care. It's blatantly obvious that money is not even on their radar as a mitigating factor of why they are in business, you can immediately tell that it is all about them caring and wanting the people who go there to truly get the assistance to live a better life and be able to do simple thiings that may feel debating to someone in chronic pain, so the patients quality of life greatly improves. I lucked out blindly choosing Dr. Reyes from a very long list of similar specialists in the Fort Lauderdale Area, but I am so great-full that in this case it was really good luck that I wound up finding out after meeting him and beginning to work with him. I would love to have given the Google rating a heck more than just 5 stars cuz that does not even come close to giving this facility the proper recognition it truly deserves. I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants a Dr. who takes the time to listen and your well being is first and foremost to his patients and I really wish there were many more other types of Dr's and specialists like Dr. Reyes out there. It would make just enough difference in one facet of people's lives that they could feel good about obtaining medical care and not have to worry about the Dr. having a God complex or strictly in it for the money and they charge you a small fortune to see them for 15 minutes and hardly anything you'd like gets accomplished cuz they are just rushing you out for the next person to come in. I'm really glad I ended up here and hope that this review helps other's to choose this facility in the event that they also need to be seen by this type of specialist, you won't and be disappointed.|Dr. Leo Reyes is my pain management doctor who has lots of experience helping people with chronic pain such as myself. Ricardo, his office mngr. and assistant, is very knowledgeable very helpful and together, this is one of the best pain management offices that I know of.

column40:
Dr Joseph has been a great doctor! He didn't just shove a pain pill script at me, and that, in itself, let me know I was seeing the right doctor! He is working with me to find a solution to my pain. Some clinics see you have severe pain so they give you pills and send you on your way, but I actually feel like he cares. I've told him, and his staff that I didn't want pills, I wanted to real solution. I  will admit, he is definitely a character, but that's one thing that will always keep me coming to him.
Here's why I left off a star. The girl at the front desk seems like it bothers her to do her job. Almost like she's annoyed by people coming in for their appointments. She's never been friendly to anyone I've seen her interact with. Whatever you do, don't try to ask her question outside of handing her paperwork or money.
There is one lady that usually checks me out and sets my next appointments and she is super sweet. The rest of the staff has been good to me.
Overall, if you can't get past the front, the people behind the doors are pretty great, especially the doctor. I hope this helps someone as I gave a very honest, straightforward opinion. This place is definitely worth it|I have been a patient of Dr. Joseph for many years. He is very compassionate and I always enjoy when I get to see him. He is very knowledgeable about alternative treatments and I appreciate that he has shared this knowledge with me on many visits. Instead of prescription meds, I have been able to treat my arthritis with Turmeric Curcumin. He is always striving to make his practice better for patients.|Teresa is a very friendly and  thorough Nurse Practitioner ! She is the best in the office and I hope I can continue to see only her! The staff is great as well! As far as Dr. Joseph, I have seen him around five times and we have not had a decent conversation yet. His visits last about two minutes with me if that long. Some people can't connect and he and I can not!! I have learned nothing about my health problems from him. I will stick with Teresa because She shows concern and listens and talks to me about my problems with my pain!|Dr. Joseph is a caring and good doctor. I had injection in my neck I didn't feel a thing,gives excellent injections and I still have relief after 3 weeks. For me is unusual. Highly recommend Dr. Joseph|Super knowledgeable and always answers any questions I may have.
I see Teresa, she is absolutely the best, listens and explains my aches and pains.
This office has kept me upright and moving for several years.|I have used Dr. Joseph and Teresa fir a few years now. Awsome people treat you with compassion....and understanding. Had ablation a couple weeks ago...woke up Mon morning screaming in pain. Could not use my right leg at all. Call..left a message. Young lady called me back and informed me there was no way to see the Dr till my regular scheduled appointment. I was instructed to go to ER. I did....the next day pain was still excruciating....young lady stated that Dr. Joseph was booked and Teresa out of the country. I am in sever pain and she sounded as she could really not care.  Totally shocked. Never been treated this way from Dr. Josrph office. So I lay here with pain pills from ER (I preferred not to have) and Ice packs praying for relief.
Update a week later....
Made a appointment with Hughston Clinic. Got in immediately.  Got approval for MRI in 2 days. WOW. usually takes weeks. These Dr's. do not play around. NURSES are kind and extremely concerned. Think alot of Dr. Joseph and Teresa but the middle man...(nurse) persuaded me to go get help else where when she could care less when I was crying and begging for help and her response was Dr. Joseph is book and Teresa is out of town.. not willing to take a message or have Dr.Joseph to call me back.|The staff was very pleasant and professional. Made me feel comfortable and at ease. 1 of the best doctors if his field.|Been seeing Dr. Joseph and his team for more than 10 yrs they have always treated Me and my Wife great.

Pain Care Florida - Stuart offers specialized pain management services for patients throughout the Stuart area. Our highly experienced specialists are skilled in treating both mild and chronic pain symptoms. We understand that mild or acute pain usually comes on suddenly, while chronic pain persists over time, requiring different treatment approaches.

At Pain Care Florida, we take multidisciplinary actions toward pain management. Our physicians, consultants, and medical assistants collaborate to develop personalized, holistic treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. This team-based approach ensures comprehensive care addressing all aspects of pain.

Our Treatment Philosophy

Our primary goal is making pain more manageable for our patients. We focus on enabling a satisfactory return to a full and active life through targeted interventions and ongoing support. Each treatment plan is customized based on individual pain conditions, medical history, and lifestyle factors.

Conditions We Treat

Our Stuart clinic specializes in addressing various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

Expert Pain Specialists

Our team consists of board-certified pain management physicians with extensive training and experience. They stay current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to provide evidence-based treatments. Our specialists have completed advanced medical education in pain management techniques and interventional procedures.

Visit Our Stuart Location

Pain Care Florida - Stuart is conveniently located at 111 SE Osceola St, Stuart, FL 34994. We welcome new patients seeking relief from both acute and chronic pain conditions. For appointments or questions about our services, call us at +1 866-228-7676 or visit our website at www.paincareflorida.com.
column11: We are highly experienced specialists and are skilled in treating patients with both mild and chronic pain symptoms. Mild or acute pain usually comes on abruptly or suddenly, while chronic pain is usually ongoing. We take multidisciplinary actions toward pain management, our physicians, consultants and medical assistants work together to develop a personalized, holistic plan to decrease and relieve each patient's pain. Our goal is to make pain more manageable and enable a satisfactory return to a full and active life.

column40:
I love Heather!  She is great at l listening!  Amazing best side manner and doesn't treat me as a number.  She genuinely cares and remembers things we've talked about months ago.|Dr. Levine is great, he listens intently and makes sure that your needs and concerns are met. The front desk ladies are super helpful, patient and kind. No one likes doctor appointments but these folks sure do make it suck less. Thank you all!|Dr Alvarez and his staff are excellent. He cares about his patients and is vey humane. He has excellent bedside manner. He is Easy to talk to. I would recommend him to anyone. He is great|The staff is welcoming, upbeat personalities and knowledgeable.

Val has a great attitude, she did not rush during my appointment.  I appreciate her expertise and willingness to take the time we needed to discuss my situation.

Thank you
Pain Care FL
Ida L|From the scheduling of the appointment to check in the service and professionalism was outstanding.  At my first appointment, the nurse, Erica was thorough in gathering my history and the background for my visit. She then took me to see Lauren Gold the P.A. Ms. Gold was exceptional and had already reviewed much of my recent medical history. She was so knowledgeable and had made suggestions that she planned to review with Dr. Levine. She left the exam room and returned a short time later with Dr. Levine, who was also thoroughly versed in my health history.
Over the last 3 years I've been treated by numerous specialists across many Healthcare systems. Many providers gave me 5-10 minutes of their time, and knew little about my health history at the appointment. Often, I felt as though those provider's didn't try to understand and correct the  source of my health concern, they just wanted to treat the treat my symptoms.
Dr. Levine, Ms. Lauren Gold P.A. and their nurse, Erica made feel as though they cared! Their confidence in their treatment plan following their review of my health created renewed hope, after three years of numerous disappointments. Excellent experience, and I highly recommend Pain Care of Florida in Stuart.|I am no longer a patient with this firm, & yes, I am a little disgruntled. Here is my issue. I've had a spinal issue for over 50 years that requires me to take NORCO to relieve the pain. This office requires people who take strong medication take a urine test every 3 months. It is not a Florida law they do this, but I do understand their need to find out who is abusing the need for painkillers. I went from monthly visits to once every 3 to 4 months (this is usually when I run out of medication). One again they asked me to take a urine test after 4 months & I had taken a urine test on my last visit. BTW, these urine tests are conducted by an in-house lab, of which is not covered by my medical insurance (I don't know about others). Upon further investigation, I have found no information that "Mobile Anesthesia Associates" (which performs the test) is a certified lab. Paincare does not require you take a urine test via a certified lab before your next appointment. IMO these charges are unethical & against my principals.|Today I saw Lauren Gold APRN. It was my first visit with Lauren. She was incredible!  Lauren's demeanor was caring and she knew my background prior to seeing her in the patient's room. I recommend her %.|Had my first visit with  Dr Levine and Lauren APRN. They listened to my problems and quickly had a plan in place for my recovery. I felt very encouraged and left the office feeling positive.

Florida Anesthesiology & Pain Clinic, P.A. offers comprehensive pain management solutions in Orlando, Florida. Our dedicated team specializes in providing effective relief to promote pain-free lifestyles for patients of all backgrounds. Located conveniently at 933 Lee Rd, Suite 105, we serve the greater Orlando community with personalized care plans tailored to each individual's needs.

Our clinic provides advanced interventional procedures and multidisciplinary approaches to pain relief. We treat various conditions including chronic back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Our physicians utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify pain sources accurately before developing targeted treatment plans.

Expert Medical Team

Our board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists bring decades of combined clinical experience. Each doctor has completed extensive fellowship training in pain medicine following their anesthesiology residency. This specialized education enables our team to offer both cutting-edge and time-tested treatment options for complex pain conditions.

Treatment Approaches

We offer a comprehensive range of treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain relief

  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain management

  • Radiofrequency ablation for longer-lasting results

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions

  • Medication management when appropriate

  • Physical therapy coordination and recommendations

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our physicians take time to understand each patient's pain history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals. This collaborative approach helps develop effective pain management strategies that improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Contact us at (407) 720-3801 to schedule your consultation. Visit our website at https://fapc.co/ for more information about our services and approach to pain management.

Florida Anesthesiology & Pain Clinic is located at 933 Lee Rd, Suite 105, Orlando, FL 32810.

column40:
Dr. Xavier and staff were extremely welcoming and provided excellent services. At first I was overwhelmingly nervous about receiving a shot in my neck, but he was very quick and efficient. I definitely would recommend this practice to anyone who is experiencing pain and need services provided. Truly impressed and my visit took less than an hour.|First and foremost I'd like to thank Dr Xavier and his staff for their professionalism and their caring for patients. His expertise with the injections has given me a little more comfortness with my pain.  I'd recommend anyone to Dr Xavier.  Again, thank you so much.|Dr. Ravi and staff are very good.
The injection for my lumbar area was very acute 9 - 10
Immediately after the first injection I felt some relief. Very thankful.|The staff is caring. The Dr's value the importance of helping people who are suffering from pain and they show it by wasting no time to help. No long waits and straight to the point to get you pain relief quick. They also help with financial assistance for those in need. All I can say is thank you for caring about those of us who are going through very difficult life altering times.|Read this review carefully before getting any services from this office. I was involved in a car accident and was under treatment through a different clinic. I was referred by my attorney because apparently they have used them in the past. On my first visit, I was basically greeted by the receptionist and the doctor himself Dr. Xavier. Basically rushed me through the paperwork requesting signatures and didn't really go into detail of the procedure. Feeling pressure and rushed, I signed all documents requested. After the treatment, which I felt very uncomfortable, I requested for it to be the last treatment. They insisted that I needed to treat at least once more. I contacted my attorney and explained the situation and they said to try to follow the doctors directions since he was the professional. I had no choice but to follow the directions.  Once I walked in to the office, the doctor said that if I wanted to be the last treatment, that he would do two treatments that day so I wouldn't have to return. Apparently the doctor had found out the limits on the policy we were going after from the accident and said: "your case is looking very good". Once we walked in, I felt like they did a lot more than what they were supposed to. I felt horrible for several weeks after that and apparently they tried to exhaust all the funds from the limits on our case against our other party. I'm only sharing my experience so you are extremely careful when coming into this office. Dr. Xavier is not concerned for your health and is simply going after any money he can get from insurance companies. Not sure how he is still in business but I will not recommend him to anyone at all after my experience in his office. Be aware and consult your attorney or other specialists prior to agreeing doing treatment with them.|Doctor Xavier and his staff are fast and professional. They make sure everything gets done and explains after and in a timely matter. Very Happy with Dr Xavier and his friendly staff.|Best staff and experience I've had!  After 6 back surgeries, and a car accident, Meg did a great job assisting me with insurance issues, getting the injections timely, and properly.|Don't even bother. If you call asking if they do certain procedures or if you need to keep searching you'll just get berated by someone who I assume was the doctor after the receptionist passed the phone to him. Not every office provides surgical options and clearly asking about them makes this doctor feel defensive. He constantly spoke over me when I attempted to ask questions and hung up on me when I tried to explain that I was just calling to get information.

Florida Pain Medicine "Restore Function & Relive Life" provides comprehensive pain management services across multiple Florida locations. The clinic combines cutting-edge technology with a holistic approach to patient health, helping those suffering from chronic pain return to the activities they love. With specialized treatment centers in Tampa, St. Petersburg, Wesley Chapel, Zephyrhills, Brandon, Riverview, and Daytona Beach area offices in Ormond Beach and Port Orange, Florida Pain Medicine delivers accessible care throughout the region.

The experts at Florida Pain Medicine understand that effective treatment isn't just about alleviating pain���it's about helping patients regain control of their lives. Their multidisciplinary team develops personalized treatment plans addressing the root causes of pain conditions. Each patient receives individualized attention focusing on both immediate relief and long-term pain management strategies. The clinic's philosophy centers on minimally invasive techniques whenever possible, reducing recovery time and improving outcomes.

Specialized Treatment Services

Florida Pain Medicine offers advanced interventional procedures for various pain conditions including:

  • Spinal Pain Management - Including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and sciatica

  • Joint Pain Therapy - For arthritis, sports injuries, and degenerative conditions

  • Nerve Pain Treatment - Addressing neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome

  • Cancer Pain Management - Compassionate care for oncology patients

  • Interventional Procedures - Including epidural injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation

Port Orange Location Details

The Port Orange facility offers convenient access to pain management services for Daytona Beach area residents. Located at 780 Dunlawton Ave STE 103, Port Orange, FL 32127, the clinic provides a comfortable, patient-centered environment. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 386-671-0600 or visiting the clinic's website at www.floridapainmedicine.com.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

Florida Pain Medicine prioritizes patient education and involvement in treatment decisions. The clinical team takes time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. This collaborative approach helps patients understand their pain management journey and actively participate in their recovery process. The clinic's goal remains consistent across all locations: helping patients overcome pain limitations and return to functional, fulfilling lives.

The doctor is very thorough and takes the time to educate the patient about his visit. It is a comfortable atmosphere and easy to talk to everyone in the office. There's not a single complaint that I can have about this office. Everyone is quite courteous to me.|Worst pain management appointment and experience ever!

I was charged as a first time patient 300$, and nothing no urine, no exam, no mri was done as if I was a first time patient, beings I was seen a few months prior I guess they just wanted a fast cash collection from a patient they knew they could not help. I have been perscribed 120 15mg oxy, probably due to the fact I am allergic to Tylenol, and the fact I am in a wheelchair due to AVN in my hips. These people knew of such information, and after excepting my 300$ told me they will try to write something close if not better because of my pain level. After that it took 4 days of calling back an fourth hunting down this prescription they wrote, with no clue of what was written. The first script written was send to North Carolina , still to this day I do not understand why. Then it took three days to fix the location of the script, by the time I located this script, it was 4 almost 5 days of being sick from being dependent on this medication, and I then found out I was written 90 10/325, almost half of what I have been perscribed the past 4 months prior. So it was all pretty much a scam to receive my 300$ an say they did something so they did not have to give me my money back witch I asked for the first three days prior, after being very unhappy an I voiced this for 3 days......so I'm writting this a second time, because it seems they removed my first review I guess hiding what truly happen an what they do to patient's they can not help. He will make you feel that you are the most important person in the world.!|Staff, Dr's. and P.A. are great! They are very caring. They now have the technology to measure patients inflammation %. I was impressed. They offer programs to decrease the inflammation in the body which with proper nutrition to decrease inflammation for a healthier and less pain lifestyle.|I have been a patient in this practice for more than three years, and the members of the staff have always been friendly and courteous. Two of my favorites are downright cheerful which is always a delight.
Most of the time I see Al, who is a Physician's Assistant rather than a M.D. At least I believe that is the designation, my apologies if that is incorrect. Al has always been attentive, caring, knowledgeable and forthright. I have never felt rushed or hurried while he was listening to me. He was on time for my appointment, and I bet he was on time for the appointment after me.
This summer I had the pleasure of meeting Dr. Kaiafas and subsequently three appointments with him. He, too,  was prompt, attentive and responsive to my situation.
I would recommend this practice to anyone who needed help with chronic pain issues. I would not have stayed this long with doctors who were not responsive to a patient's needs.|Dr Kiafias is a wonderful physician.  His listening and medical skills are first rate. A caring and compassionate doctor.
