column40:
I've received superior care from Dr. Azeem, Dr. Verdosa and the entire team here. Dr. Azeem has assembled a great team of front office staff and caring, focused providers.  I appreciate that they have a partnership with the VA. It has allowed me to access great quality care near my home in Riverview.

A plus is the upbeat music  flowing through .
Keep up the great work!|My spinal issues started 23 years ago and so at this point it's my entire spine and it affects all of my limbs. I started seeing Dr Azeem almost a year ago and within that time he and his staff have done so much to help me have a better life. From steroid injections to RFA procedures and sciatic nerve injections have really done so much to improve my lower back and legs. I am so happy that I found Dr Azeem and his team. I Thank you all for helping me.|I had an amazing experience with Florida Spine.  They were attentive to my needs and took good care of me.  I would recommend their services to anyone.|The office and everyone  working there were welcoming, courteous and helpful.   Dr. Azeem was fully engaged with me and spent a great deal of time discussing my issues and explaining possible procedures  to address my two spinal issues....after the MRI he ordered.  The doctor is extremely knowledgeable  in understanding the root of my problems.   I left his office with hope for the future, which I have not felt for quite some time.|I gave this a three star because of the long wait time sitting in the waiting room. My appt. was at 2pm I arrived 15 minutes early, as told by office, but did not get called in until after 3pm. To me, it's stressful enough going to see a new doctor, plus the stress of losing time and pay from being away from work longer than expected. No one needs the added stress of waiting 1.5 hrs to be called in to see a doctor.

Despite the long wait, Dr Azeem was awesome. He was very informative about possible procedures to help with the issue at hand. He was kind, respectful and even funny at times. My experience with him was great! The staff, including his medical assistant were very friendly and helpful.

I am returning to the office for a procedure. I do hope they get me in sooner than last time.|Very dissatisfied with the care and professionalism. After four months of chronic back pain and doing physical therapy as directed (without improving) they still refuse to do injections. Nomen Azeem first told me that we could do
the injections for a long term fix, then on the follow-up appointment he went back on it. They seem to be more interested in growing their business rather than actually help people.|I had an extremely negative experience at Dr. Nomen Azeem's clinic staff receptionist and PT. on March 14 . As a new patient in severe pain, I expected understanding and assistance, but instead, I was met with rudeness and indifference.
The receptionist, Alena, was uncooperative and argumentative when I failed to correctly complete the online paperwork, which I received just minutes before my appointment. Instead of explaining the procedure, she treated me with disdain, rolling her eyes and becoming defensive. Another staff member joined in, escalating the situation further, and the receptionist even laughed at me. after trying to de-escalate the situation by asking for her manager she said wasn't at this office and wouldn't give me her name. She told the staff I didn't want to fill out the online paperwork?  When I just had a question about not filling it out correctly. It was insane im still in shock.

The physical therapist, who was supposed to help me, was uninformed about my situation. He said I needed to apologize to the receptionist, despite not witnessing the encounter. And that the manager will be calling me this was at 10 not a soul has called. I was crying and in so much pain I was so excited to get PT and was going to have surgery now I'm just shocked that his staff doesn't have the patience for a severely in pain person. I'm not on medication because I chose a clinic that didn't give you medication.

This ordeal left me feeling even more distressed and in pain. The lack of empathy and understanding, particularly from a clinic specializing in pain management, was appalling. I left feeling like a burden rather than a patient.

Despite the reputation of Dr. Azeem, the behavior of the staff is inexcusable. A pain clinic should have employees who understand and empathize with patients, not those who treat them with disdain. I was left in more pain due to the stress of this encounter and would strongly advise others to avoid this clinic.

As I sat with the PT who has no idea despite the online paperwork and my appt on March 12 and my (information mri etc ) I thought this is who I will be dealing with if I get the surgery. I left feeling like I wanted to die cause it was abusive. The receptionist smiled cause she knew I was the one who was leaving and she was happy and laughed back to any camera. I was crying as I got into my car. Sad that this is his staff. Which after surgery that's who you deal with. I understand I was in severe pain but anyone who knows me knows I'm a kind person I am writing this cause I don't want a soul to be bullied and feel like I did and I'm sorry I wish this Dr knew how horrible his staff was and how they don't understand pain patients at all.  I'm so glad they showed me over her misunderstanding who they were. I spoke with a professional who works in this industry and he was floored. He knows me well. He said that's borderline abuse. I understand misunderstandings and such but I was told to apologize and not a soul but me and this very unkind unfriendly receptionist were the only two that were in the room far away from others.  I was warned it was on camera ?! To be honest I'm still in shock
Sadly this is the way they operate.  You'll love the Dr and his pa. But remember after the surgery you are dealing with a staff who doesn't care and no matter what you do isn't about the patient who is paying their salary but about themselves.  That's the worst thing in my 52 years I've ever experienced ever.  Ever.  Writing this for others. And I pray he gets new staff members. I'm not okay from it all at all. I'm in more pain and feel like I was abused.

Patients in extreme pain may not always be 100 percent on every level. And they should understand this. I only wanted to ask her if I should give him my personal paperwork.   yelled and bullied by Staff members which was beyond anything I've ever experienced. she thought I was complaining about the online paperwork? and I was just trying to help the PT who in return and was never there and told me I owe her an apology.horrific experience|I want to extend my heartfelt appreciation to Dr. Azeem and Nurse Practitioner Ashley for their invaluable support in the restoration of my quality of life. With a decade spent dedicated to the demanding field of emergency medicine followed by a transition to becoming a paramedical tattoo artist, my back has endured considerable strain and discomfort. It appeared that there was no relief in sight from the daily pain that had become an unwelcome constant in my life.

Before seeking treatment at Florida Spine and Pain Specialists, I diligently explored a multitude of avenues in search of relief. These included physical therapy, massage therapy, topical treatments, and even alternative therapies like cupping, yet the debilitating pain persisted.

From the very outset of my treatment and continuing throughout its course, I have undergone a remarkable transformation. I now find myself capable of maintaining an upright posture with ease, enjoying more restful nights of sleep, and, most significantly, actively participating in the lives of my children.

The profound impact that Florida Spine and Pain Specialists have had on my well-being is beyond measure. Their expertise, compassion, and unwavering dedication have not only alleviated my physical discomfort but have also instilled in me a renewed sense of hope and vitality. I am profoundly grateful for the exceptional service they have provided and the positive influence they have had on my life. From the depths of my heart, I extend my gratitude for affording me the opportunity to regain my health and actively engage in my son's childhood.

Florida Pain Institute - Merritt Island provides comprehensive pain management services for residents of Brevard County and surrounding areas. Located at 595 N Courtenay Pkwy Suite 101, Merritt Island, FL 32953, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based interventional procedures and personalized treatment plans.

Our board-certified pain specialists offer advanced treatments for various pain conditions including:

  • Spinal Pain Management - Treating herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and degenerative disc disease
  • Joint Pain Relief - Addressing arthritis, bursitis, and sports injuries
  • Nerve Pain Treatment - Managing neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and sciatica
  • Cancer Pain Management - Providing comfort for patients with cancer-related pain
  • Headache & Migraine Relief - Offering specialized protocols for chronic headache disorders

    • Advanced Treatment Options

    The Florida Pain Institute utilizes state-of-the-art techniques including:

  • Epidural steroid injections
  • Radiofrequency ablation
  • Spinal cord stimulation
  • Platelet-rich plasma therapy
  • Medication management
  • Minimally invasive procedures

    • Experienced Medical Team

    Our physicians have completed specialized fellowship training in pain management from prestigious institutions. With decades of combined experience, our doctors stay current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to provide optimal care.

    Patient-Centered Approach

    We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Each treatment plan is customized based on thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing. Our goal is improving quality of life through effective pain relief.

    For appointments or questions, contact us at +1 321-784-8211 or visit our website at [https://floridapaininstitute.net](https://floridapaininstitute.net/?y_source=1_MTI5MTQ4NjItNzE1LWxvY2F0aW9uLndlYnNpdGU%3D).

column40:
!!!Not only did this office mishandle the situation, but they also broke doctor-patient confidentiality in a way that is deeply concerning. No patient should ever have to go through this. My mother-in-law immediately switched doctors, and I highly recommend that others do the same. Stay far away from this place. Let's me explain why:

I'm writing this review based on my mother-in-law's experience, and I am absolutely shocked at the unprofessionalism of this office. What happened to her was highly unusual and completely unacceptable.

Doctor Crane, change her medication and then she called their office to tell them the medication didn't work for her. And that she needed to go back to the pain medication that she was on for 8 years. And they called the police on her and my father-in-law--two elderly individuals. The police got involved, and she was suddenly being accused of being suicidal, which was completely false. She never said anything of the sort, yet she was treated as if she were a danger to herself. This caused her an enormous amount of distress and shock. highly recommend that others do the same. Stay far away from this place!!|If they can't give you injections, they won't do nothing for you!
They will have you spend an hour and a half when they send you their paperwork to fill out and then they will say that you might are a candidate for opioid pain medication!
When you get there, you'll have a person not a nurse or anything take your blood pressure then tell you they won't be able to do that but they would love you injections your neck!
If you've been there, let me know cause have A lawsuit against them!
Wrongful malpractice!
It's on YouTube check it out
I filmed recorded ! the whole event!
If you're in pain, don't go there cause all they wanna do is rip you off and your insurance company for money and not help you!

That's where they messed up!
We're gonna hold them to the line!
Justice!
Not gonna stop  !
Till Out of Business!
Make sure you call the state and the city and the government on their practice until they get investigated properly'
Hope you get out of pain, but these people put you in pain and they put it in their pockets!
They're going to jail!|I had injections for the first time here today.  Very minimal waiting before they called me in. I don't think I've ever been to a medical facility that was as kind and considerate as all the employees were there. They talked me through things and made me feel safe. And believe me, I was a nervous wreck. I have to go back a few more times and I'm okay with that. I would highly recommend this facility for my family and friends. Thank you Florida Pain Institute for making my appointment professional as well as personal. .|Don't go here. I have been going for 10 months and still haven't gotten anything for pain my back due to broken vertebrae. All they want to do is drug screening each time I go and its $85 each time. And I only have seen the doctor once on my first visit. Seeing a PA since then and she hasn't done anything for me.  Such a waste of time and money. I have suffered too  long and going somewhere else that
has much higher reviews.|I have multiple family Members who are Patients at Florida Pain Institute. The scheduling department is horrific. They have three locations but only perform certain procedures at each office. Good Luck at the Palm Bay office. The Doctors
must think the drive is to far as generally you can only see a ARNP. The staff in PB in the past was inept and currently most of them are new. Retention must be a problem. They probably treat staff the same as their patients. Thus far we've had injections and nerve ablations. Neither provided much relief. I ended up resorting to a cervical surgery. The cost of my cervical fusion and disc replacement was similar in cost to the nerve ablations. Hence the reason they push these procedures so hard. $$ I am currently waiting for my Mother who had surgery scheduled at 9 AM. It is 11:20 and she is still sitting in the waiting room. To add to that, she is in pain, hasn't had anything to eat and I took the day off to care for her. I will be seeking different options for Pain Management Doctors and I would suggest you do too!  This is the third procedure with a wait over 2 hours. We received a 10$ Starbucks Gift card for our last experience. Pay attention to the reviews.|This institution is concerned with making money. They push you to having procedures where they charge big bucks. They wouldn't even tell me the cost of the numerous procedures they suggested.  They do not care about what need or want. Do it their way or go somewhere else. That's their motto! Have fibromyalgia and live alone, who is going to take care of me during the five procedures they want to do. They have no concern except making money. They have no respect for your personal needs. It's all about $$$$. He got a medical degree from the college of the Caribbean?|I have been a patient here for over 30 years and highly recommend if you're experiencing chronic pain|Tampa Pain Relief Clinic has many location in Florida. Before I went to have a procedure done, the Merritt Island location called me to let me know how much it was going to be out of pocket. Once the Merritt Island location gave me the price I said that I could not afford it at this time and canceled the procedure. The next day I got a call from the Melbourne location, they said if I had the procedure at their location, I would only need to pay the copay. The reason for the difference in price I was told, is because the Merritt Island location used a third party surgical center and the Melbourne location does the procedure in the office. Before I had the procedure, the Melbourne location called me and said that they called the insurance company and I only would be required to pay the copay. So I did have the procedure at the Melbourne office. Then when I got the bill, it was the same price that the Merritt Island office was going to charge me.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr. Lentz since he started there. I love him. He takes the time and explains everything which, includes options. I highly recommend him if you are serious looking for a pain management Doctor. Also if he isn't available ask for Gary. They are the only 2 Drs that gave me shots for my back that actually worked.|I was familiar Dr. Lenz from the Lake Worth Surgical Center. After my Doctor of 15 years retired I was referred to Dr. Lenz. My long time Doctor was great, he really took care of me. But in just one appointment with Dr. Lenz I already feel like I'm in the right place. Not only explaining how each issue affects us, but simply by understanding and being compassionate toward someone living with several chronic issues. I would recommend Dr. Lenz to anyone who is serious about their care and who is responsible enough to manage your daily life with the tools and treatments he offers and recommends. I know im in good Hands here. Thank you Dr. Lenz.|Good morning, Dr. Gatz your office staff are very knowledge, professional and respectful. Every time I call due to reschedule my appointment or coming late the staff be very honest with me were can I come or not simple as that. Keep up with the good work Comprehensive Pain Team.|Dr Gatz is my hero! I was suffering from RSD for years before I saw him. He has an awesome bedside manner and came to see me twice in the hospital after my surgery. People complain about waiting too long. So what when you are getting great care. He is busy but has always been there for me. The office girls are great! The only complaint I have is trying to reach the office. I can reach Dr. Gatz, but not the office. Bring a book because you will wait.
I am adding to my review 7 years later as I am still a patient at Comprehensive Pain of the Palm Beaches (which should tell you how incredible the doctors, nurse practitioners, medical assistants, physicians assistants, and the front office and back office staff is). While things have changed with the office and with Dr. Lentz heading the medical staff. It's all been for the best! The longest I have waited is no more than 15 minutes now, and instead of seeing Melissa as my ARNP I now see Gary Edman regularly and not only is he extremely knowledgeable his compassion, care, and concern for his patients is astounding! I have a medical background myself, and I am ALWAYS treated with respect based on my own knowledge. After a recent ACDF surgery, both Gary and Dr. Lentz took the time to fully assist in my recovery. I recently had trigger point injections done by Dr. Lentz relieved the constant pressure left from my new titanium disc in my neck and finally got some relief that my neurosurgeon's office could not provide.
I can't imagine ever leaving a practice where such care and concern for patients has ALWAYS appeared to me to be a number one priority for each and every staff member. Thank you ALL for your kindness, compassion, and support and for never being judgemental when I express my needs as a chronic pain patient. My needs are almost always met each month in a timely and professional manner!
If only other doctors and medical staff had the same amount of care, compassion, and concern for chronic pain patients. For we who suffer 24/7/365 from pain that oftentimes is at the top of the McGill pain index could actually learn how to MANAGE life even though we suffer so much and at times silently out of fear of being judged as "pill seekers" or drug addicts which we are NOT! Shame on the medical community for now educating future medical staff that ALL pain medications are bad and shouldn't even be given to ANYONE no matter what their condition is. Most true chronic pain patients are NOT drug addicts. They're unique people with oftentimes unique problems. WE'RE NOT ALL THE SAME!!! By limiting the care for those of us whose chronic pain can more often than not take over our entire lives and leave us wondering if life is even worth living in such agony is only causing many chronic pain sufferers to take their own lives.
If you're like me and relate to what I have gone through, then you need to make an appointment at Comprehensive Pain of the Palm Beaches! I finally have a much fuller, happier life knowing that my severe chronic pain is being controlled and if I ever need to alter or change my treatment plans I know that I am listened to and heard by the ENTIRE staff at Comprehensive Pain of the Palm Beaches. .|I made an appointment with Christian he was wonderful. He called me back to follow up which was great . I told him my insurance kicks in January 1 and I will wait  because I could only pay half. He said no come in you can make a partial payment of 200 and we will bill the rest.  When I get here Marisol would not let me be seen . She said I had to pay the entire 300 .I think that is terrible to do that to a patient . They seem very disorganized . They definitely are not on the same page. I'm in terrible pain . It's horrible to do that to a patient. Someone says come and we can see you, then the Marisol says no we can't. Marisol stated Christian does not have the authority to make appointments that why. Why would he do it if he could not . I guess it is good for some and not others. Marisol is very matter a fact and her body language is all wrong. She should not be dealing with patients. Marisol is the office manager , she definitely has poor customer service skills . She does not need to be the face of the office and the first person you deal with when you walk in .I know everyone has policies , but if you make a mistake you accommodate the patient , not inconvenience the patient. Marisol stated she called me to verify my insurance and I didn't call back . It does not matter if I didnt call back . I was paying cash and was told how much I had to pay.|First time meeting Dr. GATZ   Was January 3,2022.And he took his time explaining me everything.  A full hour. You never get that with a Dr. Didn't make me nervous.  I can tell he does care about his patients.  Plus his staff was all wonderful.  By far most the best Dr I've ever been to with dealing with my back issues.|Dr Bart Gatz has listened to my needs. I am more mobile and motivated. I have lost 5 pounds because I can exercise now. The staff here are so friendly and accommodating. I recommend the clinic to anybody who lives in pain and needs help.|This drs office has been a great place for people suffering with chronic pain until very recently. There is a new dr and pa specifically one named Gabi you really want to avoid. I don't understand why she has such a problem with people who are suffering with chronic pain but she does. I mean why even be a PA at a pain management place if you're not going to care or even treat someone's pain? All the other PAs and Dr gatz is amazing but please if you care about your self stay far away from her.

column3:
South Lake Pain Institute provides comprehensive pain management services in Clermont, Florida. Our specialized practice delivers holistic care through customized treatment plans combining medical therapies, complementary approaches, and innovative regenerative medicine procedures. Serving the Central Florida community from our convenient Hooks Street location, we focus on addressing each patient's unique pain conditions with compassionate, personalized attention.

At South Lake Pain Institute, our Board-Certified physicians offer advanced treatments for chronic and acute pain conditions. We take a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, carefully selecting the most effective therapies for each patient's specific needs. Our comprehensive pain management solutions include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Regenerative medicine treatments

  • Medication management

  • Complementary therapy integration

  • Personalized rehabilitation programs

Holistic Approach to Pain Relief

We believe effective pain management extends beyond medication. Our physicians develop individualized treatment plans that may include dietary counseling and targeted exercise recommendations. This comprehensive approach helps patients regain function and improve quality of life. We focus on sustainable pain relief strategies that address the underlying causes of discomfort.

Expert Medical Team

Our practice features Board-Certified pain specialists with extensive training in pain management techniques. The physicians at South Lake Pain Institute combine years of clinical experience with ongoing education in the latest pain treatment advances. This expertise allows us to offer cutting-edge solutions while maintaining the highest standards of patient care.

Contact Information

Location: 2440 Hooks St, Clermont, FL 34711

Phone: +1 352-394-0833

Physician Partners of America (PPOA) proudly features Dr. Chad Gorman, MD, a dedicated Pain Management Specialist serving patients in New Port Richey, Florida. Dr. Gorman brings comprehensive expertise to treating chronic pain conditions through personalized care plans. The clinic offers advanced interventional procedures, medication management, and innovative therapies designed to improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain.

At PPOA's New Port Richey location, patients receive targeted treatment for various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain management

  • Joint pain relief therapies

  • Nerve pain treatments

  • Interventional procedures for chronic pain

  • Non-surgical pain management solutions

  • Comprehensive pain diagnostic services

About Dr. Chad Gorman

Dr. Gorman earned his medical degree from the American University of the Caribbean in the Netherland Antilles. His specialized training in pain management techniques allows him to address complex pain conditions with precision. Dr. Gorman focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that combine medical interventions with functional improvement strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinic emphasizes accessible care with minimal wait times. New patients typically receive prompt appointments, and the staff prioritizes clear communication about treatment options. Dr. Gorman takes time to explain pain sources and treatment rationales during consultations.

Location and Contact Information

PPOA's New Port Richey clinic is conveniently located at 2114 Seven Springs Blvd, Suite 100, New Port Richey, FL 34655. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Gorman, patients can call +1 727-597-8430 or visit the clinic's website at physicianpartnersofamerica.com.

The clinic accepts most major insurance plans and offers assistance with insurance verification prior to appointments.

column40:
This is an incredible pain management group! Hands down!  Absolutely everyone, who works here, is amazing! From the person at the front desk, to the person, who takes your blood pressure, from the physician assistants to the person at the checkout desk! Everyone is friendly, kind, very knowledgeable & I wouldn't go anywhere else! I live in Spring Hill & travel a good 45 to get there! Why? Because all the way around, the people & the services they provide are, most definitely worth it! I would give them more than 5 stars, if I could!|Today my appointment, was injections into my spine. Do you recommended for me to get nerve blockers done, to help all the pain in my legs and of course my back!! Dr. Gorman, makes the procedure very pleasant by talking to you the whole time! It's a great bedside manner, and answers any and all questions before during and after the procedure! I would highly recommend Dr. Gorman to anyone that has chronic pain! Or even somebody that's looking for answers of why they are in so much pain!! 
C.Roy|It was a refreshing visit . I was brought back pretty quickly and Dr. Gorman came in shortly after. He sat down and patiently listened to me. He then went over his plan to help me. My visit went as I remember visits I've had with excellent Doctors in the past - Good. When your Dr.  Seems to care and listens. When your Dr. doesn't act as if he's being rushed and makes the effort to make sure you understand the plan he's just gone over with you. I happily recommend Dr. Gorman. It really was refreshing, thanks for the reminder Doc.|If you're searching for a pain management physician... then look no further, Dr. Gorman is the one! Dr. Gorman is the Michelin if that was a term for physicians! I brought my mother who was in so much lower back pain here, and he was very professional... but yet very down to earth. He explained things in a manner that we understood, he has excellent bedside manners, a very personable person with a great personality. My mother had a procedure done today, and he asked me if I wanted to be in the room where the procedure was being done... he asked my mother as well. I have never had a physician ask me that, and actually welcome me. My mother had a previous experience with another pain management physician that was very uncomfortable, and unpleasant... so we were very hesitant to try this again. Dr. Gorman made it such a pleasant experience, he made my mother feel so comfortable, and above all my mother felt no pain whatsoever. Observing this on my end made me feel so appreciative, and thankful for Dr. Gorman. His staff is amazing, very professional, and welcomed us to the facility with open arms... they  made us feel comfortable and at ease as well. Thank you so much Dr. Gorman, and his entire staff! You're all greatly appreciated! Merry Christmas to all of you, and your families!|Dr. is excellent. Who controls the admin part? PPOA? They need more doctors, more CSR's and direct contact. Being in cue for 20 patients before me to answer phones is UNACCEPT-ABLE, an hour wait time before being seen. I'm amazed that all the staff stay professional.
And the entry door needs an automatic door opener for all of us disabled adults! It's very heavy, patients often need extra help to enter or leave. Myself included.|Love Dr. Gorman...I have only gone to him since July and he has done more to help ease my pain in such a short time than the previous pain management doctor did in 20 years. All office staff and medical assistants are very friendly and professional...would recommend Dr Gorman to everyone with chronic back pain.|Dr. Gorman is great about making his clients feel welcome and taken care of.
I don't like waiting 40mins to an hour to be seen. The staff is 50/50 in relation to making you feel comfortable & not an inconvenience for them. The building is clean and the doctor is amazing. I would recommend Dr. Gorman to anyone that needs a doctor to understand their needs & situation medically.|Dr. Gorman is an excellent doctor. However, we were told to arrive a half hour before the appointment and there were no office staff there for that half hour. We were not seen until an hour after the scheduled time of the appointent, a full hour and a half after arrival. The waiting room was full to overflowing during that time. This was a frustrating position to be put in.

column38: Patient|Matthew|michael troy|Jazmine Figueroa|Jacquelyn Godfrey|Jancer Hernandez Martinez|Karen V|Denise
column40:
I'm a long time patient at this pain clinic.  I currently am seen at their Hillsborough Ave. location in Tampa.
At my last appointment I was called in my medication as usual.  I verified with nurse that correct dosage would be called in.  She  ( Megan) assured me it would (it was called in incorrectly in April, but corrected). When I went to pick up meds I discovered wrong dosage had been called in again. I Immediately called office for them to correct. I was told an urgent  message would be sent to doctor.  No response, nothing happened.  No phone call, no corrected script.  This was on a Friday.  I heard nothing throughout the day so left messages on portal and with answering service.  I made sure the answering service knew i was out of medication.  Again, no replies.  This left me with no medication over the weekend.  On Monday am. again I phoned the offices and again they said they would leave urgent msg.  My phone rang shortly after.  I could hear papers shuffling but no one was responding to my hello.  I went back to portal, I couldnt get through on phone. I left a message that I couldnt hear whoever called, please call again as I can't get through.  Again no response.  I then called Walgreens who still had no corrected prescription.  However the female who answered the phone said doctors are doing this everywhere.  They are calling in lower dose scripts. My doctor had no discussion with me about a taper. EVER
So, now here I sit extremely uncomfortable, nothing to help with my pain.  Do i pick up this lower dose script?  Do i believe this is just another error (this happened in April as well but got corrected).  No idea.  I have no idea what to do.
Physicians should return phone calls.  Physicians or their staff should communicate with patients.  If you're looking for that kind of doctor, look elsewhere.
I'm a 64 year old woman with a bladder disease.  I've seen 7 urologists over 20 years and tried all procedures, surgeries, etc. before being referred to this pain specialist for severe pain. The pain of this disease is equal to cancer pain.  That is why I'm on disability.  And my doctor  ( Dr.Grana) or his staff can't return a phone call and advise me if this is a forced taper or another error.
Well you have one less patient to worry about.
And what's even more concerning, I just reviewed my patient portal (and made some copies of what is there).  They don't even have my correct diagnosis/disease listed.  They have back pain/knee pain as chief complaints. I fill out a form to check in every month, and it clearly says Interstitial cystitis is my chief complaint yet I don't see this in my records.  I talk often with Meghan ( Dr. Grana's nurse) as well as Dr. Grana about my bladder pain.  Where is it in my records?   I'll be following up on this.
Please check your portals and make sure that it is accurate and up to date.  Mine is neither.  This is unacceptable.|Aghhh after wondering why they canceled my appointment I come to leave a review and I see everyone saying there purging pain meds.  I take Lyrica.  And they cancel a appointment for a new resident who's recently disabled with back surgery . Awesome job Karen of the Dr world .|They are currently purging all patients on pain meds.  They said that they are switching to interventional procedures only.  Such as injections and surgery for electrostimulation devices.  I was told if I didn't want a procedure they would no longer see me.  This is straight-up extortion.  I don't need injections right now and I don't appreciate being bullied into an unnecessary procedure so they can look good to the FDA & CDC on paper.  So if your pain is well controlled by pain medication do not go here as they won't help you.  They are a pain management clinic that has stopped managing pain and instead ignores it unless it can be cured by a procedure.  Honestly, I don't know how they can legally call themselves a pain management office since they only perform surgery.  Their sign needs to be changed from Tampa Pain Relief Centers to Tampa Surgery Centers since this is all they do now.|Had a very frustrating second visit. I've been suffering from neck pain since august and was finally referred to this place. It was only my second visit and it was exhausting.

First off, I'm a full time college student and a worker. Today was my only day off, so I scheduled my appointment at 12:45 so that i could have the remaining day to catch up on school work. I even got there 15 mins early just in case. I kid you not, I sat in the patient room until 2! And I still wasn't seen. I had ONE lady come and take my blood pressure and that was it. The remaining time I was waiting and waiting and waiting. I understand that doctors have other patients, but don't schedule me at a time where you won't even be able to see me until hours after. Seems like they clearly over-scheduled because there were also other people in there who haven't been seen. Just seems ridiculous to be waiting in a doctors office for over an hour and still haven't been seen. I'm sorry its just I've got things in my day to do, I don't have all day to be waiting. Seems like they have no sense of urgency. And then the lady I spoke to first to express my frustration(calmly) was rude. She gave an attitude saying well he's got other patients. Like yeah I get that, but if he can't see a patient every hour, then don't schedule one every hour.

Bummed because I'm just trying to find treatments for my neck and it seemed like they just didn't care.|Who is the Owner, I was impressed with Dr Rivera with doing my procedure but now he will NOT fill out my SHORT TERM DISABILITY PAPERWORK. I had Surgery I had stitches and was told that it could take up to 3 months to heal. Last week Denise the office manager said that Dr Rivera told her to tell me that he will not fill out my paperwork. His NP Stacy told me the same thing at my visit this week, but when Dr Rivera walked in the room, he said no? Just print the Dr's notes and send them to the insurance company.
After the surgery Denise said that Dr Rivera said that I should heal in 2 to 3 days and then go back to work.
Well I did that. I was sent home I couldn't function at work..

leaving the office after my follow up Tuesday ,Stacy said that she and Denise would sit down the next day and come up with a plan. I waited to hear back from them until later in the day, finally I called I was told that Stacy left in the afternoon.

I was told today by Stacy again today that Dr Rivera spoke to one of the other drs and that Dr said that it should take up to 10 days to heal. Which is it ?
Then Stacy said that Dr Rivera said that he will not fill out my short term Disability paperwork. When I saw Dr Rivera
On Tuesday, he told me that I was a category 2 and that means that It could take up to 3-6 months to heal.
He said that with this procedure some patients heal quicker than others but not in my case.
In my presence on Tuesday,Dr Rivera told Stacy to get his visit notes and send them to the my insurance company.

Now everything has changed AGAIN.
I'm fed up and I have been told to take it to another level,
I am very very sore still and can hardly walk. I was told by Stacy  a few weeks ago that Dr Rivera's said do not do anything until I see him during my follow up 1 month after the procedure
None of this back and forth makes sense. I'm a worker and not a couch potato. I just got the word on TUESDAY, that NOW I can start slowly and go swimming,
Im so confused right now with this back and forth, he said and I said which has been going on for ALMOST 1 month.|Hello, this place needs someone at the reception who speaks Spanish, because many people come here who do not speak English and need to be attended to correctly and the people at the reception who are currently working do not want to help with that, thank you and I hope you solve this problem.|I was very happy with the staff and the wonderful doctor Lubin.|I have been going to Tampa Relief Pain Center for years. I never had any problems. Well that has certainly changed. I have been going to Dr Rivera. I am coming back for another procedure because I am in severe pain. He said that he had sent the medication to my pharmacy to reduce my pain. So, of course, I called my pharmacy to see if anything was called in. They said no. Then I tried to call the office. So frustrating, they never answered the phone. An answering service answered in the middle of the day. The service said all that she could do is FAX a message to the office. Crickets. I heard nothing. No phone calls, texts nothing. So the next day I called the pharmacy.....nothing. Then at 11:00am during regular business hours I called back. Answering service eventually picked up. Again, said all she could do is send a FAX. So what's the problem? I believe they care nothing for their patients. They care so little they don't even want to talk to you. My primary  told me to go to a pain doctor for my severe pain. I only have hope and pray that I can get some relief soon. This severe pain has been going on since against. Please help me.

Tampa Pain Relief Centers - Brandon serves the Brandon, FL community with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating various chronic pain conditions through personalized care plans designed for long-term relief. Located conveniently in Brandon, we provide access to board-certified pain specialists who combine advanced treatments with compassionate care.

Our clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic conditions. Our physicians utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to identify pain sources accurately. Treatment options include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management. Each treatment plan addresses the unique needs of every patient.

Expert Medical Team

Our pain management physicians bring decades of combined experience to our practice. All doctors have completed specialized fellowship training in pain medicine. Many hold dual board certifications in anesthesiology and pain management. Our team stays current with the latest advancements in pain treatment techniques. This expertise allows us to offer both traditional and innovative pain solutions.

Comprehensive Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in addressing pain from multiple angles. Our clinic combines medical interventions with physical therapy recommendations. We develop individualized treatment plans based on thorough evaluations. Patients receive education about their conditions and self-management techniques. This multidisciplinary approach helps achieve better long-term outcomes for chronic pain sufferers.

Patient-Centered Care

At Tampa Pain Relief Centers - Brandon, we prioritize patient comfort and convenience. Our modern facility features minimal wait times and flexible scheduling options. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients on coverage questions. Our compassionate staff guides patients through every step of their treatment journey.

Dr Piszel is skilled in pain injections that work. His NP is kind and thoughtful. Words matter and how you say something to an unwell person matters greatly. Empathy goes a long way. I highly recommend this office...|I have been attending Tampa Pain for many years (about 15 years, plus or minus).  Their staff are excelente.  From my first Doctor (Cases) to their current staff member, love them all.
I was first referred by the MacDill AF base clinic.  Now on medicare, I now continue to attend their office and progress.  Pearl Fox, APRN, she is my leading physician.  She listens, makes recommendations, provides counseling and always have been there when I need a helping hand.  Thank you all you kindness.
Dr. Piszel, he is great and funny.  I love going to the surgery center for my treatments.  He is always jolly with a smile. Their nurses always with tender loving care.
Everyone has their opinions  but I must proudly say, I have nothing but admiration and respect towards the Tampa Pain Relief Center staff.  Thank you for giving me a better outlook, a chance to continue my life and teaching me to understand my conditions.  Peace.|They have all been amazing started out seeing Dr Cases and then Anthony Jimenez and I've seen I think most of them there been going since 2017 I think when I moved home from Texas I've had a two disc replacement in my neck and I have many pinched nerves as well as lower discs herniated L5S1 is my worst one and they are great with procedures and visits absolutely love catching up with Pizel when I do get scheduled with him he makes me laugh and forget my problems during my visit carol is the most caring and sweet nurse I've ever met adore her.|Always kind and treat me with the most respect. I love the doctor's and the staff keep up the good work.|I really don't want to give this place even one star as long as Pearl Fox remains an employee! I've only been to this place 3 times for the last 3 months and each and every single time it was nothing but incompetence. How difficult can it be to make a phone call about a referral or to obtain authorization from an insurance company before sending in the prescription?? Unfortunately my doctor was out of the office this last visit I had so one of the regular workers by the name of Pearl is the nurse that saw me that day.  Right away she started taking over me and was very pushy and bothering ssy. She told me that she had been trying to get a urine sample from me for months which was a complete lie. So now we have incompetent liars working here. I had never met the woman.  Nor
was I ever asked for a urine test except for my very 1st visit which I gladly gave them one.  The question is, why lie? What are you trying to cover up? The whole time I was there she clearly was more interested in wrongly accusing me rather than fixing her mistakes and moving forward. I have every intention of turning this company in just as soon as I'm done with this review.   Clearly she is a followers rather than a leader. Her husband really needs a new partner. It's time for her to go!
Terrie|I was in town on a family emergency for 5 months.  I see pain management out of state.  They took me in, respected the meds I was on.  Also went and had an mri, Right across the hall.  Found out some more issues and where tackling those issues before I had to leave town again.  No long wait times and an excellent staff.  Thank you so much for your help!|Been with them from Cases to Pizels. Always understood my issues. Offered solutions. Listen. I don't think I could find better care with better people.

Florida Pain Institute - Pineda serves Melbourne, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located conveniently at 5545 N Wickham Rd #104 in Melbourne, we provide accessible care for residents throughout Brevard County.

At Florida Pain Institute, our board-certified physicians offer advanced interventional procedures and multidisciplinary treatment plans. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our approach combines minimally invasive techniques with medication management when appropriate.

Expert Medical Team

Our physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine. Each doctor has completed specialized fellowship training in pain management following their anesthesiology or neurology residencies. This advanced education ensures patients receive the most current, effective treatments available for chronic pain conditions.

Treatment Options

We provide numerous treatment modalities including:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint blocks

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Nerve blocks

- Regenerative medicine options

Patient-Centered Approach

Every treatment plan begins with a thorough evaluation of your pain condition. We take time to understand how pain affects your daily activities and quality of life. This comprehensive assessment helps develop targeted interventions for long-term pain relief rather than temporary fixes.

I would give negative stars if I could. I was a cash patient, paid the $240 for the appointment. I was told not much they could do (understandable) but we could try epidural. I asked for a price and they couldn't give me one being as it's cash. Was told I would get a call, never did. Then I get a bill for an additional $833. So that would be a total of $1073....for a 5 minute consultation. BEWARE!!|Professional staff are competent. Office/management incompetent. This company exploiting loophole in insurance to allow them to charge $250 for injection, when in the past, they gave injection at local office for $30. A 700% premium borne on the patient as a copay. Not a good way to run a business!
When queried about this, staff just shrugged their shoulders.
Wow, I am sick of being treated like an imbecile. I am a good patient/consumer and have choices.
Good luck to them...........|My husband has been seeing Dr. Nguyen for about 1 year. He has had a few procedures and gotten relief. Dr. Nguyen is a good competent provider. Unfortunately the last two times we have been at the surgery center, has been a very frustrating experience. Two weeks ago, they were running 1 hour late. Today it's been two hours and still waiting. No warning when checking in that they are behind. No apology, no explanation. No consideration for people that are already in pain. What a disservice to a good doctor. A patient showed up and said they called her that they had an opening. What? You are already over 2hrs behind. This no way to treat patients. We now have the consider finding a new practice.|You will be waiting to be seen for over 45 minutes every time you go to an appointment.  For procedures you will wait an hour. Staff is nice, service just takes an absurd amount of time to get seen. If I could give 2.5 stars I would|I went for my first visit to evaluate me.  The staff and medical doctor were great.
I felt that I was listened to and understood.
I was also able to understand the staff and Md.
The appointment was made for pain of left hip.  It was scheduled two weeks out but I got a call and went in early.  I was grateful for that.
The pain management appointment/surgical
Sterile was just great. From the staff getting me ready to the nurses/technicians and Md, all did their work professionally. There was nice banter back and forth which helped. It made the experience more "human, personal"
Thank you|Dr Crane is awesome
And his entire staff is very good
He's not one of those doctors that just throws pills
At you he's all about the best treatment
For getting rid of the pain|I've been going to Florida Pain for over 3yrs. My experiences have always been great! Procedures follow ups all have been a super positive experience!

Vanessa at the front desk is so sweet and inviting! I love how she greets me each time I come in...makes me feel so comfortable! Plus she's always on top of signing people in and checking on how we are!|My wife has only had 1 appointment but so far, I've found Dr. Crain and the support staff (front desk, Brenda, Nikki, etc.) very responsive & friendly. During regular office house on 4 occasions, I called and left a message and within less than 5 minutes I got a return call. It's quite refreshing to have an office respond so quickly. It shows they care about their patients concerns.

Established in 1997, our clinic has built a reputation for excellence in addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why our team of specialists works diligently to identify the root causes of your discomfort and develop effective strategies for long-term relief.

Our clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches, including:

Experienced Pain Management Specialists

Conditions We Treat

Always good til lately dr without notice cut my meds by like 2 1/2 days ran out. I have extreme pain in my back, spine. These pills only work if I take them before the start of pain, if I forget to take them I know it. Other than the dr. I have always had excellent care. I personally think he should have told me he was cutting my pills down. The front desk and the  nurses are excellent. Always there to listen and understand your pain|Brooke is great as well as the staff. Just had knee replacement couldn't walk so the nurse came out to vehicle to see me. Not many offices do this for their patients. Ty Katie.|I have been more pleased with Dr. Arcos and his staff than any other pain mgmt specialist I have seen. He has helped me so much. His staff is very pleasant and easy to deal with. I especially like Marci. I would recommend them to anyone dealing with chronic pain.|The entire staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful. Dr A was extremely informative and took his time to explain my condition and options, not one of these in and out five minute visits. I am so grateful that I found this provider. A+!|Have been going there for a couple of years,  staff was VERY FRIENDLY, DR Bentley was an understanding and wonderful DR. I haven't met this new Dr yet , so far he has changed my prescription pills to a lower grade, and there not helping at all,  now I am living in pain, so I have decided if I have to live like this,I might as well stop taking any pills at all, so I have quit. I will still visit the clinic and get there opinion and give this new staff a chance,  and hope for the best.|The doctor and staff at Charlotte Pain Management Center are fantastic. They have greatly reduced my wife's pain level. They have also helped her to reduce the amount of medication she needs.|Brooke and Marcie are two of the nicest people i have ever met.   They care about the patients and are geeat assets!|I have been going to Charlotte pain management center for many many years. I have seen a lot of changes over the years but the one thing that always stays consistent is the level of care that I receive.
They have to be the nicest group of people. I always feel heard and any issues are always addressed immediately. Things have been pretty bad trying to get medication lately but they go above and beyond to help you get what is needed.
I can't say enough about what a great place to be able to go for my medical care. Thanks a million to Tina for helping me get through the difficult times. You are definitely an asset to CPMC. She's so compassionate and understanding and knows always exactly the best way to help. Thanks Tina...
Thanks to all of you at CPMC.

I no longer go to Charlotte pain management after 13+ years. There's a new doctor that took over July of 2024. He doesn't believe in pain medicine. He thinks pretty much it's all in our minds. He wants all patients of any type of pain medication and to start doing injections for pain management instead. I've done them in the past and was almost paralyzed during a X-ray guided injection at a surgery center. Tried again in the office and had no relief. Most people I talk to say they don't help or maybe just for a week of slight relief.
I would not go back if the same doctor is still there or until they change their ways.
Please if you're in a lot of pain don't go there...

Maybe they're good, *IF* you can get to see them. I would have been a new patient. I requested an appointment online, but no one called me back. So then I called them and got a recording to leave my info and someone would call back... they never did. I tried once again, and the same recording. Of course I went elsewhere.|From the extremely clean facility, staff, nurses, and care with Dr Torres, since I have been seeing him for over the past 2 years I have been extremely happy I chose him as my pain Dr.  He listens carefully to all my concerns and is always extremely professional. I definitely recommend him to anyone in need of any of the care services in which he offers. He has controlled my pain which has changed my way of life in a great way. Very thorough doctor for sure!|They take a long time to forward your prescriptions to the pharmacy....as in days!! One goes to the doctor for refills for a reason, need. Now at day 6 waiting on prescriptions! I've come back to update this review days later. Called spoke with Nurse, she stated " The Doctor has not signed off on yet" ..... I was charged for a prescription refill appointment as was my insurance yet as of 4/12/23 nothing! They called me and asked that " I find a new clinic" as a direct result of this review LOL Unbelievable and highly unprofessional. I asked gentleman that called why and he said "I don't know, I'm simply passing a message"!!!!|Surgery went bad a week after magically had a sezuire after surgery they magically don't know what caused my sezuire. But be careful becarful. Very rare this can happen after surgery but it happend to me.|I recently switch my Spine Doctor/ pain management facility. I started going to Novus Spine after receiving a recommendation.
It's like night and day how you're treated as a patient between where I was going and Novus Spine. Staff is wonderful and kind. The PA I saw was super knowledgeable and explained my condition to me in a way that I could actually understand . I really liked him.
Dr Torres did my SI injection. I've had so many procedures done at the place I used to go to and I felt like I was on an assembly line. It was a kind of "next....next... situation. It was all about how many appointments they could jam in a day . Outrageously long waiting times.
And their office staff was below sub par.
Novus spine is the exact opposite. And the injection I received from Dr.Torres did seem to give me a bit of pain relief. I never got any pain relief after any procedure I received at the prior facility. So far so good at Novus Spine Lakeland.|Dr. Torres is a spectacular physician. I live with Phantom Limb Pain after losing my entire left leg in an accident in 2010. I've seen other Doctors as a result and with the exception of the Doctors that originally saved my life 13 years ago Dr. Torres has done more for me than any other Doctor.
Dr. Torres has without a doubt changed my life for the better. I still do have pain of course and with my condition I always will but with the treatment I receive from Dr. Torres I can enjoy my life and have the ability to enjoy time with my granddaughter.
I owe Dr. Torres so much and will always be grateful to him for changing my life.|Doctor Torres spends adequate time to review my complaints. He carefully assesses my medical condition and communicates the treatment options available to me. My condition is very difficult, but he effectively provided treatments and procedures to help me manage the pain for the past 5 years.  Also staff are courteous and helpful.|DR TORRES IS THE BEST!  If you want, a doctor, who cares and will really sit down and talk to you about your issues, this is the doctor that you want! He explains different procedures and explains which one would be best for you. I have been seeing Dr Torres for years and I will end this paragraph the way I begin it. DR TORRES IS THE BEST!

Nurse Shelly, other nurses and the front desk staff were all so welcoming and patient. The office was very full of patients buy the staff took their time with me. The professionalism and kindness was surprising. Dr. Caudill  helps calm your nerves with a wonderful sense of humor. Miss Shelli was wonderful too. Maddie took care of me with the paperwork.  Just a wonderful experience overall experience.  Holly referred me to visit Dr. Caudill and she has been with him 20 plus years and told me he was a wonderful Dr and helped her so much. Dr. C  and his staff are exceptional. I felt like family was caring for me.|I never could imagine how good a doctor's interaction could be . This doctor and his staff literally all walk around with smiles on their faces they are a family . The doctor  exceeded my expectation of the level of actually listening caring and treating me like a person before treating me like I was a patient . He was so amazing and his beautiful soul was so toxic
If you want to have your life and your pain managed efficiently I can't see it getting any better than this doctors office
They did there jobs so well yet  catered to my needs as If they'd known me for years
This place was so awesome that I want to write and write and write but I'm going to leave you with this
You can search for people to be the authors of your destiny or you can attract the destiny you want for your health . I'm so glad I attracted them I'm not looking back because from what I can see im definitely going to a better future here
Thank you north Fl you guys have been more than amazing you've been life changing|The process for  new patient appointments is frustrating and not based on a patient centered care model. Not once during the 6 months process did anyone care about my Aunt. After a lot of back and forth with insurance she suffered a great deal of pain and was never seen further delaying her care. Don't waste your time, find another pain management provider with caring staff.|I Randal Pilgram , use first coast pain management. Medical procedures and care is superb. Front office ( Maggie) , lacks the professionalism and no dignity to the patient disrespect, abuse  threats, , of patients. Not listening to the patients well being And  talking over the patient rolling them over. She prides herself for being more than difficult and will argue to the point of causing me extreme anxieties.  And break down, totally uncalled for. she knows this about me but still gives me a hard way to go . This I know from the first encounter with her. I have an extremely important  and time sensitive (urgent). Medical records forwarded to the VA administration. I already knew I would have problems with Maggie. I ask my wife to contact her, and explain what I was dealing , my medical records to the VA administrations. Simply about 10-15 minuet procedures.  With her meanness, hatefulness and difficulty in perform the simplest task caused me to speak over her I have  mental health issues. And she knows what buttons to push. As if she enjoys being extremely difficult. I think she has been there so long she has some kind of power trip because when I asked to speak with Dr.Cadelle or Jannie sapp, her response was that's not going to happen. I guess she owns this business if the buck stops with her. Furthermore I refuse to be disrespected and abused by your staff. I'm a veteran with allot of medical issues that should be taken into consideration. If that kindness and curtesy can not be extended I think there is a sever internal problem. I am now still very upset and this should never happen anywhere. My issue ( I think) has resolved, but it came at an extremely severe cost to my mental health and overall well being. Beware... additionally she said to me that I was always a problem with her lies. I had one negative encounter and realized what kind of person she is so I was always kind, courteous trying not to engage if i didn't   have to. For this particular issue I had to get my crippled disabled wife out of the house (extremly difficult). To run interference. Sad!!! Do your job, be kind, and quit abusing people. V/R Randal Pilgram.|Staff very friendly, actually want to be in their jobs. Maggie is super nice, and Kim too. They processed me in very fast,  and answered my questions in a professional manner. Medical assistant very nice, friendly, actually listened too!!  Mr. Dr. Caudill is extremely smart, very hard worker, he listened attentively to me. He showed great caring and concern for my pain and joints. He was funny, yet 98 percent business. No BS doctor, gets right to the point. Honest and upfront. I look forward to my next appointment.  He takes great care of hos veterans too!!|I am pretty angry, I called to schedule an appointment and as soon as they heard my BCBS was through market place they wouldn't accept me. No other questions I need help with my spinal issues and would pay out of pocket to see them.  Very sad.|I have many Drs which I'm not happy to say but Dr Caudill, TC, Maggie & Shelly (all of the staff) put a smile on my face every time I go no matter how much pain I'm in that day. They treat you like a human & thats hard to find anymore. Dr Caudill & TC (the only ones I see but all of the Drs there are amazing) listen & I can talk all day long. They always shows true concern & you don't find that often. My only issue is I wish I found them sooner. And for anyone who has made a negative comment ignore them because its simply not true if I could give 1000 stars I would. I recommend them 1000%.

Pain Consultants of West Florida in Pensacola, Florida serves patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions throughout the Gulf Coast region. Our specialized medical team provides comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. We combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment approaches to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options. These include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. We also provide medication management when appropriate as part of a comprehensive treatment plan. Our approach focuses on improving function and quality of life for patients suffering from persistent pain.

Conditions We Treat

The medical team at Pain Consultants of West Florida specializes in treating various painful conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

Our Experienced Physicians

Our board-certified physicians have extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology. With decades of combined clinical experience, our doctors stay current with the latest advances in pain management techniques. Many have completed fellowships at prestigious medical institutions and regularly participate in continuing education.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address each patient's specific pain concerns. During your first visit, our physicians conduct thorough evaluations to understand your pain history. This comprehensive assessment helps determine the most effective treatment options for your condition.

Contact Information

Pain Consultants of West Florida is conveniently located at 4624 N Davis Hwy, Pensacola, FL 32503. To schedule an appointment, please call +1 850-494-0000. For more information about our services, visit our website at http://www.pcwfl.com/.

The wait was not too bad..front desk reception area everyone was kind(check-in/out). Dr. Hebert is great!
However, I did reach out through the patient portal to change an appointment and to get a correction made to my file and never received a reply.
That is the only reason for 3 stars|I was a prior patient with DR Concepcion for several years and was very satisfied but relocated away from the area. While gone I was in a near fatal motorcycle accident requiring several reconstructive surgeries and much more discomfort. When I returned I was required to come in as a new patient and was told by Doctor C that he was unable to treat me.|Dr Justin Hebert is excellent in treating all my bone pains. I a m a very complicated patient but first time I came to him, he listens to all my complaints and amazingly he is very empathetic and understands all my pains . He has a solution for each complaint of pains in my lower back with spinal stenosis, my right shoulder which is bone n bone, right side of my neck and my left hip which is probably related to sciatica. I am so miserable with pain but Dr. Hebert slowly one by one relieved my pains to a point that I was able to travel for the holidays to my daughters in New Jersey. Prior to coming to Dr Hebert, I can't hardly move nor walk due to all my pains. Besides trigger points, he also injected my shoulder joint & AC joint. Although he has not completed his plan of pain management, at least I was able to travel.i was almost bedridden due to pain but he was able to resolve most of my pain without narcotics . Thank you Dr Hebert for being an excellent physician and expert Pain Management.
Lelia Montes|What a disappointment,,,
Spent $200 as a new patient,waited over an hour n a half to b seen,,,this young man came in,never examined me,had to ask him what's going on with my back(2 previous back surgeries)i can hardly stand,tie my shoes,etc,,,he says oh,u have bersidas,,,have an x- ray saying nothing about bersidas,,,long story short,nurse gave me a shot in the butt n sent me on my way,,,said come back tomorrow for t.p.injections,another $180,,,3 hours after I left i was in so much pain,wasn't going back,,,,
A REAL EXPERIENCE,THATS Y THEY SAY TO STAY AWAY FROM PAIN MGMT,A WASTE OF MONEY,,,I AGREE|Great people, they are all very nice. Dr. Herbert is very kind and honest, he made sure to answer all of my questions thoroughly. He has made my treatment simple and easy. Thank you for all of your help during this painful time in my life.|I have been incorrectly charged for late payment. The original bill was paid but the office manager hides behind her desk and will not even discuss the issue with me.  I am so disappointed in her refusal to resolve the uncalled for charge. The response seems to be a computer generated response. The person who can correct the situation refused to discuss with me.|I have had an ongoing problem with some discs in my lower back for the last 20 plus years. I have had three episodes where I have had needed neurologists and an anesthesiologist  to address my spinal column issues. I've had a few bumps and bruises along the way, but nothing compares to bulging, mushrooming discs, and sciatic pain, nothing.
My neurologist scheduled me to see Dr. Herbert, an Anesthesiologist at the Pain Consultants of West Florida. On my first visit I met with Dr. Herbert and we discussed my back history and the issues I've had in the past and the treatment plan(s) that were used. I wanted to try the epidurals; they had worked in the past and we've had great success with them. I had been as good as new since 2018 which was when the latest episode occurred.  I was very impressed with the administrative staff when I checked in, very efficient, personable, and nice. Dr. Herbert's nursing support staff was also on their 'A game.' I found them all to be very professional and very patient with us ol Geezers taking forever to get out the chairs, etc. to show them some documentation.
But all of that would have been for naught if Dr. Justin Herbert wasn't on top of his game. Dr. Herbert gave me two epidurals  (the previous two times in 2002 and 2018 I had 3 epidural procedures.) We met for a consultation about undergoing a third epidural procedure, I had been thinking about it for several days, and I couldn't think of reason for it. My back was as good as new, or as good as it will get when you're my age. Dr Herbert and I decided it would be pointless to go ahead with the third epidural, but I could if I wanted to. It all depended on me, how my back felt. When I would talk with my friends after the procedure and they'd ask, "How'd it go?" I'd tell them, "It went well, didn't hurt and this doc is able to get right down in there, same exact spot where I would feel the sciatic nerve pain start when this injury happened. Dr Herbert's procedures seem more exact, more precise. I guess this doc's got more on his fastball than those in the past." Or maybe medicine has advanced in the last 22 years, but this was a noticeable improvement from the previous two, and those were not bad, they certainly did the trick.  I have been extremely blessed with my results from the epidural procedures I've had on my lower back.
In 22 years when I am in my mid 80s and this happens again, I am going to the Pain Consultants of West Florida and will be requesting to see Dr. Herbert. In the meantime, I will be telling all my family and friends if they need this kind of medical treatment, go see Dr. Herbert. You can't do any better. (I apologize for being a little 'long winded' but I felt I should detail the great work that is being done at the PCWF.)|Dr Conception and staff are exceptional in care. Professional, manage time well, knowledgeable, and caring. Very pleased with the care received.

column3:
Florida Pain Management Institute serves patients in Delray Beach, Boynton Beach, and Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, offering some of the most modern and comprehensive pain management solutions available. The clinic specializes in customizable treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs, ensuring effective relief from chronic and acute pain conditions.

The team at Florida Pain Management Institute utilizes state-of-the-art technology for accurate diagnosis, effective treatment, and thorough follow-up care. Their approach combines innovative medical techniques with compassionate patient care, creating a foundation for successful pain management outcomes.

Specialized Treatment Areas

The clinic excels in treating various pain conditions, including:

- Nerve pain disorders

- Degenerative diseases

- Musculoskeletal injuries

- Chronic pain syndromes

- Post-surgical pain

Expert Medical Team

The practice is led by a team of board-certified physicians with extensive experience in pain management:

- **Dr. Adam Shestack, MD** - Board-certified pain management specialist

- **Dr. Cy Blanco** - Expert in interventional pain techniques

- **Dr. Lawrence Kirschenbaum, MD** - Specialized in comprehensive pain solutions

Each physician brings years of clinical expertise to provide patients with the most effective pain relief strategies available in modern medicine.

Patient-Centered Approach

Patients experience comforting care in a soothing environment designed to reduce anxiety and promote healing. The clinic's staff provides ongoing support throughout the treatment journey, from initial consultation through recovery and maintenance.

Contact Information

**Website:** https://www.flpmi.com/

**Phone:** +1 561-823-1797

**Address:** 2623 S Seacrest Blvd #108, Boynton Beach, FL 33435, United States

Patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain can schedule a consultation to discover personalized treatment options available at Florida Pain Management Institute.

The team at Florida Pain Management Institute offers comforting care in a soothing environment, including ongoing support.

I am so glad my primary care's office highly recommended I go see him.|Dr. Cy Blanco is very patient will answer all your questions has a great bed side manner. His staff is very friendly as well. On arrival (initial visit), I arrived early in order to complete "new patient paperwork". Staff behind the desk were professional, friendly and knowledgeable. column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Winter Park
column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers in Winter Park, Florida serves the local community with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team combines skill, patience, and empathy while staying current with medical advancements to provide effective relief for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we commit to personalized treatment approaches for every individual who walks through our doors.

At our Winter Park location, we offer advanced interventional treatments for various pain conditions. Our specialists are trained in the latest techniques for managing back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic conditions. We develop customized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies.

Personalized Patient Care

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians take time to understand your pain history, evaluate your condition thoroughly, and explain treatment options clearly. This patient-centered approach helps ensure better outcomes and improved quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Experienced Pain Specialists

Our team consists of board-certified physicians with extensive training in pain management. They bring years of clinical experience and specialized knowledge to every case. Our doctors regularly participate in continuing education to remain at the forefront of pain medicine advancements.

Conditions We Treat

  • Spinal disorders and injuries
  • Arthritis and joint pain
  • Nerve pain and neuropathy
  • Headaches and migraines
  • Sports injuries
  • Post-surgical pain
  • Work-related injuries

    • Visit us at 1693 Lee Rd Suite B, Winter Park, FL 32789, or call us at +1 407-622-5766 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at https://www.treatingpain.com/winter-park/
column11: Successfully treating pain requires skill, patience, empathy and staying current within our field. We are committed to a personalized approach to treating an array of conditions and comprehensive treatment plans to improve your quality of life.
