column40:
The staff is absolutely amazing. They make sure to greet you as soon as you walk in the door they are funny they laugh with you and when you are hurting, they take care of you very well. They make sure that all of your needs are met. I love this place. I have also recommended it to my sister who also goes here and a couple of my friends. Thank you for everything you guys do. It is much appreciated.|I was referred to see Dr. Amer Ansari by my neurosurgeon. I was pleased to receive a call soon after my referral to schedule my appointment as a new patient. I was even more happy to get a call a few days later advising me of the opportunity to come at a sooner day. My over the phone process was a pleasant one and on the day of the appointment, the lady at the front office and the doctor's assistant were both very friendly, courteous and showed a great disposition to help.

Dr. Ansary reviewed results of images, went over them with me. He performed a thorough evaluation and allowed me to ask questions. He listened very attentively and  showed genuine interest in helping me to try to gain my quality of life by providing a course of treatment to begin to ease my pain and discomforts.

This office gets a five stars because in all the phases of a medical practice, they exhibited a high level of competency, care and professionalism conducive to trustworthiness, and I appreciate being treated as a person and not as a file number.|WOW! WHAT AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE! 5's all the way! When you walk into the office you can just feel the safe, the calm, the care. The lady who greeted me was very cheerful! Nurse Christina was kind and funny. 1st time visit and I felt like I was laughing with a long time friend! Then Dr. Ansari far exceeded my expectations! He didn't just say, "what brought you here", look at my records and send me on my way. He listened attentively. He asked many relevant questions, and explained everything thoroughly! I believe he will heal me! PRAISE THE LORD!!! for this establishment!|I've been coming to this office for a couple years at least. They're always kind and helpful. Even on my worst days they were compassionate and understanding. Amazing group of staff, doctors, nurses and nurse practitioners.|Dr. Ansari is very thorough in his way that he helps you with procedures he does to help calm your pain down and figure out the source of where the pain is coming from. He listens to you and is very caring of what you are going through with your pain issues! I would not want to go to Anyone else except for Dr. Ansari I have been as patient for many many years. If you choose to go to Dr. Ansari, you receive nothing but the best possible care starting with his staff and his nurse and his care! Angie|Excellent staff! The medical assistants are very helpful, attentive to my needs and very professional. Dr. Ansari is one of the best neurologist I've seen. He quickly made a decision and stopped my awful pain. He listened to his patients to find the best course of treatment. Thank you so much Dr. Ansari.|I have such a wonderful experience every time I come to this office. The staff is very professional and they make me feel comfortable. Thumbs up for the ladies at the front. They are much a joy and easy to talk to. Waiting time is non existent and overall the doctors and NP's are awesome.|Been a patient here with these folks for awhile now. Definite 5 stars. If there were more I'd click more. Nothing negative to say at all.  Great respectful people who listen to you, not at you. Which is pretty cool.  Love the entire staff

column2: Pain Healing Center & Semaglutide Weight Loss - Brandon
column3:
Pain Healing Center & Semaglutide Weight Loss in Brandon, FL serves the local community with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, sciatica, right and left side pain, abdominal pain, and muscle tightness. We understand how chronic pain affects daily life and strive to provide effective treatment options tailored to each patient's needs.

We offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapies:

- Lumbar epidural steroid injections for reducing inflammation

- Lumbar facet joint injections to target specific pain sources

- Sacroiliac joint injections for lower back and buttock pain

- Radiofrequency ablation of medial branch for longer-lasting pain relief

- Nerve blocks to interrupt pain signals

- Decompression table therapy specifically for lower back pain

- Comprehensive weight loss programs including Semaglutide treatment

- Ketamine treatment for chronic pain conditions

What Sets Us Apart

As a one-stop shop for back and neck pain treatment, our approach integrates multiple modalities under one roof. This comprehensive care model eliminates the need for patients to visit multiple specialists. Our physicians combine years of specialized training with the latest evidence-based techniques to address pain at its source.

We accommodate patients' busy schedules by offering both in-office visits and convenient televisits. Our team takes time to explain conditions and treatment options in clear, understandable terms.

Contact us today to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward pain relief.

Phone: +1 813-333-1819

Website: https://thepainhealingcenter.com/

Address: 1749 S Kings Ave, Brandon, FL 33511, United States

What sets us apart is that we are a one stop shop for everything for low back and neck pain which sets us apart from other Pain Management.

column40:
DR. Benni is nothing short of amazing. I have been seeing for many many years for cervical and lumbar spinal issues. He's been there for me through multiple spinal surgerys. Very compassionate and wants what's best for his patients and is very responsive when need be.|Dr Benni is knowledgeable professional and detailed in his expertise. Dr benni is diligent in his work ethic and adamant. The office staff and pleasant wonderful professional people. Very respectful, kind, and courteous to each patient from what I experienced. The phone lines are efficient, beyond communicative, and easy to make appointments. Highly recommend!|This clinic is gross and definitely has sketchy undertones to it. From the moment you walk in, there's signs everywhere about opiate prescriptions and cannabis cards. Every client in there looked and acted high. The doctor Benni table side manner was cold and uncaring. Which was a shock to me bc I thought I had finally found a clinic that cared about exploring treatment options for my chronic pain as well as continuing the course of treatment I was on. He did not care about discussing different treatments with me, nor did he want to discuss any medication options with me. He basically offered me at home neck traction and a rolled up towel. I'm 32 and have a severe injury in my neck and lower back that requires occasional medication and steroids and he was extremely disinterested and almost annoyed I came there to seek out treatment for an actual injury.|Dr. Benni stands above his class. Came in with severe back pain, after assessment he gave me a trigger shot that immediately took care of my pain. Staff is courteous and professional. Thank you Dr. Benni.|I am very pleased to have Dr. Benni as my pain management doctor.  God really blessed me when I was referred to him.  Dr Benni is very professional, knowledgeable, compassionate, and strong if you're not listening to his recommendations.  Dr Benni is a well rounded Doctor and strong to his beliefs, and at the end of the day I walk away knowing he has my best interest in mind. (Also he is the most handsome Doctor I ever had... Lol).|Everyone was phenomenal on the staff. Worked quickly and efficiently to help relieve pain. The establishment was clean ans inviting which made me feel comfortable as a new patient.|Clean quiet humble atmosphere. All the nurses are nice and understanding. Dr. benni, himself, is accepting and understanding and gives second chances. I come for opiate dependency but there are a range of problems him and his office treat. Even medical marijuana :)
Thanks Dr benni and his team for all you do!

UPDATE 10/2023
I've been seeing Dr benni for about a year now. For over a year I've been seeig a dermatologist for an unknown facial rash that won't go away. It's ruined my social life and work life. Dr. benni was kind enough to notice and today he started to help me find a way to get rid of the rash. Ways that my dermatologist never did. I am thankful he's taking on a task that he did not have to do. I just want my skin back to the way it was and he seems more. Eager to help than my own derm.  Thank you so much.|Best pain doctor I've ever had. He doesn't just see a patient.  He listens to you and understands what your going through. Mot affordable.  Took my insurance no problem.  Thanks Doc.

column2: Comprehensive Pain Care of South Florida Lantana
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Care of South Florida serves Lantana, Lake Worth Beach, and surrounding areas with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team focuses on relieving pain, restoring function, and renewing hope for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. We take the time to carefully evaluate each patient's unique situation, providing accurate diagnoses and personalized treatment plans designed for long-term relief.

At our Lantana facility, we offer comprehensive interventional pain management techniques. Our physicians are board-certified specialists with extensive training in pain medicine. We treat various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care to address both symptoms and underlying causes.

Our Treatment Approach

We utilize a multi-disciplinary approach that may include:

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Medication management when appropriate

  • Interventional techniques

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Patient education for self-management strategies

Patient-Centered Philosophy

Our philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just the pain. We understand how chronic pain affects quality of life and daily functioning. Each treatment plan is tailored to individual needs with the goal of improving mobility, reducing medication dependence, and enhancing overall wellbeing.

Visit Our Pain Management Clinic

Located at 4560 Lantana Rd Suite 110, Lake Worth Beach, FL 33463, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. Contact us at (561) 795-8655 to schedule your consultation or visit www.comprehensivepaincare.com for more information about our services.
column11: Comprehensive Pain Care is a Pain management facility. Relieving Pain, Restoring Function, renewing Hope. Our team will take the time to carefully evaluate, diagnose, and treat your pain.

column40:
I called 3 different times during office hours to schedule an appointment but no answer, only goes to voicemail. I received texts and I responded that I wanted to make a new patient appointment but I only got a response to call the voice line number or to respond to the text. It's an automated response, there's no real person answering my text. No one answers the phone number. That's such a turn off so I will find another doctor. If I can't reach you to make an appointment how will I reach you once I become a patient??|I have been going to this practice for 27 years. That's right 27 years.
I have been seen by many of the Drs. here. All that have given me the best care n understanding of my issues. Let's just say my case is complicated. Dr. Dietrick n Amanda have  been my main care takers. I'll close with this. When you're dealing with chronic pain 24/7, you want someone you trust. I fully trust everyone at Comprehensive Pain Care. .|I was fortunate enough to find a great group of physicians who listen to their patients carefully and take into consideration your feelings and goals of treatment, and that's unusual in these times. I have been using them for six years, and their pain management protocols are very good. I have only very nice things to say about the staff, the cleanliness and speed of which patience are seen.|This office is run like a mill.   Just go in for a schedualed appoint and WAIT!
Had an appointment with Dr Dietrich specifically and after 1 hour was told he may be able to see me for a min.   I don't think that's the type of dr I want for possible rushed injections or anything else.|Very disappointing! I have seen Dr Rasekhi for quite some times for my neck, upper back and arm pain and  she doesn't ask me how do I feel . I'm in a pain management center and I expect that simple, nice and very important question from the doctor.. Dr Rasekhi has shown that she doesn't care about the patient . She's always in a hurry, doesn't want to be asked anything . Today she even sighed at my questions which are super few.  She just schedules you the epidural , and that's it . She doesn't tell you anything at all, no explanation of anything , and doesn't ask you anything either .  I feel that I have no pain management doctor because when I ask her , I feel she gets annoyed for questions that supposedly she cannot answer . But she's the doctor , who else it's going to answer the questions . If there is no exact answer , then she should explain it but she doesn't even bother with that . They also like to se d you the nurse practitioner first instead of Dr Rasekhi which I don't accept it . If I cannot talk to her in a follow up appointment and I cannot talk to her on the day of my epidural procedure because everything is fast , and she shows that she doesn't want to be asked , so when am I supposed to talk to my pain management doctor? This is a doctor who I can't talk to , can't ask anything . Not good , don't recommend her .|Comprehensive pain care are the best. They care about the patients and go above and beyond to provide amazing care to every single patient. They treat you like family. Not just another chart number. I recommended them to anyone that needs their services.|This office is a nightmare of epic proportions. I would assign ZERO stars if it was an option. They will schedule twenty (plus) patients appointments at any given time. They lock the door at lunch, unlocking it once they feel like it even though there's twenty people waiting in the rain because they have 1pm appointments and it's 1:15pm. They will make you wait hours to see someone (rarely the actual doctor) and if you are 15 minutes late you are out of luck. They make prescription mistakes and you have to wait a month to get it corrected. Including going through withdrawals. The patient is not treated with respect. Once you choose a pain management doctor, he has you cornered because it's too hard to change prescribers. If I could do it over again I'd choose a different place.|They are on time and there staff, doctors and PA's are always very kind and very helpful I have been a patient of Dr. Dietrich for a few years now and was recommended by another friend who still travels from Tennessee just to come see Dr. Dietrich when he needs him. Awesome practice.

column3:
Florida Pain Physicians in Jacksonville, FL delivers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Northeast Florida. Our multi-service practice combines advanced treatment options with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. With state-of-the-art facilities and a patient-centered approach, we help individuals regain mobility and improve quality of life through customized treatment plans.

At our Hodges Boulevard location, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options. Our treatments include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs and medical history of our patients.

Our Expert Medical Team

Our board-certified physicians bring extensive training and clinical experience to every patient interaction. Our doctors completed advanced fellowships in pain management and anesthesiology at prestigious medical institutions. The entire clinical staff stays current with the latest pain management techniques and technologies through ongoing professional development. This expertise allows us to offer both traditional and innovative approaches to pain relief.

Patient-Focused Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily life. Our physicians take time to listen and develop comprehensive treatment strategies. We emphasize minimally invasive procedures whenever possible. Our goal is helping patients return to normal activities with reduced dependence on medication. The clinic provides detailed education about pain conditions and treatment options during each consultation.

Florida Pain Physicians is conveniently located at 4796 Hodges Blvd, Jacksonville, FL 32224. New patients are welcome to schedule an appointment by calling +1 904-800-7246. For more information about our services and providers, visit our website at https://floridapainphysician.com/.

I just adore the staff from the front all the way through the office.|I came as a new patient. Everything was great fast-forward four procedures 12 appointments and the last five months I did not see my doctor once. I was always scheduled with the nurse for them to ask me to schedule a surgery. I did not see the doctor for five months, I found a new doctor and told them I wouldn't be going there anymore. He cut off my medical marijuana card cash which was separate from my other visits cash payment and instead of allowing it to expire. He went in spitefully cut it off. I already had my orders in there. I wasn't due for more orders for another three months spiteful Front desk was nasty. The nurses didn't know what they were doing. I went there with a broken screw in my back and they did not find it in a year and a half. I had to find it myself with the imaging that I requested. This office is become too busy , too many patients too much staff and they keep striving for more and more and more money. Ridiculous.|A friend insisted that I needed to make an appointment with Dr. Foltz. I honestly was not getting my hopes up that this would result in anything better than my previous experience with 20+ years of pain management. My new patient consult with Dr. Foltz was the most comprehensive and compassionate appointment I believe I have ever had with a physician. Dr. Foltz fully listened to all of my concerns in such a manner that made me so comfortable and heard. I left that day with so much hope for a better quality of life. He made a plan of action for my care and over a year later I am happy to say that I feel better than I have in years. He has an incredible, friendly staff that make each visit from beginning to end go so smoothly and they are all just so pleasant to interact with.  April, the PA that I see for my followup appointments between procedures continues to guide my care like none other, she is so very kind and phenomenal at what she does and is clearly dedicated to finding treatment suggestions that are best for her patients. One of her suggestions for me was to start physical therapy with their on site therapist, Brian. He has been hands down the best physical therapist I have worked with, and I have had many over the years. The communication between these caregivers has been a game changer in my pain management journey.  I am so thankful that my friend led me to this practice. I wish I could give them more than the 5 stars above. Their combined care has given me such a gift and I along with my family are so very grateful.|Dr. Foltz and his team are amazing. National Pain Institute serves Lady Lake, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team combines skill, patience, and empathy to address chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment approaches. We remain committed to staying current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to provide our patients with the most effective care possible.

At National Pain Institute, we specialize in treating various pain conditions through evidence-based methods. Our physicians develop individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. We understand that pain affects everyone differently, requiring unique approaches for optimal results.

Our services include:

- Interventional pain procedures

- Medication management

- Physical therapy coordination

- Minimally invasive techniques

- Advanced diagnostic testing

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe successful pain management requires a collaborative relationship between doctor and patient. Our physicians take time to listen, understand your symptoms, and explain treatment options clearly. This personalized approach helps improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Our Location

The National Pain Institute is conveniently located at 13945 US-441, Lady Lake, FL 32159. Our facility is equipped with modern technology to provide comprehensive care in a comfortable setting.

Lipson Pain Institute serves Winter Haven, FL and surrounding Polk County communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded in 1999, this established clinic holds the distinction of being the oldest pain management practice in Polk County, building a legacy of trusted care for over two decades. Dr. Ana Lipson and her expert team of associates have dedicated their careers to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans.

The clinic offers a wide range of interventional pain management techniques and therapeutic approaches. Patients seeking relief from back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and neuropathic conditions receive customized care plans. The medical team utilizes advanced diagnostic tools to identify pain sources accurately. Treatment options include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies tailored to each patient's needs.

Expert Medical Team

Dr. Ana Lipson leads a team of board-certified pain specialists with extensive training in pain medicine. Their combined expertise covers various pain conditions affecting Polk County residents. The physicians stay current with the latest pain management research and techniques. Each doctor brings specialized knowledge in treating complex pain syndromes and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Lipson Pain Institute, the focus remains on improving quality of life through effective pain control. The clinic provides comprehensive evaluations during initial consultations. Treatment plans address both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies. Patients receive education about their conditions and self-management techniques. The staff coordinates care with primary physicians and specialists when necessary.

column40:
I first began treatment with Dr. Lipson and her team in February of 2022.  I have received multiple cervical epidural steroid injections in the past 3 years.  These injections have provided complete, yet temporary, relief of symptoms related to cervical radiculopathy.  I began these injections as an conservative alternative to surgery, and have been quite pleased with the results.  I now believe it may be time for a surgical solution, but am happy to have found Dr. Lipson during this process.

Her office staff is very competent and pleasant to deal with.  I never sat in the lobby of her office for more than 5 minutes before being called back.  On follow-up apts. you always have the option to schedule with Dr. Lipson herself, but I found Anissa, one of Dr. Lipson's ARNPs, very pleasant to work with.|The team is so kind and helpful. You really feel like you are family and everyone who works in the office is a part of your wellness journey. Dr. Lipson is incredible. She takes the time to completely understand your needs, health goals and works out a plan to ensure you feel good! She has amazing relationships with surgeons and will do anything to get you the help you need. I feel safe and taken care of at Lipson Pain Institute.|Personnel is super kind and helpful. They feel you pain and they explain in details all the options you have. Nurse Patricia Bayshore is super kind and explain how they work.|I'm a new patient of Dr. Lipson. I was referred to the Lipson group after a change of  insurance coverage in April of this year. I've had a pain management for quite a few years and whenever I've had a change of doctors I've been a bit apprehensive about the new doctors. I worried for nothing. Dr Lipson and the Lipson group have been great since starting with them I have been very happy. I've had 2 MRI' s on my upper and lower back also ex-ray of my left h knee. Thanks to Dr. Lipson I better understanding of my conditions. Everything was explained to me and everyone has been wonderful. I had two procedures done here recently. Injections in my upper and lower back. Dr. Lipson was attentive and everyone of her staff and at the Day Surgery Center we're great. I highly recommend the Lipson group. At 70 years old I'm feeling better than I have in quite awhile. 5 's|I was referred to Dr. Lipson after my former pain management provider retired!  I have had nothing but extreme success with my lumbar epidural to ease back pain.  Dr. Lipson and her entire team are kind, genuine, and passionate about what they do!  I cannot recommend Dr. Lipson enough!|Lipson Pain Institute has helped me with my pain over the past year. I have some very complicated physical issues that they are helping me with. Dr Lipson & Annissa are both very caring & competent. The front desk staff as well.|I was so very impressed with all of the staff at Lipson Pain Management and Dr Lipson. She actively listened to my concerns and addressed everything very thoroughly and thoughtfully. I highly recommend this practice! Dr. Lipson is absolutely amazing!.
I really appreciate everyone at Lipson! They are fantastic and very compassionate and caring. All of the staff is wonderful, caring, and professional. I am so happy that I found this practice and am finally getting positive results after years of pain. Thank you so much.|Patricia Bayshore made my neck feel better in one vist! Thank you 
I have been going to pain management doctors for 27 years and Dr. Lipson's practice is top-notch.

Pain Center of Central Florida serves Orlando, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team provides personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently in the heart of Central Florida, our clinic combines advanced treatment techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain their quality of life.

At our Orlando facility, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches. Our treatments include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management. We specialize in addressing back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and post-surgical pain syndromes. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs and medical history.

Our Medical Expertise

Our board-certified physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine. Our doctors completed advanced fellowships in pain management and anesthesiology at prestigious institutions. The medical team stays current with the latest developments in pain science through ongoing education and research. This commitment ensures patients receive the most effective evidence-based treatments available.

Conditions We Treat

We provide comprehensive care for numerous painful conditions including:

  • Spinal disorders and herniated discs

  • Arthritis and joint inflammation

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia and myofascial pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Work and sports injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

Our philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just symptoms. We take time to understand each patient's pain experience. Our team works collaboratively to develop multidisciplinary treatment strategies. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible. Our goal is improving function and reducing reliance on medications.

Visit Our Orlando Pain Clinic

The Pain Center of Central Florida welcomes new patients at our comfortable, modern facility. We're located at 3861 Oakwater Circle, Suite 2, Orlando, FL 32806. Most major insurance plans are accepted. Contact our friendly staff at (407) 649-7800 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at floridapaincenter.net.
column38: Rebecca Bryant|Jim Harrell|Jeffrey Foster|AUDRA Sproule|Jesus Ocasio|Heather Watson|Tom Ince|Luis Felipe Gomez
column40:
Dr. Melvin has seen my mother as a patient for over 20 years and has been the most honest and respectful doctor she has ever seen. He is very patient and kind and also a very caring person which makes a difference. He is willing to go the extra mile to make sure all his patients are well cared for and all their concerns are heard. The front end staff is always lovely every visit very warm and welcoming|I went here in regards to pain management due to a bad auto accident. While I was seeing Dr. Melvin, my attorney referred my case to another attorney due to medical reasons. That will matter later. The procedures that Dr. Melvin recommended to relieve my pain my insurance will not cover as it's related to an auto accident. I had an LOP with this office and my previous attorney. The office had continued to send me bills for services I was told would be under the LOP. Instead of telling me upfront they cancelled my LOP because *I* changed attorneys without telling them (which is false, my attorney did that for me, I never wanted to and how was I supposed to know that was their rule?), they tried to pacify me for months like falsely telling me that if I had medical insurance, I had to utilize my medical benefits before using PIP benefits or LOP benefits (my case was grandfathered before that change in the law but I guess these people are not detail-oriented even though this line of work demands it). Moreover, I pointed out what do they mean "if" someone has medical insurance? Isn't everyone required to have medical insurance under ACA? The office assistant was very rude toward me, saying "Well I'm not going to get into a political debate with you." That woman is very unpleasant and unprofessional, which basically sums up this office. To circle back, I could not use medical benefits because it's auto-related, and the LOP no longer existed but they failed to mention that detail (again, not detail-oriented). I pointed all this out to Dr. Melvin for a $30K procedure (which by the way of course doesn't have a return policy if it doesn't work...), and he did not care in the slightest. He simply said I would have to pay in cash then, to which I asked, who has $30K sitting around? I guess he does because he is clearly only after money and not after the well-being of his patients. That's when he broke the news that my LOP was cancelled. So I asked why can't we just do an LOP with my new attorney, so I can get the procedure done? He said he doesn't know my attorney...so did he know my last one? Does he meet all attorneys? Or did he just not care, and didn't want to help me anymore? This review is really not about how broken this system is, but wanted to give a wholistic view of my experience here, which is what I'm reviewing. Which deserves negative stars if given the opportunity. Go to another office that is more patient-oriented and not cash-oriented.|Doctor Melvin and his staff performed injections. So far it really helped. He is very professional and he really took away some pain. Second round today. Staff and nurses are very sweet and professional. Thank you!|One of the most professional offices I have ever been to. The staff is very friendly and thorough with explaining everything. The doctor really took time to go over all of my results with me and to explain testing needed and plans to move forward. I appreciate all of their hard work to get me going as a new patient and come up with a care plan.|Dr Creamer is an excellent doctor, I relocated in Florida from up north do to weather being hard on my injuries looking for some relief, the first pain doctors I saw wanted to start treatment from 0 again which I had tried in many forms before, I can honestly say my diabetes raised do to so many steroids I got early in my treatments and I went to see Dr Creamer and explained to him my conditions and treatments I've gotten and he right away understood and decided to continue my treatments as my other pain doctor had me on, to me that was a relief because I honestly didn't want to start all over again, the staff is very professional and caring as well, I would recommend this practice to anyone,|Dr Melvin and his staff are courteous and very skilled. Everything from the real care from Dr Melvin to the expertise of the billing staff and especially the follow ups to confirm the care provided some comfort.|Treats everyone that goes here like an addict.  The first thing they said to me when I called to make an appointment was "You should not expect to have any pain medications prescribed".

Took forever to get disability work filed (even though they charge you extra for it) and they didn't do it right.  When asked to fix they wouldn't and they also wouldn't extend my disability when their treatments didn't work.

There's a reason this place has the most availability of any of the pain management centers in Orlando, because no one wants to go here.|Fantastic staff!!
The best service after we went to 3 different offices and did not want to do the procedure!!.
Dr. Melvin and his staff where absolutely amazing and understanding, my son has autism and they cater to him perfect thank you.

The Florida Pain Physicians staff and Doctors here in Orange Park are second to none. My great experience began back in November 2024 as I walked through their doors frustrated and in pain. I was greeted by Greta and Neri who took the time to welcome me to the clinic and address my issues and concerns. They actually saw me as a person who needed medical attention and proceeded to get me the help I needed.

Their compassion and commitment to excellence has set the tone for customer service and has restored the confidence and  belief that great quality and customer care is still alive. I saw Dr. Laura Gill and before we proceeded with any type of medical conversation, she took the time to know me as the person and not the patient, in other words she valued me as an individual. I also must add she is really great at her job. There is no exploratory process, she is all about the root cause.

Great job guys and keep up the great work.|I made several different appointments each time i came for my appointment that was a problem first time the dr gill was not in the orange park the next time there was a problem they said I was not scheduled for the procedure this was three times in a row there was a problem with getting the procedure
I really like dr Gill I don't know if the person who handles the schedules is incompetent or is not organized. I will have to find another place where it is more organized and am able to get the treatment that will help me with my pain.|For the very 1st time in 25 years that I am pain free! Dr. Laura Gil is the kind of doctor that listens and she goes above and beyond for her patients. I don't even know how to thank her.|My experience with Dr. Avila has been the absolute best. Ive had a total of 6 surgeries on my spine. When I had my very first consultation with him, he was very professional, humble, the best bedside manner from any physician I have ever known, and he takes his time explaining the procedures on what to expected. column40:
I was very impressed with Dr. Cartwright and staff. Especially a young man named Gared. He is something like a savant when it comes to healthcare. They took there time with me and explained everything so I could understand. They even went the extra mile when Gared called me after my procedure to check to see how I was feeling.|Dr Joseph Cartwright has been my pain physician for 7+ years. I highly recommend Dr Cartwright to anyone experiencing chronic pain. He is personable, observant, always thinking of the patient's best interest and a great doctor to have on your medical team!|Never go to get treated at this facility in St. Augustine or you will encounter rude, belittling, uncaring, and unprofessional front desk employees named Heather, Maria, & Jennifer. I have been a patient of Dr. Friedenstein  for 6 years and I am a disabled 74 year old widow in current treatment for severe pain in my back. Yet , I was turned away from the office this week without being able to see the doctor or make the important appointment for my radiofrequency ablation back shot. That is because these incompetent women failed in their duties and did not properly notify me that the doctor was on vacation all week, and the PA Matthew Bonin left on emergency. I was essentially stood up unable to see any doctor and wasting my whole day. When I asked to see a part of my record which was my recent x ray and MRI report, I was also refused! They said a doctor had to go over them with me, which is absolutely false....it is a HIPAA violation to withhold a patient's own medical records from them .Who would not be upset in this situation? I voiced my frustrations to the girls pointing out that their company charges a fee for canceling less than 24 hours before, and yet they knew the doctor was out, and they didn't give me the decency to call until 2 hours before my appointment and then never even relay the info to the call center that Matthew was gone. I had called to check and the call center said that my appointment was still scheduled and Matthew would be there. They gave me an appointment card for next week when the doctor returns. So, essentially, these girls were goofing off, not doing their jobs, chatting at the front desk, because both of their Dr. bosses were gone for the day! They had messed up, but they did not like me telling me they did. I was so rightly upset I was mumbling under my breath as I walked to the door, as I opened the door, one shouted across the room loudly patronizing me and mocking my anger, "Have a nice Day"!!! The next day, I get a call from a Jennifer who proceeds to start rattling off something about that I can no longer see the doctor.!!!!  I stopped her dead cold. I told her I didn't know who she was but if she even tries to mess with me there will be legal manifestations. I hung up. I think these girls are somehow trying to dismiss me so the doctor doesn't hear about their misbehavior in all of the doctor's absence that day. I cannot believe they don't know that health practitioners cannot just dismiss patients who are in 'continuity of care.' They also can't dismiss patients for discriminatory reasons such as disabilities. Dismissal of a patient is only done as a last resort after a continued misbehavior or infraction. There is a set process to dismiss a patient laid out by the AMA and the Florida Medical Association. To not follow these rules is called 'patient abandonment' and can have civil liability and a doctor can lose his license over it. So, I don't know who this bottom- of- the -ladder- girl Jennifer is that tries to call me over the phone and tries to tell me that I can't see my doctor anymore who I rely on for pain medications and back shots is..but her action is absolute abuse! And it goes to show what lengths some employees will go to cover their own shortcomings. Too bad for them that I have proof on my phone of their voice messages with their names trying to cancel my appointment only two hours before. So please be leary. Dr Friedenstein is a great doctor, but members of his staff care nothing about you if you are elderly and disabled.. They will mock, slander, and abuse you if you dare need to expose them for their incompetency and uncaring behavior.|Been going to Dr. Cartwright for years to treat spine issues with epidural injections. Cartwright is knowledgeable and genuinely caring. I would attribute his skills in helping me avoid more surgeries. When it was clear I needed immediate surgical help he facilitated getting in with a surgeon the next day!|After 10 years at a different pain doctors I found the best for pain. Seeing them for the last six months of treatment and injections, life is so much better. The staff is kind , the office is clean .along with being pleasant .Injections are done for your comfort. During the period I have been seening them I fell after .I got home the hospital they were right here for me. Thank you Florida Coast for your caring healing.|I had amazing experience with this office- originally made the appointment because I was having an issue with my back but the night before fell on my knee and injured it- Dr. Foltz- advised me that I had probably torn my meniscus and needed to see a surgeon.  I did, in fact tear my meniscus and need surgery!  I did rehab with George- who really knows his stuff and I am back to work!!
Abby and Moriah-at the front desk- know how to treat patient's with a kind heart!   The assistant's- help Dr. Foltz- with all he needs so the office run as smooth as possible!  You are treated like a person- not a number at this office!!  The only time I can ever see anyone not getting the care they need- is when they are not doing their part!!
Thank you for your care!!|Dr. Foltz is an amazing pain doctor! I wish I could go to him for EVERYTHING... except groceries.  The nurses (and assistants)  are so friendly, give GREAT hugs and make you feel like you're just coming by to talk to old friends!
Being a gun shot wound survivor, leading to the amputation of my right leg, constant pain was just my "new normal". I never thought I would see a day free of pain.  I never thought, that is, until I visited Florida Pain Physicians and Dr. Foltz.  Because of Doc and the staff, I can go out and throw the ball with my son and dance with my daughter without wincing in pain. Thank you, Dr. Foltz, the wonderful nurses/assistants (Lois, Sarah, Kyra (etc.)) and Florida Pain Physicians!|Capt foltz is an excellent doctor. Glad to have him back as my pain doctor after having him in the navy. Staff is friendly also.   Capt. Folts breaks thing down so anyone can understand. He listens to patients and makes sure patients are comfortable. He is one of the best pain doctors in all of Jacksonville. He doesn't run test you don't need and does a through assessment. Capt foltz is a navy doctor that knows what he is doing and will do you any harm and will do what is in the best interests of the patients. Also brian is one of the best physical therapy around he is just like capt foltz and  naval hospital Jacksonville should hire him to do work there when not at Florida pain physician all of southeast orthopedic should come here. And tricare needs to keep them in network for all outside pain management and physical therapy.

column2: Sarasota Pain Relief Centers - Lakewood Ranch
column3:
Sarasota Pain Relief Centers in Lakewood Ranch, Florida serves patients seeking effective pain management solutions throughout Sarasota County. Our specialized clinic focuses on comprehensive pain treatment strategies tailored to each patient's unique needs. With state-of-the-art facilities at 8936 77th Terrace E, UNIT 101, Lakewood Ranch, we provide advanced interventional procedures and multidisciplinary approaches to chronic pain conditions.

Our team offers targeted treatments for various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic disorders. We utilize evidence-based techniques such as epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Each treatment plan addresses the underlying cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our Expert Medical Team

The physicians at Sarasota Pain Relief Centers combine decades of clinical experience with advanced training in pain medicine. Our doctors hold board certifications in pain management and anesthesiology, having completed specialized fellowships at prestigious medical institutions. This expertise allows our team to implement the latest pain management protocols while maintaining the highest standards of patient care.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals. Our clinic emphasizes minimally invasive procedures whenever possible, helping patients avoid unnecessary surgery while improving function and quality of life. We take time to educate patients about their conditions and treatment options.

Contact Information

Sarasota Pain Relief Centers - Lakewood Ranch

8936 77th Terrace E, UNIT 101

Lakewood Ranch, FL 34202

Phone: (941) 362-2131

Website: https://yourpainreliefcenters.com/locations/sarasota/sarasota-pain-relief-centers-lakewood-ranch

Conveniently located in Lakewood Ranch, our clinic welcomes patients from throughout Sarasota, Bradenton, and surrounding communities. We accept most major insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling options for both new and returning patients.

column38: Sarah Sunshine|katrina Loverose|Sean Mateja|king mon|B|Dejay Salmons|Amanda Smith|Chris Doucette
column40:
Really surprised at all the negative reviews I've been a patient since 2011/2012 from Tampa and now Sarasota. Although I had one dr at the waldemere office I wasn't crazy about once I moved to the office in Lakewood ranch I've been happy. Dr. Goel has done many successful procedures on me and the front office staff are super sweet. I've had issues with pharmacies not getting orders or dealing with pre authorization on certain medications but outside of that it's all great. Never a long wait in office . When I ask for modifications to medication and for imaging or injections they accommodate me. Also on a side note Amy is amazing and makes me feel heard. I'm having major knee surgery and have felt super overwhelmed with my recovery time and she listens to me and makes plans based on what I actually need.

As a side note I should mention this is not a "pill mill" they advocate for safe opioid use which is in our best interest . I wish I didn't need medication at all but I went off a bridge in my car many years ago and it's taken a toll on me . Even that being said I take the lowest dose medication possible knowing I'll likely need something for the rest of my life I don't want to build up a tolerance so high I have to take massive amounts of medication to control the pain. I hope if you are taking these medications you do so responsibly.|Well they won't see me as a patient there and basically insinuated that I was a drug addict funny though the same 60 pills they gave me back in September I've got about 55 of them left yeah I'm a big drug addict freaking hilarious!!! I just wanted help controlling my pain and they couldn't even offer that instead they offered for me to go see somebody else thanks! I'll be sure not to recommend you to anybody and if they ask my opinion I'll be sure to tell them the truth. I should have known when you were making everybody wear mask in the office when it wasn't even mandatory, which mandatory doesn't even mean it's law. But if we didn't wear a mask you wouldn't see us ridiculous it's not even a regular physician it's just pain management!!! The weird thing is is about a year ago I was seeing this doctor and everything was fine until I saw his assistant whoever she is Then they had to have a meeting and decided that I could no longer be their patient I guess y'all did me a favor maybe now I'll actually get somebody who can help me! Because this pain is ridiculous and it's hard to function some days but I will wait till I'm practically dying before I will take a pain pill so there there's that!!! Good luck to your practice and I will be praying for you!!! God knows you need it!!! Because the way you treat your patience is not very humble.|Dr. Goel doesn't care about his patients plain and simple! I have a hernia and degenerative disease and arthritis, he took me off my pain meds and didn't prescribe anything else after seeing him for two years. I'm in serious pain and he and his staff dismiss it, time to find a doctor that genuinely cares for their patients!! Definitely DO NOT recommend his practice by any means possible.|This is the worst place ever. I went there for pain they prescribed me medication. About three hours later I call Walgreens asking if they received the prescription they said no so I called back the pain relief center explained to the lady that Walgreens is saying that they haven't received the prescription keep in mind this is 3 hours later. She goes off on me telling me oh well obviously it hasn't been sent yet. Just disrespectful The whole process just didn't make sense.  so the next day I call Walgreens an still haven't received the prescription. Had to call back the pain management again the lady tells me the manager will contact me. Long story short i had to go to another doctor. I WOULD NEVER GO BACk OR RECOMMEND ANYONE TO GO THIS PLACE|I have been a patient of Dr. Goels for many years and beforehand I had to look back and see my history. It's been almost 7 years I have consistently been going to Tampa pain relief and Sarasota pain relief centers. However, my last visit was a complete utter debacle, and I cannot bring myself to almost go back, first of all, I have never heard one response from Dr. Goel about the situation and second the practitioner LeBron is clueless. We have tried to somehow fix her mess up with my medication and it is still not been properly corrected. I called and left a message to speak to the office manager of the centers and still have yet to receive a reply. This place has just gone completely downhill. I've had so many different providers. My head is still spinning. So if you have a choice to find a pain relief center find out exactly who you're going to see in the office just a completely disappointed patient|Dr. Amitabh Goel is an extremely professional and experienced physician that cares about his patients. I would highly recommend him to anyone that is dealing with symptoms of chronic pain.|WORST pain management center EVER!!! I went here due to my C6 and C7 vertebrates in my neck being out of place and degenerative disc disease in my L4 &L5 lumbar. I am a type one Diabetic on an insulin pump. All of my current medications and my health conditions were given to them prior to the appointment.

They told me I could bring in my paperwork and disc to the appointment and then tried to cancel the appointment on me 15 minutes prior to my arrival. When I told them I had everything with me they told me I could come.

I showed up with other patients in the waiting room. One was almost in tears because they kept asking her the same question over and over. Another patient walked in and said she needed her medicine called in and since they never answer their phone she had to drive all the way to the office in pain.

I finally get to see the NP and she tells me she can't help me with anything for pain because it would interfere with the medicine I was already on. Then she tells me she can't even help me with neck injections because I am a type one diabetic and steroids would make my blood  sugars shoot through the roof. Her conclusion was for me to just leave and go to a surgeon AFTER they took my insurance and $60 co-pay OF COURSE.

She blamed it all on the front desk for not doing their job. I really hope they do not try to waste time processing this through my insurance because I will fight it. Thankfully I wasn't self-pay. It seems like all they want is your money.  Also, seems like they would rather drug you up on opioids rather than use medicine that I already know works best for me. I'll take my money elsewhere with doctors who care.

I wish I would have read the negative reviews BEFORE I even made an appointment!|Paid over $1500 for two office visits and an epidural shot for back pain. After follow-up visit, Dr. Goel asked if my leg pain improved!?!  UNBELIEVABLE!!  Most of The office and Doctor are Completely clueless. If it was $5K I would've obtained an attorney and sued them! Worst medical experience of my life!

One positive note....The front counter girl was EXCEPTIONAL!!  Too bad she's not in charge.

column3:
Excel Pain and Spine in Wauchula, Florida serves residents throughout Hardee County with comprehensive pain management solutions. As the only specialized pain clinic in the area, Excel Pain and Spine offers multidisciplinary treatment approaches for both acute and chronic pain conditions. The clinic's patient-centric philosophy ensures each individual receives personalized care tailored to their specific pain syndrome and recovery goals.

The medical team at Excel Pain and Spine specializes in interventional spine procedures and advanced pain management techniques. Patients benefit from evidence-based treatments for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. The practice utilizes minimally invasive procedures whenever possible to promote faster recovery times and improved outcomes.

Specialized Treatment Options

Excel Pain and Spine offers a wide range of therapeutic interventions including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

The clinic's approach integrates multiple treatment modalities to address pain at its source. Patients appreciate the thorough diagnostic process that identifies underlying causes rather than simply masking symptoms.

Serving Hardee County

Located at 326 S 6th Ave in Wauchula, Excel Pain and Spine brings specialized pain care to an underserved region. Local patients no longer need to travel to larger cities for quality pain management services. The convenient location offers ample parking and accessibility features for patients with mobility challenges.

For consultations or to schedule an appointment, patients can call +1 813-701-5804 or visit the clinic's website at www.excelpainandspine.com. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to maximize their coverage benefits.
column11: Excel Pain and Spine, is a multidisciplinary, patient-centric practice that treats a wide range of acute and chronic pain syndromes. The Wauchula location brings the best and only choice for comprehensive pain and interventional spine care to Hardee County.

column40:
As a new patient, my first visit left a lot to be desired. I arrived prepared, MRI disc in hand, but felt like just another checkbox on an endless list of forms and processes. After lengthy questionnaires, I was met with the all-too-familiar "go here, go there, we'll be right with you" routine.

When I finally saw a PA, it felt more like a sales pitch than a genuine consultation--almost as though I needed to convince them my condition deserved real attention. The "triage" was painfully impersonal, like a fill-in-the-blank script that could have been handled in an email. My MRI? Pointless, since they "didn't have the equipment" to read it--read: no radiologist on staff.

In the end, I walked out with no treatment plan, no genuine understanding, and an appointment in two weeks. It's clear they have a rigid approach: when all you have is a hammer, everything looks like a nail. For a pain clinic, empathy and flexibility seem sorely lacking.

Update: received a very unprofessional phone call from the doctor, after this review went up.  (2hr after the appointment)

He called stating he heard I had some "questions," then used that time to clear up my expectations of being pain free and how my understanding about living life in chronic pain is flawed.  I've never been reprimanded by a doctor, I've never met, over the phone, for such a thing. He casually offered me two things... my right to go to another clinic, knowing the complications involved with the VA Community Care referral system or I could just keep my follow up as scheduled, if I want.

So.... Expect any and all frustrations to be held against you, here. Or have your case management being used as a tool of control instead of continuity.|I unfortunately had a car accident. The first appointment Dr. Reeves said he was gonna help me through this process. Everyone has been extremely helpful and friendly. It's been almost 2 years now and this has been a long process and I have no regrets on choosing Dr. Reeves.. I actually saw him yesterday in the Wauchula office and of course the whole staff is just so nice. I have a trust level with my Doctor, from the beginning of this treatment process. Several offices to choose from to see Excel Pain and Spine.. It's not fun at all, but the relieve of pain has gotten me this far. Thanks Dr. Reeves..Belinda.|I'm a new patient but I really likes the treatment they've had with me. Stella worries that everything is in order with the insurance and with appointments. I really appreciate her cordiality and kindness.|Dr Patel's office made the transition of moving to a new area and finding a pain management provider as smooth and accommodating as anyone could want. Thank you for the kind reception given to me. I might add that EVERYONE that works at EXCELfrom the office personnel to the Nurse Practitioners are kind and compassionate as well. Thank You ALL!|Received a steroid epidural Thursday Oct 17. In excruciating leg pain Saturday and Sunday which I was unable to control. In ER Monday for the same pain, they are unable to administer, or prescribe pain meds because of pain management through Excel Pain and Spine, that I would have to contact them for further treatment. I contacted Tuesday am and was told that I could not be seen by a Dr for 2 weeks on my next scheduled appointment, nothing available even on an emergency basis. Completely unprofessional to leave a patient in this condition. My association with them has been terminated, and will seek treatment elsewhere. And good luck getting through their call center.|This office is very nice, understanding from the receptionist desk ,to nurse practioners, doctors. They make you feel like a family member.  Thank you for seeing me and picking up from my Retired Doctor of almost 4 years.|I am so grateful for Dr.Lassar, and all the staff at EXCEL. Kindness, patience, and professionalism, are the foundation of their success. I have never been treated better than these wonderful people. I trust them completely with my health and well-being. Thank you all for everything, you are truly the best.|I am always treated so nice. My injury requires Debreading . Which I dread by the way, but hopefully you guys can do it with no pain because I have enough of pain   but thank you for asking how I'm  doing. .

At Family Spine and Pain Care Institute, we offer a wide range of specialized treatments for various pain conditions, including:

- Back and Neck Pain management using evidence-based approaches

- Acute Injury care with comprehensive rehabilitation plans

- Chronic Pain management with multidisciplinary approaches

Personalized Treatment Approach

Our pain specialists develop individualized treatment plans based on your specific condition, medical history, and lifestyle needs. We believe effective pain management requires understanding the whole person, not just treating symptoms. Each treatment plan may include a combination of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications.

Our Expert Team

The physicians at Family Spine and Pain Care Institute bring extensive experience in pain medicine and rehabilitation. Our doctors have completed specialized training in pain management techniques and stay current with the latest advancements in the field. Chronic pain can impact your physical health, emotional well-being, and overall quality of life. column40:
Just came from my first visit with Dr. Omar Henriquez. His office staff is friendly & efficient and made me feel welcome. Dr. Henriquez listened carefully to my concerns regarding my pain. He was able to offer me several options for treating my pain immediately & for the long term. I was very pleased with the care I received. I highly recommend Dr. Henriquez.|I went to see Dr Henriquez after extreme disappointment with 2 other pain physicians who failed to help me. After years of pain, I can finally start enjoying life again .....he did some facet injections ...No more nerve pain.
He is a wonderful, kind and very talented Dr|Dr Henriquez is an excellent doctor and a wonderful person. Always calm, friendly and a smile. As a former nurse, I can assure you that he is a top notch doctor. His care plans and his skills in doing procedures are always excellent. He has helped me so much and I am grateful. You can't find a better pain management doctor! The best.|I love dr Henriquez but the staff leaves much to be desired. I was in terrible back pain, saw his PA, on 3/25 had approval for the T4 procedure on 3/29. Then I called 4 times and got voice mail each time requesting a date for the procedure. No return call until 4/9 and couldn't get an appointment until 4/28. A doctor's office needs to respond immediately to voice mails for patients who are in trouble. I was terribly disappointed. I will pursue a pain management office in the North.|The staff at Family Spine and Pain Care Institute are great.  Dr. Omar Henriquez is such a great doctor.  He is patient and very knowledgeable who takes his time to explain to you the procedures and to makes sure he answers all your questions.  He truly treats you like a person and not a number and is concerned with the wellbeing of his patients to live a pain free life.  My only regret is that he is not in California, yet the trip that I make once a year to be treated by Dr. Henriquez is worth it because I am now living a pain free life.  I would highly recommend Dr. Henriquez to anyone struggling with back pain.|Dr Henriques is a wonderful doctor.  He is personable and an excellent doctor.  He was my pain doctor in Naples for many years before he moved to Venice. I immediately got set up as a new patient when I moved to Venice in May 2023.  His staff is very friendly as well.  They are all Compassionate and empathetic to your pain and needs.|The absolute best pain Doctor ever! I've been with Dr Henriquez for 8 years now! He's helped me so much. He listens, spends time diagnosing my problem and books my procedure to help alleviate my pain issues. I've referred many people to him for his expertise. The best ever! He's kept me out of a wheelchair while my old GP back in Illinois told me I only had a few years before I'd be in one! Dr H has done everything to keep me upright and walking! I highly recommend Dr Henriquez to anyone suffering any kind of pain, even migraines! He is very caring and compassionate. The Best!!!|Dr Omar is hands down AMAZING! I have been in pain for several years, after two treatments with him, I have been pain free for 9+ months. He and his staff are caring and compassionate. I would highly recommend if you are looking for pain management!

Advanced Interventional Pain Clinic in Longwood, Florida serves patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions throughout Central Florida. Our dedicated team combines medical expertise with compassionate care to address the complex nature of pain management. We understand that successfully treating pain requires skill, patience, empathy and staying current within our field of medicine.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

At our Longwood facility, we specialize in creating individualized treatment plans for patients suffering from various pain conditions. Our approach integrates advanced interventional techniques with traditional pain management strategies. Patients receive thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of their discomfort.

Our clinic offers specialized care for:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Sports injuries

- Post-surgical pain

- Chronic regional pain syndrome

Advanced Treatment Options

The medical team at Advanced Interventional Pain Clinic utilizes state-of-the-art procedures including:

- Epidural steroid injections

column38: Blake Blair|Rob C|Anna Rosario|Kristin Boston|EO Sponsorship|Charles Lane|Karen D|Albert Tittle
column40:
DO NOT MAKE MISTAKE OF SEEING DOCTOR KABA. I have a spine fusion comprising of the T2-T9 vertebrae. It's been 12 months since a 6 story fall that caused this and in that time I have pushed myself to the limit, battling unbelievable pain daily in physical therapy, the gym and work. I own and operate a multi unit business in the area. I have shocked the surgeons, family, friends, employees and the medical world in the progress that I have made. Unbelievable support from all directions. Except Kaba. The worst person in this entire process by far. I'm telling you unequivocally there are way better options than him. He was 30 mins late to appointments in the morning. Never was up to date on medical records and flat out acted like my father and I were lying in our first visit. Wears a mask even though he has it off around the staff in the background. Treats you like you're a junkie looking for a fix and doesn't absorb or have the communication skills to deal with varying medical situations. Clearly looks at everyone through his basic lenses and doesn't want to have to analyze and think on a person by person basis.|I've been a patient for over a year and Dr Kaba ,Ella and the rest of the staff are excellent. They're kind, courteous, and professional. I see Ella monthly and she's always great! I see Dr Kaba when I get shots and yesterday I had a nerve block that he helped me through as I couldn't receive sedation since I was driving myself. I really appreciated his concern.|On my last visit I was verbally mistreated by my Dr's nurse & I reported her to Fl Nursing Association & Human Resources. Other than that Dr Kaba and staff members are professionals willing to treat patients with care & love.|New patient!  Had my first appointment with Dr Kaba after a fall at work.  #3 - #4 disc issues pain level ... horrific muscle spasms in right shoulder pain is a 10.    Had my first set of injections in my shoulder blade on Monday NO PAIN in my shoulder slept great.  On to the back.
Dr. Kaba - a 10 in kindness and professionalism. Office staff is very kind as well. 

Forest is an asset to the clinic!!

Thank you|Staff is not very friendly, and in fact are rude, argumentative, and lazy.  It is like the patient becomes invisible. They don't provide much needed forms timely, if at all.  Unfortunately, Dr. Pham enables this lack of professionalism, as he would rather discharge a patient then address the staff and their behavior.  The office is rundown and  dirty, including the bathroom.  The lobby set up is not good not even for people with walkers and wheelchairs.   For the type of medical practice and disabled people like me who need a good ramp and automatic doors this office is sorely lacking.    I know all of them are professionals with their proper credentials and I don't have any doubts about their qualifications.   However, there is a feeling of low moral amongst the staff that projects as lack of interest on the patient.  I would be nice if the practice would address staff behavior,  did some remodeling updates to the front of door, the lobby, and most importantly,  train the staff in basic patient staff relations.  The Staff does not go a step above to make patients feel welcome or safe with their care. As for reviews complementing the staff, I'm sure that those are prepared by the staff to offset all of the reviews that complain about them. Make sure to read all reviews to get a true sense of how horrible this practice is.|Dr. Pham is very knowledgeable, caring, compassionate, and professional. I have been a patient here for 3.5 years and I have nothing but great things to say about them. The staff are friendly, courteous, and respect your time and privacy. Dr. Pham's assistants are very knowledgeable and review my health record and treatment at every appointment. I have seen Leslie Horn the most and she is fantastic! As of recent I have been seen by Forrest Saunders and he is great too! Overall, Advanced Interventional Pain Clinic offers exceptional care while making you feel like more than a patient!

Update 7/12/24: Exactly as stated above. Dr. Drahmane Kaba, MD and Forrest continue to deliver the best treatment and management of my chronic pain that I've ever received. This treatment has made a huge improvement in my daily functioning and in my relationships with family and friends. I never dread my appointments which makes it so much easier to mange. I appreciate the help of all of the staff there for making my life better.|I see a lot of Dr.'s - from the time I walk in to the time I leave,  I feel that the whole staff cares about my well being.  They are professional but friendly and caring.  Dr. Kaba is one of the best Dr.s I have been to and will continue to go to, because I know he cares and will do all he can to help me.|Everyone is caring. Forrest always asks how I am feeling and genuinely cares. My appointments are made quickly. My scripts are called in quickly. The place is spotless. You won't find a more caring staff any where. You never have to wait. It's everything you want from a doctor's office.

column40:
Absolutely wonderful! Dr. Fatouh and his staff were amazing! This clinic was so much better than my previous pain clinic. My previous clinic treated me like a drug seeker. Here, i was never treated as such. Everyone was so nice and understanding. I never had any of the issues everyone else is complaining about. The office staff was amazing! So many times there was insurance issues, etc and staff was always helpful. I hated to leave, but relocated to another state.|Dr. Udeshi and his staff are wonderful! I have been seeing him for approximately 10 years now. Front office staff are always friendly. PA Melissa is down to earth, friendly, charming and informative. She really listens. Dr. Udeshi is wicked smart and always remembers you! I have multiple issues, fibromyalgia, CRPS, lumbar injuries as well. And on and on. Dr. Udeshi really takes his time with you, on the few times that he may be running behind I never ever mind because he absolutely will be calm and patient and give me the time that I might need during my appointment. I completely trust this man, he has done several ablations on my lumbar, even my feet a few times. He and his staff keep me going, I have an active family and I am able to get the things I need to get done thanks to his education, kindness and amazing surgeon hands! He is a very kind man and I would be devasted if I ever had to change doctors! I can understand that there may be issues here and there with staffing and gosh help us insurance! I haven't had any problems thankfully and it's more important to me to see a doctor that I love so much and trust so much as well. I am super grateful for Dr. Udeshi and his staff both at the Palm Bay office and the Merritt Island office where I go for my procedures. Excellent and friendly, I truly am living a better life thanks to these amazing people! Thank you Dr. Udeshi, Melissa and staff for all you do!|The office staff should be fired. I went there on a referral and didn't even make it thru intake. Rude and unprofessional.|Honestly I just can't fathom that your office has completely left me high and dry and with no guidance, support, or help with my authorization issue.....
especially since I confirmed with my insurance company that the appeal you sent them, in fact, did have the wrong member number on it.

My insurance company called your office last week, after Tai, Ashley, and Lauren threw this issue back at me, and left a very detailed message regarding what happened and what needed to be done to rectify it. I'm pretty positive you've done nothing with that information. And that is no surprise.

I guess you have all proven that the patient is not important, customer service is not important, and being accountable, for an error that could've been easily corrected, is not important.

I am just shocked at the turn of events after having such a great experience with Dr. Udeshi when I first visited the office in October. I really wonder how he would feel if he knew how your behavior and lack of concern or customer service has lost him a patient that raved about the service, treatment, and relief I received with a prior issue.

I did my part and you all failed miserably at yours.

*****Update after receiving your response*****

I went to your website to contact you as you've requested and there is no 'contact us' option. This entire office/practice/business is a joke. You've got my name. If you actually do care, you can find me and inquire about the details of my experience.|Due to the unprofessionalism of the staff and doctors, I do not recommend this place at all because they play with the patients lives. After having an appointment for a procedure they have canceled not 1 but 3 times with ridiculous excuses and still stop me from taking pills that I need daily, they don't care at all. They have made me take blood tests every time they reschedule appointments, in addition to the expense of gasoline, of my time, and they did not solve my medical problem. It's the worst medical place I've ever been.|Very disappointed in how patients are treated.  Doctors do not return calls, most of the staff was rude. Because of concern with treatment of my daughter and lack of empathy we were released.  Found a better and more understanding office.  We were not there for "drugs" we wanted to have issues fixed. Everything I had to say was inappropriate but yet their staff treated me inappropriately more than once.|Saw Dr E and loved him. They did anset of 3 shots which did not help. On my follow up they explained that I probably needed surgery and gave me a refferal. I called a few days later to see if they could give me anything for pain since it was 15 days until the neuro had an appt.  Office staff was very rude, treats you like your shopping for drugs. She told me I might be able to get a steroid pack. I asked her how that helps with pain and she said "obviously we wouldnt give it if it didnt"  I have never heard of a steroid helpung with pain but she was not a gan of answering questions. I am sure I will never get a call back.|I showed up for my appointment 10 minutes early and used the Tele check in where I was placed on hold for 15 minutes. Then I was told to come up to the office. After waiting another 5 minutes I was told I was late for my appointment and the doctor wouldn't be seeing me. This cost me time from work oh and I still have to wait to be seen. I'll find another doctor. Since health is a business I'm sure there are other options and placed to spend my hard earned money, not to mention somewhere that acts professional and respects others time. Ohh and I'll be sending them a bill for my wasted time.

I would like to acknowledge AIPI for their excellence in staff members.
getting shots from Dr Gatz (!the best injector yet)' : lower lumbar herniation & cervical . He shoots right where it needs to be.
I realized that not all docs are precise when shooting a nerve.
This group is sincerely the kindest , preceptive, accountable and loyal group of professionals .

I know they along with the rest of my team will take care of me after a rear end car accident that we are working through. The office is super clean and everyone is very nice! Thank you everyone!|Dr. Gatz, Aneta and the team at AIPI are truly the best at helping patients after a car accident or slip and fall. They listen and really care about helping patients get back to their lives. Natalie is always helpful to accommodate my schedule for appointments.  From communicating with my attorney to the injections I've received, everything has been top notch and i cannot recommend them enough. Thank you AIPI!|I was a new patient with severe back pain after a car accident. I was scheduled to see the NP named Annette. Thank you Dr Gatz|I was able to get a very timely appointment for my consultation. I am seeing Dr. Gatz for Dystonia. I had told him about the horrible experience I had with a previous Dr. & his staff that was treating me for Dystonia.  Dr. Gatz listened and thank God made the necessary changes! Every staff member I was in contact with was absolutely excellent! VERYYYY caring! The "BESTEST EVER" was that within an hour of me leaving his office, I talked to my insurance company, and I was in shock......his staff had already called in to change my medication and was able to get the prior authorization!!!!!!! I have NEVER seen a Dr.'s office do their job in such a timely manner! Christmas came early for me this year! We could've done my procedure next Tuesday, yet due to the holiday and just playing it safe that my medication will be delivered in a timely manner, he will do my procedure 2 weeks from yesterday!! I couldn't ask for anything more! THANK YOU DR. GATZ & STAFF!|The American Interventional Pain Team are excellent. I was hit by an intoxicated driver Easter weekend, he was traveling at 80 mph when the impact occurred. I refused going to hospital in ambulance as I was in shock.
The pain hit me three days later like a train. I called American Interventional Pain and they immediately scheduled an appointment. The staff identified my injuries and worked quickly to provide lumbar & cervical epidurals which helped 100%.
Melissa, Dr. Gatz and the entire team are the best Physicians/Medical Operation I ever seen.
Keep up the great work American Interventional Pain!
