Florida Spine & Pain Specialists in Clermont, Florida provides comprehensive interventional pain management services for patients throughout Lake County. Our private practice offers immediate appointments for those seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Led by award-winning physician Dr. Javier Placer, our clinic specializes in minimally invasive treatments designed to improve quality of life without excessive medication.

Dr. Javier Placer, M.D. brings extensive experience in interventional pain management techniques. His patient-centered approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Dr. Placer's commitment to excellence has earned him recognition as an award-winning physician in his field. His specialized training enables him to offer advanced treatment options for complex pain conditions.

Our Pain Management Services

We provide comprehensive care for various pain conditions including:

- Spinal Pain Management: Treatment for herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and degenerative disc disease

- Joint Pain Relief: Specialized interventions for arthritis and joint-related discomfort

- Nerve Pain Treatment: Solutions for neuropathy and nerve compression syndromes

- Minimally Invasive Procedures: Including epidural injections and nerve blocks

- Personalized Treatment Plans: Customized approaches for each patient's unique needs

Our interventional techniques target pain at its source, providing longer-lasting relief than medication alone. We emphasize functional improvement alongside pain reduction.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Florida Spine & Pain Specialists, we understand how chronic pain affects daily life. Our team works closely with each patient to develop effective treatment strategies. We prioritize minimally invasive options before considering more aggressive interventions. Our goal is helping patients return to activities they enjoy without debilitating pain.

Contact us today at 407-499-0755 to schedule your appointment. We're conveniently located at 1804 Oakley Seaver Dr F, Clermont, FL 34711. Learn more about our services at https://floridaspinepain.com/

column40:
Dr. Sherman and his staff are wonderful! I started with this practice in December of 2021. I had recently moved to Florida and was not happy about leaving my pain doctor in Georgia. I was referred to Dr. Sherman and found that on my first appointment he was very thorough and spent quite a bit of time reviewing my charts with me. He and his staff quickly hooked me up with the St. Jude's Rep in the area for my implant and we started a journey TOGETHER! After a couple of years, Dr.  Sherman and I discussed the idea of implanting a device to administer pain meds directly into my spine. After a couple of discussions, the process began and I started titrating down from my current dosage of pain meds (which was extremely high). As we were nearing the process of being able to do the trial for the device, I learned I would have to have a total knee replacement which halted moving toward the trial. At this time, I was on the lowest amount of pain medication that I had been prescribed since 2010. After my knee surgery, I was on more pain meds than I had ever been on in my life and when I returned to the practice, Dr. Sherman worked with me to return back to my normal doses of medication. It took a couple months and my drive to "get off the meds" that brought me to where I am today. After my pain medication was returned to the level just prior to my trial, it was decided that I would not need to proceed with the pain pump implant. I no longer needed that kind of control. So, now I am back down to the lowest amount of pain meds I have ever taken since my original back surgery was performed. I accredit this to Dr. Sherman and his staff. While not every day is "coming up roses" I can say that I feel better and am more active than I have ever been even after 4 back surgeries, a neurostimulator implant, 2 SI Joint Fusions, 1 Knee Replacement, and one Knee cleanout. I encourage patients to go in and speak with Dr. Sherman and take to heart what he is saying to you. Ask questions and research your options because I can promise you that this man will be honest and truthful with you even if the discussion is a hard one to have. His staff are always friendly and welcoming and I can promise you that even though they run a tight ship...they are there to support your needs each and every day!|Dr Scott Sherman is straight to the point with his patients but HE CARES. As a matter of fact I'm not sure I have met a single doctor who cares more about my well-being than him. He is professional and extremely qualified.
I have had 3 spine surgeries with the last being total reconstructive. Dr. Sherman help me put things in perspective, not just giving me pain meds but TEACHING me and I can't imagine how long I would have struggled if I had not met him in 2011!
Dr Sherman and staff, thank you SO much!!|I've been seeing Dr Sherman for years. I have chronic neck pain and have been limited with treatment options. Dr Sherman has been very supportive and patient. He's an exceptional doctor.
All staff members are efficient and always professional. They could not be more friendly. I've always felt welcome.

Thanks to everyone for all of your support!  I couldn't be more pleased with my experiences at NPI!|Dr. Sherman is great a magician of sorts! Definitely improved my quality of life. Michael and Vanessa are awesome and always make you feel comfortable and are an awesome duo! Love seeing them even if it is for what it is.|The team here is amazing!!  From michael at check in till i leave the building all the staff always are professional yet friendly at same time!  And Dr Sherman is an amazing and truly listens to his patients. I had to go elsewhere for about 5 years and i hated everything about the other dr.  His staff was rude as can be.
When i went back to dr Sherman i remembered how sweet and professional and kind each and every team member was. So  happy im back there!!!|Dr Scott Sherman is the type of doctor everyone wishes to have. He doesn't sugar coat anything, he tells you as it is. He was extremely patient with me and answered all of my questions. He even gave me his professional and personal advice. I was in the most excruciating pain I've ever experienced. He is very knowledgeable and has a great "shot" when it comes to pain management. Highly recommend|Everyone is happy to help if they can. From the front desk Vanessa & Michael are efficient & effective. Michael was great with helping each patient entering their personal information into a new system while still helping new patients get admitted to get them back to the nurses & doctors. They all listen to what I say & make adjustments if needed. Great team that all work together.|Great Staff.  Dr. Sherman is dedicated and takes pride in his work.  I'm feeling much better thanks to his "not-giving-up" attitude.  Thanks, Doc:)

column2: Advanced Pain Management & Spine Specialists, Jonathan S. Daitch, MD & Wladislaw Fedoriw, MD
column3:
Advanced Pain Management & Spine Specialists serves Fort Myers, FL and the surrounding Southwest Florida region with exceptional pain management solutions. Founded in 2001 by Dr. Jonathan S. Daitch, MD, the clinic has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Working alongside Dr. Wladislaw Fedoriw, MD, the team brings specialized expertise to diagnosing and treating complex pain issues that have often been overlooked by other providers.

The clinic offers advanced treatment options for a wide range of pain conditions. Patients benefit from minimally-invasive procedures performed at their ASC outpatient surgical center. The medical team specializes in treating spinal fractures without open surgery, providing relief for patients with sciatica, shingles, herniated discs, and spinal stenosis. Their expertise extends to managing cancer-related pain and chronic headaches.

Specialized Approach to Pain Diagnosis

What sets Advanced Pain Management & Spine Specialists apart is their commitment to finding the true source of pain. Many patients arrive after years of unsuccessful treatments elsewhere. The physicians employ cutting-edge diagnostic techniques to identify pain origins that others have missed. This thorough approach leads to more effective treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific condition.
column11: In 2001, Jonathan Daitch, MD founded Advanced Pain Management & Spine Specialists to provide the Southwest Florida region with the most advanced techniques and technology available for chronic pain relief. Since that time, the practice has expanded to include an ASC outpatient surgical center where minimally-invasive procedures are performed with skilled hands, with patient comfort and safety a priority. He and his team have a reputation for finding the true origination source of pain when it has been overlooked by others, often for years. In addition to treating spinal fractures without the need for open surgery, he treats pain from sciatica, shingles, herniated discs and spinal stenosis as well as cancer and headache pain .

column3:
Advance Pain Management of Florida serves Miami Shores, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on delivering personalized care through interventional and minimally invasive procedures that address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be for our patients, which is why our team is committed to finding effective treatment options tailored to each individual's needs.

At our Miami Shores facility, we offer a wide range of pain management treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for back and neck pain

  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammatory conditions

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain relief

  • Radiofrequency ablation for longer-lasting pain management

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions

  • Minimally invasive procedures with reduced recovery time

Our Approach to Pain Management

Our physicians combine extensive medical training with years of clinical experience in pain medicine. We prioritize non-surgical and minimally invasive techniques whenever possible. Each treatment plan begins with a thorough evaluation of your condition. We take time to understand your pain history before recommending appropriate interventions.

Many patients come to us after trying conventional treatments without success. Our interventional techniques often provide relief where other methods have failed. We treat conditions ranging from lower back pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in educating patients about their conditions and treatment options. Our team explains procedures in clear, understandable terms. We coordinate care with your primary physician when needed. Most insurance plans are accepted at our practice.

Visit our clinic at 9001 NE 2nd Ave, Miami Shores, FL 33138, or call us at +1 305-694-3775 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about our services is available on our website: https://apmfloridamed.com/

column3:
Interventional Spine Specialists of Florida serves patients throughout Boca Raton, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team focuses on treating both chronic and acute pain conditions using advanced interventional techniques. We understand how debilitating pain can be and strive to provide personalized care plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At ISSF, we employ a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Our board-certified physicians combine their extensive medical knowledge with cutting-edge technology to deliver targeted and effective treatments. We specialize in minimally invasive procedures that can provide significant relief while minimizing recovery time.

Conditions We Treat

Our expertise extends to numerous pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain from various causes

- Arthritis and joint-related discomfort

- Neuropathic pain and nerve disorders

- Sciatica and radiating pain syndromes

- Sports injuries and related pain

- Post-surgical pain management

Advanced Treatment Options

Our physicians are skilled in performing various interventional procedures such as:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Facet joint injections

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Nerve blocks

- Regenerative medicine techniques

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

We believe effective pain management requires both medical expertise and compassionate care. Our team takes time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop customized treatment plans. We focus on improving quality of life and restoring function, not just masking symptoms.

Visit our modern facility at 2900 N Military Trl STE 230, Boca Raton, FL 33431, or call us at +1 954-708-1184 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at https://interventionalspinefl.com/
column11:
At Interventional Spine Specialists of Florida (ISSF), we specialize in providing high-quality pain management care for patients dealing with both chronic and acute pain. Our team of board-certified physicians utilizes the latest in pain management technology to provide targeted, effective, and compassionate care for our patients.

Our pain management experts specialize in treating a wide range of conditions, including arthritis, back and neck pain, neuropathy, and more.
At ISSF, we believe that the best pain management care combines advanced medical knowledge and the newest pain treatment techniques with a human touch.

I've been going to Dr. Alshon for several years! His entire staff is friendly, smart + helpful! Dr. Alshon takes his time with each patient, gives them his undivided attention and genuinely cares how you are doing both physically and mentally! He always has a new idea that I might try... Whether it be a new exercise, or some thing, he read on a specific food that might help! I really appreciate that. He takes his time listening to you and not rushing out the door to his next patient! Sure sometimes that means you're stuck waiting for him... And no one likes that! But if you take a second to realize that soon it will be your turn... You'll be the one to get an extra few minutes of the doctors time... You will feel better about the way!

supposed be more educated  and right under PHD..?
DISAPPOINTED|Dr. Alston is a very caring, patient, knowledgeable and very educated specialist. He is very thorough and knows his stuff.  He works on  getting to the root of your pain. column3:
The Pain Healing Center in Brandon, Florida serves patients throughout Hillsborough County with comprehensive pain management solutions. Dr. Abd A. Benni, MD leads our specialized clinic with a patient-centered approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team focuses on developing personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At The Pain Healing Center, we offer advanced interventional procedures and multidisciplinary treatments for various pain conditions. Our services include:

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back pain

  • Joint injections for arthritis relief

  • Nerve blocks for neuropathic pain

  • Radiofrequency ablation for facet joint pain

  • Medication management for pain control

  • Physical therapy coordination

About Dr. Abd A. Benni, MD

Dr. Benni completed his medical education and specialized training in pain management and anesthesiology. With over a decade of clinical experience, he applies evidence-based approaches to pain treatment. Dr. Benni stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to provide optimal care for his patients.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating various painful conditions including:

  • Lower back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

The Pain Healing Center is conveniently located at 1749 S Kings Ave, Brandon, FL 33511. New patients are welcome to schedule a consultation by calling +1 813-333-1819. For more information about our services, visit our website at thepainhealingcenter.com.

column40:
Dr.Benni knee injections took away my pain in both knees instantly! He said it would be soreness for a couple of days, and then I would feel relief. But as soon as he did the procedure,  no more pain, and I have not felt any since. I'm so emotional right now because I've limped for 20+ years and 2 minutes solved it all! I'm so grateful I chose to accept his pain management! You're awesome, Dr.Benni! The staff were very friendly and professional,  also. I must give them their flowers, too. Thanks for everything. You all made my future brighter. I'll be looking forward to more visits soon!|I honestly can't say what I would have done had I not learned About Dr. Bennie he has been rite by my side threw many surgeries I've had to have I can always count on him he makes me fell comfortable, he listens and cares Finally a Dr. That I can make an appointment with for one or 2 injections and know I am going to get some relief he is Truly the Best Pain Management Dr.I would travel just to be treated by Dr Benni and the Ladies in the office are very kind I have never had an issue with any of them they're as dedicated to you as Dr. Bennie is I'm blessed I found this Amazing team of Professional's Thank you All. Josephine Grella|I came to this facility with a referral from TGH after 3 day inpatient stay for chronic pain which I've been struggling with since 2015 from a fractured back in 5 places. I'm not going to even begin to list the horror stories I've seen and experienced in my quest for relief and TREATMENT which had been regulated to the ER up to this point.
While impatient, at TGH, a neurologist stated they were recommending a Laminectomy which enlarges the spinal canal to ease pressure on the spinal cord or nerves. Laminectomy is often done as part of a decompression surgery to relieve pressure I was open to albeit then the conversation or treatment plan turned to Spinal fusion. This vacillation and inability to get straight answers posed be them concerning MY SPINE I walked away from them as a result of  their inability to be straightforward. I can't begin to tell the depression that settled in after this back and forth however, I was angry, depressed with thoughts of a quick exist from the years of this unwanted excursion an agony floated within my mind.
Looking for an alternative to the screws, bolts,  mental rods or shaving  down vertebra's I regulating myself to appointments I noted Dr. Abd Alrahman Benni facility. Making an appointment filled with ambivalence and defeat, I was met by a doctor who reviewed the medical info presented to him and took the necessary steps that relieved my pain immediately with several trigger shots into the lumbar region and the correct pharmaceutical intervention needed to initiate the healing process. I found Dr. Benni attentive, straight ward and made no false promises as he laid out his suggested treatment plan. This does not exclude his staff for the most part as compassionate and understanding as they have to contend with many dealing with this chronic medical condition which is for the most part met with attributes not conducive to the healing process in general.|My PCP called his office while I was with her in her office. It should have been a Dr to Dr call! I was in a crisis situation due to my last Dr abandoning his patients right before my appt & my Dr explained that! She was calling to make sure he prescribed the meds I was on. Whoever she spoke to said "YES he does prescribe that but she has to see the Dr first" she had the call in speaker! I went to him and the first thing he did was try to sell me a flappy traction device, the kind that hooks up to a doorknob! I explained since I have spinal cord flattening w/spinal encroachment, Chiari malformation AND I am being seen for IDIOPATHIC INTRACRANIAL HYPERTENSION w/power CSF leak!! I explained my neurosurgeon advised me not to do anything with my spine bc it's too fragile! & that my new patient appt with the neurologist is coming up for the IIH. I told him I won't do any kind of traction until I clear it with both of them! He didn't like that & suddenly got snippy after that and said he didn't prescribe anything over Percocets! I will never be back! Ever! He did not take my condition seriously and wanted to ignore what my neurosurgeon said!  Not a good Dr if this is the way he is! It could actually have paralyzed me! Hooking a flimsy traction device to a door knob in my small home and laying in the floor to try and do it! Yeah..NO,!!! I can't wait to tell my neurosurgeon about this one!|I have been with Dr. Benni for going on 7+ years. Dr. Benni took over my care after my neighbor gave me his outstanding care  review. He has professionally diagnosed and cared for every pain need I had. He has been also caring for my husband with his pain issues. He has given him several healing steroid shots in his back to relieve his pain. He is very caring and compassionate with our every pain need. The staff is very pleasant and care for your needs from scheduling to insurance and office comfort. It's so refreshing to be cared with friendly people. Thank you.|I have been seeing Dr. Benni for almost a year now. This is my second review I had to post because Dr. Benni and his staff are amazing. Dr. Benni has helped me so many times and has been very flexible to my needs. I am 33 and I was very healthy and in very good shape until I was almost killed in a car accident last year. Without Dr. Bennis help I am unable to walk. He has been very understanding of my situation. It is very difficult to get a doctor who is non judgmental and its very difficult to find a pharmacy that will fill pain medication which is wrong on many levels as they are not doctors. Dr. Benni and his staff seam to smooth out any issues between patient and pharmacy as im sure most people going to pain clinics know how horrible pharmacys are. Coming to the pain healing center I have no worries month to month about anything. They will truly take care of you. I cannot recommend these guys enough they are life savers!|Dr. Benni is a really good doctor. His staff is very kind. One thing I can say about him is that I don't feel pain when he gives spinal injections. His office is very clean. He really cares about his patients. Very professional.|Told me blood clots just go away? Started seeing Dr benni last year for a rare disorder called sma syndrome from blood clots in my celiac and superior mesenteric arthritis. So my small intestine is being squished by my sma artery and my celiac artery and pain meds is how I kill the pain and eat. Dr binni here had a false positive on a test or faked a result "probably because i look 18" and after a year I get droped with him back and he back dated my discharge so 3 days after i get my discharge papers i have a appointment, he refused to see me leaving me with out meds witch are addicting and can put you through with drowls witch can kill you from shock. He dated the discharge papers for the previous month said i had a 30 days, i got thies papers 3 days befor my appointment and now being refused. I have to find a new doctor and im back to not being able to eat again from pain in the large intestine. Dr binni is uncaring about who he is helping not showing you care in as you are some one in need of help. He Never made eye contact or talking to me in the year like I was even a person. Just staring at his tablet hanging around his neck every visit walking in typing and walking out typing never looking up and never giving you personal time to ask if the meds are even working or how you feel. He also told me blood clots just go away witch I think is very unprofessional and malpractice. Every doctor knows if blood clots just go away we would have a lot less heart attack and strokes. But this is wrong and I'm being unserved by a doctor that signed a oth to help people in need. Brandon Pain Clinic serves patients throughout Brandon, FL and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our physician-led practice offers personalized care for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand how debilitating pain can be and strive to improve quality of life through evidence-based treatments and compassionate care.

At Brandon Pain Clinic, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to address various pain conditions. Our treatments include interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies. We develop individualized treatment plans based on thorough evaluations of each patient's specific needs and medical history.

Conditions We Treat

  • Chronic back and neck pain
  • Joint pain and arthritis
  • Neuropathic pain
  • Headaches and migraines
  • Post-surgical pain
  • Work-related injuries
  • Sports injuries
  • Complex regional pain syndrome

    • Meet Our Specialist

    Dr. George Sidhom, M.D. leads our clinical team with extensive experience in pain management. His comprehensive medical background includes specialized training in interventional pain techniques and a commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in pain medicine. Dr. Sidhom takes time to listen to patients, understand their pain concerns, and develop effective treatment strategies.

    Patient Information

    Our office operates by appointment only to ensure each patient receives dedicated attention during their visit. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans.

    Location: 201 Noland Dr, Brandon, FL 33511, United States

    Phone: +1 813-684-7246

    Website: http://brandonpainclinic.com/george-sidhom-m-d/

    We prioritize patient education and empowerment throughout the treatment process. Our team explains pain conditions, treatment options, and self-management techniques in clear, understandable terms.

column40:
Respectfully, but ARE procedures (injections/syringe needles) a requirement for ANY doctor's office appointment visit?
The reason WHY I ask is, it is a requirement at the PM (Pain Management) doctor's office appointment that I have been, & of course, I STILL AM going to him on & off for PROBABLY, 10-15 years. AND I have ALWAYS HATED needles/syringes ALL of my ENTIRE 62+ years of my life!!
So, PLEASE, IF you &/or ANYONE else knows for a KNOWN FACT that THESE PM (Pain Management) doctors do NOT require injections/procedures? Thank you.

Sincerely, Willie L. "Will" Smith, III|Doc is awesome. He's direct & watches out for his patients. I've been going to him roughly 10 years since I was hit by a school bus. He listens & finds better ways to help with daily chronic pain. Injections are available here if recommended, Do it. Helps greatly|I had been seeing Melissa for years, that is until I had to move out of Florida. I was referred to her by my pain doctor for fibromyalgia and for my jaw pain. If a pain doctor referred you, you know they are good!! Melissa and her staff are amazing! I live in Alabama now and there are no neurosomatic therapists here so I miss her every day! When I visit Florida I always make an appointment. You will leave there feeling better than you have in your entire life and wonder to yourself why have I not heard of them before. I had tried chiropractors and tai chi and acupuncturists, every form of exercise there is but nothing was helpful. Then I met Melissa! She also has the Overton clinic in Wesley Chapel. If you've tried it all go see them and if you haven't tried it all stop wasting your time. You won't be sorry!|Dr. Benni is an excellent pain management physician. He is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. He has come up with new ideas to help me with chronic knee pain. His staff is friendly and polite!|UPDATE: Dr. Gerguis is no longer at this practice. The head doctor writes scripts that Walmart will absolutely NOT fill. I asked why but was not told. They overbook too many appointments, and the wait can sometimes be hours. My mother has stopped going here because it's always been a big hassle since Dr. Gerguis left.

Took my mother to see Dr. Gerguis today. He's new to the practice and an excellent addition. Dr. Gerguis explained treatment options to my mother in a way that it all made sense. He was very thorough with her medications and past medical history. His assessment of her took time, and I truly believe he wants to help her have less pain. He genuinely cared. I was very impressed and have encouraged my mother to go through treatment to help alleviate her pain.|I wonder why the practice closed. Dr. Sidhom had so many medical malpractice lawsuits against him at the facility over the years. I use to be a patient there until I got kicked out for 2 dirty drug test and in the contract that you sign to become a patient at his facility, you must fail 3 drug test to get discharge from the facility. This facility is so shady. And you are no longer allowed to take xanax if you are taking pain medication in the state of Florida and if you are taking xanax, the pain doctor is now required to question why you are on xanax and if it's a 1 time thing. It doesn't matter where you live in Florida, you can not take both, you have to decide if you want to be on pain medication or xanax. It's a new law.|I admit it does take a long time to get seen.... I mean a long time!  If you are out in 2 hours you're lucky. Dr. Sidhom needs an associate like Dr. Tapia or interns who can just see patients who are there for refills.  If patients time would be respected and Dr. Sidhom would figure a way to solve the horrendous wait time, I would have given this practice 5 stars.

The good thing is that Dr. Sidhom really does care about each patient. It does take a while to establish a relationship with him. He seems aloof & unapproachable at first. He is so busy & he is a "no nonsense" type of person. Don't be discouraged. Just give him a chance. He cares about any pain you are experiencing in your body.  When and if you get shots, it seems like he is in his element. I've actually found it easier to speak to him during the prep time for my epidural shots that have successfully helped my pain.

I have found that if I feel Dr. Sidhom is ignoring me, I assert myself more and tell him I need him to listen and he does. He actually respect that.

I would not go to any other pain management doctor so I endure the wIt times at the office!  Thanks Dr. Sidhom and I have to exclaim that the staff in Brandon are AWESOME!  Thanks to you as well.  Without them, Doctor, your patients would not endure the office waits!|I am writing this for my mother, she will not speak bad of this Dr. because she is afraid he won't see her anymore and she isn't  well enough to find another doctor. The wait time averages to 3hours,she has been in severe pain for well over a year. On the last visit she told him she couldn't take the pain anymore. His response " how long have you had it"?She has complained  about this pain since it started. This last visit he told her he was worried, and sent her for an M. R. I. Now we have to wait for him to read it and get back to her. I would never, ever recommend this doctor to anyone.

column2: Pain Management Specialists of North Florida, PA, Raul A. Monzon MD
column3:
Pain Management Specialists of North Florida, PA serves St. Augustine, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain treatment solutions. Led by Dr. Raul A. Monzon, our clinic focuses on providing personalized care for patients suffering from acute, chronic, and cancer-related pain conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be and offer evidence-based interventions to improve quality of life.

At our St. Augustine clinic, we utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain. Dr. Monzon brings over three decades of experience as an Anesthesiologist specializing in pain disorders since 1990. Our treatment plans are individually tailored to address specific conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Cancer-related pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Work and sports injuries

Comprehensive Treatment Options

We offer a range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches:

- Epidural steroid injections

- Nerve blocks

- Radiofrequency ablation

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Medication management

- Physical therapy coordination

Dr. Monzon's extensive background in anesthesiology provides a unique perspective on pain control. His approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain function and comfort.

Patient-Centered Care

Our team prioritizes patient education and involvement in treatment decisions. We take time to explain conditions and treatment options in clear, understandable terms. Most insurance plans are accepted, and our staff assists with navigating coverage questions.

Visit our clinic at 1301 Plantation Island Dr S, Suite #301 A, St. Augustine, FL 32080, or call us at +1 904-460-9555 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about our services is available on our website: https://northfloridapainclinic.com/

column40:
DR. Monzon carefully assessed my lower back/Sciatica situation which caused the worst pain of my life and I am 68 y/o. We opted for the minimally invasive Disc-FX, and at long last relief! After a few weeks I still have some soreness but absolutely nothing compared to the pain I was feeling prior. I am on the road to complete recovery thanks to Dr. Monzon and his very capable staff.     John Lawless|I went through many months of PT to alleviate lower back pain.  A CT scan later revealed a large herniated disc that was causing me intense pain.
I was referred to Dr Monzon who initially gave me a couple of injections that helped me tremendously.  He later recommended a procedure called Disc FX which reduces the protrusion.  This procedure was completed as an out patient a couple of weeks ago.  To date I'm virtually pain free except a little soreness from the surgery.
Dr Monzon and his staff do a great service for those, like me, that were in a great deal of pain.  I highly recommend Dr Monzon!|Dr. Monzon is the best at giving injections.  I had a sacroiliac injection this morning and it was the best I ever had.   He seriously knows what he is doing and does them very well.   I had injections at Orthopedic Associates that nearly killed me.  He is a wonderful doctor and makes you feel comfortable and welcome.  He has a very friendly and caring staff.  Dennis is my favorite of his staff.   He goes above and beyond to make you feel comfortable.   I highly recommend Dr Monzon to all my family and friends.|I'll start out with a short history. I've had lower back pain/herniated bulging disk for most of my life and in the last year or so it's been getting so bad that I've been almost getting to the point of having to use the walker it was causing me so much pain to walk or do anything and I'm very active young 67 year old. I heard about Dr Monzan and I went to see him. I will start out by saying that his staff Maria, Eva and Alex are all wonderful and when I met Dr Mozan he really took the time to explain everything to me about my disc and what we can do to fix it and we decided to do a new procedure where he cleans out the herniated disk and then cauterizes it to close all the tears that cause the fluid to protrude and hit nerves giving me the intense pain. He used a procedure called DISC FX and it has been one week today and I am pain free for the first time in months!!  It is amazing and I cannot tell you how great I feel. I have to take it easy for a month make sure that the disk heals properly but after that I believe that I'm really going to be pain-free for a long long time due to this revolutionary procedure as opposed to doing major scary back surgery which would have been my other option, and one that probably would have ruined my life. Another great thing about this is if it gives me a pain-free life for two or three years and the pain does come back we can do it again although I am praying it lasts forever!! I highly recommend Dr Monzan!! If I could give him 20 stars I would and I highly recommend the DISC FX procedure for anyone looking for relief from bulging or herniated discs!! Throughout it all, Dr Monzon and his staff and the whole entire experience has been wonderful I can't thank him/them enough!!!!!|My experience with Dr. Monzon and his staff was excellent. I give my highest recommendation.
Dr. Monzon is very knowledgeable, very skillful, patient, easy to talk with, and accessible. I rate him 10 stars.|Dr. Monzon just performed a procedure  on my right knee using my own platelets for a torn meniscus. The platelets will help my body regenerate new cells and repair itself. He already did this procedure on my left knee and it was a success so I am excited to be completely pain free. What I like most about Dr. Monzon is that he encouraged this procedure instead of just prescribing narcotics like other doctors have in the past. I highly recommend Dr. Monzon and this procedure.|Dr Monzon is a very caring Doctor. I have been getting facet injections due to Dr Petrs' failed ACDF surgery. He is very compassionate in what he does he isn't there just for the money like my last Dr Petr..

****(Anyone out there who had a Dr make you give thousands of dollars "JUST FOR A DOCTORS FEE" as Dr PETR  did **********************

PLEASE GO TO Dr Monzon and he will make your life worth living again!|I have been going to this office for years now. Everyone there is friendly, knowledgeable, fun, and they don't rush to push you out the door. I was in the office yesterday and he spotted something I didn't realize and saved me from having to plan another doctor appointment! I am ever so grateful for everyone there. I really do not feel as if I am going to the doctors. Dr Monzon will work with you and he will be honest. The staff will make you feel comfortable and welcomed. This is the place I trust the most!

column2: Trinity Health Center: Nader Said, MD
column3:
Trinity Health Center in New Port Richey, Florida serves the local community with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Nader Said, MD. With over two decades of professional experience, Dr. Said has established a reputation for excellence in treating various pain conditions using advanced medical techniques and personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Nader Said is a board-certified physician with triple specialization in pain management, anesthesiology, and bariatric medicine. At Trinity Health Center, patients receive comprehensive care for chronic pain conditions including back pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. The clinic offers various treatment options such as medication management, minimally invasive procedures, and interventional techniques designed to improve quality of life.

About Dr. Nader Said

An Egyptian native, Dr. Said earned his medical doctorate from Ain Shams University in Cairo in 1984 before relocating to the United States. His extensive medical training includes prestigious institutions such as St. Vincent's Medical Center in Staten Island, New York, and Tampa General Hospital and the University of South Florida in Tampa. Dr. Said has called New Port Richey home since 1999, establishing deep roots in the community he serves.

Patient-Centered Approach

Trinity Health Center prioritizes patient education and collaborative care. Dr. Said takes time to explain pain conditions and treatment options thoroughly. The clinic's approach focuses on improving functionality and reducing dependency on pain medications when possible. Patients benefit from individualized treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

Contact Information

Trinity Health Center welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. The clinic is conveniently located at 8115 FL-54, New Port Richey, FL 34655. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Nader Said, call +1 727-291-7595 or visit the clinic's website at www.nadersaidmd.com for more information about services and appointment availability.
column11: Nader Said, MD, is a board-certified physician who specializes in pain management, anesthesiology, and bariatric medicine. column2: Dr. Neil J. Ellis, MD | PPOA

Physician Partners of America (PPOA) serves Tampa, FL and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team, led by Dr. Neil J. Ellis, MD, provides personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand how debilitating pain can be in your daily life, which is why our clinic offers advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Neil Ellis is a board-certified Pain Management specialist with extensive training in interventional pain procedures. After graduating from Eastern Virginia Medical School, Dr. Ellis dedicated his career to helping patients find relief from persistent pain conditions. His approach combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care, focusing on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Our Pain Management Services

At our Tampa clinic, we offer comprehensive pain management solutions including:

  • Interventional procedures for spine and joint pain

  • Medication management with focus on minimizing opioid use

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain relief

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back and leg pain

  • Radiofrequency ablation for long-lasting joint pain relief

  • Physical therapy coordination and rehabilitation planning

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We develop individualized treatment plans addressing both symptoms and underlying causes.

Visit Our Tampa Pain Management Clinic

Located at 14438 University Cove Pl, Tampa, FL 33613, our facility offers a comfortable environment with state-of-the-art equipment. New patients are welcome to schedule a consultation by calling +1 813-531-8160. For more information about our services, visit our website at https://www.physicianpartnersofamerica.com/location/florida-fl/fletcher-fl-pain-relief-group/.

Pain Diagnostic & Management Center in Winter Haven, FL serves patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions throughout Polk County. Our specialized clinic offers comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. With years of dedicated service to the Winter Haven community, our medical team combines extensive experience with advanced techniques to address various pain disorders.

Our providers at Pain Diagnostic & Management Center deliver targeted interventions designed to reduce pain and improve quality of life. We utilize a multi-disciplinary approach that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes.

Injection Therapies

- Epidural Blocks for spinal nerve pain relief

- Facet Blocks targeting joint pain in the spine

- Myofascial Trigger Point Injections for muscle pain

- Steroid Injections to reduce inflammation and pain

Nerve Block Procedures

- Somatic Nerve Blocks for skeletal muscle pain

- Sympathetic Peripheral Nerve Blocks for complex pain conditions

- Spinal Nerve Blocks targeting specific nerve pathways

Additional Treatments

- Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS) providing non-invasive pain relief

- Trigger Point Injections for focused muscle pain treatment

Our physicians bring extensive training in pain medicine and anesthesiology to every patient interaction. We emphasize creating personalized treatment plans that consider medical history, pain patterns, and lifestyle factors. Many patients experience significant improvement after receiving appropriate interventions at our clinic.

Located at 537 E Central Ave Unit B in Winter Haven, our facility offers a comfortable environment designed with patient needs in mind. Contact us at (863) 679-9494 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

Founded by Dr. Javier Placer, MD, our clinic specializes in physical medicine, rehabilitation, and advanced pain management techniques tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our rehabilitation clinic addresses a wide spectrum of physical health and pain management concerns. The clinic's approach focuses on both immediate pain relief and long-term recovery strategies.

Expert Medical Team

Dr. Javier Placer brings extensive expertise in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation to the Florida Spine & Pain Institute. As a specialist in pain management, Dr. Placer has dedicated his career to helping patients overcome physical limitations and chronic pain conditions. His comprehensive approach combines medical knowledge with personalized care to achieve optimal results.

Treatment Approach

At Florida Spine & Pain Institute, we believe no one should endure debilitating pain that prevents full enjoyment of life. Our specialists conduct thorough evaluations of each patient's physical condition before designing customized treatment protocols. This patient-centered approach ensures that all interventions address the specific causes of discomfort rather than just treating symptoms.

Conditions We Treat

- Back and neck pain

- Joint discomfort

- Sports injuries

- Post-surgical rehabilitation

- Chronic pain syndromes

- Neurological pain conditions

Don't let persistent pain limit your activities or diminish your quality of life. Contact Florida Spine & Pain Institute today to schedule your comprehensive evaluation and begin your journey toward improved physical function and pain relief.

My husband and I have been with Doctor Placer about 15 years, at his prior practice and now here, and he has always been so compassionate and truly cares about treating our pain through different modalities including spinal injections. Recently we have also seen Michael, APRN who is also awesome. He has several outstanding staff, Stephanie was super great for years but unfortunately didn't make the move into the new practice, Gigi on front desk, Melissa MA, Edwin, and also Vanessa efficiently takes care of all my FMLA paperwork. So we highly recommend Dr. Placer if you are looking for a Pain Management and to treat your spinal issues.|Florida Spine and Pain institute is amazing, as soon as you walk through the door you are met with a wonderful greeting. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Dr Placer, Dr. Rivera and Mike are angels sent from Heaven . They listen to you and care about you. I love the way they make you feel like family from the first day you walk into their office. I recommend everyone that's in a lot of pain to come here they will take excellent care of you.|Dr. Placer is the most compassionate and knowledgeable Physician I have ever seen! I suffer from a chronic condition that is very progressive he takes his time to listen and formulate a plan that is in the best interest of the Patient! His Staff is the best, very efficient and always have a Kind word. Thank you.|I can't say enough about Dr Placer and Dr Rivera. I have been seeing Dr Placer since he first opened his office in Orlando going on his own, smartest thing he ever did! As it goes, the Orlando office grew too small and he branched out into different areas, I went way out of my way to see him in Clermont, that's how good he is. Yiyi was always there to welcome me and never showed the stress of bouncing around to all the offices and made sure she answered my questions.
When Dr Rivera joined, I became one of his main patients always trying different ways to relieve my pain from shoulder surgery to Failed back surgery, the pain 'was always there...
After months of delay due to different surgical procedures, I was finally able to test the Abbott SCS system... WOW! What a difference,' it is amazing, the staff of Rachael Lucia and Yiyi, made the surgery happen for the permanent device happen 2 weeks after the trial, I can't thank everyone there enough.|Dr Placer and his staff are absolutely wonderful! They treat you like family. Mike Dr Placers assistant is so personable and explains everything clearly.
I was always a person to stay clear of pain management centers. Dr Placers office has changed my views 100%!
I've been with Dr Placer for over 2 years now. I suffered a botched neck surgery requiring 7 neck surgeries total. I have rods in my neck blocking all views of my disc's. Dr Placer started with a series of 4 nerve blocks followed by rhizotomy. What a difference that made in my life. After 2 years I'm ready for the procedure to be repeated. i look forward to being pain free again! I can't thank Dr Placer and his staff enough for their kindness, respect and expertise!|My appointment time, was exactly when I was taken.  All the ladies in the office couldn't have been nicer.  The doctor was very professional, knowledgeable, and approachable with questions . So glad I made the 2 hour round trip to go there.|My husband had steroid shots with Dr. Rivera and my husband walked in the office fine and when he got home 2 hrs. later he was in severe pain. I called the office to see if this was normal they said some people react differently to the shots put heat & ice and they sent him muscle spasm meds. Took that for a week and it still didn't help still severe back pain. I called their office again today and told them he is still in pain can I bring him in the office for the Dr. to just look at him and they said dr. was out of town I replied can somebody else look at him and they told me they didn't have any appointments available he would have to wait to see the dr. on his scheduled date of Jan. 10. He had the injections on dec. 5th. Not pleased at all with this office.|I don't like leaving negative reviews, but I feel it's important for future patients to be informed. I saw Dr. Pacer for my second appointment at the clinic while Dr. Rivera was out. I shared my concerns about my autoimmune diseases and explained that my current treatment plan wasn't working. I also mentioned that I had been following my specialists' advice by going to the hospital during severe flare-ups.

Instead of listening, Dr. Pacer spent the majority of the appointment threatening to discharge me from the practice because I sought hospital care when my options were exhausted. He even went so far as to claim I didn't "look" critical enough to need the hospital that day. Ironically, I was admitted later that same day and stayed for 8 days. I'm thankful I didn't let his dismissal of my condition deter me.

His lack of professionalism, respect, and tendency to interrupt me whenever he disagreed was deeply disappointing. I sincerely hope he doesn't treat other patients this way, as it's not only unprofessional but damaging to those seeking care.

column3:
Florida Pain Management Associates, P.A. in Sebastian, Florida serves patients throughout Indian River County with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be and strive to improve our patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

At Florida Pain Management Associates, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and medical therapies. Our approach combines cutting-edge techniques with traditional pain management strategies. Services include:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica

  • Arthritis pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs of our patients. Our physicians combine their medical expertise with compassionate care. We take time to educate patients about their conditions and treatment options.

Visit Our Pain Management Clinic

Florida Pain Management Associates is conveniently located at 13825 US-1, Sebastian, FL 32958. New patients are welcome to schedule a consultation by calling +1 772-388-9998. Our office is equipped with modern diagnostic and treatment technology. Learn more about our services by visiting our website at http://www.floridapain.com/.

Our clinic hours accommodate working professionals with flexible scheduling options. Most insurance plans are accepted. We strive to provide prompt appointments for patients seeking pain relief.
column38: Tee Fowler|Liana Rose Bardin|Greg McCarty|John Rines|Maureen McGovern|Anne Hoard|Lisa Elaine|Erik Hadinger
column40:
I have always had positive appointments and care by Dr. Olsen. I have had many procedures done by her. Some have worked. Some haven't. That is because I have several issues stemming from car accidents. So I haven't made it easy on her. Still she continues to give me her best. Thank you Dr. Olsen I appreciate everything you have done for me and continue to do.|So I was told, the day before my procedure that I couldn't have anything to drink except water two hours before my procedure. Then I came to my appointment to get nerve blockers and they asked me when my last meal was. I said 11:30 this morning. They said they couldn't take me because I'm not supposed to eat 8 hours before the procedure. Then, when I walked out and told them that nobody told me that.|The office staff at this doctor's office is horrible.  I missed an appointment and the person I spoke to, Jen, berated me for forgetting the day that I was scheduled.    Since I was being spoken to like I was a child, I asked her, "Have you ever made a mistake?"  She actually said NO, I  don't make mistakes.  If it was not so pathetic, it would be funny.  Doctor Olsen is a great doctor but I won't go back because the office staff is NUTS!   They have been rude to me too often.  They need to get nice, caring people to deal with the public or patients will never come back.|I have been a patient for 4 1/2 years.With Dr. Olson. It seems that since she left .Nothing is the same. I have seen different people each time I go for my  appointment for follow up and medications. Yesterday at my monthly appointment I was informed by " yet another NEW person.", . (She was so very  rude),  that they could no longer help me. I asked why and was told that  Because I did not make an appointment with another Pain Management specialist that they suggested I might try-NOT THAT  IT WAS A REQUIREMENT -I  had thought was a decision I was to Make , Then I was informed that  they would not let me have ANY medication At All ! How is this helping me as a patient? At least, they could of provided me with some type of help. But NONE!
One  should think  twice before you make  an appointment at "Florida Pain Management.". Hence the word "Pain Management "- if they are the Pain Management set of doctors, then WHY must my insurance pay for brief and rude services- AND require I go to another Pain Management?
Now, I have nothing to deal with the severe chronic and Real medical issues, not just "joe" of the street looking to score. My insurance company will be notified.|Absolutely horrible experience. Saw Olsen, who was very reassuring and said she needed to stabilize me in order to prepare me for tests (couldn't walk, lie down, or stand at the time). Gave me injections assisted by an "anesthesiologist" who may as well have given me a baby aspirin. I was screaming and she sternly told me to stop. Injections did NOTHING. When I asked to see her partner, Dr. Cordner, I was denied because I was "established" with HER, and she wanted me to get a CT scan......ummmm duh, didn't we just go through this? I couldn't walk, stand, lie down, or bend, and here she's telling me to get the tests that she was supposed to stabilize me for! DON'T GO.|I am currently seeing Dr. Jessica Olsen.  I believe she is an extremely competent physician.  She takes time with patients and explains and listens to what is going on.  The staff is also helpful and polite.  They are a busy office so you have to be patient.|I have been a chronic patient since an auto accident in 1984
I have been a patient of Dr. Cordners since 1996
Honestly, I tried the all the rest without much success.
I highly recommend Dr. Cordner and this Florida Pain Management staff with two locations: Sebastian and Vero Beach. This office is a five star all day long! My thought is the similar names of other local facilities have definitely been confused!
If you are looking to manage your pain without the complicating effects of surgical procedures then I encourage you to consider many of the less invasive treatment methods that are superbly administered by this fine doctor. "Superbly" ..is the keyword in pain management.|If you are a new patient stay away! The person that deals with receiving new patients is incompetent! Not a single call to make sure they have everything correct. Anyone moving from New England that is dealing with Lyme disease stay away from this waste of time practice!

column3:
Premier Pain Center in Orange Park, Florida serves patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions throughout Clay County and surrounding areas. Dr. Ashraf G. Andrawis, MD leads our specialized medical practice with a comprehensive approach to pain management. Our clinic focuses on identifying the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, offering personalized treatment plans for each patient's unique needs.

At Premier Pain Center, we provide advanced interventional procedures and multidisciplinary treatments for various pain conditions. Our services include:

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic back pain

  • Joint injections for arthritis relief

  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain management

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal conditions

  • Radiofrequency ablation for long-term pain relief

  • Medication management when appropriate

About Dr. Ashraf G. Andrawis, MD

Dr. Andrawis brings extensive training and experience to Premier Pain Center. Board-certified in Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology, he completed his medical education at prestigious institutions followed by specialized fellowship training in interventional pain management. Dr. Andrawis stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to provide evidence-based treatments for complex pain conditions.

Conditions We Treat

Our clinic specializes in treating a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Lower back pain and sciatica

  • Neck pain and cervical radiculopathy

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia and myofascial pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. Our team takes time to explain conditions and treatment options in clear, understandable terms. We coordinate care with primary physicians and specialists when needed for comprehensive pain management.

Visit Our Orange Park Location

Premier Pain Center welcomes new patients at our convenient location: 1543 Kingsley Ave, Orange Park, FL 32073. Contact our office at +1 904-264-0770 to schedule a consultation. For more information about our services, visit our website at www.premierpaincenter.net.

column40:
Took really good care of my mother she was happy so I was happy. She was very happy with his recommendations and excited to come home.|I keep calling just so they pick up the phone and hang it up after ringing several times. I do love doctor andrawis and  his staff but I need someone to pick up the phone when I can't be there for an appointment.|Dr Andrawis is caring and amazing! However his staff gives them a 1-star rating because of their bad attitudes and unprofessional behavior, especially Sara! Sara has no customer service skills and should not be dealing with the public! Sara is extremely rude and unpleasant to deal with. They should not have her dealing with patients at all! I have tried to complain to management several times about her behavior and the office manager doesn't care how patients are treated and turned a blind eye to everything that i said. Neither one of them should be in their current positions and both need to be retrained! Its sad that such a kind and caring doctor has such unpleasant people working for him. If you want to deal with a kind and caring STAFF go elsewhere. Melody and Sara are terrible to deal with and do not care about their patients... Sara is extremely rude even yelling at ne on the phone when asked a question... Melody is a poor excuse for an office manager as she lets this behavior and  treatment to continue.|I trust him. He is amazing. I've been seeing Dr  Andrawis for approx 20 yr , before he owned his own practice, he's always been very caring and knowledgeable. He and his staff travel to multiple locations , every week, to prevent his patients from having to travel so far to see him. I've heard people complain of the wait time but they fail to consider that he doesn't rush you during your appointment and will do unplanned injections ect, when necessary, those things take extra time during your appt.|Updated to say after many yrs as a patient, I found this Dr has no compassion whatsoever!

I was a patient of Dr Andrawis a few years ago, but unfortunately had to move to South Florida. Just came back to the Jacksonville area, and I'm highly delighted to find out that I can start seeing him again.|My doctor gave me a referral to this place after getting out of the hospital. When I called to make an appointment the woman who answered the phone said that they didn't get the referral. When I called my doctor they said they had sent it several days ago but she would fax it again anyway. When I called back after lunch the same lady answered and was very snotty and foul saying "we'll call you when we get it" she got very defensive when I said it had been sent twice and I replied that I didn't like her attitude towards a potential patient that is suffering and she just hung up the phone. I'm on hold right now with my doctor to get a referral to another place.|Dr. Andrawis is very caring and compassionate. Several of his staff members are very rude and disrespectful! They gave me fits about my disability paperwork...and we're going to charge me $50 per page for office notes! I called several times to complain to the office manager, left several messages, and never got a call back! Maybe that's what's wrong with them...under poor management! As a bonus...The very first time I saw Dr. Andrawis, he told me I was a surgery candidate, repeated my MRI, and referred me to a neurosurgeon. The girls in the office seemed very surprised that he did that! I would go back to him as long as certain staff members weren't there!|Love this Dr. He and his staff are exceptional! I have been seeing Dr Andrawis for over 2 years now and getting injectors for my back, neck and shoulder pain. There is minimal discomfort when he does the injections. He has excellent bedside manner and really cares for his patients. His staff is always friendly and goes above and beyond. Meagan, Michelle and Emily are superb and helpful. I can't rave enough about this Dr and his staff. If you have pain... This is the place you need to come!

column2: Hector Cases, MD - Pain Management Specialist | PPOA
column3:
Physician Partners of America (PPOA) in Sun City Center, FL serves the local community with specialized pain management solutions. Dr. Hector Cases, MD leads our clinical team with extensive expertise in treating chronic and acute pain conditions. As a board-certified Pain Management specialist, Dr. Cases combines advanced interventional techniques with comprehensive care plans tailored to each patient's needs.

Dr. Hector Cases graduated from the prestigious Central University of the Caribbean in Puerto Rico, bringing his medical expertise to Florida's Sun City Center community. His approach focuses on minimizing pain while maximizing function through targeted interventions. Dr. Cases specializes in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic disorders.

Our Pain Management Services

At PPOA, we offer comprehensive pain management treatments including:

- Interventional procedures for precise pain relief

- Medication management with careful monitoring

- Physical therapy coordination for improved mobility

- Minimally invasive techniques to reduce recovery time

- Customized treatment plans addressing individual needs

Location and Contact Information

Our Sun City Center clinic is conveniently located at 920 Cypress Village Blvd, Sun City Center, FL 33573. Patients seeking consultation or treatment can reach our office at +1 813-670-2225 to schedule appointments. For more information about Dr. Cases and our services, visit our website at https://www.physicianpartnersofamerica.com/doctor/florida-fl/hector-cases-md/.

What to Expect at Your First Visit

New patients receive thorough evaluations to identify pain sources and develop effective treatment strategies. Dr. Cases takes time to understand each patient's medical history, current symptoms, and treatment goals before recommending appropriate interventions.

I just moved here & was very nervous about a new pain management Dr as I had a great relationship with my former Dr in NY. I was immediately put at ease by the office staff. Great people. Words will never capture his expertise nor his kind treatment and care.|My husband and I both see Dr. Cases he's a really good doctor !!!  The sun city office is older and chairs in the waiting room are worn out however don't judge him for that , it's an above him Corporation thats not replacing them.
We feel blessed to have him take care of us, sometimes you may have to wait longer in the waiting room because he's so good at what he does , so many want his care.|I liked the doctor, I was a first time patient. I didn't enjoy the 90 minute past my appt time to be seen. And would have appreciated a little friendliness from the front office staff. I was greeted with a cold "name?" No hello, how are you, she almost snapped at me. Dr Cases was great, so I'll be back.|Dr. Cases is a wonderful doctor alongside his assistant P. A Daniel.  They are kind and empathetic to the issue at hand. Their communication is fantastic and the waiting time is also good. Their front desk ladies are compassionate as well. They dont make you feel like a number. I am grateful for having them treating me. I highly recommend them to anyone in need. Thank you.|Dr. Cases is an excellent physician.  He cares about his patients well-being.  He has excellent staff working with him.|Dr. Cases is a wonderful person  and Doctor  I have known him for several years. I had other pain management  doctors  before but  none of them compared to his kindness to his patients.|I am so happy that I found Dr. Cases. I have Complex Regional Pain Syndrome so finding someone who listens to my needs and does everything possible to relieve my pain long term has been great. He has a great bedside manner.  If you want a real physician who knows pain he's also a neurologist another added value to your relief   He and his staff are compassionate about their patients. Love y'all seriously

column3:
UF Health Pain Management Center - Jacksonville serves patients throughout Jacksonville, Florida with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on diagnosing and treating various pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. We understand how chronic pain affects daily life and work diligently to create personalized treatment plans for each patient.

At UF Health Pain Management Center, our team offers treatments for numerous pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain management

  • Joint pain relief

  • Neuropathic pain treatment

  • Cancer-related pain care

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Our physicians combine their extensive training with the latest techniques to address complex pain issues. We utilize a multidisciplinary approach that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication optimization, and rehabilitation strategies.

Expert Medical Team

Our pain specialists hold board certifications in pain medicine and anesthesiology. Many completed fellowships at prestigious institutions and regularly participate in continuing education. This expertise allows our team to offer advanced interventional procedures alongside comprehensive pain management protocols.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address the specific needs of each patient. During your consultation, our specialists will thoroughly evaluate your condition, medical history, and pain patterns. Location and Contact Information

UF Health Pain Management Center - Jacksonville is conveniently located at Pavilion, 555 8th St W, 2nd Floor, Jacksonville, FL 32206. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call +1 904-383-1020. You can also visit our website at https://ufhealthjax.org/location/25/uf-health-pain-management-center-jacksonville/ for additional information.

As part of the UF Health network, our clinic maintains the highest standards of medical care while providing compassionate service to Jacksonville residents struggling with acute and chronic pain conditions.

Our specialized clinic focuses on treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. An hour drive for me from Naples, but this is the closest clinic in my network. Not one to complain as long as I can receive the help I need for my broken down back with bulging discs, a great cause of the severe pain I'm in, especially when I hurt my back. The pain can be hell, but I have an 80yr old father and 10yr old daughter to take care of, so I can't just take time off. I have high hopes for getting the proper help from this clinic. Everyone was very friendly and professional. As far as I can tell, I feel it's a top notch doctor's office with multiple doctors. 5 stars so far.|Have been going here for 24 years now.  I'm a retired RN who's had 12 major back surgeries & will need pain management always. Dr.Cassell & Mary Soscia truly understand what you need to live when you have a great deal of pain all the time. I now have "fairly comfortable " days, which, without their  care, would not be possible. I thank them every day. Without their expertise  I would be up the proverbial creek..
Helen B.|From the entrance to the receptionist, you're welcomed with a warm hello and asked to fill out the normal paperwork. With a short wait, you're called back and I was seen by Dr. Diaz that I have been with over 7 years. She's warm, caring and very knowledgeable in her field. She knows me very well and we have a doctor/patient relationship that she Always has my best interest in her decisions!! I recommend her and her practice to any of my family members and friends that would ever need her professional care!!!

column2: Center for Pain Treatment: Ronald Stern, MD
column3:
The Center for Pain Treatment serves patients in Sebastian, Melbourne, and St. Cloud, Florida with specialized pain management services. Under the leadership of Ronald J. Stern, MD, owner and medical director, the clinic combines proven interventional pain medicine procedures with conservative medication management to address chronic pain conditions. Dr. Stern brings extensive experience to his practice, focusing on treating the whole person rather than just symptoms.

At The Center for Pain Treatment, patients receive personalized care plans tailored to their specific needs. The medical team specializes in treating various pain conditions affecting the neck, back, knee, and other body areas. Their conservative approach ensures patients receive appropriate care without unnecessary interventions or medications.

Specialized Treatment Options

The clinic offers innovative pain management solutions including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Conservative medication management

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Ongoing pain monitoring and adjustment

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes The Center for Pain Treatment from other pain management practices is their focus on treating the individual, not just their symptoms. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the underlying causes of their pain. This comprehensive approach leads to more effective long-term pain relief and improved quality of life.

Located at 1333 Gateway Dr Suite 1000, Melbourne, FL 32901, the clinic welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. For appointments or more information, call +1 321-559-7771 or visit their website at www.thecenterforpaintreatment.com.
column9: Medical clinic|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician
column11:
The Center for Pain Treatment is a pain management practice in Sebastian, Melbourne, and St. Cloud, Florida. Ronald J. Stern, MD, owner and medical director of the Center for Pain Treatment, and the team take a conservative approach to care, combining proven interventional pain medicine procedures with conservative medication management.

The team offers innovative treatments for many common conditions that cause pain in the neck, back, knee, and other areas.

The Center for Pain Treatment sets itself apart from other pain management practices by providing personalized care. The team focuses on the individual, not their symptoms.

column40:
I came to Dr. Stern after the BACK center stop accepting patients for pain management. I met with Dr. Stern twice, and both times he attempted to lower my current pain prescription. At that time, I was scheduled to get a triple bypass surgery and I did not think it was wise to lower my dosage due to the surgery. He insisted on lowering without consideration. I am so glad I decided to see another pain mgmt DR after my surgery. It was well needed. I do not recommend going to this practice. Stay away!|I was reffered to Dr. Stern after 3 other pain management clinics did not meet my expectations. Dr. Stern took his time with me and explained what my L4-L5 and L5-S1 showed on my MRI and didn't try to BS me. He was honest and upfront from the very beginning and explained my options.

I had a nerve block procedure done by Dr. Stern a few weeks later and had high hopes. Unfortunately, the injection did nothing to improve my back pain so we talked about plan B.

Plan B was a local injection (in office) in my L5 facet joint today (12/12/24). Unfortunately, that was not effective as well.

So why a positive review? I'm writing a positive review because Dr. Stern and the entire staff never gave me false hope, took time to plan out a treatment plan and were incredibly professional to work with. Plan C is for me to see a surgeon but I cannot thank Dr. Stern and his staff for the compassionate bedside manners and doing what they could to help me out. I highly recommend them!|My daughter has called 4 days lmsgs in emerg 2xs now  in hosp .. never got a response from anyone has no pain meds  .. so this is pain management!!!!! They had to admit her ..in hospital this is unreal unprofessional  to let people suffer greatly  I called both  offices says for 1 hour I am 2nd caller in q no answer nompick up no beep to leave another message no answering service|They don't EVER call you back no matter who you back. If you don get a hold of someone, they can't help you and you have to leave a message. It's absolutely the most frustrating doctors office staff I've ever dealt with!|Dr. Stern and all of his staff especially Victoria are very friendly, professional and accommodating. There's never a long wait and they will go above and beyond to make sure you're taken care of. Simply put, these guys have their stuff together in all aspects of their practice and it's always a pleasure dealing with them!

No one asked me to write this review and I usually don't leave reviews but after having many horrible experiences at other local clinics I felt the need to share my positive experience here for anyone considering which provider to choose.|I highly recommend Dr. Stern. He explains everything in terms that are understandable and he takes all the time necessary. He is very competent and thorough with evaluation of my medical issues.
Dr. Stern and his staff are professional, caring and kind.
Highly recommend!
Brian|I was lucky enough to be told about Dr Stern for my back problems by another great doctor of mine.  After calling the office I was helped by front desk ",kind  Victoria ", who assisted with me getting in ASAP.  I later  met the assistants -who were all caring & helpful.  Once I met Dr. Stern, I was convinced that I had the right doctor. His credentials & experience are tops along with his knowledge & concern for each patient!!. He then explains your problem & gives YOU the choice(s) for what will help.
At my first visit I did wait a little longer than expected BUT once I got in and saw that he was not "rushing" me--- I was very content. So, if you wait to see him remember that he will/does take his time with everyone (even you)--- because he truly cares. Kudos Dr. Stern= YOU are the BEST !!!  God Bless!!!

WHY MONTHS LATER HAS MY POST NOT BEEN SHOWN IN REVIEWS??? Google!!|Dr Stern had a tough problem with my lower back condition. He found a procedure, ablation, and administered it. It worked and eliminated 90% of my pain, giving me the ability to work in the yard and travel with my wife again. He is my hero and I highly recommend him. On June 29th He gave me an epidural that Canceled out about 80% of the pain involved in seating, sitting and rising. This will make our impending trip really enjoyable.
